original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened.

original: Saṃyuttanikāye🔽Mahāvaggaṭīkā
analyzed: saṃyutta nikāye
translated: In the Connected Discourses on the Aggregates,🔽the Great Chapter,

original: 1. Maggasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: magga saṃyuttam
translated: the Connected Discourses on the Path,

original: 1. Avijjāvaggo
analyzed: avijjā vaggaḥ
translated: the Vagga on Ignorance,

original: 1-2. Avijjāsuttādivaṇṇanā🔽1-2. Pubbaṅgamāti pubbecarā. Avijjā hi aññāṇalakkhaṇā sammuyhanākārena ārammaṇe pavattatīti🔽sampayuttadhammānampi tadākārānuvidhānatāya paccayo hoti. Tathā hi te aniccāsubhadukkhānattasabhāvepi🔽dhamme niccādito gaṇhanti, ayamassā tesaṃ sahajātavasena pubbaṅgamatā. Yaṃ pana mohena
analyzed: pubbaṅgamā ati pubbecarā avijjā hi aññāṇa lakkhaṇā sammuyhana ākārena ārammaṇe pavattati iti  sampayutta dhammānam pi tad ākāra anuvidhāna tāya paccayaḥ hoti tathā hi te anicca asubha dukkha anatta sabhāve pi  dhamme nicca āditas gaṇhanti ayam assā tesam sahajāta vasena pubbaṅgama tā yam pana mohena
translated: the exposition of the Sutta on Ignorance, etc.,

original: abhibhūto pāpakiriyāya ādīnavaṃ apassanto pāṇaṃ hanati, adinnaṃ ādiyati, kāmesu micchā🔽carati, musā bhaṇati, aññampi vividhaṃ dussīlyaṃ ācarati, ayamassa sahajātavasena🔽ca upanissayavasena ca pubbaṅgamatā. Samāpajjanāyāti tabbhāvāpajjanāya akusalappattiyā.
analyzed: abhibhūtaḥ pāpa kiriyāya ādīnavam a passantaḥ pāṇam hanati adinnam ādiyati kāmesu micchā 🔽carati musā bhaṇati aññam pi vividham dussīlyam ācarati ayam assa sahajāta vasena 🔽ca upanissaya vasena ca pubbaṅgama tā samāpajjanāya ati tad bhāva āpajjanāya akusala ppattiyā

original: Sabhāvapaṭilābhāyāti attalābhāya. Tenāha “uppattiyā”ti. Sā panesā vuttākārena akusalānaṃ🔽pubbaṅgamabhūtā avijjā uppajjatīti sambandho. Yadetanti yaṃ etaṃ pāpājigucchanatāya
analyzed: sabhāva paṭilābhāya ati atta lābhāya tena āha uppattiyā iti sā pana isā vutta ākārena akusalānam  pubbaṅgama bhūtā avijjā uppajjati iti sambandhaḥ yat etat iti yam etam pāpa ājigucchana tāya
translated: “For the acquisition of individual essence” : for the acquisition of self. Hence “for the arising” is said. And this ignorance, which is the forerunner in the way stated of the unwholesome,

original: pāpato alajjanākārasaṇṭhitaṃ ahirikaṃ, pāpānutrāsatāya pāpato abhāyanākārasaṇṭhitañca
analyzed: pāpataḥ a lajjana ākāra saṇṭhitam ahirikam pāpa anutrāsa tāya pāpataḥ a bhāyanā ākāra saṇṭhitam ca
translated: arises. This is the construction of the meaning. “What is this” : what is this shamelessness, which is the state of being devoid of shame in regard to evil,

original: anottappaṃ, etaṃ dvayaṃ anudeva anvāgatameva. Anu-saddena cettha etanti upayogavacanaṃ.🔽Anudevāti etassa attho saheva ekatoti. Ettha avijjāya vuttanayānusārena tappaṭipakkhato
analyzed: etam dvayam anu dā iva anvāgatam eva anu saddena ca ittha etat ti upayoga vacanam  anudeva iti etassa atthaḥ saha iva ekatas ti ettha avijjāya vutta naya anusārena tad paṭipakkhato
translated: and what is this lack of fear, which is the state of being devoid of fear in regard to evil? These two are always together. Here the word “this” is a demonstrative pronoun.

original: ca attho veditabbo. Ayaṃ pana viseso – tattha yathā akusalakammapathavasena pavattiyaṃ🔽pubbaṅgamatā avijjāya, evaṃ kusalakammapathavasena puññakiriyavatthuvasena ca pavattiyaṃ
analyzed: ca atthaḥ veditabbaḥ ayam pana visesaḥ tattha yathā akusala kammapatha vasena pavattiyam  pubbaṅgama tā avijjāya evam kusala kammapatha vasena puñña kiriya vatthu vasena ca pavattiyam
translated: The meaning is “together with this.” Here the meaning should be understood in the opposite sense to that stated for ignorance. But there is this difference. Just as ignorance is the forerunner in the occurrence of the unwholesome courses of kamma,

original: vijjāya pubbaṅgamatā vattabbā. Vīmaṃsādhipativasena pavattiyaṃ ādhipaccākāravasena
analyzed: vijjāya pubbaṅgama tā vattabbā vīmaṃsā adhipati vasena pavattiyam ādhipacca ākāra vasena
translated: so it should be said that knowledge is the forerunner in the occurrence of the wholesome courses of kamma and in the occurrence of the bases of meritorious activity. And in the occurrence of the bases of meritorious activity, knowledge is the forerunner in the sense of predominance, in the sense of being the chief factor.

original: ca pubbaṅgamatā veditabbā. Dvīhevāti ca avadhāraṇaṃ ādhipaccākārassa sahajāteneva saṅgahetabbato.
analyzed: ca pubbaṅgama tā veditabbā dvīhā iva ati ca avadhāraṇam ādhi pacca ākārassa sahajātena iva saṅgahetabbataḥ
translated: and the precedence should be understood as stated. And the word “only” is a restriction because the mode of predominance can be included only with the conascent states.

original: Lajjanākārasaṇṭhitāti pāpato jigucchanākārasaṇṭhitā. Bhāyanākārasaṇṭhitanti uttasanākārasaṇṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: lajjana ākāra saṇṭhitā ati pāpataḥ jigucchana ākāra saṇṭhitā bhāyana ākāra saṇṭhitam iti uttasana ākāra saṇṭhitam
translated: “Embarrassed by evil” means “embarrassed by what is evil.” “Frightened by evil” means “frightened by what is fearful.”

original: Etthāti hiriottappe. Vidati, vindatīti vā vijjā. Viddasūti ca sappaññapariyāyoti
analyzed: ettha ati hiri uttappe vidati vindati iti vā vijjā ca sappañña pariyāyā
translated: “Here” : in shame and fear of wrongdoing. “Knowledge” : it cuts off , it finds , thus it is knowledge . And the word “wise” is a synonym for “one possessed of knowledge” .

original: āha “viddasunoti viduno”ti. Yāthāvadiṭṭhīti aviparītā diṭṭhi, saṃkilesato niyyānikadiṭṭhi.
analyzed: āha viddasunoti vidunoti yāthāva diṭṭhi iti aviparītā diṭṭhi saṃkilesataḥ niyyānika diṭṭhi
translated: “Right view” : non-distorted view, view that leads out of the tangle of defilements.🔽“Comes to be” : here that knowledge should be understood as right view.

original: Sammādiṭṭhi pahotīti ettha sā vijjā sammādiṭṭhi veditabbā. Na ekato sabbāni labbhanti
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi pahoti iti ettha sā vijjā sammādiṭṭhi veditabbā na ekatas sabbāni labbhanti
translated: All these are not found together in one and the same person,🔽because the prior volitions of right speech, right action, and right livelihood are of many kinds.

original: sammāvācākammantājīvānaṃ pubbābhisaṅkhārassa anekarūpattā. Lokuttaramaggakkhaṇe ekato
analyzed: sammā vācā kammanta ājīvānam pubba abhisaṅkhārassa aneka rūpa ttā lokuttara magga kkhaṇe ekatas
translated: But at the moment of the supramundane path they are found together,

original: labbhanti kiccato bhinnānampi tāsaṃ tattha sarūpato abhinnattā. Ekā eva hi virati
analyzed: labbhanti kiccataḥ bhinnānam pi tāsam tattha sarūpataḥ abhinna ttā ekā eva hi virati
translated: because although they are different in function, they are not different in essence there. For there is only one abstinence

original: maggakkhaṇe tissannampi viratīnaṃ kiccaṃ sādhentī pavattati, yathā ekā eva sammādiṭṭhi
analyzed: magga kkhaṇe tissannam pi viratīnam kiccam sādhentī pavattati yathā ekā eva sammādiṭṭhi
translated: At the moment of the path, it occurs accomplishing the function of all three abstinences, just as right view,

original: parijānanādivasena catubbidhakiccaṃ sādhentī pavattati. Tāni ca kho sabbāni aṭṭhapi
analyzed: parijānanā ādi vasena catubbidha kiccam sādhentī pavattati tāni ca kho sabbāni aṭṭha pi
translated: though one only, occurs accomplishing the four functions of full-understanding, etc.,🔽and all these are found in the path of the first jhāna.

original: paṭhamajjhānike magge labbhantīti yojanā. Paṭhamajjhāniketi paṭhamajhānavante.
analyzed: paṭhama jhānike magge labbhanti iti yojanā paṭhama jhānika iti paṭhama jhānavante
translated: “In the first jhāna” means in one possessing the first jhāna.🔽“In one such as he” means in one possessing the noble path.

original: Tathābhūtassāti ariyamaggasamaṅgino. Yasmā mahāsaḷāyatanasutte vuttaṃ “sammādiṭṭhiādīnaṃ
analyzed: tathābhūtassa ati ariya magga samaṅginaḥ yasmai mahāsaḷāyatana sutte vuttam sammādiṭṭhi ādīnam
translated: Since it is said in the Mahāsaḷāyatana Sutta, “By means of the five factors beginning with right view” ,

original: pañcannaṃ eva aṅgānaṃ vasenā”ti, tasmā pañcaṅgiko lokuttaramaggo hoti. “Pubbeva kho
analyzed: pañcannam eva aṅgānam vasena ati tasmā pañcaṅgikaḥ lokuttara maggaḥ hoti pubbā iva kho
translated: therefore the supramundane path is fivefold. The statement, “But previously” ,

original: panā”ti hi vacanaṃ tadā maggakkhaṇe viratīnaṃ abhāvaṃ ñāpeti, tasmā kāmāvacaracittesu
analyzed: panāti hi vacanam tadā magga kkhaṇe viratīnam abhāvam ñāpeti tasmā kāmāvacara cittesu
translated: informs us that there is no abstinence at the moment of the path. Therefore, just as in the mundane consciousnesses,🔽in the supramundane consciousnesses also the abstinence is not fixed. The intention is this:

original: viya lokuttaracittesu virati aniyatāti adhippāyo. Parisuddhabhāvadassananti parisuddhasīlabhāvadassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: viya lokuttara cittesu virati aniyatā ati adhippāyo parisuddha bhāva dassananti parisuddha sīla bhāva dassana attham
translated: “For the purpose of showing the state of purity” means for the purpose of showing the state of pure morality.

original: Ayamattho dīpito, na ariyamagge viratīnaṃ abhāvo.
analyzed: ayam atthaḥ dīpitaḥ na ariya magge viratīnam abhāvaḥ
translated: This meaning is indicated, not the absence of abstinence in the noble path.

original: Yadi evaṃ kasmā abhidhamme maggavibhaṅge pañcaṅgikavāro āgatoti āha “yampi abhidhamme”tiādi.
analyzed: yadi evam kasmai abhidhamme magga vibhaṅge pañcaṅgika vāraḥ āgataḥ ti āha yam pi abhidhamma itiādi
translated: “To show one function”: the fivefold section is included in the Vibhaṅga in order to show one function of the path, namely, the function of abandoning.🔽“In the Vibhaṅga”: in the Abhidhamma Vibhaṅga.🔽“The fivefold section”: the fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga.🔽“The fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga”: the passage “The path is fivefold” .

original: Tanti “pañcaṅgiko maggo hotī”ti vacanaṃ. “Ekaṃ kiccantaraṃ dassetuṃ vutta”nti vatvā
analyzed: tatti pañcaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ hoti iti vacanam ekam kicca antaram dassetum vuttan ti vatvā
translated: “To show one function”: the fivefold section is included in the Vibhaṅga in order to show one function of the path, namely, the function of abandoning.🔽“In the Vibhaṅga”: in the Abhidhamma Vibhaṅga.🔽“The fivefold section”: the fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga.🔽“The fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga”: the passage “The path is fivefold” .

original: taṃ dassetuṃ “yasmiñhi kāle”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yasmiñhi kāleti lokiyakāle. Tena “ekaṃ🔽kiccantara”nti vuttaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikakiccaṃ dasseti. Viratiuppādanena micchāvācādīni puggalena
analyzed: tam dassetum yasmin hi kāle itiādi vuttam yasmin hi kāle iti lokiya kāle tena ekam  kiccantaram ti vuttam aṭṭhaṅgika kiccam dasseti virati uppādanena micchā vācā ādīni puggalena
translated: “To show one function”: the fivefold section is included in the Vibhaṅga in order to show one function of the path, namely, the function of abandoning.🔽“In the Vibhaṅga”: in the Abhidhamma Vibhaṅga.🔽“The fivefold section”: the fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga.🔽“The fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga”: the passage “The path is fivefold” .

original: maggasamaye pajahāpentīti sammādiṭṭhiādīni “pañca kārakaṅgānī”ti vuttāni. Sammāvācādikiriyā
analyzed: magga samaye pajahāpenti iti sammādiṭṭhi ādīni pañca kārakaṅgāni iti vuttāni sammā vācā ādi kiriyā
translated: “To show one function”: the fivefold section is included in the Vibhaṅga in order to show one function of the path, namely, the function of abandoning.

original: hi virati, tañca etāni kārāpentīti. Virativasenāti viramaṇakiriyāvasena kārāpakabhāvena,
analyzed: hi virati tat ca etāni kārāpenti iti virati vasena ati viramaṇa kiriyā vasena kārāpaka bhāvena
translated: “In the Vibhaṅga”: in the Abhidhamma Vibhaṅga.🔽“The fivefold section”: the fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga.

original: kattubhāvena vāti attho. “Viratittayavasenā”ti vā pāṭho.
analyzed: kattu bhāvena vā iti atthaḥ virati ttaya vasena iti vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: “The fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga”: the passage “The path is fivefold” .🔽“To show one function”: the fivefold section is included in the Vibhaṅga in order to show one function of the path, namely, the function of abandoning.🔽“In the Vibhaṅga”: in the Abhidhamma Vibhaṅga.

original: Sammākammanto pūratīti imehi sammādiṭṭhiādīhi sammākammantakiccaṃ pūrati nāma tehi
analyzed: sammākammantaḥ pūrati iti imehi sammādiṭṭhi ādīhi sammākammanta kiccam pūrati nāma tehi
translated: “The fivefold section”: the fivefold section in the Vibhaṅga.🔽“The fivefold section in the Vibha

original: vīriyādikehi tadatthasiddhito. Tampi sandhāya “ekaṃ kiccantaraṃ dassetu”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vīriya ādikehi tad attha siddhitaḥ tam pi sandhāya ekam kicca antaram dassetun ti vuttam
translated: because the purpose of the latter is fulfilled by the former, namely, by energy, etc. It is with reference to this that it is said, “to show one function.”

original: Imaṃ kiccantaraṃ dassetunti lokuttaramaggakkhaṇepi imāneva pañca sammāvācādiviratittayassa
analyzed: imam kiccantaram dassetun ti lokuttara magga kkhaṇe pi imān eva pañca
translated: To show this function: to show that at the moment of the supramundane path these same three abstinences, namely, right speech, right action, and right livelihood,

original: ekakkhaṇe kārāpakaṅgānīti dassetuṃ. Evaṃ vuttanti “tasmiṃ samaye pañcaṅgiko maggo
analyzed: eka khaṇe kārā pakaṅgāni iti dassetum evam vuttam ti tasmin samaye pañcaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: are the three factors of instigation in a single moment. Thus it is said: “At that time the path is fivefold,

original: hotī”ti evaṃ vuttaṃ. Lokiyamaggakkhaṇe pañceva honti, virati pana aniyatā, tasmā
analyzed: hoti iti evam vuttam lokiya magga kkhaṇe pañca iva honti virati pana aniyatā tasmā
translated: at the moment of the mundane path there are only five factors, but the abstinence is not fixed. Therefore,

original: “chaaṅgiko”ti avatvā “pañcaṅgiko”icceva vuttaṃ. Tayidaṃ abhidhamme pañcaṅgikavāradesanāya
analyzed: chaaṅgikā iti avatvā vuttam abhidhamme pañcaṅgika vāra desanāya
translated: without saying ‘sixfold,’ it is said to be ‘fivefold.’ This is the reason for the teaching of the fivefold path in the Abhidhamma.

original: kāraṇakittanamaggo, ariyamaggo pana aṭṭhaṅgikovāti dassetuṃ, “yā ca, bhikkhave”tiādimāha,
analyzed: kāraṇa kittana maggaḥ ariya maggaḥ pana aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ u āti dassetum yā ca bhikkhave tiādim āha
translated: To show that the noble path is eightfold, he says, “And whatever, bhikkhus,”

original: taṃ suviññeyyameva. Micchādiṭṭhiādikā dasa, tappaccayā akusalā ca dasāti vīsati akusalapakkhiyā,
analyzed: tam su viññeyyam eva micchādiṭṭhi ādikāḥ dasa tad paccayāḥ akusalā ca dasa ati vīsati akusala pakkhiyā
translated: which is easy to understand. There are ten wrongnesses beginning with wrong view, and the ten unwholesome roots that have them as their condition. Thus there are twenty factors of the unwholesome side.

original: sammādiṭṭhiādikā dasa, tappaccayā kusalā ca dasāti vīsati kusalapakkhiyā mahācattārīsakasutte
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi ādikā dasa tad paccayā kusalā ca dasa ati vīsati kusala pakkhiyā mahācattārīsaka sutte
translated: The ten beginning with right view and the ten profitable roots with ignorance as condition make twenty. These are the twenty kinds of profitable roots stated in the Great Forty Discourse .

original: vuttā. Mahācattārīsakanti tassetaṃ nāmaṃ. Missakova kathito lokuttarassapi idha labbhamānattā.
analyzed: vuttā mahācattārīsakanti tassa etam nāmam missakaḥ uva kathitaḥ lokuttarassa api idha labbhamāna ttā
translated: The Great Forty is its name. It is called “mixed” because the supramundane is included here.

original: Yasmā kosalasaṃyuttepi idha ca therena “upaḍḍhamidaṃ, bhante, brahmacariyassā”tiādinā
analyzed: kosala saṃyutte api ca therena upaḍḍham idam bhante brahmacariyassa ati ādinā
translated: Because what the Elder Ānanda said in the Kosala Samyutta, namely, “This is half of the spiritual life, venerable sir” ,

original: vuttaṃ “mā hevaṃ ānandā”tiādinā paṭikkhipitvā “sakalamevidaṃ ānandā”tiādinā bhagavatā
analyzed: vuttam mā ha ivam ānanda iti ādinā paṭikkhipitvā sakalam eva idam ānanda iti ādinā bhagavatā
translated: was rejected by the Blessed One with the words “Do not put it like that, Ānanda” , and because the sutta taught by the Blessed One with the words “Ānanda, this is the whole spiritual life” ,

original: desitaṃ suttaṃ āgataṃ. Tassattho kosalasaṃyuttavaṇṇanāyaṃ vutto, tasmā vuttaṃ “kosalasaṃyutte vuttatthamevā”ti.
analyzed: desitam suttam āgatam tassa attho kosala saṃyutta vaṇṇanāyam vutto tasmā vuttam kosala saṃyutte vutta ttham eva ati
translated: has come down in this sutta. Its meaning is stated in the commentary on the Kosala Samyutta, and that is why it is said, “The meaning is stated in the Kosala Samyutta” .

original: Avijjāsuttādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: avijjā sutta ādi vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the Avijjā Sutta is ended.

original: 3. Sāriputtasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sāriputta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sāriputta Sutta

original: 3. Sāvakabodhi sāvakapāramiyo, tappariyāpannaṃ ñāṇaṃ sāvakapāramiñāṇaṃ, taṃ pana
analyzed: sāvaka bodhi sāvaka pāramiyaḥ tad pariyāpannam ñāṇam sāvaka pārami ñāṇam tam pana
translated: The disciples’ enlightenment, the disciples’ perfections, the knowledge included there is knowledge of the disciples’ perfections. But that

original: dvinnaṃ aggasāvakānaṃ tatthapi dhammasenāpatino eva savisesaṃ matthakaṃ pattaṃ, na
analyzed: dvinnam aggasāvakānam tattha api dhammasenāpatino eva sa visesam matthakam pattam na
translated: of the two chief disciples is pre-eminent there, and of them the General of the Dhamma’s is pre-eminent, not that of the Elder Ānanda’s.

original: itaresanti āha – “sāvaka…pe… appattatāyā”ti. Tasmā tassa matthakappattiyā maggabrahmacariye
analyzed: itaresan ti āha tasmā tassa matthaka ppattiyā magga brahmacariye
translated: Therefore, when the disciple is striving for the attainment of the peak of the spiritual life,

original: ijjhante tassa ekadeso idha ijjhati, na sakalanti. Na hi addhabrahmacariyaṃ nāma
analyzed: ijjhante tassa eka desaḥ idha ijjhati na na hi addhabrahmacariyam nāma
translated: one part of it is successful here, not the whole. For there is no such thing as a half-spiritual life.

original: atthi, tasmā vuttaṃ, “sakalampi …pe… labbhatī”ti, taṃ pana bhaṇḍāgāriko nāññāsi ñāṇassa
analyzed: atthi tasmā vuttam sakalam pi pe labbhati iti tam pana bhaṇḍāgārikaḥ na aññāsi ñāṇassa
translated: Therefore it was said: “The whole … is not attained.” But the treasurer did not know,

original: sāvakavisayepi sappadesikattā, dhammasenāpati pana ñāṇassa tattha nippadesikattā
analyzed: sāvaka visaye pi sappadesika ttā dhamma senāpati pana ñāṇassa tattha nippadesika ttā
translated: because the knowledge of the disciple is limited to his own domain. But the general of the Dhamma knew,

original: aññāsīti. Tenāha – “ānandatthero…pe… aññāsī”ti. Evamāhāti “sakalamidaṃ, bhante”ti evaṃ avoca.
analyzed: aññāsi iti tena āha aññāsi iti evam āha ati sakalam idam bhante iti evam avoca
translated: because the knowledge of the Buddha is unlimited. Therefore it was said: “The Elder Ānanda … knew.”

original: Sāriputtasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽4. Jāṇussoṇibrāhmaṇasuttavaṇṇanā🔽4. Vaḷavābhi-saddo vaḷavāpariyāyoti āha “catūhi vaḷavāhi yuttarathenā”ti. Yodharathoti
analyzed: sāriputta sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā            vaḷava abhisaddaḥ vaḷavā pariyāyaḥ iti āha catūhi vaḷavāhi yutta rathena ati yodha rathā iti
translated: The commentary on the Sāriputta Sutta is finished.🔽The commentary on the Jāṇussoṇi Sutta

original: yodhehi yujjhanatthaṃ ārohitabbaratho. Alaṅkāraratho maṅgaladivasesu alaṅkatapaṭiyattehi
analyzed: yodhehi ārohitabba rathaḥ alaṅkāra rathaḥ maṅgala divasesu alaṅkata paṭiyattehi
translated: The sound of the chariot is called “the sound of the chariot’s wheels.” Therefore it was said: “With a chariot yoked with four horses.” A war chariot is a chariot to be mounted by warriors for the purpose of fighting. A decorated chariot is a chariot decorated and prepared for festive occasions.

original: ārohitabbaratho. Ghanadukulena parivāritoti rajatapaṭṭavaṇṇena setadukulena paṭicchādito.
analyzed: ārohitabba rathaḥ ghana dukulena parivāritaḥ iti rajata paṭṭa vaṇṇena seta dukulena paṭicchāditaḥ
translated: and the chariot was mounted. It was surrounded by a network of gold: it was covered with a network of the colour of gold-leaf.

original: Paṭicchādanattho hi idha parivārasaddo. Rajatapanāḷisuparikkhittā setabhāvakaraṇatthaṃ.
analyzed: paṭicchādana tthaḥ hi idha parivāra saddo seta bhāva karaṇa ttham
translated: For the word ‘surrounded’ here has the meaning of ‘covered’. It was surrounded by silver panels, in order to make it white.

original: Channaṃ channaṃ māsānanti niddhāraṇe sāmivacanaṃ. Ekavāraṃ nagaraṃ padakkhiṇaṃ karotīti
analyzed: channam channam niddhāraṇe sāmi vacanam eka vāram nagaram padakkhiṇam karoti iti
translated: For six months at a time: the instrumental case is used in the sense of limitation. He went round the city once:

original: idaṃ tasmiṃ ṭhānantare ṭhitena kātabbaṃ cārittaṃ. Nagarato na pakkantāti nagarato
analyzed: idam tasmin ṭhāna antare ṭhitena kātabbam cārittam nagarataḥ na pakkantā ati nagarataḥ
translated: this is the conduct to be performed by one who is standing in that place. He did not leave the city:

original: bahi na gatā. Maṅgalavacane niyuttā maṅgalikā, suvatthivacane niyuttā sovatthikā.
analyzed: bahi na gatā maṅgala vacane niyuttā maṅgalikā suvatthi vacane niyuttā sovatthikā
translated: he did not go outside the city. The maṅgalikās were the ones appointed to speak auspicious words, and the sovatthikās were the ones appointed to speak words of good fortune.

original: Ādi-saddena thutimāgadhavandikācariyake saṅgaṇhāti. Sukapattasadisāni vaṇṇato.
analyzed: ādi saddena thuti māgadha vandikā cariyake saṅgaṇhāti suka patta sadisāni vaṇṇato
translated: The word ‘etc.’ includes the thutimāgadha and vandikā teachers. As to colour, they were like a good fan-palms leaf.

original: Vaṇṇagītanti thutigītaṃ. Brahmabhūtaṃ seṭṭhabhūtaṃ yānaṃ, brahmabhūtānaṃ seṭṭhabhūtānaṃ
analyzed: vaṇṇa gītanti thuti gītam brahma bhūtam seṭṭha bhūtam yānam brahma bhūtānam seṭṭha bhūtānam
translated: The song of praise: the song of praise. The vehicle of the Brahmā, the vehicle of the best: the vehicle of the Brahmās, the vehicle of the best,🔽or the vehicle of Brahmā. Because of the conquest, because of the special victory,

original: yānanti vā brahmayānaṃ. Vijitattā visesena jinanato. Rāgaṃ vinayamānā pariyosāpetīti
analyzed: vā brahmayānam vijita ttā visesena jinanataḥ rāgam vinayamānā pariyosāpeti iti
translated: he brought passion to an end, he completed the conquest of passion.

original: sabbampi rāgaṃ samucchedavinayavasena vineti, attano kiccaṃ pariyosāpeti. Kiccapariyosāpaneneva
analyzed: sabbam pi rāgam samuccheda vinaya vasena vinā iti attano kiccam pariyosāpeti kicca pariyosāpanena iva
translated: and he disciplines all lust by way of the complete destruction of lust, and he brings his own task to its consummation.

original: hi sayampi pariyosānaṃ nipphattiṃ upagacchati. Tenāha “pariyosānaṃ gacchati nipphajjatī”ti.
analyzed: hi sayam pi pariyosānam nipphattim upagacchati tena āha pariyosānam gacchati nipphajjati iti
translated: For it is by the consummation of his own task that he himself comes to the consummation of the fruit. That is why it is said, “it comes to its consummation, it is produced.”

original: Dhuranti bhummatthe upayogavacananti āha “tatramajjhattatāyuge yuttā”ti. Īsāti yugasandhārikā
analyzed: āha tatra majjhatta tā yuge yuttā ati īsā ati yuga sandhārikā
translated: “Yoke” : in the sense of a base, a support. Thus it is said, “It is yoked to the pair of equalities right there.” “Pole” : a wooden pole that holds the yoke together.

original: dāruyugaḷā. Yathā vā bāhiraṃ yugaṃ dhāreti, tassā ṭhitāya eva kiccasiddhi, evaṃ kiriyāvasena
analyzed: dāru yugaḷā yathā vā bāhiram yugam dhārā iti tassāḥ ṭhitāya eva evam kiriyā vasena
translated: Or just as the pole supports the outer yoke, so too, equanimity, having obtained strength by way of function,

original: laddhabalena tatramajjhattatāyuge thiraṃ dhāreti, teheva ariyamaggarathassa pavattanaṃ.🔽Hiriggahaṇena cettha taṃsahacaraṇato ottappampi gahitaṃyeva hoti. Tenāha “attanā
analyzed: laddha balena tatram ajjhatta tā yuge thiram dhāreti tehā iva ariya magga rathassa pavattanam  hiri gahaṇena ca ittha tad sahacaraṇato ottappam pi gahitam yā iva hoti tena āha
translated: firmly supports the pair of equalities right there, and by means of them the noble supreme truth proceeds.🔽Here, by the mention of shame, conscience is also included because it accompanies the former. Therefore it is said, “with itself”

original: saddhi”ntiādi. Nāḷiyā minamāno puriso viya ārammaṇaṃ minātīti mano. Kataraṃ pana
analyzed: nāḷiyā minamānaḥ puriso viya ārammaṇam mināti iti mano kataram pana
translated: and so on. “It measures the object” : it measures the object as if a man were measuring with a bamboo. Thus it is called mind . But what is this “mind” ?

original: taṃ mano, kathañcassa yottasadisatāti āha “vipassanācitta”ntiādi. Tena yottaṃ viyāti
analyzed: tam mano katham ca assa yotta sadisa tā ti āha vipassanā citta ntiādi tena yottam viyāti
translated: “The mind” is the insight consciousness. “Like a charioteer” is said in order to show how it is like a charioteer.

original: yottanti dasseti. Lokiyavipassanācittaṃ atirekapaññāsa kusaladhamme ekābaddhe ekasaṅgahite🔽karotīti sambandho. Te pana “phasso hoti…pe… avikkhepo hotī”ti cittaṅgavasena dhammasaṅgahe🔽āgatanayeneva veditabbā. Lokuttaravipassanācittanti maggacittaṃ āha. Atirekasaṭṭhīti
analyzed: dasseti lokiya vipassanā cittam atireka paññāsa kusala dhamme eka ābaddhe eka saṅgahite  karoti iti sambandhaḥ te pana phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti iti citta aṅga vasena dhamma saṅgahe  āgata nayena iva veditabbā lokuttara vipassanā cittam ti magga cittam āha atireka saṭṭhi iti
translated: The meaning is that it makes the mundane insight consciousness and the more than fifty profitable states one-pointed and unified.

original: te eva sammākammantājīvehi anaññātaññassāmītindriyādīhi ca saddhiṃ atirekasaṭṭhi🔽kusaladhamme. Ekābaddheti ekasmiṃ eva ārammaṇe ābaddhe. Ekasaṅgaheti tatheva vipassanākiccavasena
analyzed: te eva sammā kammanta ājīvehi ca saddhim  kusala dhamme eka ābaddha iti ekasmin eva ārammaṇe ābaddhe eka saṅgahā iti tathā iva vipassanā kicca vasena
translated: The profitable states should be understood according to the method given in the Dhammasanganī under the heading of consciousness, as follows: “Contact is a factor of the mind, associated with consciousness, and occurs as a condition for consciousness. … Attention is a factor of the mind, associated with consciousness, and occurs as a condition for consciousness” . The supramundane insight consciousness is the path consciousness.🔽The more than sixty profitable states are the thirty-seven states partaking of enlightenment, the three aggregates, the four path states, and the four fruition states.🔽“One-pointed” : unified on a single object. “Unified” : unified by the function of insight.

original: ekasaṅgahe karoti. Pubbaṅgamabhāvena ārakkhaṃ sāretīti ārakkhasārathī. “Yathā hi
analyzed: eka saṅgahe karoti pubbaṅgama bhāvena ārakkham sāreti iti ārakkha sārathī yathā hi
translated: “It is a protector of the mind” : it is a protector of the mind by being its forerunner. “It is a charioteer of the mind” : it is a charioteer of the mind by being its forerunner.

original: rathassa…pe… sārathī”ti vatvā taṃ dassetuṃ “yoggiyo”ti vuttaṃ. Dhuraṃ vāheti yogge.
analyzed: rathassape sārathī iti vatvā tam dassetum yoggiyaḥ iti vuttam dhuram vāheti yogge
translated: “Just as a charioteer” is said in order to show how it is like a charioteer. “It is a yoke-bearer” is said in order to show how it is like a yoke-bearer.

original: Yojeti yogge samagatiyañca. Akkhaṃ abbhañjati sukhappavattanatthaṃ. Rathaṃ peseti
analyzed: yojeti yogge sama gatiyam ca akkham abbhañjati sukha ppavattana attham ratham peseti
translated: Yojeti is the same as yogge and samagatiyaṃ. Akkhaṃ is the same as abbhañjati for the purpose of the occurrence of happiness. Rathaṃ is the same as peseti.

original: yoggacodanena. Nibbisevane karoti gamanavīthiyaṃ paṭipādanena sanniyojeti. Ārakkhapaccupaṭṭhānāti
analyzed: yogga codanena nibbisevane karoti gamana vīthiyam paṭipādanena sanniyojeti ārakkha paccupaṭṭhānā ti
translated: Yojeti yogge samagatiyañca: he yokes it to the yoke, to the yoke-fellowing. Akkhaṃ abbhañjati sukhappavattanatthaṃ: he yokes it to the plough, for the sake of the occurrence of pleasure. Rathaṃ peseti yoggacodanena: he drives the chariot by urging it on with the yoke-fellowing. Nibbisevane karoti gamanavīthiyaṃ paṭipādanena sanniyojeti: he makes it enter the path by guiding it on the path. Ārakkhapaccupaṭṭhānāti:

original: ārakkhaṃ paccupaṭṭhapeti asammosasabhāvattā. Gatiyoti pavattiyo, nipphattiyo vā.
analyzed: ārakkham paccupaṭṭhapeti a sammosa sabhāvattā gatiyaḥ ti pavattiyaḥ nipphattiyaḥ vā
translated: he sets about guarding it, because of its non-loss nature. Gatiyo: the occurrences or the results.

original: Samanvesatīti gavesati.🔽Ariyapuggalassa nibbānaṃ paṭimukhaṃ sampāpane ratho viyāti ratho. Parikaroti vibhūsayatīti
analyzed: samanvesati iti gavesati  ariya puggalassa nibbānam paṭimukham sampāpane rathaḥ viyāti rathaḥ parikaroti vibhūsayati iti
translated: Samanvesati: he seeks.

original: parikkhāro, vibhūsanaṃ, sīlañca ariyamaggassa vibhūsanaṭṭhāniyaṃ. Tena vuttaṃ “catupārisuddhisīlālaṅkāro”ti,
analyzed: parikkhāraḥ vibhūsanam sīlam ca ariya maggassa vibhūsana ṭṭhāniyam tena vuttam catu pārisuddhi sīla alaṅkāraḥ ti
translated: Nibbāna is in front of the Noble Person, as if it were a chariot, thus it is a chariot. He adorns it, thus it is an adornment. Virtue is the adornment of the Noble Path. Therefore it was said: “The adornment of virtue consisting in the four kinds of purification” .

original: sīlabhūsanoti attho. Vipassanāsampayuttānanti lokiyāya lokuttarāya ca vipassanāya
analyzed: sīla bhūsanaḥ ti atthaḥ vipassanā sampayuttānam ti lokiyāya lokuttarāya ca vipassanāya
translated: The meaning is: the adornment of virtue. Vipassanāsampayuttānaṃ: of those associated with insight,

original: sampayuttānaṃ. Vidhinā īretabbato pavattetabbato vīriyaṃ, sammāvāyāmo. Samaṃ sammā
analyzed: sampayuttānam vidhinā īretabbataḥ pavattetabbataḥ vīriyam sammāvāyāmaḥ samam sammā
translated: both mundane and supramundane. Vīriyaṃ: energy, because it is to be exerted in the right way, to be made to occur. Sammāvāyāmo: right endeavour. Samaṃ sammā

original: ca dhiyatīti samādhi, dhurañca taṃ samādhi cāti dhurasamādhi, upekkhā dhurasamādhi
analyzed: ca dhiyati iti samādhi dhuram ca tam samādhi ca ati dhura samādhi upekkhā dhura samādhi
translated: and he steadies, thus it is concentration; and that is the yoke and it is concentration, thus it is the yoke of concentration; the equanimity is the yoke of concentration.

original: etassāti upekkhādhurasamādhi, ariyamaggo upekkhāsaṅkhātadhurasamādhīti attho. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: etassa ati upekkhā dhura samādhi ariya maggaḥ upekkhā saṅkhāta dhura samādhi iti atthaḥ aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: and it is the state of being concentrated, thus it is concentration . It is the yoke and it is concentration, thus it is the yoke of concentration . The concentration of equanimity is the yoke of concentration . It belongs to that , thus it is the concentration of the yoke of equanimity . The meaning is: the concentration of the yoke that is called equanimity is the noble path.

original: pana byañjanaṃ anādiyitvā dhurasamādhisaddānaṃ bhinnādhikaraṇatā vuttā. Payogamajjhatteti
analyzed: pana byañjanam an ādiyitvā dhura samādhi saddānam bhinna adhikaraṇa tā vuttā payoga majjhattā iti
translated: But in the commentary the word-meaning is not taken thus. The meaning of the words “yoke” and “concentration” is given separately.🔽In the middle of the application : in the middle of energy, because of the equality of energy.

original: vīriyasamatāya. Anicchāti icchāpaṭipakkhā. Tenāha “alobhasaṅkhātā”ti. Parivāraṇanti
analyzed: vīriya samatāya anicchā ati icchā paṭipakkhā tena āha alobha saṅkhātā iti
translated: Non-greed : the opposite of greed. Hence it is said: “called non-greed.”

original: parivāro, paricchadoti attho.🔽Mettāti mettācetovimutti. Tathā karuṇā. Pubbabhāgoti ubhinnampi upacāro. Dvepi kāyacittavivekā
analyzed: parivāro paricchado ti attho  mettā ati mettā cetaḥ vimutti tathā karuṇā pubbabhāgo ti ubhinnam pi upacāraḥ dve pi kāya citta vivekā
translated: Surrounding : surrounding, surrounding on all sides.🔽The surrounding is the retinue, the attendants.

original: viya pubbabhāgadhammavasena vuttā. Ariyamaggaratheti parisuddhamaggasaṅkhāte rathe.
analyzed: viya pubbabhāga dhamma vasena vuttā ariya magga rathe ti parisuddha magga saṅkhāte rathe
translated: Loving-kindness : the deliverance of mind called loving-kindness. So too, compassion. The preliminary work : the access of both . Both are called preliminary work because they are states of the preliminary stage, like the bodily and mental seclusion . The chariot of the noble path : the chariot called the pure path .

original: Ariyamaggaratho ca maggaratho cāti ariyamaggaratho, evaṃ ekasesanayena vā attho veditabbo.
analyzed: ariya magga ratho ca magga ratho ca ati ariya magga ratho evam eka sesa nayena vā attho veditabbo
translated: The chariot of the noble path and the chariot, thus it is the chariot of the noble path . Or the meaning should be understood in this way: the noble path is the chariot, and the chariot is the noble path, thus it is the chariot of the noble path .

original: Tenāha “imasmiṃ lokiyalokuttaramaggarathe ṭhito”ti. Sannaddhacammoti yogāvacarassa🔽paṭimukkacammaṃ. Na naṃ te vijjhantīti vacanapathā na naṃ vijjhanti. Dhammabhedanavasena
analyzed: tena āha imasmin lokiya lokuttara magga rathe ṭhitaḥ iti sannaddha cammaḥ ti yogāvacarassa  paṭimukka cammam na nam te vijjhanti iti vacana pathāḥ na nam vijjhanti dhamma bhedana vasena
translated: Hence it was said above: “Standing in the vehicle of the supramundane path that leads to the world beyond.”🔽The yogi’s shield is his mindfulness.🔽The words of the verse do not pierce him,

original: na bhañjati, tassa ariyamaggassa rathassa sammā yojitassa antarā bhaṅgo natthīti attho.
analyzed: na bhañjati tassa ariya maggassa rathassa sammā yojitassa antarā bhaṅgaḥ na atthi iti attho
translated: and he is not broken by the division of the Dhamma. The meaning is that there is no breaking of the noble path’s chariot when it is properly yoked.🔽The intention is that it is his own because it is obtained by his own effort.

original: Attano purisakāraṃ nissāya laddhattā attano santāneti adhippāyo. Anuttaranti uttararahitaṃ.
analyzed: attano purisakāram nissāya laddha ttā attano santāne iti adhippāyaḥ anuttaram ti uttara rahitam
translated: It is unsurpassed because it is free from any higher state.🔽It is the best vehicle because it is not equal to anything else.

original: Tato eva seṭṭhayānaṃ, nassa kenaci sadisanti asadisaṃ. Dhitisampannatāya dhīrā paṇḍitapurisā
analyzed: tatas eva seṭṭha yānam kenacid sadisanti asadisam dhiti sampanna tāya dhīrā paṇḍita purisā
translated: The wise, who are endowed with steadfastness,🔽depart from the world.

original: lokamhā niyyanti gacchanti. “Jayaṃ jaya”nti gāthāyaṃ vacanavipallāsena vuttanti āha
analyzed: lokamhā niyyanti gacchanti jayam jayanti gāthā ayam vacana vipallāsena vuttan ti āha
translated: In the verse “Jayaṃ jaya” is said with a reversal of the words.

original: “jinantā jinantā”ti.
analyzed: jinantā jinantā ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “Jinantā jinantā.”

original: Jāṇussoṇibrāhmaṇasuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇa sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Jāṇussoṇi Sutta is finished.

original: 5-6. Kimatthiyasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Kimatthiyā Sutta, etc.

original: 5-6. Niyamatthoti avadhāraṇattho. Tena niyamena avadhāraṇena – aññaṃ maggaṃ paṭikkhipati
analyzed: niyama attho ti avadhāraṇa attho tena niyamena avadhāraṇena aññam maggam paṭikkhipati
translated: By that restriction, by that limitation, he excludes any other path,🔽because there is no other path leading out.

original: ito aññassa niyyānikamaggassa abhāvato. “Dukkhassa pariññattha”nti vuttattā vaṭṭadukkhaṃ
analyzed: itas aññassa niyyānika maggassa abhāvataḥ dukkhassa vutta ttā vaṭṭa dukkham
translated: Since it is said “for the purpose of fully understanding suffering,” the suffering of the round🔽is indicated.

original: kathitaṃ. Ariyamagge gahite tassa pubbabhāgamaggo vipassanāya gahito evāti “missakamaggo🔽kathito”ti vuttaṃ. Uttānameva apubbassa abhāvā. Ayaṃ pana viseso “rāgakkhayo”tiādīhi
analyzed: kathitam ariya magge gahite tassa pubbabhāga maggaḥ vipassanāya gahitaḥ eva ati missaka maggaḥ  kathito ti vuttam uttānam eva apubbassa abhāvā ayam pana visesaḥ rāga kkhayaḥ ti ādīhi
translated: When the noble path is taken, the path that is its prerequisite is included in insight. Therefore it is said that the mixed path🔽is indicated. The peak is just that, because there is nothing higher. But this is the difference:🔽although Nibbāna is indicated by the words “destruction of lust,” etc.,

original: yadipi nibbānaṃ vuttaṃ. Tathāpi arahattaṃ viya brahmacariyampi. Tena nibbānaṃ eva
analyzed: yadi pi nibbānam vuttam tathā api arahattam viya brahmacariyam pi tena nibbānam eva
translated: nevertheless, like arahatship, the life of purity is also indicated. Therefore it is said that Nibbāna itself

original: vuccati “idaṃ brahmacariyapariyosāna”nti.
analyzed: vuccati idam brahmacariya pariyosānam ti
translated: is called the life of purity.

original: Kimatthiyasuttādivaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kimatthiya sutta ādi vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Kimatthiyasutta is concluded.

original: 7. Dutiyaaññatarabhikkhusuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya aññatara bhikkhu sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Second Sutta on a Certain Monk🔽Nibbāna or arahatship is indicated by the words “taming of lust,” etc., because that monk is

original: 7. Rāgavinayādipadehi nibbānaṃ vāpi vucceyya arahattaṃ vāpi. Yasmā so bhikkhu ubhayatthapi
analyzed: rāga vinaya ādi padehi nibbānam vā api vucceyya arahattam vā api yasmā so bhikkhu ubhayattha api
translated: established in both.

original: niviṭṭhabuddhi, tasmā bhagavā tassa ajjhāsayavasena “nibbānadhātuyā kho eta”ntiādinā
analyzed: tasmai bhagavā tassa ajjhāsaya vasena nibbāna dhātuyā kho etat ti ādinā
translated: and his mind was fixed on that, so the Exalted One, in order to satisfy his intention, said, “In the element of extinction, bhikkhu,” and so on.

original: nibbānadhātuṃ vissajjetvā puna “āsavānaṃ khayo tena vuccatī”ti āha. Yasmā ariyamaggo
analyzed: nibbāna dhātum vissajjetvā puna āsavānam khayaḥ tena vuccati iti āha yasmai ariya maggo
translated: Then, having answered his question about the element of extinction, he said, “The destruction of the taints is called nibbana.”

original: rāgādike samucchedavasena vineti, āsavañca sabbaso khepeti, tena ca vuttaṃ nibbānaṃ
analyzed: rāga ādike samuccheda vasena vinā iti āsavam ca sabbaso khepeti tena ca vuttam nibbānam
translated: Because the noble path eradicates lust, etc., and completely purifies the taints, and because nibbana and arahatship are called by that name,

original: arahattañca, tasmā tadubhayaṃ “rāgavinayotiādi nāmamevā”ti vuttaṃ. Anusandhikusalatāya🔽pucchanto etaṃ avocāti iminā “pucchānusandhi idha labbhatī”ti dīpitaṃ, ajjhāsayānusandhipi
analyzed: tasmā tat ubhayam rāga vinaya uti ādi nāmam eva ati vuttam anusandhi kusala tāya  pucchantaḥ etam avoca iti iminā puccha anusandhi idha labbhati iti dīpitam
translated: therefore both are called by the name “the eradication of lust, etc.”🔽By asking his question in this way, the bhikkhu showed his skill in pursuing the implications of a statement.

original: ettha labbhatevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: ettha labbhate iva ati daṭṭhabbam
translated: The reply given by the Exalted One shows his skill in pursuing the implications of a question.

original: Dutiyaaññatarabhikkhusuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya aññatara bhikkhu sutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The second sutta in the “Bhikkhu” group is finished.

original: 8. Vibhaṅgasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vibhaṅga sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition Sutta

original: 8. Ekena pariyāyena aṭṭhaṅgikamaggaṃ vibhajitvāti “sammādiṭṭhī”tiādinā ekena pariyāyena
analyzed: ekena pariyāyena aṭṭhaṅgika maggam vibhajitvā ati sammādiṭṭhi iti ādinā ekena pariyāyena
translated: By one method: by the method of the eight factors, beginning with right view.

original: ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ vibhāgena dassetvā “katamā ca, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhī”tiādinā
analyzed: ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam vibhāgena dassetvā katamā ca bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi itiādinā
translated: That is why it is said: “By learning, by questioning, by discerning the Dhamma for himself, the wise one, ardent, does not come to ruin.”🔽The knowledge of reviewing is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of reviewing.🔽The knowledge of retaining is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of retaining.

original: puna aparena pariyāyena vibhajitukāmo. Uggahadhāraṇaparicayañāṇānipi savanañāṇe eva
analyzed: puna aparena pariyāyena vibhajitu kāmaḥ uggaha dhāraṇa paricaya ñāṇāni pi savana ñāṇe eva
translated: The knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself.🔽The knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself is the knowledge of retaining.🔽The knowledge of retaining is the knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself.🔽The knowledge of reviewing is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of reviewing.🔽The knowledge of retaining is the knowledge of learning.

original: avarodhaṃ gacchantīti “savanasammasanapaṭivedhapaccavekkhaṇavasenā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: avarodham gacchanti iti savana sammasana paṭivedha paccavekkhaṇa vasena ati vuttam
translated: The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of retaining.🔽The knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself.🔽The knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself is the knowledge of retaining.

original: Kammaṭṭhānābhinivesoti kammaṭṭhānapaṭipatti. Purimāni dve saccāni uggaṇhitvāti sambandho.
analyzed: kammaṭṭhāna abhinivesaḥ ti kammaṭṭhāna paṭipatti purimāni dve saccāni uggaṇhitvā iti sambandho
translated: The knowledge of retaining is the knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself.🔽The knowledge of reviewing is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of reviewing.🔽The knowledge of retaining is the knowledge of learning.

original: Iṭṭhaṃ kantaṃ manāpanti nirodhamaggesu ninnabhāvaṃ dasseti, na abhinandanaṃ, tanninnabhāvo
analyzed: iṭṭham kantam manāpanti nirodha maggesu ninna bhāvam dasseti na abhinandanam tad ninna bhāvaḥ
translated: The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of retaining.🔽The knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself.🔽The knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself is the knowledge of retaining.🔽The knowledge of retaining is the knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself.

original: eva ca tattha kammakaraṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Ekenevākārena saccānaṃ paṭivedhanimittatā,🔽so eva abhimukhabhāvo tesaṃ samāgamoti ekābhisamayo.
analyzed: eva ca tattha kamma karaṇam daṭṭhabbam ekena iva ākārena saccānam paṭivedha nimitta tā  saḥ eva abhimukha bhāvaḥ tesam samāgamaḥ ti eka abhisamayaḥ
translated: The knowledge of reviewing is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of reviewing.🔽The knowledge of retaining is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of retaining.🔽The knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself is the knowledge of learning.🔽The knowledge of learning is the knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself.

original: Assāti ñāṇassa, yogino vā. Ettha ca keci “lokiyañāṇampi paṭivedho sabbassa yāthāvabodhabhāvato”ti
analyzed: assa ati ñāṇassa yoginaḥ vā ettha ca keci lokiya ñāṇam pi paṭivedhaḥ sabbassa yāthāvabodha bhāvato ti
translated: The knowledge of discerning the Dhamma for oneself is the knowledge of retaining.🔽The

original: vadanti. Nanu uggahādipaṭivedho ca paṭivedhova, na ca so lokuttaroti? Taṃ na, kevalena🔽paṭivedha-saddena uggahādipaṭivedhānaṃ avacanīyattā, paṭivedhanimittattā vā uggahādivasena🔽pavattaṃ dukkhādīsu pubbabhāge ñāṇaṃ “paṭivedho”ti vuccati, na paṭivedhattā, paṭivedhabhūtameva🔽pana ñāṇaṃ ujukaṃ paṭivedhoti vattabbataṃ arahati. Kiccatoti pariññādikiccato. Ārammaṇapaṭivedhoti
analyzed: vadanti nanu uggaha ādi paṭivedho ca na ca saḥ tam na kevalena  paṭivedha saddena uggaha ādi paṭivedhānam avacanīya ttā paṭivedha nimitta ttā vā uggaha ādi vasena  pavattam dukkha ādīsu pubbabhāge ñāṇam paṭivedhaḥ iti vuccati na paṭivedha ttā paṭivedha bhūtam eva  pana ñāṇam ujukam paṭivedhaḥ iti vattabba tam arahati kiccato ti pariññā ādi kiccato ārammaṇa paṭivedho ti
translated: Do they not say that the penetration of the apprehended object, etc., is penetration, and is that not supramundane? —It is not so, because the penetration of the apprehended object, etc., cannot be called simply “penetration,”🔽or because the knowledge that occurs in the earlier stage with respect to suffering, etc., as the apprehended object, etc., is called “penetration” because it is the cause of penetration, not because it is penetration itself,🔽and it is only the knowledge that is penetration itself that deserves to be called “straight” penetration. As to function: as to the function of full-understanding, etc. As to the penetration of the object:

original: sacchikiriyāpaṭivedhamāha. Kiccatoti asammohapaṭivedhaṃ. Uggahādīhi saccassa pariggaṇhanaṃ pariggaho.🔽Duddasattāti anadhigatañāṇena yāthāvasarasalakkhaṇato daṭṭhuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā uppattito🔽pākaṭānipi. Tenāha “dukkhasaccaṃ hī”tiādi. Ubhayanti purimaṃ saccadvayaṃ. Payogoti
analyzed: sacchikiriyā paṭivedham āha kiccato ti asammoha paṭivedham uggaha ādīhi saccassa pariggaṇhanam pariggahaḥ 🔽duddasa ttā ti anadhigata ñāṇena yāthāvasa rasa lakkhaṇataḥ daṭṭhum a sakkuṇeyya ttā uppattito 🔽pākaṭāni pi tena āha dukkha saccam hi itiādi ubhayanti purimam sacca dvayam
translated: Do they not say that the penetration of the known, etc., is penetration, and is that not supramundane? —It is not so because the known, etc., are not called penetration by the mere word “penetration.” Or else, because it is the cause of penetration, the knowledge that occurs in the earlier stage in regard to suffering, etc., as the known, etc., is called “penetration,” not because it is penetration. But the knowledge that is penetration itself deserves to be called “straight” penetration. As to function: as to the function of full-understanding, etc. As to object: as to the function of verifying. As to function: as to the function of non-delusion. As to apprehending: as to apprehending the four truths by the known, etc., in the earlier stage. As to difficult to see: because it is not possible to see the characteristic of actuality by means of knowledge that has not reached that stage, even though it is evident in its occurrence. Hence he said, “The truth of suffering is obvious” , etc. As to both: as to the first two truths. As to effort: as to the last two truths.

original: kiriyā, vāyāmo vā. Tassa mahantatarassa icchitabbataṃ dukkarataratañca upamāhi dasseti
analyzed: kiriyā vāyāmaḥ vā tassa mahantatarassa icchitabba tam dukkaratara tam ca upamāhi dasseti
translated: and the effort is the greater. He illustrates the desirability of the greater and its greater difficulty with a simile

original: “bhavaggaggahaṇattha”ntiādinā. Yathā purimaṃ saccadvayaṃ viya kenaci pariyāyena apākaṭatāya
analyzed: bhava gga ggahaṇa ttha nti ādinā yathā purimam sacca dvayam kenacid pariyāyena
translated: in the passage beginning, “For the purpose of grasping the summit of becoming” .

original: paramagambhīrattā uggahādivasena pubbabhāge pavattibhedaṃ gahetvā “dukkhe ñāṇa”ntiādinā
analyzed: parama gambhīra ttā uggaha ādi vasena pubba bhāge pavatti bhedam gahetvā dukkhe ñāṇa nti ādinā
translated: Just as the first two Truths are stated in four ways in the passage beginning, “Knowledge of suffering” ,🔽so too the third Truth is stated in four ways in the passage beginning, “Knowledge of the way” , taking the difference in its occurrence in the earlier stage as the means of grasping it, because it is supremely profound and not obvious in any way, like the first two Truths.

original: catubbidhaṃ katvā vuttaṃ. Ekameva taṃ ñāṇaṃ hoti ekābhisamayavaseneva pavattanato.
analyzed: catubbidham katvā vuttam ekam eva tam ñāṇam hoti eka abhisamaya vasena iva pavattanato
translated: But it is a single kind of knowledge, because it occurs only by a single kind of penetration.

original: Kāmapaccanīkaṭṭhenāti kāmānaṃ ujupaccanīkabhāvena. Kāmato nissaṭabhāvenāti kāmehi
analyzed: kāma paccanīka ṭṭhena ati kāmānam uju paccanīka bhāvena kāmataḥ nissaṭa bhāvena ati kāmehi
translated: As the opposite of sense desires: as the direct opposite of sense desires. As the escape from sense desires: as the unentangledness from sense desires.

original: visaṃyuttabhāvena. Kāmaṃ sammasantassāti duvidhampi kāmaṃ aniccādito sammasantassa.
analyzed: visaṃyutta bhāvena kāmam sammasantassa ati duvidham pi kāmam anicca āditas sammasantassa
translated: As the one who comprehends sense desires: as the one who comprehends the two kinds of sense desires as impermanent, and so on.

original: Pajjati pavattati etenāti padaṃ, kāmassa padanti kāmapadaṃ, kāmassa uppattikāraṇassa
analyzed: pajjati pavattati etena ati padam kāmassa padanti kāma padam kāmassa uppatti kāraṇassa
translated: A footing is a means. The footing for sense desires is the cause of the arising of sense desires.

original: ghāto samugghāto, taṃ kāmapadaghātaṃ. Tenāha “kāmavūpasama”nti. Kāmehi vivittaṃ kāmavivittaṃ.
analyzed: ghātaḥ samugghātaḥ tam kāma pada ghātam tena āha kāma vūpasamanti kāmehi vivittam kāma vivittam
translated: The destruction of that is the uprooting of it. That is the destruction of the footing for sense desires. Hence it was said above “The stilling of sense desires” . Sense desires are secluded in the secludedness of sense desires.

original: So eva ca nesaṃ anto samucchedaviveketi katvā tasmiṃ sādhetabbe uppannoti vuttaṃ🔽“kāmavivittante uppanno”ti. Kāmato nikkhamatīti nikkhamo, so eva nekkhammasaṅkappo.🔽Imasmiñca nekkhammasaṅkappassa saddatthavibhāvena yathāvutto kāmapaccanīkaṭṭhādiko🔽atthaniddhāraṇaviseso antogadho.🔽Eseva nayoti iminā byāpādapaccanīkaṭṭhena vihiṃsāya paccanīkaṭṭhenātiādikaṃ abyāpādāvihiṃsāsaṅkappānaṃ🔽atthuddhāraṇavidhiṃ atidisati. Nekkhammasaṅkappādayoti ādi-saddena abyāpādaavihiṃsāsaṅkappe
analyzed: saḥ eva ca na isam antaḥ samuccheda viveka iti katvā tasmin sādhetabbe uppannaḥ iti vuttam  kāma vivitta ante uppannaḥ ti kāmataḥ nikkhamati iti nikkhamaḥ saḥ eva nekkhamma saṅkappo  imasmin ca nekkhamma saṅkappassa sadda attha vibhāvena yathā vuttaḥ kāma paccanīka ṭṭhādiko  attha niddhāraṇa visesaḥ antogadhaḥ  iminā byāpāda paccanīka ṭṭhena vihiṃsāya paccanīka ṭṭhena ati ādikam a byāpāda a vihiṃsā saṅkappānam  attha uddhāraṇa vidhim atidisati nekkhamma saṅkappa ādayo ti ādi saddena a byāpāda avihiṃsā saṅkappe
translated: And since it is the only one of these that is the opposite of the kind of thinking that is to be abandoned in this meditation subject, it is said to “arise in the opposite way.”🔽“In the opposite way from sensual-desire-rooted thinking”: “exit” is “departure” from sense desires; that is, the kind of thinking that is the opposite of sensual desire.🔽And the distinction in meaning of the opposite of sensual desire, etc., stated in the way beginning, “The meaning of the opposite of sensual desire is the meaning of renunciation,” is included in the word “renunciation” in the phrase “renunciation-thinking.”🔽“In this way too”: this shows the method of determining the meaning of non-ill will and non-cruelty by the method stated for renunciation.🔽“Renunciation-thinking, etc.”: the word “etc.” includes non-ill will and non-cruelty.

original: eva saṅgaṇhāti. Kāma…pe… saññānanti kāmavitakkādiviratisampayuttānaṃ nekkhammādisaññānaṃ.🔽Nānattāti nānākhaṇikattā. Tīsu ṭhānesūti tippakāresu kāraṇesu. Uppannassāti uppajjanārahassa.
analyzed: eva saṅgaṇhāti kāmape saññānan ti kāma vitakka ādi virati sampayuttānam nekkhamma ādi saññānam 🔽nānattā ati nānākhaṇikattā tīsu ṭhānesu uti tippakāresu kāraṇesu uppannassa ati uppajjanā rahassa
