translated: By this he shows that not only by way of object but also by way of decisive support is the meaning to be found here. For in the second sutta in the first vagga the meaning is shown by way of decisive support only. The mixed enlightenment factors

original: kathitā avibhāgeneva kathitattā. Aparihāniyeti tīhi sikkhāhi aparihānāvahe.
analyzed: kathitā avibhāgena iva kathita ttā aparihāniyā iti tīhi sikkhāhi a parihānāvahe
translated: are stated without analysis, since they are stated without analysis. Non-decline: the non-decline that is the cause of the three trainings.

original: 6-7. Taṇhakkhayasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: taṇhā khaya sutta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Sutta on the Subject of Craving’s Destruction

original: 207-208. “So maṃ pucchissatī”ti adhippāyena bhagavatā osāpitadesanaṃ. Patthaṭattā
analyzed: saḥ mama pucchissati iti adhippāyena bhagavatā osāpita desanam
translated: The Blessed One’s teaching was interrupted by the Blessed One with the intention: “He will ask me” . The Blessed One’s teaching was interrupted by the Blessed One with the intention: “He will ask me” .

original: bhāvanāpāripūriyā vitthāritaṃ gatattā. Mahantabhāvanti bhāvanāvaseneva mahattaṃ gatattā.🔽Tato eva vaḍḍhippamāṇā. Nīvaraṇavigame sambhavato paccayato byāpādo vigato hotīti
analyzed: bhāvanā pāripūriyā vitthāritam bhāvanā vasena iva  tatas eva vaḍḍhippamāṇā nīvaraṇa vigame sambhavataḥ paccayataḥ byāpādaḥ vigataḥ hoti iti
translated: And it is called “development of the increase” because it has reached the state of increase.🔽Since it is possible in the absence of the hindrances, ill will is absent through the condition of the absence of the hindrances.🔽So it is said that “because of the remoteness of the hindrances, it is free from ill will.”

original: āha – “nīvaraṇānaṃ dūrībhāvena byāpādavirahitattā”ti. Taṇhāmūlakanti taṇhāpaccayaṃ.
analyzed: āha dūrībhāvena byāpāda virahita ttā ati taṇhā mūlakam taṇhā paccayam
translated: “Rooted in craving”: conditioned by craving.

original: Yañhi taṇhāsahagataṃ asahagatampi taṇhaṃ upanissāya nipphannaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ taṇhāmūlakaṃ.
analyzed: yat hi taṇhā sahagatam asahagatam pi taṇham upanissāya nipphannam sabbam tat taṇhā mūlakam
translated: For whatever is associated with craving or is produced by craving, whether or not it is actually associated with craving, is all rooted in craving.🔽It is abandoned by the abandonment consisting in non-arising.

original: Pahīyati anuppādappahānena. Taṇhādīnaṃyeva khayā, na tesaṃ saṅkhārānaṃ khayā. Etehi
analyzed: pahīyati anuppāda pahānena taṇhā ādīnam yeva khayā na tesam saṅkhārānam khayā etehi
translated: By the destruction of craving, etc., not by the destruction of those formations.

original: taṇhakkhayādipadehi.🔽8. Nibbedhabhāgiyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: taṇhakkhaya ādi padehi  nibbedhabhāgiya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: By the terms “destruction of craving,” etc.🔽Nibbedhabhāgiya Sutta Explanatory Translation: because it has been extended by the fulfilment of development. It is called “great development” because it has reached greatness by the method of development.

original: 209. Nibbijjhantīti nibbedhā, nibbijjhanadhammā dhammavinayādayo, tappariyāpannatāya
analyzed: nibbijjhanti iti nibbedhāḥ nibbijjhana dhammāḥ dhamma vinaya ādayaḥ tad pariyāpanna tāya
translated: And it is called “development of the increase” because it has reached the state of increase.🔽Since it is possible in the absence of the hindrances, ill will is absent through the condition of the absence of the hindrances.🔽So it is said that “because of the remoteness of the hindrances, it is free from ill will.”🔽“Rooted in craving”: conditioned by craving.🔽For whatever is associated with craving or is produced by craving, whether or not it is actually associated with craving, is all rooted in craving.🔽It is abandoned by the abandonment consisting in non-arising.🔽By the destruction of craving, etc., not by the destruction of those formations.

original: nibbedhabhāge gato nibbedhabhāgiyo, taṃ nibbedhabhāgiyaṃ. Tenāha “nibbijjhanakoṭṭhāsiya”nti.
analyzed: nibbedha bhāge gataḥ nibbedhabhāgiyaḥ tam nibbedhabhāgiyam tena āha nibbijjhana koṭṭhāsiyanti
translated: By the terms “destruction of craving,” etc.🔽Nibbedhabhāgiya Sutta Explanatory Translation

original: Bhāvetvā ṭhitena cittena. Vipassanāmaggampi gahetvā “maggabojjhaṅgā missakā”ti vuttā.🔽Tehīti bojjhaṅgehi bhāvitaṃ cittaṃ. Te vā bojjhaṅge bhāvetvā ṭhitaṃ cittaṃ nāma phalacittaṃ,
analyzed: bhāvetvā ṭhitena cittena vipassanā maggam pi gahetvā maggabojjhaṅgā missakā ti vuttā  tehi iti bojjhaṅgehi bhāvitam cittam te vā bojjhaṅge bhāvetvā ṭhitam cittam nāma phala cittam
translated: The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.

original: tasmā nibbattitalokuttarameva. Tampīti phalacittampi maggānantaratāya magganissitaṃ
analyzed: tasmā nibbattita lokuttaram eva tam pi iti phala cittam pi magga anantaratāya magga nissitam
translated: The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.

original: katvā missakameva kathetuṃ vaṭṭati “bodhāya saṃvattantī”ti vuttattā.🔽9. Ekadhammasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: katvā missakam eva kathetum vaṭṭati bodhāya saṃvattanti iti vutta ttā  ekadhamma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.🔽The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.

original: 210. Saṃyojanasaṅkhātā vinibandhāti kāmarāgādisaṃyojanasaññitā bandhanā. Pariniṭṭhapetvā gahaṇāti gilitvā viya pariniṭṭhapetvā gahaṇākārā.
analyzed: saṃyojana saṅkhātā vinibandhā ati kāma rāga ādi saṃyojana saññitā bandhanā pariniṭṭhapetvā gahaṇā ati gilitvā viya pariniṭṭhapetvā gahaṇa ākārā
translated: The supramundane consciousness that arises next to the path is called “developed consciousness” because it is developed by the path.

original: 10. Udāyisuttavaṇṇanā🔽211. Bahukataṃ vuccati bahukāro bahumāno, natthi etassa bahukatanti abahukato, akatabahumāno.🔽Dhammo uppajjamāno ukkujjanto viya nirujjhamāno avakujjanto viya hotīti vuttaṃ “ukkujjaṃ
analyzed: udāyi sutta vaṇṇanā 🔽bahukatam vuccati bahu kāraḥ bahu māno na atthi etassa bahu katan ti abahu kataḥ akata bahu māno 🔽dhammaḥ uppajjamānaḥ ukkujjantaḥ viya nirujjhamānaḥ avakujjantaḥ viya hoti iti vuttam ukkujjam
translated: The supramundane consciousness that arises next to

original: vuccati udayo, avakujjaṃ vayo”ti. Parivattentoti aniccātipi dukkhātipi anattātipi.
analyzed: vuccati udayaḥ avakujjam vayaḥ ti parivattento ti anicca atipi dukkha atipi anatta atipi
translated: it is said that the arising is the opening and the fall is the closing.

original: “Eso hi te udāyi maggo paṭiladdho, yo te…pe… tathattāya upanessatī”ti pariyosāne🔽bhagavato vacanañcettha sādhakaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tena tenākārena viharantanti yena sammasanākārena
analyzed: esaḥ hi te udāyi maggo paṭiladdhaḥ yaḥ tepe tathattāya upanessati iti pariyosāne  bhagavataḥ vacanañca ittha sādhakam daṭṭhabbam tena tena ākārena viharantam ti yena sammasana ākārena
translated: “This is the path, Udayin, that you have gained, by which you will arrive at such a state” .🔽The Blessed One’s words at the end should be taken as the proof here.🔽As to “he who abides in this or that way”: he who abides in the way of insight by means of this or that mode of insight.

original: vipassanāvihārena viharantaṃ. Tathābhāvāyāti khīṇāsavabhāvapaccavekkhaṇāya. Tenāha
analyzed: vipassanā vihārena viharantam tathābhāvāya ati khīṇāsava bhāva paccavekkhaṇāya tena āha
translated: As to “for the purpose of that state”: for the purpose of reviewing the state of one whose cankers are destroyed. Hence it was said above:

original: – “khīṇā jātīti…pe… taṃ dassento evamāhā”ti.
analyzed: khīṇā jātī itipe tam dassentaḥ evam āha ati
translated: “he shows that birth is destroyed, etc., and that he has reached the state of one whose cankers are destroyed” .

original: Udāyivaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: udāyi vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Udayi chapter is finished.

original: 4. Nīvaraṇavaggo
analyzed: nīvaraṇa vaggo
translated: The Hindrance Chapter

original: 3-4. Upakkilesasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Upakkilesa sutta, etc.🔽Nor does it shine: it is not endowed with shining.

original: 214-215. Na ca pabhāvantanti na ca pabhāsampannaṃ. Pabhijjanasabhāvanti tāpetvā tālane
analyzed: na ca na ca pabhā sampannam tāpetvā tālane
translated: The nature of breaking up: the state of breaking up after heating and beating.

original: pabhaṅgutaṃ. Avasesaṃ lohanti vuttāvasesaṃ jātilohaṃ, vijātilohaṃ, kittimalohanti
analyzed: avasesam lohanti vutta avasesam jāti loham vijāti loham kittima lohanti
translated: The rest of the iron: the remaining iron that is mentioned, namely, the iron of the same type, the iron of a different type, and the iron of a mixed type.

original: pabhedaṃ sabbampi lohaṃ. Uppajjituṃ appadānenāti ettha nanu lokiyakusalacittassapi
analyzed: pabhedam sabbam pi loham uppajjitum appadānena ati ettha nanu lokiya kusala cittassa api
translated: and all iron is of that kind. As to ‘not giving opportunity for arising’: are not the hindrances also a defilement of the profitable mundane consciousness, too,

original: suvisuddhassa uppajjituṃ appadānena upakkilesatāti? Saccametaṃ, yasmiṃ pana santāne
analyzed: su visuddhassa uppajjitum appadānena upakkilesa tā ati saccam etam yasmin pana santāne
translated: when it has arisen in a very pure form? It is so, but in a continuity in which the hindrances have obtained a footing,

original: nīvaraṇāni laddhapatiṭṭhāni, tattha mahaggatakusalassapi asambhavo, pageva lokuttarakusalassa,
analyzed: nīvaraṇāni laddha patiṭṭhāni tattha mahaggata kusalassa api asambhavaḥ pagā iva lokuttara kusalassa
translated: there can be no exalted profitable consciousness, much less supramundane profitable consciousness;

original: parittakusalaṃ pana yathāpaccayaṃ uppajjati. Nīvaraṇe hi vūpasante santāne uppattiyā
analyzed: paritta kusalam pana yathāpaccayam uppajjati nīvaraṇe hi vūpasante santāne uppattiyā
translated: but the minor profitable arises according to conditions. For when the hindrances are suppressed,

original: aparisuddhaṃ hoti, upakkiliṭṭhaṃ nāma hoti, aparisuddhadīpakapallikavaṭṭhitelādisannissayo🔽dīpo viya, apica nippariyāyato uppajjituṃ appadāneneva tesaṃ upakkilesatāti dassento
analyzed: aparisuddham hoti upakkiliṭṭham nāma hoti aparisuddha dīpaka pallika vaṭṭhi tela ādi sannissayaḥ  dīpaḥ viya apica nippariyāyataḥ uppajjitum appadānena iva tesam upakkilesa tā ti dassento
translated: the arising of the profitable in the continuity is not pure, it is called ‘defiled,’🔽like a lamp with an impure wick and oil, etc., for its support. Furthermore, he said ‘not giving opportunity for arising’ in order to show that the hindrances are a defilement in the ultimate sense.

original: “yadaggena hī”tiādimāha. Ārammaṇe vikkhittappattivasena cuṇṇavicuṇṇatā veditabbā.
analyzed: yat aggena hi iti ādim āha ārammaṇe vikkhitta ppatti vasena cuṇṇa vicuṇṇa tā veditabbā
translated: The meaning should be understood as ‘scatteredness in the object.’

original: Na āvarantīti kusaladhamme uppajjituṃ appadānavasena na āvaranti, atha kho tesaṃ
analyzed: na āvaranti iti kusala dhamme uppajjitum appadāna vasena na āvaranti atha kho tesam
translated: ‘Do not obstruct’: they do not obstruct the arising of profitable states.

original: uppattiyā honti. Na paṭicchādentīti na vinandhanti. Catubhūmakacittassāti catutthabhūmakakusalacittassa
analyzed: uppattiyā honti na paṭicchādenti iti na vinandhanti catu bhūmaka cittassa ati catuttha bhūmaka kusala cittassa
translated: With the consciousness of the fourth plane: with the profitable consciousness of the fourth plane.

original: anupakkilesā, tehi akilissanato.
analyzed: an upakkilesā tehi a kilissanato
translated: are unadulterated, because they are not adulterated by them.

original: 8. Āvaraṇanīvaraṇasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āvaraṇa nīvaraṇa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Hindrance of Worry

original: 219. Paññā dubbalā hoti, na balavatī paṭipakkhena upakkiliṭṭhabhāvato. Tenāha “mandā avisadā”ti.
analyzed: paññā dubbalā hoti na balavatī paṭipakkhena upakkiliṭṭha bhāvataḥ tena āha mandā avisadā iti
translated: is weak, not strong, because it is defiled by its opposite. Hence it is said to be sluggish and unclear.🔽The five hindrances are far away because they are absent.

original: Pañca nīvaraṇā dūre honti āvaraṇābhāvato. Tameva pītinti sappāyadhammasavane uppannaṃ
analyzed: pañca nīvaraṇāḥ dūre honti āvaraṇa abhāvataḥ tam eva sappāya dhamma savane uppannam
translated: That rapture: the rapture arisen in listening to the True Idea.🔽Not abandoning the aspect of its arising: not abandoning the aspect of its arising then by discerning it.

original: pītiṃ. Tassā tadā uppannākārasallakkhaṇena avijahanto punappunaṃ tassā nibbattanena.
analyzed: pītim tassā tadā uppanna ākāra sat lakkhaṇena a vijahanto punappunam tassāḥ nibbattanena
translated: By repeatedly producing it: by producing it again and again.🔽Hence it is said: “Having suppressed the five hindrances” .

original: Tenāha “pañca nīvaraṇe vikkhambhetvā”ti. Idaṃ sandhāyāti ettake divasepi na vinassanti,
analyzed: tena āha pañca nīvaraṇe vikkhambhetvā iti idam sandhāya ati ettake divase pi na vinassanti
translated: This is what is meant: “They do not perish even in that many days,

original: sā dhammapīti laddhapaccayā hutvā visesāvahāti imamatthaṃ sandhāya etaṃ “imassa pañca
analyzed: sā dhamma pīti laddha paccayā hutvā visesa āvahā ti imam attham sandhāya etam imassa pañca
translated: and that rapture of the True Idea, having obtained conditions, goes on to distinction” .

original: nīvaraṇā tasmiṃ samaye na hontī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Pītipāmojjapakkhiyāti pītipāmojjapaccayā.
analyzed: nīvaraṇā tasmin samaye na honti itiādi vuttam pīti pāmojja pakkhiyā ati pīti pāmojja paccayā
translated: With rapture and gladness as its nutriment: with rapture and gladness as its condition.

original: Nassantīti nirodhapaccayavasena pavattanato nassanti. Sabhāgapaccayavasena puna uppajjantāpi…pe…
analyzed: nassanti iti nirodha paccaya vasena pavattanataḥ nassanti sabhāga paccaya vasena puna
translated: They disappear: they disappear through the condition of cessation.

original: vuccati kiccasādhanavasena pavattanato.
analyzed: vuccati kicca sādhana vasena pavattanato
translated: They are called “hindrances” because they occur by accomplishing their function.

original: 9. Rukkhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: rukkha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Tree Discourse

original: 220. Abhiruhanakāti samīparukkhe abhibhavitvā ruhanakā. Aṭṭhikacchakoti aṭṭhibahulakacchako. Kapithanasadisaphalattā kapitthanoti laddhanāmo.
analyzed: abhiruhanakā ati samīpa rukkhe abhibhavitvā ruhanakā aṭṭhikacchako ti aṭṭhi bahula kacchako kapithana sadisa phalattā kapitthano ti laddha nāmo
translated: They grow by overtopping the trees nearby. The “bone-covered turtle” is the turtle with many bones. It is called “kapitthana” because its fruit resembles a wood-apple.

original: 10. Nīvaraṇasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nīvaraṇa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Hindrances Discourse🔽They are called “hindrances” because they are the cause of blindness and because they obstruct the eye of wisdom.

original: 221. Andhabhāvakaraṇā paññācakkhussa vibandhanato. Tathā hi te “acakkhukaraṇā paññānirodhikā”ti
analyzed: andha bhāva karaṇā paññā cakkhussa vibandhanato tathā hi te a cakkhu karaṇā paññā nirodhikā ti
translated: For they are described as “making one blind and obstructing wisdom.”

original: vuttā. Vihanati vibādhatīti vighāto, dukkhanti āha “vighātapakkhiyāti dukkhapakkhikā”ti.
analyzed: vuttā vihanati vibādhati iti vighātaḥ dukkhanti āha vighāta pakkhiyā āti dukkha pakkhikā ati
translated: “Distress” is that which distresses, which afflicts.🔽They do not lead to Nibbāna, thus they are not conducive to Nibbāna.

original: Nibbānatthāya na saṃvattantīti anibbānasaṃvattanikā. Missakabojjhaṅgāva kathitā pubbabhāgikānaṃ kathitattā.
analyzed: nibbāna atthāya na saṃvattanti iti anibbāna saṃvattanikā missaka bojjhaṅgā ava kathitā pubbabhāgikānam kathita ttā
translated: The mixed factors of enlightenment are called “factors of enlightenment” because they are included in the preliminary stage.

original: Nīvaraṇavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nīvaraṇa vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Hindrances chapter is finished.

original: 5. Cakkavattivaggo
analyzed: cakkavatti vaggaḥ
translated: The Wheel-Turning Monarch Chapter

original: 1. Vidhāsuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vidhā sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Analysis of Hindrances Discourse

original: 222. Vidhīyantīti vidhā, mānādibhāgā koṭṭhāsāti āha “tayo mānakoṭṭhāsā”ti. Tathā tathā vidahanatoti “seyyohamasmī”tiādinā tena tenākārena vidahanato ṭhapanato, ṭhapetabbato vā.
analyzed: vidhīyanti iti vidhā māna ādi bhāgā koṭṭhāsā ti āha tayo māna koṭṭhāsā ti tathā tathā vidahanāt ti seyya uham asmi iti ādinā tena tena ākārena vidahanataḥ ṭhapanataḥ ṭhapetabbataḥ vā
translated: The three kinds of conceit are the three parts of the section on conceit.  It is “because of burning up” in this way and that, that is, because of burning up in this way and that, that is, because of burning up in the various ways beginning with “I am better” and because of keeping burning or because of being kept burning.

original: 2. Cakkavattisuttavaṇṇanā🔽223. Sirisampattiyā rājati dippati sobhatīti rājā, dānapiyavacanaatthacariyāsamānattatāsaṅkhātehi
analyzed: cakkavatti sutta vaṇṇanā  siri sampattiyā rājati dippati sobhati iti rājā dāna piya vacana attha cariyā samānatta tā saṅkhātehi
translated: The explanation of the Wheel-turning Monarch Sutta🔽He shines, glows, and radiates with the glory of his success, thus he is a king ; he delights with the four kinds of sharing, that is to say, with gifts, with kindly words, with looking after welfare, and with equality of treatment ;🔽he is a delight because he delights.

original: catūhi saṅgahavatthūhi. Rañjetīti rameti. Abbhuggatāyāti udīritā nibbattito tattha
analyzed: catūhi saṅgaha vatthūhi rañjeti iti rameti abbhugga tāya ati udīritā nibbattito tattha
translated: He is born, is what is meant.🔽He sets the wheel going, thus he is a wheel-turner .🔽A shrine for the gods: a place of worship.

original: tattha gacchanato. Cakkaṃ vattetīti cakkaratanaṃ pavatteti. Devaṭṭhānanti pūjanīyadevaṭṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: tattha gacchanataḥ cakkam vatteti iti cakka ratanam pavatteti devaṭṭhānam ti pūjanīya devaṭṭhānam
translated: In the sense of being worshipped: in the sense of being an object of worship.

original: Cittīkataṭṭhenāti pūjanīyabhāvena. Aggho natthi cirakālasambhavapuññānubhāvasiddharatanasabbhāvato.
analyzed: cittīkata ṭṭhena ati pūjanīya bhāvena agghaḥ natthi cira kāla sambhava puñña anubhāva siddha ratana sabbhāvato
translated: It has no price because it is a jewel that has come about through the power of merit accumulated over a long period.🔽With other jewels that are the property of other wheel-turners.

original: Aññehi cakkavattino pariggahabhūtaratanehi. Loketi manussaloke. Tena tadaññalokaṃ
analyzed: aññehi cakkavattino pariggaha bhūta ratanehi loke ti manussa loke tena tad añña lokam
translated: In the world of men: in the world of human beings.

original: nivatteti. Vijjamānaggahaṇena atītānāgataṃ nivatteti. Buddhā ca kadāci karahaci uppajjanti
analyzed: nivatteti vijjamāna ggahaṇena atīta anāgatam nivatteti buddhā ca kadāci karahaci uppajjanti
translated: and he turns back the past and future by the word “existing.” The intention is that Buddhas appear from time to time,🔽and that Universal Monarchs appear almost always in the same world-sphere.

original: cakkavattinopi yebhuyyena tasmiṃyeva uppajjanatoti adhippāyo. Anomassāti alāmakassa
analyzed: cakkavattinaḥ pi yebhuyyena tasmin yeva uppajjanato ti adhippāyaḥ anomassa ati alāmakassa
translated: “Without disease” means without affliction,

original: ukkaṭṭhassa. Sesāni ratanāni.
analyzed: ukkaṭṭhassa sesāni ratanāni
translated: and “excellent” means outstanding. The other three treasures🔽are the Dhamma, the Sangha, and the Noble Ones’ virtue.🔽“There” is a demonstrative pronoun referring to the appearance of the treasures.

original: Tatrāti vākyopaññāsane nipāto, tasmiṃ pātubhāvavacane. “Ayutta”nti vatvā tattha adhippāyaṃ
analyzed: tatra ati vākya upaññā āsane nipāto tasmin pātubhāva vacane ayuttam ti vatvā tattha adhippāyam
translated: After saying “incompatible,” he explains the intention there, saying “when arisen.”

original: vivaranto “uppannaṃ hī”tiādimāha. Tehi ratanehi cakkavattananiyamāpekkhatāya cakkavattivacanassa.🔽Niyamenāti ekantena. Vattabbataṃ āpajjati bhāvini bhūte viya upacāroti yathā – “agamā
analyzed: vivarantaḥ uppannam hi iti ādim āha tehi ratanehi cakkavattana niyama apekkha tāya cakkavatti vacanassa  niyamena ati ekantena vattabba tam āpajjati bhāvini bhūte viya yathā
translated: The statement about the Universal Monarch is because of the expectation of the regularity of the Universal Monarch with those treasures.🔽“Regularly” means exclusively. It comes to be stated as if it were future, as in “The Buddha came to Rājagaha.”

original: rājagahaṃ buddho”ti. Laddhanāmassāti cakkavattīti loke laddhasamaññassa patthanīyassa
analyzed: rājagaham buddho ti laddha nāmassa ati cakkavattī iti loke laddha samaññassa patthanīyassa
translated: “The one who has obtained the name” is the outstanding person who has obtained the designation “Universal Monarch” in the world.

original: purisavisesassa. Mūluppattivacanatopīti “cakkavattissa pātubhāvā”ti etassa paṭhamuppattiyā
analyzed: purisa visesassa mūla uppatti vacanataḥ pi iti cakkavattissa pātubhāvā ti etassa paṭhama uppattiyā
translated: “Even by the statement of the original appearance” means that the original appearance of the statement “through the appearance of the Universal Monarch” is

original: vacanatopi. Idāni tamatthaṃ vivaranto “yo hī”tiādimāha. Yo hi cakkavattirājā, tassa
analyzed: vacanataḥ api idāni tam attham vivarantaḥ yaḥ hi iti ādim āha yaḥ hi cakkavatti rājā tassa
translated: And by the word: Now, in order to explain that meaning, he says “For whoever” , etc. For whoever is a Wheel-Turning Monarch,

original: uppattiyā cakkaratanassa uppajjanato cakkavattīti evaṃ nāmaṃ uppajjati. “Cakkaṃ vattessatī”ti
analyzed: uppattiyā cakka ratanassa uppajjanataḥ cakkavattī iti evam nāmam uppajjati cakkam vattessati iti
translated: his name “Wheel-Turner” arises in this way because of the arising of the Wheel Treasure in him for the purpose of his arising. “He will turn the wheel” ,

original: idaṃ pana niyāmaṃ anapekkhitvā tassa uppajjatīti ratanānuppattiṃ gahetvā vuttanayato
analyzed: idam pana niyāmam an apekkhitvā tassa uppajjati iti ratana anuppattim gahetvā vutta nayataḥ
translated: but this is said without regard to the rule, and it arises in him because of the arising of the treasures, and so the perception “Wheel-Turner” arises in the way stated.

original: saññā uppajjati “cakkavattī”ti. Ekamevāti cakkaratanameva paṭhamaṃ pātubhavati. Yasmiṃ🔽bhūte rañño cakkavattisamaññā, atha pacchā ratanāni pātubhavantīti bahūnaṃ pātubhāvaṃ
analyzed: saññā uppajjati cakkavattī iti ekam eva ati cakka ratanam eva paṭhamam pātubhavati yasmin  bhūte raññaḥ cakkavatti samaññā atha pacchā ratanāni pātubhavanti iti bahūnam pātubhāvam
translated: Only one: only the Wheel Treasure appears first. In the being

original: upādāya bahulavacanatopi etaṃ “cakkavattissa pātubhāvā ratanānaṃ pātubhāvo”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: upādāya bahula vacanataḥ pi etam cakkavattissa pātubhāvā ratanānam pātubhāvā ti vuttam
translated: in whom the name “Wheel-Turning Monarch” arises, then afterwards the treasures appear. So it is said “The appearance of the treasures is dependent on the appearance of the Wheel-Turner” because of the appearance of many.🔽This is the difference in meaning as the cause.

original: Ayaṃ hetukattusaññito atthabhedo. Pātubhāvāti pātubhāvato. Puññasambhāro bhinnasantānatāya
analyzed: ayam hetu kattu saññitaḥ attha bhedo pātubhāvā ati pātubhāvataḥ puñña sambhāraḥ bhinna santāna tāya
translated: From the appearance: from the appearance. The requisites of merit are a condition by way of decisive support for the treasures, since they are of the same continuity,

original: ratanānampi pariyāyena upanissayahetūti vuttaṃ. Yuttamevetaṃ yathāvuttayuttiyuttattā.
analyzed: ratanānam pi pariyāyena upanissaya hetu uti vuttam yuttam eva etam yathā vutta yutti yutta ttā
translated: so it is said “The appearance of the treasures is dependent on the appearance of the requisites of merit” . This is appropriate because it is appropriate as the explanation stated.

original: Vattabbabhūto adhippāyo etassa atthīti adhippāyo, atthaniddeso, saṅkhepato adhippāyo🔽saṅkhepādhippāyo. Cakkaratanānubhāvena cakkavattissariyassa sijjhanato “dātuṃ samatthassā”ti
analyzed: vattabba bhūtaḥ adhippāyaḥ etassa atthi iti adhippāyaḥ attha niddesaḥ saṅkhepataḥ adhippāyaḥ  saṅkhepa adhippāyaḥ cakka ratana anubhāvena cakkavatti ssariyassa sijjhanataḥ dātum samatthassa ati
translated: He has a purport to be stated, thus he is purportive; he is a describer of meanings, a summarizer of the meaning in brief,🔽thus he is purportive and brief. “To one who is able to give” is said because the Great Man’s success comes about through the influence of the Wheel Treasure.

original: vuttaṃ. Yojanappamāṇe padese pavattattā yojanappamāṇaṃ andhakāraṃ. Atidīghātirassatādiṃ
analyzed: vuttam yojana pamāṇe padese pavatta ttā yojana ppamāṇam andhakāram ati dīgha atirassa tā ādim
translated: The darkness is a yojana in extent because it extends over an area a yojana in extent.

original: chabbidhaṃ dosaṃ vivajjetvā ṭhitassāti vacanaseso.
analyzed: chabbidham dosam vivajjetvā ṭhitassa ati vacana sesaḥ
translated: The word “free” is to be construed with each of the six faults, namely, too long, too short, and so on.

original: Sabbesaṃ catubhūmakadhammānaṃ purecaraṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ gatiyo samanvesanavasena
analyzed: sabbesam catu bhūmaka dhammānam purecaram kusalānam dhammānam gatiyaḥ samanvesana vasena
translated: Because it occurs by way of seeking the destinies of profitable ideas which precede all ideas of the four planes.

original: pavattanato. Buddhādīhipi appahānīyatāya mahantadhammasabhāvattā dhammakāye ca jeṭṭhakaṭṭhena
analyzed: pavattanataḥ buddha ādīhi pi appahānīya tāya mahanta dhamma sabhāva ttā dhammakāye ca jeṭṭhakaṭṭhena
translated: Because it is the Great Being’s nature to be the great mass of ideas that is not to be abandoned even by Buddhas, etc.,

original: dhammakāyūpapannaṃ. Paññāpāsādatāya cassa uparigataṭṭhena accuggataṃ. Vitthataṭṭhena
analyzed: dhamma kāya upapannam paññā apāsāda tāya ca ssa uparigata ṭṭhena accuggatam vitthata ṭṭhena
translated: and because it is the foremost of the mass of ideas, it is called “risen in the world of ideas.” Because it is a palace of understanding, it is “elevated.” Because it is extensive,

original: vipulaṃ. Mahantatāya mahantaṃ. Anādikālabhāvitassa kilesasantānassa khaṇeneva viddhaṃsanato
analyzed: vipulam mahantatāya mahantam anādi kāla bhāvitassa kilesa santānassa khaṇena iva viddhaṃsanataḥ
translated: it is “vast.” Because it is great, it is “great.” Because it destroys in an instant the continuity of defilements that have been accumulating since beginningless time,🔽it is “unshakable.”

original: sīghaṃ lahu javanti pariyāyā. Bojjhaṅgadhammapariyāpannattā hi vuttaṃ “ekanta-kusalattā”ti.
analyzed: sīgham lahu javanti pariyāyāḥ bojjhaṅga dhamma pariyāpanna ttā hi vuttam ekanta kusala ttā ti
translated: and the terms are quick, swift, and fast. For it is said that they are exclusively profitable because they are included among the ideas of the enlightenment factors.

original: Sampayuttavasena pītiyā ālokaviddhaṃsanabhāvavasenāti vuttaṃ “sahajātapaccayādī”tiādi.
analyzed: sampayutta vasena pītiyāḥ āloka viddhaṃsana bhāva vasena ati vuttam sahajāta paccaya ādi itiādi
translated: And because of the association with happiness, and because of the dispelling of darkness by light, it is said that they are “due to the conascence condition, etc.”

original: Sabbasaṅgāhikadhammaparicchedoti catubhūmakattā sabbasaṅgāhako bojjhaṅgadhammaparicchedo kathito.
analyzed: sabba saṅgāhika dhamma paricchedo ti catu bhūmaka ttā sabba saṅgāhakaḥ bojjhaṅga dhamma paricchedo kathito
translated: The section on the ideas that embrace all is called “the section on the ideas of the enlightenment factors” because it embraces all four planes.

original: 4-10. Duppaññasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: duppañña sutta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Sutta on the Unwise (is finished).

original: 225-231. Eḷaṃ vuccati doso, eḷena mūgo viyāti eḷamūgoti imamatthaṃ dassento “mukhena vāca”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: eḷam vuccati dosaḥ eḷena mūgaḥ viyāti eḷa mūgaḥ iti imam attham dassentaḥ mukhena vācam ti ādim āha
translated: The word eḷa means hate. He is as if dumb with hate, thus he is eḷamūga. Showing this meaning, he said “speech in the mouth” and so on.

original: Cakkavattivaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: cakkavatti vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Wheel-turning Monarch chapter is finished.

original: 6. Sākacchavaggo
analyzed: sākacchavaggaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Discussion

original: 1. Āhārasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: āhāra sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Food Discourse

original: 232. Purimanayatoti “satisambojjhaṅgaṭṭhānīyānaṃ dhammāna”ntiādinā āgatanayato. Evanti
analyzed: purima nayāt ti sati sambojjhaṅga ṭhānīyānam dhamma ananti ādinā āgata nayāt evam ti
translated: In the way stated: in the way stated in the passage beginning, “Ideas that are the basis for the mindfulness enlightenment factor” . Thus:

original: idāni vuccamānākārena. Sati ca sampajaññañca satisampajaññaṃ. Satipadhānaṃ vā abhikkantādīsu
analyzed: idāni vuccamāna ākārena sati ca sampajaññam ca satisampajaññam sati padhānam vā abhikkanta ādīsu
translated: in the way now going to be stated. Mindfulness and full awareness are mindfulness and full awareness. Or mindfulness is the footing for the exertion of mindfulness .

original: satthakabhāvapariggaṇhakañāṇaṃ satisampajaññaṃ. Taṃ sabbattha satokārībhāvāvahattā
analyzed: satthaka bhāva pariggaṇhaka ñāṇam sati sampajaññam tam sabbattha satokārībhāva āvahattā
translated: Knowledge that discerns the state of being a weapon is mindfulness and full awareness.

original: satisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattati. Yathā ca paccanīkadhammappahānaṃ anurūpadhammadesanā
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya saṃvattati yathā ca paccanīka dhamma ppahānam anurūpa dhamma desanā
translated: That is conducive to the arising of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness because it causes mindfulness to be effective everywhere.

original: ca anuppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ uppādāya hoti, evaṃ satirahitapuggalavajjanā
analyzed: ca anuppannānam kusalānam dhammānam uppādāya hoti evam sati rahita puggala vajjanā
translated: And just as the abandoning of opposing states and the teaching of the appropriate states are conducive to the arising of unarisen profitable states,

original: satokārīpuggalasevanā ca tattha ca yuttapayuttatā satisambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya hotīti
analyzed: ca tattha ca yutta payutta tā sati sambojjhaṅgassa uppādāya hoti iti
translated: so too the avoidance of people devoid of mindfulness and the cultivation of people who are mindful and the association with them and the companionship of them are conducive to the arising of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness.🔽He shows this meaning by “mindfulness and full awareness” and so on.

original: imamatthaṃ dasseti “satisampajañña”ntiādinā. Arahattamaggena bhāvanāpāripūrī hoti.
analyzed: imam attham dasseti sati sampajañña nti ādinā arahatta maggena bhāvanā pāripūrī hoti
translated: And the fulfilment of development is by means of the Arahant path.

original: Tathā hi arahāva “sativepullappatto”ti vuccati.
analyzed: tathā hi sati vepulla ppatto ti vuccati
translated: For only an Arahant is called “one who has reached the height of mindfulness” .

original: Dhammānaṃ, dhammesu vā vicayo, so eva heṭṭhā vuttanayena sambojjhaṅgo, tassa dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa.
analyzed: dhammānam dhammesu vā vicayo so eva heṭṭhā vutta nayena sambojjhaṅgo tassa dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgassa
translated: Discernment of states, or the states discerned, is the enlightenment factor of discrimination of states.

original: Paripucchakatāti ācariyaṃ payirupāsitvā pañcapi nikāye sahaṭṭhakathāya pariyogāhetvā
analyzed: paripucchaka tā ati ācariyam payis upāsitvā pañca api nikāye saha aṭṭha kathāya pariyogāhetvā
translated: The questioner is one who, after attending on a teacher, has mastered the five Nikāyas together with the commentaries.

original: yaṃ yaṃ tattha gaṇṭhiṭṭhānaṃ, tassa tassa “idaṃ, bhante, kathaṃ imassa ko attho”ti
analyzed: yam yam tattha gaṇṭhi ṭṭhānam tassa tassa idam bhante katham imassa kaḥ attho ti
translated: Whatever is a knotty point there, he asks the meaning of that, saying, “Why is this, venerable sir? What is the meaning of this? “

original: evaṃ khandhādīsu atthapucchakabhāvo. Tenāha “khandha…pe… bahulatā”ti.
analyzed: evam khandha ādīsu attha pucchaka bhāvaḥ tena āha khandhape bahula tā ati
translated: This is how he asks the meaning in the case of the aggregates, etc. Hence it was said above “in the case of the aggregates, etc., it is the state of being a mass, etc., that is meant” .

original: Vatthuvisadakiriyāti cittacetasikānaṃ pavattiṭṭhānabhāvato sarīraṃ tappaṭibaddhāni
analyzed: vatthu visada kiriyā ti citta cetasikānam pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvato sarīram tad paṭibaddhāni
translated: The state of being a basis for the purification of the object: the body is intended here by “object” since it is the basis for the occurrence of consciousness and its concomitants.

original: ca cīvarādīni idha “vatthūnī”ti adhippetāni, tāni yathā cittassa sukhāvahāni honti,
analyzed: ca cīvara ādīni idha vatthūni iti adhippetāni tāni yathā cittassa sukha āvahāni honti
translated: And the requisites such as the robe, etc., that are bound up with it are also intended by “object.” The purification of those is the making them favourable to the mind’s happiness.🔽That is why it was said above “in the case of the internal and external bases, it is the state of being a basis for the purification of the object that is meant” .

original: tathā karaṇaṃ tesaṃ visadabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Tena vuttaṃ “ajjhattikabāhirāna”ntiādi. Ussannadosanti
analyzed: tathā karaṇam tesam visada bhāva karaṇam tena vuttam ajjhattika bāhira ananti ādi ussanna dosa nti
translated: The state of being a basis for the removal of the cankers: the body is intended here by “object” since it is the basis for the occurrence of consciousness and its concomitants.

original: vātādiussannadosaṃ. Sedamalamakkhitanti sedena ceva jallikāsaṅkhātena sarīramalena
analyzed: vāta ādi ussanna dosam seda malam akkhitanti sedena ca iva jallikā saṅkhātena sarīra malena
translated: And the requisites such as the robe, etc., that are bound up with it are also intended by “object.” The removal of the cankers is the removal of the imperfections of wind, etc., and the removal of the impurities of sweat, etc., that soil the body.

original: ca makkhitaṃ. Ca-saddena aññampi sarīrassa ca cittassa ca pīḷāvahaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Senāsanaṃ
analyzed: ca makkhitam ca saddena aññam pi sarīrassa ca cittassa ca pīḷā vaham saṅgaṇhāti senāsanam
translated: By the word “and” the other kinds of affliction to body and mind are included.🔽The state of being a basis for the removal of the cankers is the making of the body and the requisites favourable to the removal of the cankers.

original: vāti vā-saddena pattādīnaṃ saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Avisade sati, visayabhūte vā. Kathaṃ
analyzed: vā ti vā saddena patta ādīnam saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbo avisade sati visaya bhūte vā katham
translated: That is why it was said above “in the case of the internal and external bases, it is the state of being a basis for the removal of the cankers that is meant” .🔽The state of being a basis for the removal of defilements: the body is intended here by “object” since it is the basis for the occurrence of consciousness and its concomitants.🔽And the requisites such as the robe, etc., that are bound up with it are also intended by “object.” The removal of defilements is the removal of the imperfections of wind, etc., and the removal of the impurities of sweat, etc., that soil the body.🔽By the word “and” the other kinds of affliction to body and mind are included. The state of being a basis for the removal

original: bhāvanamanuyuttassa tāni visayoti? Antarantarā pavattanakacittuppādavasena evaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvanam anuyuttassa tāni antar antarā pavattanaka cittuppāda vasena evam vuttam
translated: Are they the domain of one devoted to development? —This is said with reference to the occurrence of the impulsions of consciousness.🔽For although these impulsions succeed through unification of mind, they lead to the failure of purification.

original: Te hi cittuppādā cittekaggatāya ijjhantiyāpi aparisuddhabhāvāya saṃvattanti. Cittacetasikesu
analyzed: te hi citta uppādāḥ citta ekagga tāya ijjhantiyā api a parisuddha bhāvāya saṃvattanti citta cetasikesu
translated: In the case of the mental factors,🔽the word “also” in the words “and also knowledge” includes the support, etc., which are conditions.

original: nissayādipaccayabhūtesu. Ñāṇampīti pi-saddo sampiṇḍane. Tena na kevalaṃ taṃ vatthuyeva,🔽atha kho tasmiṃ aparisuddhe ñāṇampi aparisuddhaṃ hotīti nissayāparisuddhiyā nissitāparisuddhi
analyzed: nissaya ādi paccaya bhūtesu ñāṇam pi iti pi saddaḥ sampiṇḍane tena na kevalam tam vatthuyā iva  atha kho tasmin aparisuddhe ñāṇam pi aparisuddham hoti iti nissaya aparisuddhiyā nissita aparisuddhi
translated: For it is not only the object that is purified,

original: viya visayassa aparisuddhatāya visayīnaṃ aparisuddhiṃ dasseti anvayato byatirekato ca.
analyzed: viya visayassa aparisuddha tāya visayīnam aparisuddhim dasseti anvayataḥ byatirekato ca
translated: but also the knowledge is purified. So he shows that the failure of purification of the object leads to the failure of purification of the knower, and the success of purification of the object to the success of purification of the knower, by the method of agreement and difference.

original: Samabhāvakaraṇaṃ kiccato anūnādhikabhāvakaraṇaṃ. Yathāpaccayaṃ saddheyyavatthusmiṃ
analyzed: sama bhāva karaṇam kiccataḥ anūna adhika bhāva karaṇam yathāpaccayam saddheyya vatthusmim
translated: The making even is the making of the function neither deficient nor excessive.🔽In the case of the object that is to be believed,

original: adhimokkhakiccassa paṭutarabhāvena paññāya avisadatāya vīriyādīnañca anubalappadānasithilatādinā
analyzed: adhimokkha kiccassa paṭutara bhāvena paññāya avisada tāya vīriya ādīnam ca anubala ppadāna sithila tā ādinā
translated: the function of resolve is more prominent, and understanding is not clear, and energy, etc., are slow in giving support, etc.,

original: saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ hoti. Tenāha “itarāni mandānī”ti. Tatoti tasmā saddhindriyassa🔽balavabhāvato itaresañca mandattā. Kosajjapakkhe patituṃ adatvā sampayuttadhammānaṃ
analyzed: saddhi indriyam balavam ha iti tena āha itarāni mandāni iti tasmā saddhi indriyassa  balava bhāvataḥ itaresam ca manda ttā kosajja pakkhe patitum a datvā sampayutta dhammānam
translated: “From that”: because the faith faculty is strong and the others are weak.

original: paggaṇhanaṃ anubalappadānaṃ paggaho, paggahakiccaṃ kātuṃ na sakkotīti sambandhitabbaṃ.
analyzed: paggaṇhanam anubala ppadānam paggahaḥ paggaha kiccam kātum na sakkoti iti sambandhitabbam
translated: “It cannot do the act of holding up”: it cannot give support to the associated states by not falling into the side of indolence.🔽“The state of standing by the object”: the state of standing by not letting go of the object.

original: Ārammaṇaṃ upagantvā ṭhānaṃ, anissajjanaṃ vā upaṭṭhānaṃ, vikkhepapaṭipakkho. Yena🔽vā sampayuttā avikkhittā honti, so avikkhepo. Rūpagataṃ viya cakkhunā yena yāthāvato
analyzed: ārammaṇam upagantvā ṭhānam a nissajjanam vā upaṭṭhānam vikkhepa paṭipakkhaḥ yena  vā sampayuttāḥ a vikkhittāḥ honti saḥ avikkhepaḥ rūpa gatam viya cakkhunā yena yāthāvato
translated: “The opposite of distraction”: that by which the associated states are undistracted.

original: visayasabhāvaṃ passati, taṃ dassanakiccaṃ kātuṃ na sakkoti balavatā saddhindriyena🔽abhibhūtattā. Sahajātadhammesu hi indaṭṭhaṃ karontānaṃ saha pavattamānānaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: visaya sabhāvam passati tam dassana kiccam kātum na sakkoti balavatā saddhindriyena  abhibhūta ttā sahajāta dhammesu hi indaṭṭham karontānam saha pavattamānānam dhammānam
translated: “It cannot do the act of seeing”: it cannot do the act of seeing the nature of the object as it really is, as though with the eye seeing a visible object, because it is overcome by the strong faith faculty.🔽For when faculties are exercising their controlling power over associated states occurring together with them, their effectiveness is accomplished only by the single act of their mere presence, not in any other way.

original: ekarasatāvaseneva atthasiddhi, na aññathā. Tasmāti vuttamevatthaṃ kāraṇabhāvena paccāmasati.
analyzed: ekarasa tā vasena iva na aññathā tasmā iti vuttam evattham kāraṇa bhāvena
translated: “Therefore” is a reason for what has just been said.

original: Tanti saddhindriyaṃ.🔽Dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇenāti yassa saddheyyavatthuno uḷāratādiguṇe adhimuccanassa
analyzed: tanti sat hi indriyam  dhamma sabhāva paccavekkhaṇena ati yassa saddheyya vatthunaḥ uḷāra tā ādi guṇe adhimuccanassa
translated: The faith faculty is the faith power.🔽By reviewing the specific nature of ideas: when the faith faculty has become strong in one who has resolved upon the noble qualities of the object of faith,

original: sātisayappavattiyā saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ jātaṃ, tassa paccayapaccayuppannatādivibhāgato🔽yāthāvato vīmaṃsanena. Evañhi evaṃdhammatānayena sabhāvasarasato pariggayhamāne savipphāro
analyzed: sa atisaya pavattiyā saddhi indriyam balavam jātam tassa paccaya paccaya uppanna tā ādi vibhāgato  yāthāvataḥ vīmaṃsanena evam hi evaṃdhammatā nayena sabhāva sarasataḥ pariggayhamāne sa vipphāro
translated: then by reviewing as it actually is the specific nature of the ideas that are the cause and the result of that faith,

original: adhimokkho na hoti – “ayaṃ imesaṃ dhammānaṃ sabhāvo”ti paññābyāpārassa sātisayattā.
analyzed: adhimokkhaḥ na hoti ayam imesam dhammānam sabhāvaḥ ti paññā byāpārassa sa atisaya ttā
translated: for then, when the specific nature is being apprehended by the method of the way things are, the resolution is not over-ready with the thought “This is the specific nature of these ideas,” because the function of understanding is strong.

original: Dhuriyadhammesu hi yathā saddhāya balavabhāve paññāya mandabhāvo hoti, evaṃ paññāya🔽balavabhāve saddhāya mandabhāvo hoti. Tena vuttaṃ – “taṃ dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇena…pe…
analyzed: dhuriya dhammesu hi yathā saddhāya balava bhāve paññāya manda bhāvaḥ hoti evam paññāya  balava bhāve saddhāya manda bhāvaḥ hoti tena vuttam tam dhamma sabhāva paccavekkhaṇena pe
translated: For just as when there is strength in faith there is weakness in understanding, so when there is strength in understanding there is weakness in faith.🔽That is why it was said above: “By reviewing the specific nature of ideas …

original: hāpetabba”nti. Tathā amanasikaraṇenāti yenākārena bhāvanamanuyuñjantassa saddhindriyaṃ
analyzed: hāpetabbanti tathā a manasikaraṇena ati yena ākārena bhāvanam anuyuñjantassa saddhindriyam
translated: … should be abandoned.” By not giving attention to them in that aspect: when one is devoted to developing the faith faculty in that aspect, then the faith faculty becomes strong and the understanding faculty becomes weak.

original: balavaṃ jātaṃ, tenākārena bhāvanaṃ nānuyuñjanenāti vuttaṃ hoti. Idha duvidhena saddhindriyassa
analyzed: balavam jātam tena ākārena bhāvanam na anuyuñjanena ati vuttam hoti idha duvidhena saddhindriyassa
translated: Herein, the strength of the faculty of faith is twofold:

original: balavabhāvo attano vā paccayavisesena kiccuttariyato vīriyādīnaṃ vā mandakiccatāya.🔽Tattha paṭhamavikappe hāpanavidhi dassito, dutiyavikappe pana yathā manasikaroto
analyzed: balava bhāvaḥ attanaḥ vā paccaya visesena kiccuttariyataḥ vīriya ādīnam vā manda kiccatāya  tattha paṭhama vikappe hāpana vidhi dassitaḥ dutiya vikappe pana yathā
translated: through the predominance of its function by means of a special condition of its own, and through the weakness of the functions of energy, etc.,

original: vīriyādīnaṃ mandakiccatāya saddhindriyaṃ balavaṃ jātaṃ, tathā amanasikārena vīriyādīnaṃ
analyzed: vīriya ādīnam manda kiccatāya saddhindriyam balavam jātam tathā amanasikārena vīriya ādīnam
translated: In the first case the method of reducing is shown. But in the second case, when he is giving attention in such a way that the faculty of faith becomes strong through the weakness of the functions of energy, etc.,

original: paṭutarabhāvāvahena manasikārena saddhindriyaṃ tehi samataṃ karontena hāpetabbaṃ.
analyzed: paṭutara bhāva āvahena manasikārena saddhi indriyam tehi samatam karontena ha apetabbam
translated: then he should reduce the faculty of faith by giving attention in such a way that the functions of energy, etc., are intensified.

original: Iminā nayena sesindriyesupi hāpanavidhi veditabbo.
analyzed: iminā nayena veditabbo
translated: The method of reducing should be understood in the same way with the other faculties.🔽The story of the Elder Vakkali is given in the Majjhima Commentary on the Vakkali Sutta .

original: Vakkalittheravatthūti so hi āyasmā saddhādhimutto tattha ca katādhikāro satthu rūpakāyadassane
analyzed: so hi saddhā adhimuttaḥ tattha ca kata adhikāro satthu rūpa kāya dassane
translated: For that venerable one, who was devoted to faith and had done his duties under the Blessed One, was devoted to seeing the Blessed One’s material body.

original: pasuto eva hutvā viharanto satthārā – “kiṃ te, vakkali, iminā pūtikāyena diṭṭhena,
analyzed: pasutaḥ eva hutvā viharantaḥ satthārā kim te iminā pūti kāyena diṭṭhena
translated: While he was living devoted to that, the Blessed One said to him, “What is the use of seeing this foul body, Vakkali?

original: yo kho, vakkali, dhammaṃ passati, so maṃ passatī”tiādinā ovadiyamāno kammaṭṭhāne🔽niyojitopi taṃ ananuyuñjanto paṇāmito attānaṃ vinipātetuṃ papātaṭṭhānaṃ abhiruhi.
analyzed: yaḥ kho vakkali dhammam passati saḥ mama passati itiādinā ovadiyamānaḥ kammaṭṭhāne  niyojitaḥ api tam an anuyuñjantaḥ paṇāmitaḥ attānam vinipātetum papāta ṭṭhānam abhiruhi
translated: When the Teacher had thus instructed him, he further advised him, saying, “Vakkali, he who sees the Law sees me.” But although the Teacher thus instructed him, he did not apply himself to the subject of meditation which the Teacher had given him.🔽Therefore the Teacher dismissed him, saying, “Go.” Thereupon Vakkali went to the place where he had intended to kill himself and sat down.

original: Atha naṃ satthā yathānisinnova obhāsavissajjanena attānaṃ dassetvā –
analyzed: atha nam satthā yathā nisinnaḥ uva obhāsa vissajjanena attānam dassetvā
translated: But the Teacher, even as he sat in the Perfumed Chamber, revealed himself to Vakkali and preached the Law.

original: “Pāmojjabahulo bhikkhu, pasanno buddhasāsane;
analyzed: pāmojja bahulaḥ pasannaḥ buddha sāsane
translated: “The monk who is filled with joy, who has faith in the Buddha’s word,

original: Adhigacche padaṃ santaṃ, saṅkhārūpasamaṃ sukha”nti. –
analyzed: adhigacche padam santam saṅkhā rūpa samam
translated: Will attain the state of peace, the bliss of the stilling of all the In-and-out breathings.”

original: Gāthaṃ vatvā “ehi, vakkalī”ti āha. So tena vacanena amateneva abhisitto haṭṭhatuṭṭho
analyzed: gātham vatvā ehi vakkali iti āha saḥ tena vacanena amatena iva abhisittaḥ haṭṭha tuṭṭhaḥ
translated: And when he had thus spoken, he said to Vakkali, “Come.” Thereupon Vakkali, as if sprinkled with nectar, became filled with joy and happiness.

original: hutvā vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapesi, saddhāya bahulabhāvato vipassanāvīthiṃ nārohati. Taṃ🔽ñatvā bhagavā indriyasamattapaṭipādanāya kammaṭṭhānaṃ sodhetvā adāsi. So satthārā
analyzed: hutvā vipassanam paṭṭhapesi saddhāya bahula bhāvataḥ vipassanā vīthim na ārohati tam  ñatvā bhagavā indriya samatta paṭipādanāya kammaṭṭhānam sodhetvā adāsi so satthārā
translated: But because he had so much faith, he was unable to enter upon the Path.🔽Therefore the Teacher, in order to develop his faculties, purified the subject of meditation which he had given him and restored it to him.

original: dinnanayena vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā maggapaṭipāṭiyā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ
analyzed: dinna nayena vipassanam ussukkāpetvā magga paṭipāṭiyā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam
translated: By means of the method restored to him by the Teacher, Vakkali developed insight, passed through the four stages of fruition in due order, and attained Arahatship.🔽This is the story.

original: – “vakkalittheravatthu cettha nidassana”nti. Etthāti saddhindriyassa adhimattabhāve
analyzed: ca ittha ettha ati saddhi indriyassa adhimatta bhāve
translated: “The example here is the story of the Elder Vakkali.” Herein,

original: sesindriyānaṃ sakiccākaraṇe.
analyzed: sa is indriyānam sa k it ca a karaṇe
translated: when the faith faculty is excessive, the other faculties do not perform their several functions.🔽The other kinds of work: the special kinds of work consisting in nursing, etc.

original: Itarakiccabhedanti upaṭṭhānādikiccavisesaṃ. Passaddhādīti ādi-saddena samādhiupekkhāsambojjhaṅgānaṃ
analyzed: itara kicca bhedam ti upaṭṭhāna ādi kicca visesam passaddha ādi iti ādi saddena samādhi upekkhā sambojjhaṅgānam
translated: The words “purity, etc.” should be understood to include concentration and equanimity enlightenment factors.

original: saṅgaho daṭṭhabbo. Hāpetabbanti yathā saddhindriyassa balavabhāvo dhammasabhāvapaccavekkhaṇena🔽hāyati, evaṃ vīriyindriyassa adhimattatā passaddhiyādibhāvanāya hāyati samādhipakkhikattā🔽tassā. Tathā hi samādhindriyassa adhimattataṃ kosajjapātato rakkhantī vīriyādibhāvanā
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ hāpetabbanti yathā saddhi indriyassa balava bhāvaḥ dhamma sabhāva paccavekkhaṇena  hāyati evam vīriya indriyassa adhimatta tā passaddhiya ādi bhāvanāya hāyati samādhi pakkhika ttā  tassā tathā hi samādhi indriyassa adhimatta tam kosajja pātataḥ rakkhantī vīriya ādi bhāvanā
translated: It should be abandoned: just as the strength of the faith faculty is abandoned by reviewing the specific nature of things,🔽so the excess of the energy faculty is abandoned by the development of serenity, etc., because the latter are on the side of concentration.

original: viya vīriyindriyassa adhimattataṃ uddhaccapātato rakkhantī ekaṃsato hāpeti. Tena
analyzed: viya vīriya indriyassa adhimatta tam uddhacca pātataḥ rakkhantī ekaṃsataḥ hāpeti tena
translated: For just as the development of serenity, etc., protects the excess of the concentration faculty from falling into the sloth-and-torpor and agitation extremes, so the development of serenity, etc., protects the excess of the energy faculty from falling into the sloth-and-torpor and agitation extremes, and thus it abandons it outright.🔽Therefore it is said that it should be abandoned by the development of serenity, etc.

original: vuttaṃ “passaddhādibhāvanāya hāpetabba”nti. Soṇattherassa vatthūti sukumārasoṇattherassa
analyzed: vuttam passaddha ādi bhāvanāya hāpetabbanti soṇa therassa vatthu iti sukumārasoṇa ttherassa
translated: The story of the Elder Soṇa: the story of the delicate Elder Soṇa.

original: vatthu. So hi āyasmāpi satthu santikā kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā sītavane viharanto – “mama
analyzed: vatthu saḥ hi āyasmā api satthu santikā kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā sītavane viharantaḥ mama
translated: The story of the venerable one is as follows. He took a meditation subject from the Master and went to live in the Cool Grove (Sītavana).

original: sarīraṃ sukhumālaṃ, na ca sakkā sukheneva sukhaṃ adhigantuṃ, kāyaṃ kilametvāpi samaṇadhammo
analyzed: sarīram na ca sakkā sukhena iva sukham adhigantum kāyam kilametvā api samaṇa dhammaḥ
translated: For this venerable one, after receiving a meditation subject from the Teacher, was living in the Cool Grove. He thought: “My body is delicate. It is not possible to attain bliss by bliss. The recluse’s life

original: kātabbo”ti ṭhānacaṅkamanameva adhiṭṭhāya padhānamanuyuñjanto pādatalesu phoṭesu uṭṭhitesupi🔽vedanaṃ ajjhupekkhitvā daḷhavīriyaṃ karonto accāraddhavīriyatāya visesaṃ pavattetuṃ
analyzed: kātabbo ti ṭhāna caṅkamanam eva adhiṭṭhāya padhānam anuyuñjantaḥ pāda talesu phoṭesu uṭṭhitesu pi  vedanam ajjhupekkhitvā daḷha vīriyam karontaḥ accāraddha vīriya tāya visesam pavattetum
translated: must be lived by making the body tired. ” So he resolved to stand and walk up and down, and he applied himself to the struggle. When the blisters rose on his feet,

original: nāsakkhi. Satthā tattha gantvā vīṇopamovādena ovaditvā vīriyasamatāyojanavidhiṃ dassento
analyzed: na asakkhi satthā tattha gantvā vīṇā upama uvādena ovaditvā vīriya sama tā yojana vidhim dassentaḥ
translated: he looked on at the feeling with equanimity and exerted himself with strong energy. But because his energy was too great, he was unable to develop any distinction. The Teacher went there and advised him with the simile of the lute. Showing him the method of directing the mind to the middle by balancing energy,

original: kammaṭṭhānaṃ sodhetvā gijjhakūṭaṃ gato. Theropi satthārā dinnanayena vīriyasamataṃ🔽yājetvā bhāvento vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā arahatteva patiṭṭhāsi. Tena vuttaṃ “soṇattherassa
analyzed: kammaṭṭhānam sodhetvā gijjhakūṭam gataḥ theraḥ api satthārā dinna nayena vīriya samatam  yājetvā bhāventaḥ vipassanam ussukkāpetvā arahattā iva patiṭṭhāsi tena vuttam soṇa ttherassa
translated: he purified his meditation subject and went to the Vultures’ Peak. The elder, too, by balancing his energy in the way shown by the Teacher,

original: vatthu dassetabba”nti. Sesesupīti satisamādhipaññindriyesupi.
analyzed: vatthu dassetabbanti sesesu pi iti sati samādhi paññindriyesu pi
translated: and by developing insight, reached Arahantship. Therefore it was said above: “The story of the Elder Soṇa should be told.” In the rest: in the faculties of mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: Samatanti saddhāpaññānaṃ aññamaññaṃ anūnādhikabhāvaṃ, tathā samādhivīriyānañca. Yathā
analyzed: samatanti saddhā paññānam aññamaññam anūna adhika bhāvam tathā samādhi vīriyānam ca yathā
translated: Balance is the absence of excess or deficiency in faith and understanding, and likewise in concentration and energy.

original: hi saddhāpaññānaṃ visuṃ visuṃ dhuriyadhammabhūtānaṃ kiccato aññamaññanātivattanaṃ🔽visesato icchitabbaṃ. Yato tesaṃ samadhuratāya appanā sampajjati, evaṃ samādhivīriyānaṃ🔽kosajjuddhaccapakkhikānaṃ samatāya sati aññamaññupatthambhanato sampayuttadhammānaṃ
analyzed: hi saddhā paññānam visum visum dhuriya dhamma bhūtānam kiccataḥ aññamaññana ativattanam  visesataḥ icchitabbam yatas tesam samadhura tāya appanā sampajjati evam samādhi vīriyānam  kosajja uddhacca pakkhikānam samatāya sati aññamañña upatthambhanato sampayutta dhammānam
translated: For just as faith and understanding, which are respectively the dhamma of the plough and the ploughshare, should be desired in a state of balance, not in a state of mutual obstruction,🔽so too concentration and energy, which are respectively on the side of slackness and on the side of restless- ness,🔽should be balanced, since when they are they support each other and so the associated states are rightly balanced and absorption succeeds.

original: antadvayapātābhāvena sammadeva appanā ijjhatīti. Balavasaddhotiādi vuttasseva atthassa
analyzed: anta dvaya pāta abhāvena sammad eva appanā ijjhati iti balava saddhaḥ ti ādi vuttassa iva atthassa
translated: The words “One of strong faith” and so on are a further explanation of the same meaning.

original: byatirekamukhena samatthanaṃ. Tassattho – yo balavatiyā saddhāya samannāgato avisadañāṇo,
analyzed: byatireka mukhena samatthanam tassa atthaḥ yaḥ balavatiyā saddhāya samannāgataḥ a visada ñāṇo
translated: Its meaning is this. One who possesses strong faith but whose understanding is sluggish

original: so mudhappasanno hoti, na aveccappasanno. Tathā hi so avatthusmiṃ pasīdati, seyyathāpi
analyzed: saḥ mudhappasannaḥ hoti na avecca ppasanno tathā hi saḥ avatthusmim pasīdati seyyathā api
translated: is inclined to be over-confident, not to be well-confident. For he has confidence in what is not a ground for confidence,🔽like the disciples of the sectarians. He is inclined to be deceitful.

original: titthiyasāvakā. Kerāṭikapakkhanti sāṭheyyapakkhaṃ bhajati. Saddhāhīnāya paññāya atidhāvanto
analyzed: titthiya sāvakā kerāṭika pakkhanti sāṭheyya pakkham bhajati saddhā hīnāya paññāya atidhāvantaḥ
translated: With deficient faith and sluggish understanding he overshoots the mark,

original: “deyyavatthupariccāgena vinā cittuppādamattenapi dānamayaṃ puññaṃ hotī”tiādīni parikappeti🔽hetupatirūpakehi vañcito, evaṃbhūto ca lūkhatakkaviluttacitto paṇḍitānaṃ vacanaṃ
analyzed: deyya vatthu pariccāgena vinā cittuppāda mattena api dāna mayam puññam hoti itiādīni parikappeti  hetu patirūpakehi vañcitaḥ evaṃbhūtaḥ ca lūkha takka vilutta cittaḥ paṇḍitānam vacanam
translated: “Merit consisting in giving comes about even without the giving away of an object, just by the mere occurrence of the consciousness that gives” .

original: nādiyati, saññattiṃ na gacchati. Tenāha “bhesajjasamuṭṭhito viya rogo atekiccho hotī”ti.
analyzed: na ādiyati saññattim na gacchati tena āha bhesajja samuṭṭhitaḥ viya rogaḥ atekicchaḥ hoti iti
translated: He is deceived by the semblance of a cause, and with his mind perverted by the crookedness of his greed he does not accept the advice of the wise, he does not go by the advice of the wise. Therefore it is said that “like a disease curable with difficulty, he is curable with difficulty.”

original: Yathā cettha saddhāpaññānaṃ aññamaññaṃ samabhāvo atthāvaho, visamabhāvo anatthāvaho,
analyzed: yathā ca ittha saddhā paññānam aññamaññam sama bhāvaḥ attha āvahaḥ visama bhāvaḥ anattha āvahaḥ
translated: And just as the presence or absence of equality between faith and understanding is respectively the cause for the presence or absence of welfare,

original: evaṃ samādhivīriyānaṃ aññamaññaṃ samabhāvo atthāvaho, itaro anatthāvaho, tathā samabhāvo
analyzed: evam samādhi vīriyānam aññam aññam sama bhāvaḥ attha āvahaḥ itaraḥ anattha āvahaḥ tathā sama bhāvaḥ
translated: so too the presence or absence of equality between concentration and energy is the cause for the presence or absence of welfare. The absence of equality is the cause for the presence of unwelfare. The presence of equality is the cause for the presence of welfare.

original: avikkhepāvaho, itaro vikkhepāvaho. Kosajjaṃ abhibhavati, tena appanaṃ na pāpuṇātīti
analyzed: a vikkhepa āvahaḥ itaraḥ vikkhepa āvahaḥ kosajjam abhibhavati tena appanam na pāpuṇāti iti
translated: Laziness overcomes him, and he does not reach absorption.🔽This is the intention. So too with “agitation overcomes him.”

original: adhippāyo. Esa nayo uddhaccaṃ abhibhavatīti etthāpi. Tadubhayanti saddhāpaññādvayaṃ
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ esa nayaḥ uddhaccam abhibhavati iti ettha api tat ubhayanti saddhā paññā dvayam
translated: The two: the pair, faith and understanding,

original: samādhivīriyadvayañca. Samaṃ kātabbanti samataṃ kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: samādhi vīriya dvayam ca samam kātabbanti samatam kātabbam
translated: and the pair, concentration and energy. Should be made equal: should be made even.

original: Samādhikammikassāti samathakammaṭṭhānikassa. Evanti evaṃ sante, saddhāya thokaṃ balavabhāve🔽satīti attho. Saddahantoti “pathavī pathavīti manasikāramattena kathaṃ jhānuppattī”ti🔽acintetvā “addhā sambuddhena vuttavidhi ijjhatī”ti saddahanto saddhaṃ janento. Okappentoti
analyzed: samādhi kammikassa ati samatha kammaṭṭhānikassa evam ti evam sante saddhāya thokam balava bhāve  satī iti attho saddahanto ti pathavī pathavī iti manasikāra mattena katham jhāna uppatti iti  a cintetvā addhā sambuddhena vutta vidhi ijjhati iti saddahantaḥ saddham janentaḥ okappentaḥ iti
translated: “One whose meditation subject is concentration”: one whose meditation subject is serenity. “In that case”: if that is so, then faith is strong.

original: ārammaṇaṃ anupavisitvā viya adhimuccanavasena avakappento pakkhandanto. Ekaggatā🔽balavatī vaṭṭati samādhipadhānattā jhānassa. Ubhinnanti samādhipaññānaṃ. Samādhikammikassa
analyzed: ārammaṇam an upavisitvā viya adhimuccana vasena avakappentaḥ pakkhandantaḥ ekagga tā  balavatī vaṭṭati samādhi padhāna ttā jhānassa samādhi paññānam samādhi kammikassa
translated: The meaning is: mindfulness is strong. “Confident”: without thinking, “How can there be attainment of jhāna by mere attention with ‘earth, earth,’” he is confident, he has faith, thinking, “Surely the method stated by the Fully Enlightened One succeeds.” “Enters into”: he enters by way of resolution, as if penetrating the object.🔽Concentration is strong, because jhāna is a condition for concentration. “Both”: concentration and understanding.

original: samādhino adhimattatāya paññāya adhimattatāpi icchitabbāti āha “samatāyapī”ti, samabhāvenāpīti
analyzed: samādhinaḥ adhimatta tāya paññāya adhimatta tā api icchitabbā ati āha samatāya api iti sama bhāvena api iti
translated: Since concentration is strong in one whose meditation subject is concentration, strength in understanding is also required. That is why he says “and also in equanimity,” the meaning is: by means of balance.

original: attho. Appanāti lokiyaappanā. Tathā hi “hotiyevā”ti sāsaṅkaṃ vadati, lokuttarappanā
analyzed: atthaḥ appanā ti lokiya appanā tathā hi hotiyā iva ati sa āsaṅkam vadati lokuttara ppanā
translated: “Absorption”: mundane absorption. For he speaks with doubt, saying, “There is.” Supramundane absorption is not intended here.

original: pana tesaṃ samabhāveneva icchitā. Yathāha “samathavipassanaṃ yuganaddhaṃ bhāvetī”ti.
analyzed: pana tesam sama bhāvena iva icchitā yathā āha samatha vipassanam yuga naddham bhāveti iti
translated: but they are intended as equal. As it is said: “He develops serenity and insight yoked evenly” .

original: Yadi visesato saddhāpaññānaṃ samādhivīriyānañca samānataṃ icchati, kathaṃ satīti🔽āha – “sati pana sabbattha balavatī vaṭṭatī”ti. Sabbatthāti līnuddhaccapakkhikesu
analyzed: yadi visesataḥ saddhā paññānam samādhi vīriyānam ca samānataṃ icchati katham sati iti  āha sati pana sabbattha balavatī vaṭṭati iti sabbattha ati līn uddhacca pakkhikesu
translated: If he intends the equality of faith and understanding and of concentration and energy, how does he intend mindfulness?🔽He intends mindfulness to be strong in all cases.🔽In all cases means in the five faculties beginning with concentration which are on the side of slackness and restlessness.

original: pañcindriyesu. Uddhaccapakkhikekadese gaṇhanto “saddhāvīriyapaññāna”nti āha. Aññathā
analyzed: pañca indriyesu uddhacca pakkhika ikadese gaṇhanto saddhā vīriya paññānan ti āha aññathā
translated: Taking the side of restlessness, he said “faith, energy, and understanding.” Otherwise🔽excitement would have to be included. For it is said: “With concentration on the side of indolence” ,

original: pīti ca gahetabbā siyā. Tathā hi “kosajjapakkhikena samādhinā”icceva vuttaṃ, na ca
analyzed: pi iti ca gahetabbā siyā tathā hi kosajja pakkhikena vuttam na ca
translated: but not “with tranquillity, concentration, and equanimity” .

original: “passaddhisamādhiupekkhāhī”ti. Sāti sati. Sabbesu rājakammesu niyuttoti sabbakammiko.
analyzed: passaddhi samādhi upekkhāhi iti sā ati sati sabbesu rāja kammesu niyuttaḥ ti sabbakammiko
translated: Mindfulness is sati. He is employed in all the king’s business, thus he is sabbakamiko .

original: Tenāti yena kāraṇena sabbattha icchitabbā, tena āha aṭṭhakathāyaṃ. Sabbattha niyuttā
analyzed: tena ati yena kāraṇena sabbattha icchitabbā tena āha aṭṭhakathā ayam sabbattha niyuttā
translated: For the reason for which he is intended in all cases, he says in the commentary:

original: sabbatthikā, sabbena vā līnuddhaccapakkhikena bojjhaṅgena atthetabbā sabbatthiyā,
analyzed: sabbatthikā sabbena vā līn uddhacca pakkhikena bojjhaṅgena atthetabbā sabbatthiyā
translated: He is employed in all cases, thus he is sabbakamiko . He is to be sought in all cases by all the factors of enlightenment on the side of slackness and restlessness, thus he is sabbatthika .

original: sabbatthiyāva sabbatthikā. Cittanti kusalacittaṃ. Tassa hi satipaṭisaraṇaṃ parāyaṇaṃ
analyzed: sabbatthiyā ava sabbatthikā cittanti kusala cittam tassa hi sati paṭisaraṇam parāyaṇam
translated: and all-purpose is all-purpose. Mind is profitable consciousness. For that is the mindfulness’s resort, its refuge,

original: appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya. Tenāha – “ārakkhapaccupaṭṭhānā”tiādi.
analyzed: appattassa pattiyāḥ anadhigatassa adhigamāya tena āha ārakkha paccupaṭṭhāna atiādi
translated: for the attainment of what has not been attained and the realization of what has not been realized. Hence it is said, “It is manifested as protection” , and so on.

original: Khandhādibhede anogāḷhapaññānanti pariyattibāhusaccavasenapi khandhāyatanādīsu appatiṭṭhitabuddhīnaṃ.
analyzed: khandha ādi bhede pariyatti bāhu sacca vasena api khandha āyatana ādīsu appatiṭṭhita buddhīnam
translated: Whose understanding is not yet keen in the classification of the aggregates, etc.: whose understanding is not yet firmly grounded in the aggregates, sense bases, etc., even by much learning.

original: Bahussutasevanā hi sutamayañāṇāvahā. Taruṇavipassanāsamaṅgīpi bhāvanāmayañāṇe ṭhitattā
analyzed: bahu ssuta sevanā hi suta maya ñāṇa āvahā taruṇa vipassanā samaṅgī api bhāvanā maya ñāṇe ṭhita ttā
translated: For much learning leads to knowledge consisting in what is heard. One who possesses tender insight is called “wise in a general way” because he is established in knowledge consisting in what is seen.

original: ekaṃsato paññavā eva nāma hotīti āha – “samapaññāsa…pe… puggalasevanā”ti. Ñeyyadhammassa🔽gambhīrabhāvavasena tapparicchedakañāṇassa gambhīrabhāvagahaṇanti āha – “gambhīresu🔽khandhādīsu pavattāya gambhīrapaññāyā”ti. Tañhi ñeyyaṃ tādisāya paññāya caritabbato
analyzed: ekaṃsataḥ paññavā eva nāma hoti iti āha sama paññāsape puggala sevanā ati ñeyya dhammassa  gambhīra bhāva vasena tad paricchedaka ñāṇassa gambhīra bhāva gahaṇan ti āha gambhīresu  khandha ādīsu pavattāya gambhīra paññāya ati tat hi ñeyyam tādisāya paññāya caritabbato
translated: Therefore it is said, “who is devoted to wise people” .🔽Because of the profundity of the states of knowledge, he has grasped the profundity of the knowledge that defines them. Therefore it is said, “in the deep aggregates, etc., in the deep way of knowledge” .🔽For that knowable is called “deep” because it is to be penetrated by such knowledge. Or alternatively, the way of knowledge is deep because it is the penetration of that knowable.

original: gambhīrañāṇacariyaṃ, tassā vā paññāya tattha pabhedato pavatti gambhīrañāṇacariyā,
analyzed: gambhīra ñāṇa cariyam tassāḥ vā paññāya tattha pabhedato pavatti gambhīra ñāṇa cariyā
translated: The way of knowledge is the penetration of that knowable by means of the classification of the aggregates, etc.,

original: tassā paccavekkhaṇāti āha “gambhīrapaññāya pabhedapaccavekkhaṇā”ti. Yathā sativepullappatto
analyzed: tassā paccavekkhaṇā ti āha gambhīra paññāya pabheda paccavekkhaṇā ti yathā sati vepulla ppatto
translated: “The reviewing of it” is said in the words “The reviewing of the analysis by deep knowledge.”

original: nāma arahā eva, evaṃ so eva paññāvepullappattopīti āha “arahattamaggena bhāvanāpāripūrī
analyzed: nāma arahā eva evam so eva paññā vepulla ppattaḥ api iti āha arahatta maggena bhāvanā pāripūrī
translated: Just as one who has reached the state of abundance of mindfulness is an Arahant, so too one who has reached the state of abundance of understanding is an Arahant. That is why it is said that “the completion of the development is with the Arahant path.”

original: hotī”ti. Vīriyādīsupi eseva nayoti.🔽“Tattaṃ ayokhilaṃ hatthe gamentī”tiādinā vuttapañcavidhabandhanakammakāraṇā niraye
analyzed: hoti iti vīriya ādīsupi esā iva  tat tam ayaḥ khilam hatthe gamenti iti ādinā vutta pañcavidha bandhana kamma kāraṇā niraye
translated: The same method applies to energy, etc.,

original: nibbattasattassa sabbapaṭhamaṃ karontīti devadūtasuttādīsu, tassā ādito vuttattā
analyzed: nibbatta sattassa sabba paṭhamam karonti iti deva dūta sutta ādīsu tassāḥ āditas vutta ttā
translated: The “divine messengers” mentioned in the Devadūta Sutta, etc., are the first to do so, because they are mentioned first in the texts, which say: “The divine messengers are the first to do so.”

original: ca āha – “pañcavidhabandhanakammakāraṇato paṭṭhāyā”ti. Sakaṭavahanādikāleti ādi-saddena🔽tadaññamanussehi tiracchānehi ca vibādhanīyakālaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Ekaṃ buddhantaranti
analyzed: ca āha pañcavidha bandhana kamma kāraṇataḥ paṭṭhāyāti sakaṭa vahana ādi kāla iti ādi saddena  tad añña manussehi tiracchānehi ca vibādhanīya kālam saṅgaṇhāti ekam buddha antaram ti
translated: The “carts and conveyances” mentioned in the texts are the first to do so, because they are mentioned first in the texts, which say: “The carts and conveyances are the first to do so.”

original: idaṃ aparāparaṃ petesu eva uppajjanakasattavasena vuttaṃ, ekaccānaṃ vā petānaṃ, ekaccatiracchānānaṃ
analyzed: idam apara aparam petesu eva uppajjanaka satta vasena vuttam ekaccānam vā petānam ekacca tiracchānānam
translated: “One birth-interval” is said with reference to a being who is reborn only among the petas, or with reference to some petas and some animals.

original: viya tathā dīghāyukatāpi siyāti tathā vuttaṃ. Tathā hi kālo nāgarājā catunnaṃ buddhānaṃ rūpadassāvī.
analyzed: viya tathā dīgha āyuka tā api siyā iti tathā vuttam tathā hi kālaḥ nāga rājā catunnam buddhānam rūpa dassāvī
translated: and so too longevity is said to be like that. For the nāga king Kāla was a seer of the four Buddhas.

original: Evaṃ ānisaṃsadassāvinoti “vīriyāyatto eva sakalalokiyalokuttaravisesādhigamo”ti evaṃ🔽ānisaṃsadassanasīlassa. Gamanavīthinti sapubbabhāgaṃ nibbānagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ. Saha
analyzed: evam vīriya āyattaḥ eva sakala lokiya lokuttara visesa adhigamaḥ ti evam  ānisaṃsa dassana sīlassa gamana vīthim ti sa pubba bhāgam nibbāna gāminim paṭipadam saha
translated: Thus “seers of the benefits” are those who are possessed of energy.🔽The “path of progress” is the way leading to Nibbāna together with its prior stage.

original: vipassanāya ariyamaggapaṭipāṭi, sattavisuddhiparamparā vā. Sā hi vaṭṭato niyyānāya
analyzed: vipassanāya ariya magga paṭipāṭi satta visuddhi paramparā vā sā hi vaṭṭataḥ niyyānāya
translated: The Noble Path together with insight is a succession of seven kinds of purification.

original: gantabbā paṭipadāti katvā gamanavīthi nāma.
analyzed: gantabbā paṭipadā ati katvā gamanavīthi nāma
translated: For that is called the “path of progress” since it is the way that should be gone by for escape from the round.🔽“One who is devoted to strengthening the body” is one who is intent on nourishing the body.

original: Kāyadaḷhībahuloti kāyassa posanapasuto. Piṇḍanti raṭṭhapiṇḍaṃ. Paccayadāyakānaṃ attani
analyzed: kāya daḷhī bahulo ti kāyassa posana pasutaḥ piṇḍanti raṭṭha piṇḍam paccaya dāyakānam attani
translated: “The alms” are the alms of the country.

original: kārassa attano sammāpaṭipattiyā mahapphalabhāvassa karaṇena piṇḍāya bhikkhāya paṭipūjanā
analyzed: kārassa attano sammāpaṭipattiyāḥ mahapphala bhāvassa karaṇena piṇḍāya bhikkhāya paṭipūjanā
translated: “The honoring of the alms” is the making of the alms given by the donors fruitful by one’s own correct practice.🔽“Taking out” is taking out from the bowl and the bag.

original: piṇḍāpacāyanā. Nīharantoti pattatthavikato nīharanto. Taṃ saddaṃ sutvāti taṃ upāsikāya
analyzed: piṇḍa apacāyanāḥ nīharantoti pattatthavikataḥ nīharantaḥ tam saddam sutvā iti tam upāsikāya
translated: “Having heard the sound” of the alms-resort.

original: vacanaṃ paṇṇasāladvāre ṭhitova pañcābhiññatāya dibbasotena sutvāti vadanti. Manussasampatti,
analyzed: vacanam paṇṇasāla dvāre ṭhitaḥ uva pañca abhiñña tāya dibba sotena sutvā iti vadanti manussa sampatti
translated: They say that he heard it by means of the divine ear-element, which is purified and surpasses the human, while standing at the door of the leaf hut.🔽The three kinds of success are: success in the human state,

original: dibbasampatti, ante nibbānasampattīti tisso sampattiyo. Sitaṃ karontovāti “akiccheneva
analyzed: dibba sampatti ante nibbāna sampatti iti tissaḥ sampattiyaḥ sitam karontaḥ uvāti a kicchena iva
translated: success in the divine state, and success in nibbāna.

original: mayā vaṭṭadukkhaṃ samatikkanta”nti paccavekkhaṇāvasāne sañjātapāmojjavasena sitaṃ karonto eva.🔽Alasānaṃ bhāvanāya nāmamattampi ajānantānaṃ kāyassa posanabahulānaṃ yāvadatthaṃ paribhuñjitvā
analyzed: mayā vaṭṭa dukkham samatikkantanti paccavekkhaṇa avasāne sañjāta pāmojja vasena sitam karontaḥ eva  alasānam bhāvanāya nāma mattam pi a jānantānam kāyassa posana bahulānam yāvadattham paribhuñjitvā
translated: “While he was making his meal”: while he was making his meal with the joy that arose at the conclusion of his reflection, thinking, “Without difficulty I have crossed over the suffering of the round.”🔽“He avoided from afar those who are lazy”: those who are lazy, who do not know even the name of the development of the enlightenment factors, who are concerned only with nourishing the body, who eat as much as they like

original: seyyasukhādiṃ anuyuñjantānaṃ tiracchānakathikānaṃ dūratova vajjanaṃ kusītapuggalaparivajjanā.
analyzed: seyya sukha ādim anuyuñjantānam tiracchāna kathikānam dūratas va vajjanam kusīta puggala parivajjanā
translated: and then indulge in the pleasures of sleep, etc., and who talk like animals.

original: “Divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāyā”tiādinā bhāvanārambhavasena āraddhavīriyānaṃ daḷhaparakkamānaṃ
analyzed: divasam caṅkamena nisajja āyāti ādinā bhāvanā ārambha vasena āraddha vīri yānam daḷha parakkamānam
translated: “He associated with those who are energetic”: those who have begun to make effort by undertaking the development of concentration in such a way that they can reflect, “During the day I have walked and sat—when shall I attain?”

original: kālenakālaṃ upasaṅkamanā āraddhavīriyapuggalasevanā. Tenāha “kucchiṃ pūretvā”tiādi.
analyzed: kālenakālam upasaṅkamanā āraddha vīriya puggala sevanā tena āha kucchim pūretvā itiādi
translated: and who approach him from time to time. Therefore it is said: “He filled his belly” , etc.

original: Visuddhimagge pana “jātimahattapaccavekkhaṇā, sabrahmacārimahattapaccavekkhaṇā”ti
analyzed: visuddhi magge pana jāti mahatta paccavekkhaṇā sabrahmacāri mahatta paccavekkhaṇā ati
translated: But in the Visuddhimagga it is said: “Recollection of the Buddha’s greatness, recollection of the Dhamma’s greatness, recollection of the Saṅgha’s greatness, recollection of virtue’s greatness, recollection of generosity’s greatness, recollection of deities’ greatness” .🔽

original: idaṃ dvayaṃ na gahitaṃ, “thinamiddhavinodanatā, sammappadhānapaccavekkhaṇā”ti idaṃ🔽dvayaṃ gahitaṃ. Tattha ānisaṃsadassāvitāya eva sammappadhānapaccavekkhaṇā gahitā
analyzed: idam dvayam na gahitam thinam iddha vinodana tā sammappadhāna paccavekkhaṇā ti idam  dvayam gahitam tattha eva sammappadhāna paccavekkhaṇā gahitā
translated: But in the Visuddhimagga the two kinds of reflection are not given as “reflection on the greatness of the opportunity” and “reflection on the greatness of the spiritual friend” but as “the clearing up of stiffness and torpor” and “reflection on the right endeavor” .🔽Herein, the reflection on the right endeavor is given because it shows the benefit,

original: lokiyalokuttaravisesādhigamassa vīriyāyattatādassanabhāvato. Thinamiddhavinodanaṃ🔽tadadhimuttatāya gahitaṃ, vīriyuppādane yuttapayuttassa thinamiddhavinodanaṃ atthato
analyzed: lokiya lokuttara visesa adhigamassa vīriya āyatta tā dassana bhāvataḥ thinam iddha vinodanam  tad adhimutta tāya gahitam vīriya uppādane yutta payuttassa thinam iddha vinodanam atthataḥ
translated: since the attainment of the distinction of the supramundane and the mundane depends on energy. The clearing up of stiffness and torpor🔽is given because it is the outcome of that reflection, since the clearing up of stiffness and torpor is actually implied in the case of one who is occupied with the arousing of energy.

original: siddhameva. Tattha thinamiddhavinodanaṃ kusītapuggalaparivajjana-āraddhavīriyapuggala-sevana-
analyzed: siddham eva tattha thinam iddha vinodanam
translated: Herein, the clearing up of stiffness and torpor should be regarded as the arousing of the enlightenment factor of energy in one who has not aroused it by avoiding a person who is lazy, by frequenting a person who has aroused energy,

original: tadadhimuttatāpaṭipakkhavidhamana-paccayūpasaṃhāravasena, apāyabhayapaccavekkhaṇādayo🔽samuttejanavasena vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa uppādakāti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: tad adhimutta tā paṭipakkha vidhamana paccayu upasaṃhāra vasena apāya bhaya paccavekkhaṇa ādayaḥ 🔽samuttejana vasena vīriya sambojjhaṅgassa uppādakā ati daṭṭhabbā
translated: by the removal of hindrances that oppose the reflection on the fearfulness of the states of loss, etc., and by the accumulation of the conditions for that reflection.

original: Buddhānussatiyā upacārasamādhiniṭṭhattā vuttaṃ “yāva upacārā”ti. Sakalasarīraṃ pharamānoti🔽pītisamuṭṭhānehi paṇītarūpehi sakalasarīraṃ pharamāno. Dhammasaṅghaguṇe anussarantassapi🔽yāva upacārā sakalasarīraṃ pharamāno pītisambojjhaṅgo uppajjatīti yojanā. Evaṃ sesaanussatīsu
