analyzed: pādagāmaḥ ti nagarassa pada sadisaḥ mahantagāmaḥ tena iva āha vesāliyam viharati veḷuva gāmaka iti
translated: Pādagāma: a big village like a suburb of the city. Therefore it is said: “He dwelt at Vesālī in the grove of the Gabled Hall.”

original: Ahitanisedhana-hitaniyojana-byasanapariccajana-lakkhaṇo mittabhāvo yesu atthi, te
analyzed: ahita nisedhana hita niyojana byasana pariccajana lakkhaṇaḥ mitta bhāvaḥ yesu atthi te
translated: Those who have the characteristic of removing what is harmful, of providing what is beneficial, and of avoiding misfortune, are friends.

original: mittā. Ye pana diṭṭhamattasahāyā, te sandiṭṭhā. Ye savisesaṃ bhattimanto, te sambhattāti
analyzed: mittāḥ ye pana diṭṭha matta sahāyā te sandiṭṭhāḥ ye sa visesam bhattimanto te sambhattā ati
translated: But those who are friends only as long as they are seen are acquaintances. Those who are more respectful are intimate friends.

original: dassento “mittāti mittāvā”tiādimāha. Assāti bhagavato. Pañcamiyaṃ aṭṭhamiyaṃ cātuddasiyaṃ
analyzed: dassentaḥ mittā iti mittāvā iti ādim āha assa iti bhagavataḥ pañcamiyam aṭṭhamiyam cātuddasiyam
translated: Showing this, he said: “Friends are friends.” Assa: the Blessed One.🔽On the fifth, eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of each half-month,

original: pañcadasiyanti ekekasmiṃ pakkhe cattāro vāre katvā māsassa aṭṭhavāre.
analyzed: ekekasmin pakkhe cattāraḥ vāre katvā māsassa aṭṭha vāre
translated: making eight times a month.

original: Vedanānaṃ balavabhāvena kharo pharuso kakkhaḷo. Ābādhoti pubbakammahetutāya kammasamuṭṭhāno
analyzed: vedanānam balava bhāvena kharaḥ pharusaḥ kakkhaḷaḥ ābādhaḥ ti pubba kamma hetu tāya kamma samuṭṭhāno
translated: Because of the strength of the feelings, the illness is sharp, severe, and rough. It is a disease that arises from kamma because of past kamma as its cause.

original: ābādho saṅkhāradukkhatāsaṅkhāto sabbakālikattā sarīrassa sabhāgarogo nāma. Nāyamīdiso
analyzed: ābādhaḥ saṅkhāra dukkha tā saṅkhāto sabbakālika ttā sarīrassa sa bhāga rogaḥ nāma na ayam īdisaḥ
translated: Sickness is called “a disease of the body’s own kind” because it occurs in the body at all times as suffering due to formations.🔽This sickness is not like that. But it is called “a disease of a different kind” because it is a very severe affliction.

original: ābādho, ayaṃ pana bahalatarabyādhitāya “visabhāgarogo”ti vutto. Anta-saddo samīpapavattoti
analyzed: ābādhaḥ ayam pana bahalatara byādhitāya visabhāga rogo ti vutto anta saddo samīpa pavatto ti
translated: The word “near” is used in the sense of proximity.🔽He says: “Near to death, close to death.”🔽Feeling …

original: āha – “maraṇantaṃ maraṇasantika”nti. Vedanā…pe… akaronto ukkaṃsagatabhāvitakāyāditāya.
analyzed: āha
translated: without doing anything, because his body, etc., are developed to the point of excellence.🔽Without being pressed: as if he were not being pressed.

original: Apīḷiyamānoti apīḷiyamāno viya. Ovādameva bhikkhusaṅghassa apalokananti āha – “ovādānusāsaniṃ🔽adatvāti vuttaṃ hotī”ti. Pubbabhāgavīriyaṃ nāma phalasamāpattiyā parikammabhūtavipassanāvīriyaṃ.🔽Jīvitampi jīvitasaṅkhāro patituṃ adatvā attabhāvassa abhisaṅkharaṇato.
analyzed: a pīḷiyamānaḥ ti a pīḷiyamānaḥ viya ovādam eva bhikkhu saṅghassa apalokanan ti āha ovāda anusāsanim  a datvā iti vuttam hoti iti pubbabhāga vīriyam nāma phala samāpattiyā parikamma bhūta vipassanā vīriyam  jīvitam pi jīvita saṅkhāraḥ patitum a da tvā atta bhāvassa abhisaṅkharaṇato
translated: Looking only for advice from the Community of Bhikkhus: he says: “What is meant is: without giving advice and instruction.”🔽The energy in the earlier stage is the energy of insight that is the preliminary work for the attainment of fruition.🔽Life is called “the formation of life” because it is the formation of the individual essence by not giving up the opportunity for death.

original: “Ettakaṃ kālaṃ atikkamitvā vuṭṭhahissāmī”ti khaṇaparicchedavatī samāpatti khaṇikasamāpatti.
analyzed: ettakam kālam atikkamitvā vuṭṭhahissāmi iti khaṇa paricchedavatī samāpatti khaṇika samāpatti
translated: The attainment that has a limited duration, thinking “I shall emerge after so long a time,” is a momentary attainment.

original: Niggumbaṃ nijjaṭaṃ katvāti rūpasattakārūpasattakavasena pavattiyamānaṃ vipassanābhāvanaṃ
analyzed: niggumbam nijjaṭam katvā ati rūpa sattaka arūpa sattaka vasena pavattiyamānam vipassanā bhāvanam
translated: Having made the meditation subject free from flaws and well-knit,

original: sabbaso khilavirahena niggumbaṃ, abyākulatāya nijjaṭaṃ katvā. Mahāvipassanāvasenāti
analyzed: sabbasas khila virahena niggumbam a byākula tāya nijjaṭam katvā mahā vipassanā vasena ati
translated: he should enter upon and abide in that jhāna. Herein, having made the meditation subject free from flaws and well-knit: having made the development of insight that occurs by means of the fourfold and fourfold method free from flaws by absence of any deficiency, and well-knit by absence of any confusion.

original: paccekaṃ savisesaṃ vitthāritānaṃ aṭṭhārasādīnaṃ mahāvipassanānaṃ vasena vipassitvā
analyzed: paccekam savisesam vitthāritānam aṭṭhārasa ādīnam mahāvipassanānam vasena vipassitvā
translated: By means of the great insight: having insight by means of the eighteen great insights, etc., each of which is distinguished by a particular method.

original: samāpannā yā samāpatti, sā suṭṭhu vikkhambheti vedanaṃ mahābalavatāya pubbārammaṇassa,
analyzed: samāpannā yā samāpatti sā suṭṭhu vikkhambheti vedanam mahā balavatāya pubbārammaṇassa
translated: The attainment well suppresses feeling: the attainment well suppresses the feeling that is the object that has occurred by virtue of the great strength of the insight energy that has occurred thus.

original: mahānubhāvatāya tathāpavattitavipassanāvīriyassa. Yathā nāmātiādinā tassa nidassanaṃ
analyzed: mahā anubhāva tāya yathā nāma ati ādinā tassa nidassanam
translated: By means of such and such a method: he shows that by the method stated in the way beginning, “Just as … ”🔽Feeling: painful feeling.

original: dasseti. Vedanāti dukkhavedanā. Cuddasahākārehīti tasseva sattakadvayassa vasena
analyzed: dassā iti vedanā ati dukkha vedanā tassa iva sattaka dvayassa vasena
translated: By the fourteen aspects: he says this because of the two sets of four aspects.

original: vadati. Sannetvāti antarantarā samāpannajjhānasamāpattisambhūtena vipassanāpītisinehena
analyzed: vadati san netvā iti antar antarā samāpanna jhāna samāpatti sambhūtena vipassanā pīti sinehena
translated: Having moistened: having moistened by means of the delight and happiness of insight arisen from time to time with the attainment of jhāna.

original: temetvā. Samāpattīti phalasamāpatti.
analyzed: tema itvā phala samāpatti
translated: Attainment: fruition attainment.

original: Gilānā vuṭṭhitoti gilānabhāvato vuṭṭhito. Sarīrassa garuthaddhabhāvappatti madhurakatāti
analyzed: gilānā vuṭṭhitoti gilāna bhāvataḥ vuṭṭhitaḥ sarīrassa garu thaddha bhāva ppatti madhuraka tā ati
translated: “He has recovered from his illness”: he has recovered from the state of being sick. “The attainment of a state of physical ease” means the attainment of a state of physical comfort.

original: āha – “sañjātagarubhāvo sañjātathaddhabhāvo”ti. Nānākāratoti puratthimādibhedato.
analyzed: āha sañjāta garu bhāvo sañjāta thaddha bhāvo ti nānā ākārato ti puratthima ādi bhedato
translated: He says: “He has attained a state of physical ease, he has attained a state of physical comfort.” “In various ways”: in the directions east, etc.

original: Satipaṭṭhānadhammāti pubbe attanā bhāviyamānā satipaṭṭhānadhammā. Pākaṭā na honti
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāna dhammā ti pubbe attanā bhāviyamānā sati paṭṭhāna dhammā pākaṭāḥ na honti
translated: “The dhammas of the foundations of mindfulness”: the dhammas of the foundations of mindfulness that he himself has previously developed. They are not evident

original: kāyacittānaṃ akammaññatāya. Tanti dhammāti pariyattidhammā na ñāyanti.
analyzed: kāya cittānam akammañña tāya tanti dhammā ati pariyatti dhammā na ñāyanti
translated: because of the unserviceability of his body and mind. “The dhammas called ‘the dhammas’” means the dhammas of the texts are not known.

original: Anantaraṃ abāhiranti dhammavasena puggalavasena ca antarabāhiraṃ akatvā. Ettakantiādinā🔽vuttamevatthaṃ vivarati. Daharakāleti attano daharakāle. Na evaṃ hotīti “ahaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ
analyzed: anantaram abāhiram ti dhamma vasena puggala vasena ca antara bāhiram a katvā ettaka nti ādinā  vuttam eva attham vivarati dahara kāle iti attanaḥ dahara kāle na evam hoti iti aham bhikkhu saṅgham
translated: “Without looking to the outside”: without looking to the inside or the outside in terms of dhammas or in terms of persons. “Just this” and so on

original: pariharissāmī”tiādiko mānataṇhāmūlako issāmacchariyānaṃ pavattiākāro tathāgatassa
analyzed: pariharissāmi iti ādikaḥ māna taṇhā mūlakaḥ pavatti ākāraḥ tathāgatassa
translated: he explains the meaning stated. “In his youth”: in his own youth. “It does not occur to him” means the way in which envy and avarice occur, rooted in conceit and craving, “I will look after the Sangha of bhikkhus,” and so on,

original: na hoti, nattheva pageva tesaṃ samucchinnattāti āha – “bodhipallaṅkeyevā”tiādi. Paṭisaṅkharaṇena
analyzed: na hoti nattha iva pagā iva tesam samucchinna ttā ati āha paṭisaṅkharaṇena
translated: does not occur to the Tathāgata. It does not exist at all, much less has he cut them off. Therefore he says: “Even while sitting in the Enlightenment Tree,” and so on. By the act of recollecting

original: veṭhena missakena. Maññeti yathāvuttaṃ paṭisaṅkharaṇasaññitena veṭhamissakena viya
analyzed: veṭhena missakena maññā iti yathā vuttam paṭisaṅkharaṇa saññitena veṭha missakena viya
translated: “As if with a strap mixed with a rope” means as if with a strap mixed with a rope.

original: jarasakaṭaṃ. Arahattaphalaveṭhenāti arahattaphalasamāpattisaññitena atthabhāvaveṭhena.
analyzed: jarasakaṭam arahatta phala veṭhena ati arahatta phala samāpatti saññitena attha bhāva veṭhena
translated: “With the strap of Arahantship” means with the strap of the attainment of Arahantship, which is the non-existence of the aggregates.

original: Phalasamāpattiyā adhippetattā “ekaccānaṃ vedanānanti lokiyānaṃ vedanāna”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: phala samāpattiyāḥ adhippeta ttā ekaccānam vedanānam ti lokiyānam vedanānam ti vuttam
translated: “Some feelings” means mundane feelings.

original: Attadīpāti ettha atta-saddena dhammo eva vutto, svāyamattho heṭṭhā vibhāvito eva.
analyzed: atta dīpā iti ettha atta saddena dhammaḥ eva vuttaḥ svāyam atthaḥ heṭṭhā vibhāvitaḥ eva
translated: “Self-luminous”: here the word “self” refers to the Dhamma. The meaning is explained below.

original: Navavidho lokuttaradhammo veditabbo. So hi catūhi oghehi anajjhottharaṇīyato “dīpo”ti
analyzed: navavidhaḥ lokuttara dhammo veditabbo saḥ hi catūhi oghehi an ajjhottharaṇīyataḥ
translated: The supramundane Dhamma should be understood as ninefold. It is called “a light” because it cannot be overwhelmed by the four floods.

original: vutto. Tamaaggeti tamayogābhāvena sadevakassa lokassa agge. Sabbesanti sabbesaṃ sikkhākāmānaṃ.
analyzed: vuttaḥ tama agge ti tama yoga abhāvena sa devakassa lokassa agge sabbesam ti sabbesam sikkhā kāmānam
translated: “The foremost in the world with its gods” because it is free from the darkness of defilements. “Of all” means of all those who desire training.

original: Te “dhammadīpā viharathā”ti vuttā catusatipaṭṭhānagocarāva bhikkhū agge bhavissanti.
analyzed: te dhamma dīpāḥ viharatha ati vuttā catusati paṭṭhāna gocarā ava bhikkhū agge bhavissanti
translated: “Abiding as self-luminous” means that the bhikkhus, who are the subject of the statement “Abide as self-luminous,” will be foremost in the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: 10. Bhikkhunupassayasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bhikkhun upassaya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition of the Discourse on the Bhikkhunis’ Quarters🔽.

original: 376. Kammaṭṭhānakammikāti kammaṭṭhānamanuyuttā. Visesetīti viseso, atisayo, svāyaṃ pubbāparaviseso upādāyupādāya gahetabboti taṃ dassetuṃ “tatthā”tiādimāha.🔽Uppajjati kilesapariḷāhoti kāye asubhādivasena manasikāraṃ adahantassa manasikārassa
analyzed: kammaṭṭhāna kammikā ti kammaṭṭhānam anuyuttā viseseti iti visesaḥ atisayaḥ su ayam pubba apara visesaḥ upādāya upādāya gahetabbaḥ iti tam dassetum tattha atiādim āha  uppajjati kilesa pariḷāho ti kāye asubha ādi vasena manasikāram a dahantassa manasikārassa
translated: “Who are devoted to the meditation subject”: who are devoted to the development of the meditation subject. “Distinction”: distinction is a special quality, a superiority. This distinction is to be understood as due to the difference in the way the meditation subject is undertaken. “Therein” is said in order to point out that distinction.🔽“The defilement of the meditation subject arises” means that when he does not apply attention to the meditation subject in the way beginning “repulsiveness of food” the defilement of the meditation subject arises in him.

original: vīthiyaṃ apaṭipannatā subhādivasena kāyārammaṇo kilesapariḷāho ca uppajjati. Vīriyārambhassa
analyzed: vīthiyam apaṭipanna tā subha ādi vasena kāya ārammaṇaḥ kilesa pariḷāho ca uppajjati vīriya ārambhassa
translated: “The mind sinks” because of the absence of instigation of energy.

original: abhāvena tasmiṃ ārammaṇe cetaso vā līnattaṃ hoti, gocarajjhattato bahiddhā puthuttārammaṇe🔽cittaṃ vikkhipati. Evaṃ kilesapariḷāhe cātiādinā tividhampi bhāvanānuyogassa kilesavatthubhāvaṃ🔽upādāya samuccayavasena aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Yasmā pana te pariḷāhalīnattavikkhepā
analyzed: abhāvena tasmin ārammaṇe cetasaḥ vā līnattam hoti gocara jjhattataḥ bahiddhā puthutta ārammaṇe  cittam vikkhipati evam kilesa pariḷāhe ca ati ādinā tividham pi bhāvanā anuyogassa kilesa vatthu bhāvam  upādāya samuccaya vasena aṭṭhakathā ayam vuttam yasmā pana te pariḷāha līna tta vikkhepā
translated: “The mind becomes distracted outwardly” because of the mind’s going outside to an object other than the meditation subject.🔽So in the commentary the three are stated collectively as the basis for the arising of defilements in the practice of development.

original: ekajjhaṃ na pavattanti, tasmā pāḷiyaṃ “kāyārammaṇo vā”tiādinā aniyamattho vā-saddo
analyzed: ekajjham na pavattanti tasmā pāḷiyam kāya ārammaṇaḥ vā iti ādinā aniyama tthaḥ vā saddaḥ
translated: But since these three, namely, the sinking of the mind, the distraction of the mind, and the defilement of the meditation subject, do not occur together, the word “or” in the text should be understood to be in the sense of “and.”

original: gahito. Kilesānurañjitenāti kilesavivaṇṇitacittena hutvā na vattitabbaṃ. Kathaṃ pana🔽vattitabbanti āha “kismiñcidevā”ti. Na ca vitakketi na ca vicāretīti kilesasahagate
analyzed: gahitaḥ kilesa anurañjitena ati kilesa vivaṇṇita cittena hutvā na vattitabbam katham pana  vattitabbanti āha kismiñcid eva ati na ca vitakketi na ca vicāreti iti kilesa sahagate
translated: He should not go about with a mind defiled by defilements. But how should he go about?

original: vitakkavicāre na pavatteti. Sukhitoti jhānasukhena sukhito.🔽Imassa bhikkhuno bhāvanā pavattāti sambandho. Yasmā hi imassa bhikkhuno taṃ mūlakammaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: vitakka vicāre na pavatteti sukhito ti jhāna sukhena sukhitaḥ  imassa bhikkhuno bhāvanā pavattā ati sambandhaḥ yasmā hi imassa bhikkhuno tam mūlakammaṭṭhānam
translated: He should not give attention to thoughts and cogitation accompanied by defilements. He should be happy with the happiness of jhāna.

original: paripanthe sati ṭhapetvā buddhaguṇādianussaraṇena cittaṃ pasādetvā mūlakammaṭṭhānabhāvanā🔽pavattā, tasmā paṇidhāya bhāvanāti vuttanti sambandho. Aṭṭhapetvāti cittaṃ appavattetvāti
analyzed: paripanthe sati ṭhapetvā buddha guṇa ādi anussaraṇena cittam pasādetvā mūlakammaṭṭhāna bhāvanā  pavattā tasmā paṇidhāya bhāvanā iti vuttan ti sambandhaḥ aṭṭhapetvā ti cittam a pavattetvā ati
translated: This bhikkhu should develop the meditation subject thus. For when this bhikkhu has aroused confidence in the meditation subject by recollecting the special qualities of the Buddha, etc., and has steadied his mind by the attainment of the jhāna that is the basis for direct-knowledge, he should then develop the meditation subject by surmounting the perception of earth and so on.

original: attho veditabbo. Kammaṭṭhānādīnaṃ tiṇṇampi vasena atthayojanā sambhavati. Tenāha
analyzed: atthaḥ veditabbaḥ kammaṭṭhāna ādīnam tiṇṇam pi vasena attha yojanā sambhavati tena āha
translated: This is the meaning: he should not develop it by giving attention to the meditation subject without surmounting the perception of earth, and so on. The explanation of the meaning of the three terms beginning with “meditation subject” is possible in all three instances. That is why he said “there” , and so on.

original: “tatthā”tiādi. Sārento viyāti rathaṃ vāhayanto viya. Samappamāṇato aṭṭhakādivasena
analyzed: tattha atiādi sārentaḥ viya ati ratham vāhayantaḥ viya samappamāṇataḥ aṭṭhaka ādi vasena
translated: He should go about as if he were driving a chariot: he should go about as if he were driving a chariot.

original: sutacchitaṃ pakkhipanto viya. Sukheneva kilesānaṃ okāsaṃ adento antarā asajjanto
analyzed: suta chitam pakkhipantaḥ viya sukhena iva kilesānam okāsam adentaḥ antarā a sajjantaḥ
translated: like one who puts a sword through a sword-leaf. Without giving the defilements an opportunity by being slack or lazy in between,

original: alagganto. Vipassanācārassa āraddhavuttitaṃ aparipanthatañca dassento opammadvayamāha.
analyzed: vipassanā ācārassa āraddha vutti tam aparipantha tam ca dassentaḥ opamma dvayam āha
translated: without being delayed, he should go forward. Showing that the practice of insight has begun and that it is not obstructed, he gives two similes.

original: Byābhaṅgiyāti kājadaṇḍena. Kilesapariḷāhādīnanti kilesapariḷāhalīnattavikkhepānaṃ.
analyzed: byābhaṅgiyā ati kāja daṇḍena kilesa pariḷāha ādīnam ti kilesa pariḷāha līnatta vikkhepānam
translated: With a bamboo pole: with a bamboo pole for a stick. The defilements’ heat, etc.: the defilements’ heat, sluggishness, and distraction.

original: Guḷakhaṇḍādīnīti guḷakhaṇḍasakkharakhaṇḍādīni ucchuvikārabhūtāni. “Kāye kāyānupassī viharāmī”tiādivacanato “pubbabhāgavipassanā kathitā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: guḷa khaṇḍa ādīni iti guḷa khaṇḍa sakkharakhaṇḍa ādīni ucchu vikāra bhūtāni kāye kāya anupassī viharāmi iti ādi vacanataḥ pubba bhāga vipassanā kathitā ti vuttam
translated: Sugar lumps, etc.: sugar lumps, lumps of sugar-cane juice, etc., which have become like a lump of froth. “He abides contemplating the body as a body” and so on. It is said that the preliminary insight is stated.

original: Ambapālivaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Nālandavaggo
analyzed: ambapāli vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  na alanda vaggo
translated: The commentary on the Ambapali chapter is finished.🔽The Nālandā chapter

original: 2. Nālandasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: nālanda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the Nālandā sutta

original: 378. Dutiyavagge paṭhamasuttaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayattā suviññeyyanti taṃ laṅghitvā “dutiye”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Bhiyyataro abhiññātoti sambodhiyā seṭṭhataroti abhilakkhito. Bhiyyatarābhiññoti sabbasattesu
analyzed: dutiya vagge paṭhama suttam heṭṭhā vutta naya ttā su viññeyyan ti tam laṅghitvā dutiyā iti vuttam 🔽bhiyyataraḥ abhiññātoti sambodhiyā seṭṭhataraḥ iti abhilakkhitaḥ bhiyyatara abhiñño ti sabba sattesu
translated: The first sutta in the second chapter is easy to understand because it is stated in the same way as above, so it is omitted and the second sutta is mentioned.

original: adhikatarapañño. Tenāha “uttaritarañāṇo”ti. Sammā anavasesato bujjhati etenāti sambodhīti
analyzed: tena āha uttaritara ñāṇo ti sammā anavasesataḥ bujjhati etena ati sambodhi iti
translated: and he is superior in wisdom. Hence it is said: “He has higher knowledge” .🔽He fully awakens to all things by means of this, thus it is enlightenment .🔽He says: “Enlightenment is the knowledge of omniscience” .

original: āha – “sambodhiyanti sabbaññutaññāṇe”ti. Nippadesā gahitāti anavasesā buddhaguṇā
analyzed: āha sambodhiyanti sabbaññu ta ññāṇe iti nippadesā gahitā ati anavasesāḥ buddha guṇā
translated: The whole is included without exception: all the qualities of a Buddha are included without exception.🔽For the Blessed One’s possession of all the qualities is established by the establishment of the highest path.

original: gahitā aggamaggasiddhiyāva bhagavato sabbaguṇānaṃ siddhattā. Na kevalañca buddhānaṃ,
analyzed: gahitā agga magga siddhiyā va bhagavato sabba guṇānam siddha ttā na kevalam ca buddhānam
translated: And not only of the Buddhas,

original: atha kho aggasāvakapaccekabuddhānampi taṃtaṃguṇasamijjhanaṃ aggamaggādhigamenevāti
analyzed: atha kho agga sāvaka paccekabuddhānam pi taṃ taṃ guṇa samijjhanam agga magga adhigamena iva ati
translated: but also of the chief disciples and paccekabuddhas, the establishment of their respective qualities is by the attainment of the highest path.

original: dassento “dvepi aggasāvakā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: dassentaḥ dve pi aggasāvaka ati ādim āha
translated: Showing this, he says: “The two chief disciples” , and so on.

original: Aparo nayo – pasannoti iminā pasādassa vattamānatā dīpitāti uppannasaddhoti imināpi
analyzed: aparaḥ nayaḥ pasannaḥ ti iminā pasādassa vattamāna tā dīpitā ati uppanna saddhaḥ ti iminā api
translated: Another method: by the word “pleased” the state of being pleased is indicated. By the word “with confidence” the presence of confidence is made known.

original: saddhāya paccuppannatā pakāsitāti āha – “evaṃ saddahāmīti attho”ti. Abhijānāti abhimukhabhāvena
analyzed: saddhāya paccuppanna tā pakāsitā iti āha evam saddahāmi iti attho ti abhijānāti abhimukha bhāvena
translated: Hence he says: “The meaning is: I have confidence in this way” .

original: sabbaññeyyaṃ jānātīti abhiñño, bhiyyo adhiko abhiññoti bhiyyobhiñño. So eva atisayavacanicchāvasena
analyzed: sabbaññeyyam jānāti iti abhiññaḥ bhiyyas adhikaḥ abhiñño ti bhiyyobhiññaḥ saḥ eva atisaya vacana icchā vasena
translated: He knows by facing up to , thus he is a knower . He is a knower of what is more, thus he is a knower of what is more . He is a knower of what is more, thus he is a knower of what is more .

original: bhiyyobhiññataroti vuttoti āha – “bhiyyataro abhiññāto”ti. Dutiyavikappe pana abhijānātīti🔽abhiññā, abhivisiṭṭhā paññā. Bhiyyo abhiññā etassāti bhiyyobhiñño, so eva atisayavacanicchāvasena
analyzed: bhiyyobhiññataraḥ iti vuttaḥ ti āha bhiyyataraḥ abhiññāto ti dutiya vikappe pana abhijānāti iti  abhiññā abhivisiṭṭhā paññā bhiyyas abhiññā etassa ati bhiyyobhiñño so eva atisaya vacana icchā vasena
translated: He is called “one of greater direct-knowledge” : he said “one of greater direct-knowledge” .

original: bhiyyobhiññataro. Svāyaṃ assa atisayo abhiññāya bhiyyobhāvakatoti āha – “bhiyyatarābhiñño🔽vā”ti. Sambujjhati etāyāti sambodhi, sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ aggamaggañāṇañca. Sabbaññutaññāṇapadaṭṭhānañhi
analyzed: bhiyyobhiññataraḥ svāyam assa atisayaḥ abhiññāya bhiyyobhāva kato ti āha bhiyyatara abhiññaḥ  vā ati sambujjhati etāya ati sambodhi sabbaññu taññāṇam agga magga ñāṇañca sabbaññu taññāṇa padaṭṭhānam hi
translated: In the second analysis, however, he is one who directly knows , thus he is one of direct-knowledge ; he is one of distinguished understanding. He is one of greater direct-knowledge , thus he is one of greater direct-knowledge . This his superiority is stated by way of the desire for excellence.🔽He is one of greater direct-knowledge , thus he is one of greater direct-knowledge .

original: aggamaggañāṇaṃ, aggamaggañāṇapadaṭṭhānañca sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ sambodhi nāma. Tattha
analyzed: aggamagga ñāṇam aggamagga ñāṇa padaṭṭhānañca sabbaññuta ññāṇam sambodhi nāma tattha
translated: Enlightenment is the knowledge of omniscience and the knowledge of the path of Arahantship. For the knowledge of the path of Arahantship is the basis for the knowledge of omniscience, and the knowledge of omniscience is the basis for the knowledge of the path of Arahantship. This is called “enlightenment” .

original: padhānavasena tadatthadassane paṭhamavikappo, padaṭṭhānavasena dutiyavikappo. Kasmā
analyzed: padhāna vasena tad attha dassane paṭhama vikappo padaṭṭhāna vasena dutiya vikappo kasmā
translated: Herein, the first analysis is by way of the endeavour to see that meaning, and the second analysis is by way of the basis .

original: panettha arahattamaggañāṇasseva gahaṇaṃ, nanu heṭṭhimānipi bhagavato maggañāṇāni
analyzed: pana ittha arahatta magga ñāṇassa iva gahaṇam nanu heṭṭhimāni pi bhagavataḥ magga ñāṇāni
translated: But why is only the knowledge of the path of Arahantship included here? Are not the Blessed One’s other path-knowledges also

original: savāsanameva yathāsakaṃ paṭipakkhavidhamanavasena pavattāni. Savāsanappahānañhi ñeyyāvaraṇappahānanti?
analyzed: sa vāsanam eva yathāsakam paṭipakkha vidhamana vasena pavattāni sa vāsanā pahānam hi ñeyya āvaraṇa ppahānam ti
translated: and the rest of the path are the abandoning of the defilements together with their associated residual tendencies.🔽This is true, but it is incomplete, since the abandoning of the opposing qualities is not yet completed.

original: Saccametaṃ, taṃ pana aparipuṇṇaṃ paṭipakkhavidhamanassa vippakatabhāvatoti āha “arahattamaggañāṇe
analyzed: saccam etam tam pana aparipuṇṇam paṭipakkha vidhamanassa vippakata bhāvato ti āha arahatta magga ñāṇe
translated: “In the knowledge of the path of arahatship” is said.

original: vā”ti. Sabbanti sammāsambuddhena adhigantabbaṃ sabbaṃ.
analyzed: vā ati sabbam ti sammāsambuddhena adhigantabbam sabbam
translated: “All” means all that is to be attained by a Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: Khādanīyānaṃ uḷāratā sātarasānubhāvenāti āha “madhure āgacchatī”ti. Pasaṃsāya uḷāratā
analyzed: uḷāra tā sāta rasa anubhāvena ati āha madhure āgacchati iti uḷāra tā
translated: The excellence of the food is due to its taste and nutritive value.🔽The excellence of the praise is due to its distinction.

original: visiṭṭhabhāvenāti āha – “seṭṭhe”ti. Obhāsassa uḷāratā mahantabhāvenāti vuttaṃ – “vipule”ti.🔽Usabhassa ayanti āsabhī, idha pana āsabhī viyāti āsabhī. Tenāha – “usabhassa vācāsadisī”ti.
analyzed: visiṭṭha bhāvena āti āha seṭṭhā iti obhāsassa uḷāra tā mahanta bhāvena ati vuttam vipulā iti  usabhassa ayanti āsabhī idha pana āsabhī viyāti āsabhī tena āha usabhassa vācā āsadisī iti
translated: The excellence of the illumination is due to its greatness.🔽The excellence of the voice is due to its loudness.

original: Yena guṇena sā taṃsadisā, taṃ dassetuṃ “acalā asampavedhī”ti vuttaṃ. Yato kutoci🔽anussavanaṃ anussavo. Vijjāṭṭhānādīsu kataparicayānaṃ ācariyānaṃ taṃ taṃ atthaṃ ñāpentī
analyzed: yena guṇena sā taṃsadisā tam dassetum acalā asampavedhī iti vuttam yatas kutocid 🔽anussavanam anussavaḥ vijjā ṭṭhāna ādīsu kata paricayānam ācariyānam tam tam attham ñāpentī
translated: “Unwavering and unperturbed” is said to show the quality by which it is like the voice of the bull.

original: paveṇī ācariyaparamparā. Kevalaṃ attano matiyā “iti kira evaṃ kirā”ti parikappanā
analyzed: paveṇī ācariya paramparā kevalam attanaḥ matiyā iti kira evam kira ati parikappanā
translated: It is a mere conjecture of his own mind, thinking: “It seems that it is so, it seems that it is so.”

original: itikirā. Piṭakassa ganthassa sampadānato bhūtato tassa gahaṇaṃ piṭakasampadānaṃ.
analyzed: iti kirā piṭakassa ganthassa sampadānataḥ bhūtataḥ tassa gahaṇam piṭaka sampadānam
translated: The grasping of the text of the Piṭaka as it really is, by one who has mastered the Piṭaka, is the Piṭaka mastery.

original: Yathāsutānaṃ attānaṃ ākārassa parivitakkanaṃ ākāraparivitakko. Tathevassa “evameta”nti
analyzed: yathā sutānam attānam ākārassa parivitakkanam ākāra parivitakko tathā iva assa evam etat ti
translated: The pondering of the mode of the text as one has heard it is the pondering of the mode. The confirmation of the view that it is so is the confirmation of the view.🔽Without the acquisition of the texts and the mastery of the texts, the mere grasping of the text as one has heard it is the grasping of the text.

original: diṭṭhiyā nijjhānakkhamanaṃ diṭṭhinijjhānakkhanti. Āgamādhigamehi vinā kevalaṃ anussutato🔽takkamaggaṃ nissāya takkanaṃ takko. Anumānavidhiṃ nissāya gahaṇaṃ nayaggāho. Yasmā
analyzed: diṭṭhiyāḥ nijjhāna khamanam diṭṭhi nijjhāna kkhanti āgama adhigamehi vinā kevalam anussutataḥ  takka maggam nissāya takkanam takkaḥ anumāna vidhim nissāya gahaṇam naya ggāhaḥ yasmā
translated: The conjecture by way of the path of conjecture, without the method of inference, is conjecture. The grasping by way of the method of inference is the grasping of the method. Because

original: buddhavisaye ṭhatvā bhagavato ayaṃ therassa codanā therassa ca so avisayo, tasmā
analyzed: buddha visaye therassa codanā therassa ca saḥ avisayaḥ tasmā
translated: one who stands in the domain of the Buddha, and who is a teacher of the Buddha’s Dispensation, should not be reproached by the Blessed One or by a great disciple,🔽it is said: “having penetrated by knowledge as if cutting down with an axe.”

original: “paccakkhato ñāṇena paṭivijjhitvā viyā”ti vuttaṃ. Sīhanādo viyāti sīhanādo. Taṃsadisatā
analyzed: paccakkhatas ñāṇena paṭivijjhitvā viyā ti vuttam sīha nādaḥ viyā ti sīha nādaḥ tad sadisa tā
translated: The lion’s roar is like the lion’s roar. Its similarity🔽is shown by its excellence. And showing that it should be understood in this way, he said: “The lion’s roar.”

original: cassa seṭṭhabhāvena, so cettha evaṃ veditabboti dassento “sīhanādo”tiādimāha. Unnādayantenāti
analyzed: cassa seṭṭha bhāvena so ca ittha evam veditabbaḥ iti dassento sīhanādaḥ iti ādim āha unnādayantena ati
translated: “Roaring” means

original: asanisadisaṃ karontena.🔽Anuyogadāpanatthanti anuyogaṃ sodhāpetuṃ. Vimaddakkhamañhi sīhanādaṃ nadanto atthato
analyzed: a sani sadisam karontena  anuyoga dāpana attham ti anuyogam sodhāpetum vimadda khaman hi sīha nādam nadantaḥ atthataḥ
translated: By one who makes it like a thunderbolt.🔽In order to give a cross-examination: in order to purify a cross-examination. For one who roars a lion’s roar in order to shake off is said to purify a cross-examination in the sense of meaning,

original: anuyogaṃ sodheti nāma, anuyujjhanto ca naṃ sodhāpeti nāma. Dātunti sodhetuṃ. Keci🔽“dānattha”nti atthaṃ vadanti, taṃ na yuttaṃ. Na hi yo sīhadānaṃ nadati, so eva tattha🔽anuyogaṃ detīti yujjati. Nighaṃsananti vimaddanaṃ. Dhamamānanti tāpayamānaṃ. Tāpanañcettha
analyzed: anuyogam sodha iti nāma ca nam sodhāpa iti nāma dātum ti sodhetum keci  dāna atthanti attham vadanti tam na yuttam na hi yaḥ sīha dānam nadati saḥ eva tattha  anuyogam deti iti vimaddanam dhamamānanti tāpayamānam tāpanam ca ittha
translated: and one who cross-examines is said to purify it in the sense of a cross-examination. To give: to purify. Some say

original: gaggariyā dhammāpanasīsena vadati.
analyzed: gaggariyā dhammāpana sīsena vadati
translated: that the meaning of “to give” is “to give a cross-examination,” but that is not correct. For it is not correct to say that he who roars a lion’s roar gives a cross-examination. To shake off: to shake. To burn: to torment. Herein, he says this in the sense of the burning of the tongue.

original: Sabbe teti sabbe te atīte niruddhe sammāsambuddhe. Tenetaṃ dasseti – ye te ahesuṃ🔽atītamaddhānaṃ tava abhinīhārato oraṃ sammāsambuddhā, tesaṃ tāva sāvakañāṇagocare
analyzed: sabbe te iti sabbe te atīte niruddhe sammāsambuddhe tena itam dasseti ye te ahesuṃ  tava abhinīhārato sammāsambuddhā tesam tāva sāvaka ñāṇa gocare
translated: All those: all those fully enlightened Buddhas who have passed away and disappeared. He shows this:🔽You might know the worldly thoughts and conduct of the Buddhas, like Mara and the others,🔽by defining the Dhamma that is the province of knowledge of the disciples of those who were fully enlightened before your aspiration,

original: dhamme paricchindanto mārādayo viya ca buddhānaṃ lokiyacittācāraṃ tvaṃ jāneyyāsi.
analyzed: dhamme paricchindantaḥ māra ādayaḥ ca buddhānam lokiya citta ācāram tvam jāneyyāsi
translated: during the past period.

original: Ye pana te abbhatītā, tato parato chinnavaṭumā chinnapapañcā pariyādinnavaṭṭā sabbadukkhavītivattā
analyzed: ye pana te abbhatītā tatas paratas chinna vaṭumā chinna papañcā pariyādinna vaṭṭā sabba dukkha vītivattā
translated: But as for those who have passed away, beyond that, who have cut off the round , who have cut off proliferation, who have closed the round of the planes of existence, who have overcome all suffering,

original: sammāsambuddhā, tesaṃ sabbesampi tava sāvakañāṇassa avisayabhūte dhamme kathaṃ jānissasīti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhā tesam sabbesam pi tava sāvaka ñāṇassa avisaya bhūte dhamme katham jānissasi iti
translated: and who are Fully Enlightened Ones, how can you know the things that are not within the range of the knowledge of your disciples?🔽‘By that’: by the knowledge of the path of arahatship, which is the footing for the knowledge of omniscience called ‘enlightenment’. ‘Such virtue’:

original: Tenāti sambodhisaṅkhātena sabbaññutaññāṇapadaṭṭhānena arahattamaggañāṇena. Evaṃsīlāti🔽tādisasīlā. Samādhipakkhāti samādhi ca samādhipakkhā ca samādhipakkhā ekadesasarūpekasesanayena.
analyzed: tena ati sambodhi saṅkhātena sabbaññuta ññāṇa padaṭṭhānena arahatta magga ñāṇena evaṃsīlā ati  tādisa sīlā samādhi pakkhā ati samādhi ca samādhi pakkhā ca samādhi pakkhā eka desa sarūpa ikasesa nayena
translated: such as that. ‘The factors of concentration’: concentration and the factors of concentration are included by the words ‘the factors of concentration’ in the sense of a part and its components.

original: Tattha samādhipakkhāti vīriyasatiyo tadanuguṇā ca dhammā veditabbā. Jhānasamāpattīsu🔽yebhuyyena vihāravohāro, jhānasamāpattiyo samādhippadhānāti vuttaṃ “samādhipakkhānaṃ
analyzed: tattha vīriya satiyaḥ tad anuguṇāḥ ca dhammāḥ veditabbāḥ jhāna samāpattīsu  yebhuyyena vihāra vohāraḥ jhāna samāpattiyaḥ samādhi ppadhānā ti vuttam samādhi pakkhānam
translated: Herein, the factors of concentration should be understood as energy, mindfulness, and the states that are conascent with them.🔽The jhāna attainments are included by the words ‘the factors of concentration’ because they are included by the states that are the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the pre-eminent states in the expression ‘abiding in the jhāna attainments’ because they are the principal states.

original: dhammānaṃ gahitattā vihāro gahito”ti.
analyzed: dhammānam gahita ttā vihāro gahito ti
translated: The jhāna attainments are the states that are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the states that are the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the states that are the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the states that are the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the states that are the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the states that are the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the states that are the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the states that are the factors of concentration.🔽The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are conascent with the states that are the factors of concentration.

original: Yathā pana heṭṭhā gahitāpi samādhipaññā paṭipakkhato vimuttattā vimuccana-saṅkhāta-kiccavisesa-dassanavasena
analyzed: yathā pana heṭṭhā gahitā api samādhi paññā paṭipakkhataḥ vimutta ttā vimuccana saṅkhāta kicca visesa dassana vasena
translated: The jhāna attainments are the factors of concentration because they are con

original: vimuttipariyāyena puna gahitā “evaṃvimuttā”ti, evaṃ dibbavihāro dibbavihāravisesadassanavasena
analyzed: vimutti pariyāyena puna gahitā evam vimuttā ati evam dibba vihāraḥ dibba vihāra visesa dassana vasena
translated: and again by way of the liberation, “thus liberated,” and again by way of the divine abiding, “thus dwelling,” the divine abiding being shown as a special kind of abiding.

original: puna gahito “evaṃvihārī”ti, tasmā sabbesaṃ samāpattivihārānaṃ vasenettha attho yujjatīti
analyzed: puna gahitaḥ evaṃvihārī iti tasmā sabbesam samāpatti vihārānam vasena ittha atthaḥ yujjati iti
translated: Therefore the meaning of the passage should be understood in accordance with all the kinds of abiding and attainments.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vimuttīti saṅkhaṃ gacchanti vimuccitthāti katvā. Esa nayo sesesupi. Paṭippassaddhanteti
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam vimutti iti saṅkham gacchanti vimuccittha iti katvā esa nayaḥ sesesu pi paṭippassaddha ntā iti
translated: They are called “liberations” because they are liberated by being liberated. The same method applies in the other cases.🔽The word “having” is used in the sense of “having reached” .

original: paṭippassambhanosāpanena. Sabbakilesehi nissaṭattā asaṃsaṭṭhattā vimuttattā ca nissaraṇavimutti nibbānaṃ.
analyzed: paṭippassambhana usāpanena sabba kilesehi nissaṭa ttā asaṃsaṭṭha ttā vimutta ttā ca nissaraṇa vimutti nibbānam
translated: Nibbāna is the “liberation by crossing over” because it is the escape from all defilements, from being mixed with them, and from being subject to them.🔽The word “also” in the phrase “the future Buddhas as well” indicates a distinction.

original: Anāgatabuddhānaṃ panāti pana-saddo visesatthajotano. Tena atītesu tāva khandhānaṃ
analyzed: anāgata buddhānam pana ati pana saddaḥ visesa attha jotanaḥ tena atītesu tāva khandhānam
translated: The meaning is that although the past aggregates have already arisen,

original: bhūtapubbattā tattha siyā ñāṇassa savisaye gati, anāgatesu pana sabbaso asañjātesu
analyzed: bhūta pubba ttā tattha siyā ñāṇassa sa visaye gati anāgatesu pana sabbaso a sañjātesu
translated: the knowledge can reach them because they are the same in kind as the present aggregates. But the future aggregates have not yet arisen at all.🔽How can the knowledge reach them? This is the point being illustrated.

original: kathanti imamatthaṃ joteti. Tenāha “anāgatāpī”tiādi. “Attano cetasā paricchinditvā
analyzed: katham ti imam attham jotā iti tena āha anāgatā api itiādi cetasā paricchinditvā
translated: Therefore the Master said, “The future as well,” and so on.

original: viditā”ti kasmā vuttaṃ? Nanu atītānāgate sattāhe eva pavattaṃ cittaṃ cetopariyañāṇassa
analyzed: viditā iti kasmai vuttam nanu atīta anāgate sattāhe eva pavattam cittam cetaḥ pariya ñāṇassa
translated: Why is it said, “known”? —But is not the mind that occurs only during the past and future seven days the domain of the knowledge of penetration of minds,

original: visayo, na tato paranti? Nayidaṃ cetopariyañāṇakiccavasena vuttaṃ, atha kho pubbenivāsaanāgataṃsañāṇānaṃ
analyzed: visayaḥ na tatas paranti nayidam cetaḥ pariya ñāṇa kicca vasena vuttam atha kho pubbenivāsa anāgataṃsa ñāṇānam
translated: and not beyond that? —This is not said by way of the function of the knowledge of penetration of minds, but rather by way of the knowledge of past lives and the knowledge of the future,

original: vasena vuttaṃ, tasmā nāyaṃ doso. Viditaṭṭhāne na karoti sikkhāpadeneva tādisassa🔽paṭikkhepassa paṭikkhittattā setughātato ca. Kathaṃ pana thero dvayasambhave paṭikkhepameva
analyzed: vasena vuttam tasmā na ayam doso vidita ṭṭhāne na karoti sikkhāpadena iva tādisassa  paṭikkhepassa paṭikkhitta ttā setu ghātato ca katham pana theraḥ dvaya sambhave paṭikkhepam eva
translated: and therefore this is not a fault. He does not do it in a known place, because such a one is prohibited by the training rule, and because of the bridge-breaking.🔽But how did the Elder make a prohibition only when there was a possibility of a pair, and did not explain by dividing? He said, “The Elder, it seems,” etc.

original: akāsi, na vibhajja byākāsīti āha “thero kirā”tiādi. Pāraṃ pariyantaṃ minotīti pāramī,
analyzed: akāsi na vibhajja byākāsi iti āha theraḥ kirāti ādi pāram pariyantam minoti iti pāramī
translated: Pāramī means that which measures the far end.

original: sā eva ñāṇanti pāramiñāṇaṃ, sāvakānaṃ pāramiñāṇaṃ sāvakapāramiñāṇaṃ. Tasmiṃ sāvakānaṃ
analyzed: sā eva pāramiñāṇam sāvakānam pāramiñāṇam sāvaka pāramiñāṇam tasmin sāvakānam
translated: That itself is knowledge, thus it is pāramiñāṇa. The knowledge of the disciples is sāvakapāramiñāṇa. In that knowledge which has reached the limit of the disciples’

original: ukkaṃsapariyantagate jānane nāyamanuyogo, atha kho sabbaññutaññāṇe sabbaññutāya jānane.
analyzed: ukkaṃsa pariyanta gate jānane na ayam anuyogaḥ atha kho sabbaññu ta ññāṇe sabbaññu tāya jānane
translated: excellence, there is no need to pursue it, but rather in the knowledge of omniscience, in the knowledge of omniscience.

original: Keci pana “sāvakapāramiñāṇeti sāvakapāramiñāṇavisaye”ti atthaṃ vadanti, tathā sesapadesupi.
analyzed: keci pana sāvaka pārami ñāṇa iti sāvaka pārami ñāṇa visayā iti attham vadanti tathā sesa padesu pi
translated: But some say that the words a disciple’s knowledge of the disciple’s perfection mean the knowledge of the disciple’s perfection as the disciple’s province, and so with the rest.

original: Sīla…pe… samatthanti sīlasamādhipaññāvimuttiñāṇasaṅkhātānaṃ kāraṇānaṃ jānanasamatthaṃ.
analyzed: sīlape samatthanti sīla samādhi paññā vimutti ñāṇa saṅkhātānam kāraṇānam jānana samattham
translated: Able to know virtue, etc., is able to know the reasons called virtue, concentration, understanding, deliverance, and knowledge.

original: Buddhasīlādayo hi buddhānaṃ buddhakiccassa parehi ete buddhāti jānanassa ca kāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: buddha sīla ādayaḥ hi buddhānam buddha kiccassa parehi ete buddhā ati jānanassa ca kāraṇam
translated: For the Buddha’s virtue, etc., are the reason for the Buddhas’ being Buddhas and for the knowledge that they are Buddhas.

original: Anumānañāṇaṃ viya saṃsayaṭṭhitaṃ ahutvā idamidanti yathāsabhāvato ñeyyaṃ dhāreti
analyzed: anumāna ñāṇam viya saṃsaya ṭṭhitam a hutvā idam idam ti yathā sabhāvataḥ ñeyyam dhārā iti
translated: It is not like inferential knowledge, which is uncertain, but it holds the knowable as it is, as “This is so”

original: nicchinotīti dhammo, paccakkhañāṇanti āha “dhammassa paccakkhato ñāṇassā”ti. Anuetīti🔽anvayoti āha “anuyogaṃ anugantvā”ti. Paccakkhasiddhañhi atthaṃ anugantvā anumānañāṇassa🔽pavatti “diṭṭhena adiṭṭhassa anumāna”nti veditabbā. Vidite vedakampi ñāṇaṃ atthato
analyzed: nicchinoti iti dhammaḥ paccakkha ñāṇanti āha dhammassa paccakkhataḥ ñāṇassa ati anueti iti  anvayaḥ ti āha anuyogam anugantvā ti paccakkha siddham hi attham anugantvā anumāna ñāṇassa  pavatti diṭṭhena adiṭṭhassa anumānanti veditabbā vidite vedakam pi ñāṇam atthato
translated: and it determines it, thus it is a state of dhammas. It is knowledge of the dhammas as they are in themselves, he says.🔽It follows on, thus it is a state of dhammas that follows on.🔽For the occurrence of inferential knowledge is dependent on the establishment of the meaning in the first instance by knowledge of the dhammas as they are in themselves, and it should be understood that “Inference is of the unperceived from the perceived” .🔽And since the knowledge of the knower is in fact known,🔽it is said that “Inference is the known as the known by the known” .

original: viditameva hotīti “anumānañāṇaṃ nayaggāho vidito”ti vuttaṃ. Viditoti viddho paṭiladdho,
analyzed: viditam eva hoti iti anumāna ñāṇam naya ggāhaḥ viditaḥ iti vuttam viditaḥ iti viddhaḥ paṭiladdhaḥ
translated: The known is the penetrated, the reached.

original: adhigatoti attho. Appamāṇoti aparimāṇo mahāvisayattā. Tenāha “apariyanto”ti. Tenāti
analyzed: adhigataḥ ti atthaḥ appamāṇaḥ ti aparimāṇaḥ mahā visaya ttā tena āha apariyantaḥ iti tena ati
translated: the meaning is, ‘is known.’ ‘Immeasurable’ means immeasurable, having a great scope. Hence he said ‘unbounded.’ ‘By that’:

original: apariyantattā. Tena vā apariyantena ñāṇena. Etena thero yaṃ yaṃ anumeyyamatthaṃ ñātukāmo
analyzed: tena vai a pariyantena ñāṇena etena theraḥ yam yam anumeyya mattham ñātu kāmo
translated: by the unboundedness. Or by that unbounded knowledge. By this the Elder shows that whatever matter he wishes to know by inference,

original: hoti, tattha tattha tassa asaṅgamappaṭihataṃ anumānañāṇaṃ pavattetīti dasseti. Tenāha
analyzed: hoti tattha tattha tassa asaṅgam appaṭihatam anumāna ñāṇam pavatteti iti dasseti tena āha
translated: there his inferential knowledge proceeds unobstructed. Hence he said

original: “so iminā”tiādi. Tattha imināti iminā kāraṇena.🔽Pākārassa thirabhāvaṃ uddhamuddhaṃ āpetīti uddhāpaṃ, pākāramūlaṃ. Ādi-saddena pākāradvārabandhaparikhādīnaṃ
analyzed: tattha iminā atiādi tattha iminā ati iminā kāraṇena  pākārassa thira bhāvam uddham uddham āpeti iti uddhāpam pākāra mūlam ādi saddena pākāra dvāra bandha parikhā ādīnam
translated: ‘By that.’ Herein, ‘by that’ means by that reason.

original: saṅgaho veditabbo. Paccante bhavaṃ paccantimaṃ. Paṇḍitadovārikaṭṭhāniyaṃ katvā thero
analyzed: saṅgahaḥ veditabbaḥ paccante bhavam paccantimam paṇḍitadovārikaṭṭhāniyam katvā thero
translated: ‘The base of the rampart’: the base of the rampart is the foundation of the rampart. By the word ‘etc.’ the inclusion of the gate of the rampart, the moat, and so on, should be understood. ‘The border region’: the border region is the region beyond the capital. The Elder, having made himself the wise gatekeeper,

original: attānaṃ dassetīti dassento “ekadvāranti kasmā āhā”ti codanaṃ samuṭṭhāpesi.
analyzed: attānam dasseti iti dassentaḥ eka dvāram iti kasmai āha ati codanam samuṭṭhāpesi
translated: shows himself. The questioner raises the question, ‘Why did he say “one gate”?’

original: Yassā paññāya vasena puriso paṇḍitoti vuccati, taṃ paṇḍiccanti āha – “paṇḍiccena
analyzed: yassā paññāya vasena puriso paṇḍito ti vuccati tam paṇḍiccanti āha paṇḍiccena
translated: ‘Wisdom’ is the wisdom by which a man is called wise. He said ‘wisdom’

original: samannāgato”ti. Taṃtaṃitikattabbatāsu chekabhāvo byattabhāvo veyyattiyaṃ. Medhati🔽aññāṇaṃ hiṃsati vidhamatīti medhā, sā etassa atthīti medhāvī. Ṭhāne ṭhāne uppatti
analyzed: samannāgataḥ ti cheka bhāvaḥ byatta bhāvaḥ veyyattiyam medhati  aññāṇam hiṃsati vidhamati iti medhā sā etassa atthi iti medhāvī ṭhāne ṭhāne uppatti
translated: “He is endowed with wisdom” . The state of being a cheka, a byatta, a veyyattiya, in the various things to be done, is medha.🔽He has that, thus he is medhāvi . The state of arising in this or that place is ṭhānuppatti .

original: etissā atthīti ṭhānuppattikā, ṭhānaso uppajjanapaññā. Anupariyāyanti etenāti anupariyāyo,🔽so eva pathoti anupariyāyapatho, parito pākārassa anuyāyanamaggo. Pākārabhāgā sambandhitabbā
analyzed: etissāḥ atthi iti ṭhānuppattikā ṭhānaso uppajjana paññā anupariyāyanti etena ati anupariyāyaḥ  saḥ eva patho ti anupariyāya patho paritas pākārassa anuyāyana maggo pākāra bhāgā sambandhitabbā
translated: He has that, thus he is ṭhānuppattika . He has wisdom that arises in a place, in a situation.🔽The path that goes by that is anupariyāyo .🔽That itself is a path, thus it is anupariyāyapatho . It is the path that goes around the outer wall. The parts of the wall should be connected

original: etthāti pākārasandhi, pākārassa phullitapadeso. So pana heṭṭhimantena dvinnampi iṭṭhakānaṃ
analyzed: ettha ati pākāra sandhi pākārassa phullita padeso so pana heṭṭhimantena dvinnam pi iṭṭhakānam
translated: here, thus it is pākārasandhi . It is the place where the wall is broken. But that is said to be

original: vigamena evaṃ vuccatīti āha – “dvinnaṃ iṭṭhakānaṃ apagataṭṭhāna”nti. Chinnaṭṭhānanti
analyzed: vigamena evam vuccati iti āha dvinnam iṭṭhakānam apagata ṭṭhānan ti chinna ṭṭhānan ti
translated: by the separation of two bricks, thus he said: “The place where two bricks are removed” . The place where it is broken is

original: chinnabhinnapadesaṃ, chinnaṭṭhānaṃ vā. Tañhi “vivara”nti vuccati. Kīliṭṭhanti malīnaṃ.
analyzed: chinna bhinna padesam chinna ṭṭhānam vā tat hi vivaranti vuccati kīliṭṭhanti malīnam
translated: the place where it is broken or cut, or it is called vivara . It is soiled, thus it is kīḷittha .

original: Upatāpentīti kilesapariḷāhena santāpenti. Vibādhentīti pīḷenti. Uppannāya paññāya
analyzed: upatāpenti iti kilesa pariḷāhena santāpenti vibādhenti iti pīḷenti uppannāya paññāya
translated: They torment with the fever of defilement, thus they upatāpenti . They afflict, thus they vibādhenti . When wisdom has arisen

original: nīvaraṇehi na kiñci kātuṃ sakkāti āha “anuppannāya paññāya uppajjituṃ na dentī”ti.🔽Tasmāti paccayūpaghātena uppajjituṃ appadānato. Catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu suṭṭhu ṭhapitacittāti
analyzed: nīvaraṇehi na kiñci kātum sakkā iti āha anuppannāya paññāya uppajjitum na denti iti  tasmā ati paccaya upaghātena uppajjitum appadānato catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu suṭṭhu ṭhapita cittā ti
translated: Since the hindrances cannot do anything, he said “does not give room for the arising of non-arisen understanding.”🔽  Because it does not give room for the arising of understanding by the destruction of its conditions,🔽“In the four foundations of mindfulness”:

original: catubbidhāyapi satipaṭṭhānabhāvanāya sammadeva ṭhapitacittā appitacittā. Yathāsabhāvena
analyzed: catubbidhā api sati paṭṭhāna bhāvanāya sammat eva ṭhapita cittāḥ appita cittāḥ yathā sabhāvena
translated: in the fourfold development of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: bhāvetvāti yāthāvato sammadeva yathā paṭipakkhā samucchijjanti, evaṃ bhāvetvā.
analyzed: bhāvetvā iti yāthāvato sammat eva yathā paṭipakkhāḥ samucchijjanti evam bhāvetvā
translated: “Having developed” means having developed in accordance with actuality, in accordance with the way the opposing states are abandoned.

original: Purimanaye satipaṭṭhānāni bojjhaṅgā ca missakā adhippetāti tato aññathā vattuṃ “apicetthā”tiādi
analyzed: purima naye satipaṭṭhānāni bojjhaṅgā ca missakā adhippetā ti tatas aññathā vattum apica itthā atiādi
translated: In the first method the foundations of mindfulness and the enlightenment factors are intended as mixed, therefore, in order to explain them in a different way, “Herein, however, …” is said.🔽  “Mixed” means mixed by the path of serenity and insight.

original: vuttaṃ. Missakāti samathavipassanāmaggavasena missakā. “Catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittāti
analyzed: vuttam missakā ti samatha vipassanā magga vasena missakā catūsu sati paṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhita cittā ti
translated: “In the four foundations of mindfulness”:

original: paṭhamaṃ vuttattā satipaṭṭhānesu vipassanaṃ gahetvā satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvetvāti
analyzed: paṭhamam vutta ttā sati paṭṭhānesu vipassanam gahetvā satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtam bhāvetvā ati
translated: because they are mentioned first, taking insight in the foundations of mindfulness, he said “having developed the seven enlightenment factors in accordance with actuality.”

original: vuttattā maggapariyāpannānaṃyeva ca nesaṃ nippariyāyabojjhaṅgabhāvato tesu ca adhigatameva
analyzed: vutta ttā magga pariyāpannānaṃya iva ca nesam nippariyāya bojjhaṅga bhāvato tesu ca adhigatam eva
translated: and because they are included in the path, and because they are the factors of enlightenment in the absolute sense, and because they are already obtained in the path,

original: hotīti bojjhaṅge maggo ca sabbaññutaññāṇañcāti gahite sundaro pañho bhaveyyā”ti mahāsivatthero
analyzed: hoti iti bojjhaṅge maggo ca sabbaññu taññāṇam ca ati gahite sundaraḥ pañhaḥ bhaveyya ati mahāsiva tthero
translated: the question would be a good one if it were asked thus: ‘When the path and the knowledge of omniscience are stated, are the enlightenment factors stated too?’”

original: āha. Na panevaṃ gahitaṃ porāṇehīti adhippāyo. Itīti vuttappakāraparāmasanaṃ. Theroti sāriputtatthero.
analyzed: āha na pana ivam gahitam porāṇehi iti adhippāyaḥ iti iti vutta ppakāra parāmasanam thero ti sāriputta thero
translated: The Elder Mahā-Siva said this. But the intention of the Ancients was not to take it that way. It is thus: the Ancients took it thus. The Elder: the Elder Sāriputta.

original: Tatthāti tesu paccantanagarādīsu. Nagaraṃ viya nibbānaṃ tadatthikehi upagantabbato🔽upagatānañca parissayarahitasukhādhigamaṭṭhānato. Pākāro viya sīlaṃ tadupagatānaṃ
analyzed: tattha iti tesu paccanta nagara ādīsu nagaram viya nibbānam tad atthikehi upagantabbataḥ  upagatānam ca parissaya rahita sukha adhigama ṭhānato pākāraḥ viya sīlam tad upagatānam
translated: There: among those towns, etc., that are mentioned. Nibbāna is like a town because those who want it go to it,🔽and because it is the place where those who have gone to it obtain the bliss that is free from troubles. Virtue is like a rampart because it guards those who have gone to it

original: parito ārakkhabhāvato. Anupariyāyapatho viya hirī sīlapākārassa adhiṭṭhānabhāvato.
analyzed: paritas ārakkha bhāvataḥ anupariyāya pathaḥ viya hirī sīla pākārassa adhiṭṭhāna bhāvato
translated: on all sides. Conscience is like a surrounding wall because it is the foundation of the virtue-rampart.

original: Vuttañhetaṃ – “pariyāyapathoti kho bhikkhu hiriyā etaṃ adhivacana”nti. Dvāraṃ viya
analyzed: vuttam ha etam pariyāya pathaḥ ti kho bhikkhu hiriyā etam adhivacananti dvāram viya
translated: For this is said: “The surrounding wall, bhikkhu, is a term for conscience” . Shame is like a door-panel because it is the foundation of the surrounding wall of conscience.

original: ariyamaggo nibbānanagarappavesane añjasabhāvato. Paṇḍitadovāriko viya dhammasenāpati🔽nibbānanagaraṃ paviṭṭhapavisanakānaṃ sattānaṃ sallakkhaṇato. Dinnoti dāpito, sodhitoti
analyzed: ariya maggaḥ nibbāna nagara ppavesane añjasa bhāvataḥ paṇḍita dovārikaḥ viya dhamma senāpati  nibbāna nagaram paviṭṭha pavisanakānam sattānam sat lakkhaṇataḥ dinnaḥ iti dāpitaḥ sodhitaḥ iti
translated: and the Noble Path is like the guide, since it is the means of entry to the city of Nibbāna. The Dhamma-leader is like the wise door-keeper,

original: attho. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: attho sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: since he observes beings who have entered the city of Nibbāna. “Given” means “handed over,” “purified” is the meaning. The rest is easy to understand.

original: 3. Cundasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: cunda sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Cunda Sutta

original: 379. Pubbe sāvatthito veḷuvagāmassa gatattā vuttaṃ “āgatamaggeneva paṭinivattanto”ti.
analyzed: pubbe sāvatthitaḥ veḷuva gāmassa gata ttā vuttam āgata maggena iva paṭinivattanto ti
translated: Since he had previously gone from Sāvatthī to the village of Veḷuva, it is said, “turning back on the very road he had come.”

original: Sattannanti upaseno, revato, khadiravaniyo, cundo, samaṇuddeso ahanti catunnaṃ, cālā,🔽upacālā, sīsūpacālāti, tissannanti imesaṃ sattannaṃ arahantānaṃ. Natthi nu khoti🔽etthāpi “olokento”ti ānetvā sambandho sīhāvalokanañāyena. Bhavissanti me vattāro
analyzed: upasenaḥ revataḥ khadira vaniyaḥ cundo samaṇa uddesaḥ catunnam  upacālā sīsūpacālā ati imesam sattannam arahantānam natthi nu kho ti  ettha api olokento ti ānetvā sambandhaḥ sīha avalokana ñāyena bhavissanti me vattāro
translated: “Of the seven” means of the four: Upasena, Revata, Khadiravaniya, Cunda, and the novice monk, and of the three: Cālā,🔽Upacālā, and Sīsūpacālā. “Is there no one” here the connection is to be supplied as “looking” . The method is like the “lion’s look.” “They will say of me”

original: harituṃ nāsakkhīti sambandho. Idaṃ dāni pacchimadassananti bhūtakathanamattaṃ, na
analyzed: haritum na asakkhi iti sambandhaḥ idam dāni pacchima dassanam ti bhūta kathana mattam na
translated: the connection is to be supplied as “I was not able to carry away.” This is the last sight now is just a statement of fact, not a

original: tattha sālayatādassanaṃ yathā tathāgatassa vesāliyā nikkhamitvā nāgāpalokitaṃ.
analyzed: tattha sa ālaya tā dassanam yathā tathāgatassa vesāliyā nikkhamitvā nāga apalokitam
translated: Herein, the showing of the reed-bed is like the Tathāgata’s looking back at Vesāli on leaving it.

original: Tassa tassa visesassa adhiṭṭhānavaseneva iddhibhedadassanaṃ iddhivikubbanaṃ. Sīhassa🔽vijambhanādivasena kīḷitvā nādasadisī ayaṃ dhammakathāti vuttaṃ “sīhavikīḷito dhammapariyāyo”ti.
analyzed: tassa tassa visesassa adhiṭṭhāna vasena iva iddhi bheda dassanam iddhi vikubbanam sīhassa  vijambhana ādi vasena kīḷitvā nāda sadisī ayam dhamma kathā iti vuttam sīha vikīḷitaḥ dhamma pariyāyaḥ ti
translated: The showing of the various kinds of supernormal power is the ‘miracle of supernormal power’ in the sense of the establishment of this or that particular kind of supernormal power.🔽This is like the lion’s roar, which is a kind of talk on the True Idea. That is why it is said that ‘the lion’s roar of the True Idea’ was spoken.🔽The meaning of ‘the time for going away’ is this. The word ‘iti’ is a particle that has the sense of completion.

original: Gamanakālo mayhantīti ettha iti-saddo parisamāpane. Tena therena yathārambhassa vacanapabandhassa
analyzed: gamana kālaḥ mayhanti iti ettha iti saddo parisamāpane tena therena yathā ārambhassa vacana pabandhassa
translated: So it illuminates the fact that the statement made by the elder was completed in the way begun.

original: samāpitabhāvaṃ joteti. Esa nayo sesesupi edisesu sabbaṭṭhānesu. Yugandharādayo paribhaṇḍapabbatāti
analyzed: samāpita bhāvam jotā iti esa nayo sesesu pi edisesu sabba ṭṭhānesu yugandhara ādayo paribhaṇḍa pabbatā ti
translated: This method applies in all such instances. The mountains Yugandhara, etc., should be understood as the outer range of mountains.🔽‘In a single impact’ : as if in a single impact.

original: veditabbā. Ekappahārenevāti ekappahārena iva. Svāyaṃ iva-saddo na sakkomīti ettha🔽ānetvā sambandhitabbo.
analyzed: veditabbā eka pahārena iva ati eka ppahārena iva su ayam iva saddaḥ na sakkomi iti ettha  ānetvā sambandhitabbaḥ
translated: This ‘iva’ particle should be construed as in the phrase ‘I am not able’ .🔽‘I will make him come to me by standing still’: I will make him come to me by standing still.

original: Paṭipādessāmīti ṭhitakāyaṃ paṭipādessāmi. Patthanākāle anomadassissa bhagavato vacanasutānusārena
analyzed: paṭipādessāmi iti ṭhita kāyam paṭipādessāmi patthanā kāle anomadassissa bhagavataḥ vacana suta anusārena
translated: At the time of his aspiration he had heard the Blessed One Anomadassī’s words and had acted according to them.

original: ñāṇena diṭṭhamattataṃ sandhāya “taṃ paṭhamadassana”nti vuttaṃ. Dhāretuṃ asakkontī🔽guṇasāraṃ. Esa maggoti eso jātānaṃ sattānaṃ maraṇaniṭṭhito pantho. Punapi evaṃbhāvino
analyzed: ñāṇena diṭṭha matta tam sandhāya tam paṭhama dassanam ti vuttam dhāretum a sakkontī  guṇa sāram esa maggo ti eso jātānam sattānam maraṇa niṭṭhito pantho puna api evaṃbhāvino
translated: Unable to bear🔽The essence of his virtues. “This is the path”: this is the path to the end of the death of beings who are born.

original: nāma saṅkhārāti saṅkhārā nāma evaṃbhāvino, maraṇapariyosānāti attho. Ettakanti ettakaṃ
analyzed: nāma saṅkhārā ati saṅkhārāḥ nāma evaṃbhāvinaḥ maraṇa pariyosānā ti attho ettakanti ettakam
translated: Again, “such formations”: formations of such a kind, ending in death, is the meaning. “So much”: so much

original: kālaṃ. Saṅkaḍḍhitvā saṃharitvā. Mukhaṃ pidhāyāti mukhaṃ chādetvā. Agghikasatānīti
analyzed: kālam saṅkaḍḍhitvā saṃharitvā mukham pidhāya ati mukham chādetvā agghika satāni iti
translated: time. “Having gathered together”: having collected. “Having covered his face”: having covered his face. “Hundreds of agghis”:

original: makuḷaṅkuracetiyasatāni.🔽Purimadivaseti atītadivase. Yasmā dhammasenāpatino arahattappattadivaseyeva satthu
analyzed: makuḷa aṅkura cetiya satāni  purima divasa iti atīta divase yasmai dhammasenāpatino satthu
translated: hundreds of makuḷa sprouts.🔽“On the previous day”: on the past day. Since the assembly of disciples

original: sāvakasannipāto ahosi, tasmā “pūritasāvakasannipāto esa bhikkhū”ti vuttaṃ. Pañca
analyzed: sāvaka sannipātaḥ ahosi tasmā pūrita sāvaka sannipātaḥ esa bhikkhu iti vuttam pañca
translated: was held on the very day that the General of the Dhamma attained arahantship, therefore it is said: “This assembly of monks was complete.”

original: jātisatānīti bhummatthe, accantasaṃyoge vā upayogavacanaṃ.
analyzed: jāti satāni iti bhumma tthe a c c anta saṃyoge vā upayoga vacanam
translated: Five hundred births: in the sense of a measure, or in the sense of extreme connection, the word “use” is used.

original: Kaḷopihatthoti vilīvamayabhājanahattho. “Cammamayabhājanahattho”ti ca vadanti. Purantareti nagaramajjhe. Vaneti araññe.
analyzed: kaḷopi hattho ti vilīva maya bhājana hattho camma maya bhājana hattho ti ca vadanti purantare iti nagara majjhe vane iti araññe
translated: “With a bowl in his hand” means with a bowl made of clay in his hand. “With a bowl made of skin in his hand” is another reading. “In the middle of the city” means in the middle of the town. “In the forest” means in the wilderness.

original: Osakkanākāravirahitoti dhammadesanāya saṅkocahetuvirahito. Visāradoti sāradavirahito.🔽Dhammojanti dhammarasaṃ, ojavantaṃ desanādhammanti attho. Dhammabhoganti dhammaparibhogaṃ,
analyzed: osakkana ākāra virahito ti dhamma desanāya saṅkoca hetu virahitaḥ visāradaḥ ti sārada virahitaḥ  dhammojanti dhamma rasam ojavantam desanā dhammanti attho dhamma bhoganti dhamma paribhogam
translated: “Without the manner of turning away” means without the cause of turning away from teaching the Dhamma. “Without fear” means without timidity.🔽“The taste of the Dhamma” means the taste of the Dhamma, the nourishment of the teaching of the Dhamma, is the meaning. “The enjoyment of the Dhamma” means

original: parehi saddhiṃ saṃvibhajanavasena pavattaṃ dhammasambhoganti desanādhammameva vadati.
analyzed: parehi saddhim saṃvibhajana vasena pavattam dhamma sambhogam ti desanā dhammam eva vadati
translated: the enjoyment of the Dhamma. He says it is the teaching of the Dhamma itself that occurs by way of sharing with others.

original: Tena vuttaṃ “ubhayenapi dhammaparibhogova kathito”ti.
analyzed: tena vuttam ubhayena api dhamma paribhogaḥ eva kathito ti
translated: Therefore it is said: “By both of these, only the enjoyment of the Dhamma is spoken of.”

original: Piyāyitabbato piyehi. Manassa vaḍḍhanato manāpehi. Jātiyāti khattiyādijātiyā. Nānābhāvo
analyzed: piyāyitabbataḥ piyehi manassa vaḍḍhanataḥ manāpehi jātiyā ati khattiya ādi jātiyā nānābhāvaḥ
translated: “Dear” because of being dear. “Delightful” because of delighting the mind. “By birth” means by the birth of a noble, etc. “Different” means

original: asahabhāvo visuṃbhāvo. Aññathābhāvo aññathattaṃ. Sarīranti rūpadhammakāyasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: asahabhāvaḥ visuṃbhāvaḥ aññathābhāvaḥ aññathattam sarīran ti rūpa dhamma kāya saṅkhātam
translated: not together, not in common, separate. “Otherwise” means otherwise, in a different way. “Body” means the body consisting of material phenomena,

original: sarīraṃ. Rūpakāye hi bhijjante bhijjanteva. So bhijjeyyāti so mahantataro khandho bhijjeyya.
analyzed: sarīram rūpa kāye hi bhijjante bhijjantā iva saḥ bhijjeyya ati saḥ mahantataraḥ khandhaḥ bhijjeyya
translated: The body. For the material body breaks up again and again. If it were to break up, then that big trunk would break up.

original: Dakkhiṇadisaṃ gatoti dakkhiṇadisāmukhe pavatto. Mahākhandho viyāti mahanto sāravanto
analyzed: dakkhiṇa disam gataḥ ti dakkhiṇa disā mukhe pavattaḥ mahā khandhaḥ viyāti mahanto sāravanto
translated: Gone to the south: turned to the south. Like a big trunk: like a big trunk with heartwood.

original: sākhākhandho viya. Sākhakhandhā hi disābhimukhapavattākārā, mūlakhandho pana uddhamuggato.
analyzed: sākhā khandhaḥ viya sākha khandhāḥ hi disa abhimukha pavatta ākārāḥ mūla khandhaḥ pana uddham uggataḥ
translated: For trunks with branches are turned to the directions, while the root trunk is upright.

original: Soḷasannaṃ pañhānanti soḷasannaṃ aparāpariyapavattaniyānaṃ atthānaṃ. Ñātuṃ icchito hi attho pañho.
analyzed: soḷasannam pañhānam ti soḷasannam apara apariya pavatta niyānam atthānam ñātum icchitaḥ hi attho pañho
translated: Of the sixteen questions: of the sixteen matters that occur in succession. For a matter that is desired to be known is a question.

original: 4-5. Ukkacelasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Ukkacelā Sutta

original: 380-381. Amāvasuposatheti amāvasiuposathe, kālapakkhauposatheti attho. Purimanayenevāti anantarasutte vuttanayeneva.
analyzed: amāvasu posatha iti amāvasi uposathe kāla pakkha uposatha iti attho purima nayena iva āti anantara sutte vutta nayena iva
translated: On the Uposatha of the new moon: on the Uposatha of the new moon; the meaning is, on the Uposatha of the dark fortnight. In the same way as before: in the same way as in the immediately preceding sutta.

original: 6. Uttiyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: uttiya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Uttiya Sutta

original: 382. Maccudheyyassāti maccuno pavattiṭṭhānassa.
analyzed: maccudheyyassa ati maccuno pavatti ṭṭhānassa
translated: The realm of Death: the realm of the occurrence of death.

original: 8. Brahmasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: brahma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Brahmā Sutta

original: 384. Tasmiṃ kāleti paṭhamābhisambodhiyaṃ. Bhikkhuyeva natthi dhammacakkassa appavattitattā,
analyzed: tasmin kāle ti paṭhama abhisambodhiyam bhikkhu yā iva na atthi dhammacakkassa
translated: In that life: in the first enlightenment. There is no bhikkhu because the wheel of the Dhamma has not yet been set in motion,

original: bhikkhuyeva bhikkhulakkhaṇayogato. Ekako maggo, na dvedhāpathabhūtoti ekamaggo, taṃ
analyzed: bhikkhuyā iva bhikkhu lakkhaṇa yogataḥ ekakaḥ maggaḥ na dvedhā patha bhūto ti eka maggo tam
translated: The one path, not a path that is two-fold, is the one path.

original: ekamaggaṃ. Jātiyā khayo vaṭṭadukkhassa antabhūtoti jātikkhayanto, nibbānaṃ, taṃ diṭṭhattā
analyzed: eka maggam jātiyāḥ khayaḥ vaṭṭa dukkhassa anta bhūto ti jāti khaya antaḥ nibbānam tam diṭṭha ttā
translated: That is the one path. The destruction of birth, being the end of the suffering of the round, is the end of the destruction of birth, Nibbāna. Because he has seen that,

original: jātikkhayantadassīti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: he is one who has seen the end of the destruction of birth. This is how the meaning should be regarded here.

original: 9. Sedakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sedaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Explanation of the Sutta on the Leaning Tree

original: 385. Ayaṃ tassa laddhīti ayaṃ idāni vuccamānā tassa ācariyassa laddhi. Tato anāmentoti
analyzed: ayam tassa laddhi iti ayam idāni vuccamānā tassa ācariyassa laddhi tatas
translated: This is the opinion of that teacher, which is now being stated.

original: yena vaṃso namati, tena kāyaṃ anāmento. Tathā namanto hi patitvā cuṇṇavicuṇṇaṃ hoti.
analyzed: yena vaṃsaḥ namati tena kāyam tathā namantaḥ hi patitvā cuṇṇa vicuṇṇam hoti
translated: Without bending his body: without bending his body in the direction in which the tree leans. For if he were to bend it in that way, he would fall and be smashed to pieces.🔽That: the body, or the tree.

original: Tanti kāyaṃ, taṃ vaṃsaṃ vā. Ākaḍḍhento viyāti namitaṭṭhānato parabhāgena ākaḍḍhento
analyzed: tanti kāyam tam vaṃsam vā ākaḍḍhentaḥ viyāti namita ṭṭhānataḥ parabhāgena ākaḍḍhentaḥ
translated: As if drawing it: as if drawing it by the opposite side from the side it is leaning on.

original: viya. Ekatobhāgiyaṃ katvāti yathāvuttaṃ satiṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ katvā onataṃ viya katvā.
analyzed: viya ekatobhāgiyam katvā iti yathāvuttam satim su upaṭṭhitam katvā onatam viya katvā
translated: Having made it one-sided: having made it as if bent, having made his mindfulness well-established as already described.

original: Tathā karaṇaṃ pana tathā vātūpatthambhagāhāpanenāti āha – “vātūpatthambhaṃ gāhāpetvā”ti.
analyzed: tathā karaṇam pana tathā vātu upatthambha gāhāpanena ati āha vātu upatthambham gāhāpetvā iti
translated: But the making it so is by means of taking a support in the way stated, thus he said, “having taken a support in the way stated.”

original: Tañca satiyā tadatthaṃ upaṭṭhānenāti vuttaṃ “satiṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ katvā”ti. Niccalova
analyzed: tat ca satiyā tad attham upaṭṭhānena ati vuttam satim su upaṭṭhitam katvā iti niccalaḥ va
translated: And that is by means of mindfulness and by means of the state of being present at the meaning, thus it is said, “having established mindfulness well” .

original: nisīdanto antevāsī ācariyaṃ rakkhati, ettakaṃ ācariyassa laddhivasena vuttaṃ. “Ācariyo
analyzed: nisīdantaḥ antevāsī ācariyam rakkhati ettakam ācariyassa laddhi vasena vuttam ācariyo
translated: When the pupil sits down without moving, he protects the teacher. This much is said by way of the teacher’s allowance.

original: vaṃsaṃ suggahitaṃ gaṇhanto”tiādi sabbaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayameva.
analyzed: vaṃsam su gahitam gaṇhanto tiādi sabbam heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva
translated: “The teacher, taking the lineage well-held” , etc., is all in the way already stated.

original: “Attānameva rakkhatī”ti idaṃ attano rakkhaṇaṃ padhānaṃ katvā vuttaṃ, na antevāsikanti
analyzed: attānam eva rakkhati iti idam attanaḥ rakkhaṇam padhānam katvā vuttam na antevāsikam ti
translated: “He protects himself alone” : this is said by way of the pre-eminence of his own protection, not by way of the pupil’s protection.

original: avadhāraṇaphalaṃ. Attarakkhāya panettha sijjhamānāya antevāsikarakkhāpi siddhā eva🔽hotīti. Dutiyapakkhepi eseva nayo. So tattha ñāyoti yā attano eva rakkhā, sā atthato
analyzed: avadhāraṇa phalam atta rakkhāya pana ittha sijjhamānāya antevāsika rakkhā api siddhā eva  hoti iti dutiya pakkhe pi esā iva nayo so tattha ñāyaḥ ti yā attanaḥ eva rakkhā sā atthato
translated: The result of the limitation is that, when his own protection succeeds here, the pupil’s protection succeeds too.🔽In the second case, the same method applies. “That is the way there” : the meaning of his own protection is also protection of the other.

original: pararakkhāpi hotīti ayamettha ñāyo yuttappayogo. Anuvaḍḍhiyāti yathāvaḍḍhitassa anuanuvaḍḍhiyā.
analyzed: para rakkhā api hoti iti ayam ettha ñāyaḥ yutta ppayogaḥ anuvaḍḍhiya ati yathā vaḍḍhitassa anuanuvaḍḍhiya
translated: This is the way, the proper application, here. “He grows with his growth” : by the growth of one who has grown.

original: Etena paṭiladdhasampayuttapamodanākāro dassitoti āha – “sapubbabhāgāya muditāyāti
analyzed: etena paṭiladdha sampayutta pamodana ākāraḥ dassito ti āha sa pubbabhāgāya muditāya ati
translated: By this, the mode of rejoicing in the acquisition of the associated virtue is shown. Thus it is said, “with the gladness that has the prior portion” .

original: attho”ti. Āsevanāyātiādīni padāni anudayatāpariyosānāni (yasmā satipaṭṭhānaṃ sevantassa
analyzed: atthaḥ ti āsevanāya atiādīni padāni anudaya tā pariyosānāni yasmā sati paṭṭhānam sevantassa
translated: The words “cultivation” and so on, ending with “non-decline,”🔽indicate the protection of oneself and others for one who cultivates the foundations of mindfulness.

original: siddhaṃ attano ca parassa ca rakkhaṇaṃ pakāsenti, tasmā) – “attānaṃ, bhikkhave, rakkhissāmīti
analyzed: siddham attanaḥ ca parassa ca rakkhaṇam pakāsenti tasmai attānam bhikkhave rakkhissāmi iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “Bhikkhus, if you wish to protect yourselves,

original: satipaṭṭhānaṃ sevitabba”ntiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sati paṭṭhānam sevitabba ntiādi vuttam
translated: you should cultivate the foundations of mindfulness.”

original: 10. Janapadakalyāṇīsuttavaṇṇanā🔽386. Janapadasmiṃ kalyāṇīti sakalajanapade bhaddā rūpasampattiyā sikkhāsampattiyā
analyzed: janapadasmim kalyāṇī iti sakala janapade bhaddā rūpa sampattiyā sikkhā sampattiyā
translated: The Explanation of the Discourse on the Most Excellent in the Country🔽She is most excellent in the country: she is the most excellent, the most beautiful, in the whole country, by virtue of her physical beauty and her virtue.

original: ca sundarā seṭṭhā. Rūpasampatti ca nāma sabbaso rūpadosābhāvena rūpaguṇapāripūriyā🔽hotīti tadubhayaṃ dassetuṃ “chasarīradosarahitā pañcakalyāṇasamannāgatā”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Taṃ duvidhampi vivaranto “sā hī”tiādimāha. Pañcakalyāṇasamannāgatāti pañcavidhasarīraguṇasampadāhi
analyzed: ca sundarā seṭṭhā rūpa sampatti ca nāma sabbaso rūpa dosa abhāvena rūpa guṇa pāripūriyā  hoti iti tat ubhayam dassetum cha sarīra dosa rahitā pañca kalyāṇa samannāgatā iti vuttam  tam sā hi iti ādim āha sā hi iti ādim āha
translated: And physical beauty is due to the complete absence of any physical defect and to the perfection of physical qualities.🔽In order to show both of these, it is said that she is “free from the six defects of the body and endowed with the five factors of excellence.”🔽In order to explain these two kinds of excellence, the Exalted One says: “She is not too tall or too short,” and so on.

original: samannāgatā. Nātidīghā nātirassāti pamāṇamajjhimā dīghatarappamāṇā na hoti, na atirassā,
analyzed: samannāgatā na atidīghā na atirassā ati pamāṇa majjhimā dīghatara pamāṇā na hoti na atirassā
translated: Endowed with the five factors of excellence: endowed with the five kinds of excellence of the body.

original: lakuṇḍakarūpā na hoti. Nātikisāti ativiya kisathaddhamaṃsalohitā dissamānā aṭṭhisarīrā🔽jālasarīrā na hoti. Nātithūlāti bhāriyamaṃsā mahodarā na hoti. Nātikāḷā nāccodātāti🔽ativiya kāḷavaṇṇā jhāmaṅgāro viya, dadhitakkādīhi pamajjitamattakaṃsalohavaṇṇā na
analyzed: lakuṇḍaka rūpā na hoti kisa thaddha maṃsa lohitā dissamānā aṭṭhi sarīrā  jāla sarīrā na hoti na ati thūlā ati bhāriya maṃsā mahā udarā na hoti na ati kāḷā na accodātā ati  kāḷa vaṇṇā jhāmaṅgāraḥ viya dadhi takka ādīhi pamajjita matta kaṃsa loha vaṇṇā na
translated: He is not of dwarfish appearance. He is not too tall. He is not too short. He is not too thin. He is not too fat. He is not too dark. He is not too fair.

original: hoti. Manussaloke tādisiyā rūpasampattiyā abhāvato atikkantā manussavaṇṇaṃ. Yathā🔽pamāṇayuttā, evaṃ ārohapariṇāhayogato ca paresaṃ pasādāvahā nātidīghatādayo. Evaṃ🔽manussānaṃ dibbarūpatāsampattīpīti vuttaṃ “appattā dibbavaṇṇa”nti. Ettha ca nātidīghanātirassatāvacanena🔽ārohasampatti vuttā ubbedhena pāsādikabhāvato. Kisathūladosābhāvavacanena pariṇāhasampatti🔽vuttā. Ubhayenapi saṇṭhānasampadā vibhāvitā, nātikāḷatāvacanena vaṇṇasampatti vuttā
analyzed: hoti manussa loke tādisiyāḥ rūpa sampattiyāḥ abhāvataḥ atikkantā manussa vaṇṇam yathā 🔽pamāṇa yuttāḥ evam āroha pariṇāha yogataḥ ca paresam pasāda āvahāḥ na ati dīgha tā ādayaḥ evam 🔽manussānam dibba rūpa tā sampattīpī iti vuttam appattā dibba vaṇṇanti ettha ca na ati dīgha na ati rassa tā vacanena 🔽āroha sampatti vuttā ubbedhena pāsādika bhāvataḥ kisa thūla dosa abhāva vacanena pariṇāha sampatti 🔽vuttā ubhayena api saṇṭhāna sampadā vibhāvitā na ati kāḷa tā vacanena vaṇṇa sampatti vuttā
translated: He is not of a network-like appearance. He is not of a skeleton-like appearance. He is not of a mottled appearance. He is not of a striped appearance. He is not of a motley appearance. He is not of a dappled appearance. He is not of a ruddy appearance. He is not of a livid appearance. He is not of a livid-streaked appearance. He is not of a sallow appearance. He is not of a sallow-streaked appearance. He is not of a coal-black appearance. He is not of a charcoal-black appearance. He is not of a sooty appearance. He is not of a sooty-streaked appearance. He is not of a lead-coloured appearance. He is not of a lead-streaked appearance. He is not of a copper-coloured appearance. He is not of a copper-streaked appearance. He is not of a brass-coloured appearance. He is not of a brass-streaked appearance. He is not of a silver-coloured appearance. He is not of a silver-streaked appearance. He is not of a golden-coloured appearance. He is not of a golden-streaked appearance. He is not of a red-coloured appearance. He is not of a red-streaked appearance. He is not of a blue-coloured appearance. He is not of a blue-streaked appearance. He is not of a yellow-coloured appearance. He is not of a yellow-streaked appearance. He is not of a white-coloured appearance. He is not of a white-streaked appearance. He is not of a black-coloured appearance. He is not of a black-streaked appearance. He is not of a spotted appearance. He is not of a dappled appearance. He is not of a mottled appearance. He is not of a striped appearance. He is not of a ruddy appearance. He is not of a livid appearance. He is not of a livid-streaked appearance. He is not of a sallow appearance. He is not of a sallow-streaked appearance. He is not of a coal-black appearance. He is not of a charcoal-black appearance. He is not of a sooty appearance. He is not of

original: vivaṇṇatābhāvato. Piyaṅgusāmāti pariṇatapiyaṅgupupphasadisasarīranibhāsā. Mukhapariyosānanti
analyzed: vivaṇṇa tā bhāvataḥ piyaṅgu sāmā ati pariṇata piyaṅgu puppha sadisa sarīra nibhāsā mukha pariyosānanti
translated: and because of the absence of pallor. Piyaṅgusāmā: having a bodily complexion like a developed piyaṅgu flower. Mukhapariyosānā:

original: adharoṭṭhamāha. Ayaṃ yathāvuttā sarīravaṇṇasampatti. Assāti janapadakalyāṇiyā. Chavikalyāṇatā
analyzed: adharoṭṭham āha ayam yathā vuttā sarīra vaṇṇa sampatti assa ati janapada kalyāṇiyā chavi kalyāṇa tā
translated: the lower lip is what is meant. This is the possession of bodily complexion described as above. Assa: of the beauty of the country. Chavikalyāṇatā:

original: chavisampattihetukattā tassā. Esa nayo sesesupi. Nakhā eva pattasadisatāya nakhapattāni.
analyzed: chavi sampatti hetuka ttā tassāḥ esa nayo sesesu pi nakhāḥ eva patta sadisa tāya nakha pattāni
translated: the possession of softness is the cause for her softness. The same method applies to the rest. Nakhapattāni: the nails are like leaves.

original: (Pasāvo sarīrāvayavena iriyananti āha – “pavattīti attho”ti, pasāvo yathāparitameva
analyzed: pasāvaḥ sarīra avayavena iriyananti āha pavatti iti attho ti pasāvaḥ yathāparitam eva
translated: (The word pasāvo is a part of the body. It moves, thus it is said: “The meaning is that it moves.” The pasāva moves only as far as the limit of the skin,

original: kanatanti, na sabhāvasandhānaṃ. Yathāvibhāvasena uttamameva naccaṃ naccati. Te vā🔽vīsatiyāsūtiraṃ dhānappattiyā pavattiyā pavattimakatamandatā vibhāvasuṭatassa uttamameva
analyzed: na sabhāva sandhānam yathā vibhāvasena uttamam eva naccam naccati te vā  dhāna ppattiyā pavattiyā uttamam eva
translated: not by connecting with the inside. She dances only the highest dance according to the highest ability. She sings only the highest song

original: gītañca gāyatīti attho.) [Etthantare pāṭho asuddho dussodhanīyo ca. Suddhapāṭho gavesitabbo.]
analyzed: gītam ca gāyati iti atthaḥ etthantare pāṭhaḥ asuddhaḥ dussodhanīyaḥ ca suddha pāṭhaḥ gavesitabbo
translated: according to the highest ability of the voice. The meaning is that she sings.) [The text in between here is corrupt and difficult to correct. A pure text should be sought.]

original: Samatittiko telapattoti mukhavattisamaṃ telānaṃ pūritattā samatittikamukhaṃ telabhājanaṃ.
analyzed: sama tittikaḥ tela patto ti mukha vat tisamam telānam pūrita ttā sama tittika mukham tela bhājanam
