translated: The oil-tube is a vessel for oil, its mouth being the same size as its base,

original: Antarena ca mahāsamajjaṃ antarena ca janapadakalyāṇinti janapadakalyāṇiyā, tassā
analyzed: antarena ca mahā samajjam antarena ca janapada kalyāṇinti janapada kalyāṇiyā tassā
translated: and between the great crowd and the beauty of the land is the beauty of the land,

original: ca naccagītaṃ pekkhituṃ sannipatitamahājanasamūhassa majjhato pariharitabbo netabbo.
analyzed: ca nacca gītam pekkhitum sannipatita mahā jana samūhassa majjhataḥ pariharitabbaḥ netabbaḥ
translated: and it should be carried in the middle of the great crowd gathered to see her dancing and singing.

original: Nanti telaṃ. Āhareyyāti āpajjeyya. Tatridaṃ opammasaṃsandanaṃ – telapattaṃ viya kāyagatāsati,
analyzed: telam āhareyya ati āpajjeyya tatra idam opamma saṃsandanam tela pattam viya kāyagata asati
translated: Oil is the oil. Should bring: should incur. Here is the correlation of the similes: mindfulness occupied with the body is like the oil-tube,

original: tassa pariharaṇapuggalo viya vipassako, janakāyā viya puthuttārammaṇāni, asipuriso
analyzed: tassa pariharaṇa puggalaḥ viya vipassakaḥ jana kāyāḥ viya puthutta ārammaṇāni asipuriso
translated: the meditator who carries it is like the meditator, the various objects of consciousness are like the crowd,🔽the sword is like the mind, the spilling of the oil is like the arising of defilements,

original: viya mano, telassa cajanaṃ viya kilesuppādanaṃ, sīsapātanaṃ viya ariyamaggañāṇasīsānuppatti.
analyzed: viya manaḥ telassa cajanam viya kilesa uppādanam sīsa pātanam viya ariya magga ñāṇa sīsa anuppatti
translated: and the falling of the sissoo flowers is like the descent of the noble path knowledge.

original: “Kāyagatā sati no bhāvitā…pe… sikkhitabba”nti vuttattā “pubbabhāgavipassanāva kathitā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kāya gatā sati no bhāvita āpe sikkhitabban ti vutta ttā pubbabhāga vipassanā ava kathitā iti vuttam
translated: “Mindfulness occupied with the body has not been developed … trained” .

original: Nālandavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽3. Sīlaṭṭhitivaggo
analyzed: nālanda vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sīla ṭṭhiti vaggo
translated: The explanation of the Nālandā Group is ended.🔽The Chapter on the Support of Virtue

original: 1-2. Sīlasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Sīlakkhandhavagga is ended.

original: 387-388. Sīlānīti bahuvacanaṃ anekavidhattā sīlassa. Tañhi sīlanaṭṭhena ekavidhampi🔽cārittādivasena anekavidhaṃ. Tenāha – “catupārisuddhisīlānī”ti. Pañhamaggoti ñātuṃ
analyzed: sīlāni iti bahuvacanam sīlassa tat hi sīlana ṭṭhena ekavidham pi  cāritta ādi vasena anekavidham tena āha catu pārisuddhi sīlāni iti ñātum
translated: “Moralities” : the plural is because of the many kinds of morality. For that is of one kind in the sense of moral action ,

original: icchitassa atthassa vīmaṃsanaṃ. Tenāha – “pañhagavesana”nti.
analyzed: icchitassa atthassa vīmaṃsanam tena āha pañha gavesanam ti
translated: but of many kinds in the sense of conduct, etc. Hence it is said: “The moralities consisting in the four purifications” . “Questioning” : the investigation of a matter desired to be known. Hence it is said: “The seeking of a question” .

original: 3-5. Parihānasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition of the Parinibbāna Sutta, etc.

original: 389-391. Puggalavasena parihānaṃ hoti na dhammavasena. Yo na bhāveti, tasseva parihāyati. Tenāha “yo hī”tiādi.
analyzed: puggala vasena parihānam hoti na dhamma vasena yaḥ na bhāveti tassa iva parihāyati tena āha yaḥ hi itiādi
translated: The falling away is according to the person, not according to the Dhamma. It is only the one who does not develop that falls away. Hence it is said: “The one who does not develop” , etc.

original: 6. Padesasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: padesa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition of the Part Sutta

original: 392. Padesato bhāvitattāti ekadesato bhāvitattā bhāvanāpāripūriyā ananuppattattā. Tenāha – “cattāro hi magge”tiādi.
analyzed: padesataḥ bhāvita ttā iti eka desataḥ bhāvita ttā bhāvanā pāripūriyā ananuppatta ttā tena āha cattāraḥ hi magga itiādi
translated: “From the part” : because of being developed by part, because of not reaching the fulfilment of development. Hence it is said: “For there are four paths” , etc.

original: 7. Samattasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samatta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition of the Whole Sutta

original: 393. Samattā bhāvitattāti pariyattā bhāvitattā.
analyzed: samattā bhāvita ttā ati pariyattā bhāvita ttā
translated: “Whole” : because of being developed in entirety.

original: 8-10. Lokasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition of the World Sutta, etc.

original: 394-396. Mahāvisayattā mahatiyo abhiññā etassāti mahābhiñño, tassa bhāvoti sabbaṃ
analyzed: mahā visaya ttā mahatiyaḥ abhiññā etassa ati mahābhiñño tassa bhāvaḥ ti sabbam
translated: He who has great direct-knowledge because of its great scope is “of great direct-knowledge” . The state of that is “great direct-knowledge-ness” .

original: vattabbaṃ. “Satatavihāravasena vutta”nti vatvā tamatthaṃ pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ “thero kirā”tiādi
analyzed: vattabbam satata vihāra vasena vuttan ti vatvā tam attham pākaṭam kātum theraḥ kirāti ādi
translated: “It is said in terms of the abiding in the eternal,” and in order to make the meaning clear he says, “The elder, it seems.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tassāti therassa. Āvajjanassa gatinti ekāvajjanasseva gamanavīthiṃ. Anubandhati
analyzed: vuttam tassa ati therassa āvajjanassa gatim ti eka āvajjanassa iva gamana vīthim anubandhati
translated: “His” means the elder’s. “The course of the adverting”: the course of the single adverting. “He follows”

original: cakkavāḷānaṃ sahassaṃ ekāvajjaneneva sahassalokadhātuyā icchitamatthaṃ jānituṃ samatthoti dasseti.
analyzed: cakkavāḷānam sahassam ekāvajjanena iva sahassa lokadhātuyāḥ icchitam attham jānitum samatthaḥ ti dasseti
translated: shows that he is able to know the desired meaning in a world system of a thousand worlds with a single adverting.

original: Sīlaṭṭhitivaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sīla ṭṭhiti vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the “Section on the Upright One in Virtue” is finished.

original: 4. Ananussutavaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: ananussuta vagga vaṇṇanā
translated: The “Section on the Unheard”

original: 397-407. Yā vedanā sammasitvāti yā tebhūmakavedanā sammasitvā. Tāvassāti tā tebhūmakavedanā
analyzed: yā vedanā sammasitvā ati yā tebhūmaka vedanā sammasitvā tāvassā ati tā tebhūmaka vedanā
translated: “Having comprehended the feeling”: having comprehended the feeling of the three planes. “That”

original: eva assa bhikkhuno. Sadisavasena cetaṃ vuttaṃ, aniccādisammasanavasena viditā pubbabhāge
analyzed: eva assa bhikkhuno sadisa vasena ca itam vuttam anicca ādi sammasana vasena viditā pubba bhāge
translated: means that the bhikkhu’s feeling of the three planes. This is said according to similarity. In the earlier stage, when the feeling of the three planes is known by way of the comprehension of impermanence, etc.,

original: sammasanakāle upaṭṭhahanti. Pariggahitesūti parijānanavasena paricchijja gahitesu.
analyzed: sammasana kāle upaṭṭhahanti pariggahitesu iti parijānana vasena paricchijja gahitesu
translated: it appears. “When they are apprehended”: when they are apprehended by defining them by way of full-understanding.🔽“Feeling is the root of the proliferation of craving,🔽thinking is the root of the proliferation of conceit,

original: “Vedanā taṇhāpapañcassa, vitakko mānapapañcassa, saññā diṭṭhipapañcassa mūlavasena
analyzed: vedanā taṇhā papañcassa vitakkaḥ māna papañcassa saññā diṭṭhi papañcassa mūla vasena
translated: and perception is the root of the proliferation of views.”

original: sammasanaṃ vuttā”ti vadanti. “Vedanāvitakkasaññā taṇhāmānadiṭṭhipapañcānaṃ mūladassanavasenā”ti apare.
analyzed: sammasanam vuttā iti vadanti vedanā vitakka saññā taṇhā māna diṭṭhi pa pañcānam mūla dassana vasena ati apare
translated: “The contemplation of feeling, etc., are stated as the direct-comprehension of the roots of craving, conceit, and views.”

original: Ananussutavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Amatavaggo
analyzed: ananussuta vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  a mata vaggaḥ
translated: The exposition of the “Unlearned” chapter is ended.🔽The Chapter on the Deathless

original: 2. Samudayasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: samudaya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sutta on the Origin

original: 408. Sārammaṇasatipaṭṭhānāti ārammaṇalakkhitā satipaṭṭhānā kathitā, na satilakkhaṇā.
analyzed: sa ārammaṇa sati paṭṭhānā ti ārammaṇa lakkhitā sati paṭṭhānā kathitā na sati lakkhaṇā
translated: The “object-based” foundations of mindfulness are taught as the mindfulness that is characterized by the object, not as the mindfulness that is characterized by the characteristic of mindfulness.

original: 4. Satisuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sati sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sutta on Mindfulness

original: 410. Suddhikaṃ katvā visuṃ visuṃ katvā. Tathā ca vuttaṃ pāḷiyaṃ “kāye vā bhikkhū”ti.
analyzed: suddhikam katvā visum visum katvā tathā ca vuttam pāḷiyam kāye vā bhikkhū ti
translated: “Having made them pure” means having made them separate. And this is said in the text: “In the body, bhikkhus” .

original: 6. Pātimokkhasaṃvarasuttavaṇṇanā🔽412. Jeṭṭhakasīlanti padhānakasīlaṃ. Sīlaggahaṇañhi pāḷiyaṃ pātimokkhasaṃvaravaseneva🔽āgataṃ. Tenāha “tipiṭakacūḷanāgatthero panā”tiādi. Tattha pātimokkhasaṃvarova sīlanti
analyzed: pātimokkhasaṃvara sutta vaṇṇanā  jeṭṭhaka sīlanti padhānaka sīlam sīla ggahaṇam hi pāḷiyam pātimokkha saṃvara vasena iva  āgatam tena āha tipiṭakacūḷanāga thero tattha tattha
translated: The Sutta on Restraint by the Pāṭimokkha🔽“The seniormost rule” is the foremost rule. For the undertaking of virtue is given in the text only as restraint by the Pāṭimokkha.🔽Hence the Elder Tipiṭaka Cūḷanāga is quoted. Here the qualification “only” shows that the other three are included in the Pāṭimokkha.

original: avadhāraṇaṃ itaresaṃ tiṇṇaṃ ekadesena pātimokkhantogadhabhāvaṃ dīpeti. Tathā hi anolokiyolokane
analyzed: avadhāraṇam itaresam tiṇṇam ekadesena pātimokkha antogadha bhāvam dīpeti tathā hi
translated: For the Pāṭimokkha is the eye of the Vinaya.

original: ājīvahetu ca chasikkhāpadavītikkamane gilānapaccayassa appaccavekkhitaparibhoge ca🔽āpatti vihitāti. Tīṇīti indriyasaṃvarādīni. Sīlanti vuttaṭṭhānaṃ nāma natthīti sīlapariyāyena
analyzed: ājīva hetu ca cha sikkhāpada vītikkamane gilāna paccayassa appaccavekkhita paribhoge ca  āpatti vihitā ati tīṇi iti indriya saṃvara ādīni sīlanti vutta ṭṭhānam nāma natthi iti sīla pariyāyena
translated: And in the case of the transgression of a training precept and in the case of the use of what has not been given away, the condition is a wrong view.

original: tesaṃ katthaci sutte gahitaṭṭhānaṃ nāma natthīti nippariyāyasīlataṃ tesaṃ paṭikkhipati.
analyzed: tesam katthaci sutte gahita ṭṭhānam nāma natthi iti nippariyāya sīla tam tesam paṭikkhipati
translated: The three are the restraint of the faculties, etc. ‘Morality’ : there is no place mentioned in the texts where these three are included. Therefore the Master rejects the idea that they are ‘morality in the true sense of the word’ .

original: Chadvārarakkhaṇamattamevāti tassa sallahukatamāha cittādhiṭṭhānamattena paṭipākatikabhāvappattito.
analyzed: cha dvāra rakkhaṇa mattam evā ti tassa sat lahuka tam āha citta adhiṭṭhāna mattena paṭipākatika bhāva ppattito
translated: ‘Merely the guarding of the six sense doors’ : he shows their inferiority by the mere fact that they are established in the mind.

original: Itaradvayepi eseva nayo. Paccayuppattimattakanti phalena hetuṃ dasseti. Uppādanahetukā
analyzed: itara dvaye pi esā iva nayaḥ paccaya uppatti mattakam ti phalena hetum dasseti uppādana hetukā
translated: The same method applies to the other two. ‘The mere occurrence of a condition’ : he shows the cause by the fruit. For the occurrence of conditions is the cause of their production.

original: hi paccayānaṃ uppatti. Idamatthanti idaṃ payojanaṃ imassa paccayassa paribhuñjaneti
analyzed: hi paccayānam uppatti idamatthanti idam payojanam imassa paccayassa paribhuñjaneti
translated: ‘The purpose of this condition’ : the intention is that this is the purpose of using this condition.

original: adhippāyo. Nippariyāyenāti iminā indriyasaṃvarādīni tīṇi padhānasīlassa paripālanaparisodhanavasena
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ nippariyāyena ati iminā indriya saṃvara ādīni tīṇi padhāna sīlassa paripālana parisodhana vasena
translated: ‘In the true sense of the word’ : by this he shows that the three, the restraint of the faculties, etc., are not ‘morality in the true sense of the word’ because they are included in the guarding and purification of the morality of the training precepts.

original: pavattiyā pariyāyasīlāni nāmāti dasseti. Idāni pātimokkhasīlasseva padhānabhāvaṃ
analyzed: pavattiyā pariyāyasīlāni nāma ati dasseti idāni pātimokkha sīlassa iva padhāna bhāvam
translated: He shows that the other kinds of virtue are the virtue of the course of practice.🔽Now, in order to illustrate by means of a simile the pre-eminent position of virtue consisting in the Pāṭimokkha rule,

original: byatirekato anvayato ca upamāya vibhāvetuṃ “yassā”tiādimāha. Tattha soti pātimokkhasaṃvaro.
analyzed: byatirekataḥ anvayataḥ ca upamāya vibhāvetum yassa ati ādim āha tattha saḥ ti pātimokkha saṃvaraḥ
translated: and its superiority, he said: “The virtue of the Pāṭimokkha rule is like a rampart,” etc. Herein, the “Pāṭimokkha restraint” is the virtue of the Pāṭimokkha rule.🔽The other kinds of virtue are the “other kinds of virtue,” namely, the virtue of the course of practice, etc.

original: Sesāni indriyasaṃvarādīni. Pātimokkhasaddassa attho pana visuddhimaggasaṃvaṇṇanādīsu
analyzed: sesāni indriya saṃvara ādīni pātimokkha saddassa atthaḥ pana visuddhi magga saṃvaṇṇanā ādīsu
translated: The meaning of the word pāṭimokkha has been explained in the Visuddhimagga and in the commentaries, etc.,

original: vitthārito, tasmā tattha vuttanayeneva veditabbo.
analyzed: vitthārito tasmā tattha vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ
translated: and so it should be understood in the way stated there.🔽“Endowed with good habits and resorts”: endowed with good habits and resorts consisting in non-transgression by way of body and mind,

original: Ācārena ca gocarena ca sampannoti kāyikacetasikaavītikkamasaṅkhātena ācārena ca navesiyādigocaratādisaṅkhātena
analyzed: ācārena ca gocarena ca sampannoti kāyika cetasika avītikkama saṅkhātena ācārena ca navesiya ādi gocara tā ādi saṅkhātena
translated: and endowed with resorts consisting in the avoidance of the resorts of harlots, etc.,

original: gocarena ca sampanno, sampannaācāragocaroti attho. Appamattakesūti atiparittakesu🔽anāpattigamanīyesu. “Dukkaṭadubbhāsitamattesū”ti apare. Vajjesūti akaraṇīyesu gārayhesu.
analyzed: gocarena ca sampannaḥ sampanna ācāra gocaraḥ ti attho appamattakesu ti ati parittakesu  anāpatti gamanīyesu dukkaṭa dubbhāsita mattesu iti apare vajjesu iti akaraṇīyesu gārayhesu
translated: and the practice of the resorts of going on alms round, etc. The meaning is: endowed with good habits and resorts.🔽“In regard to the most insignificant offenses”: in regard to offenses that are very slight and that can be atoned for.🔽“In regard to offenses of wrong-doing and wrong speech,” say others.🔽“In regard to faults”: in regard to things that should not be done and that are blameworthy.

original: Te pana ekantato akusalā hontīti āha – “akusaladhammesū”ti. Bhayadassāvīti bhayato
analyzed: te pana ekantataḥ akusalāḥ honti iti āha akusala dhammesu iti bhaya dassāvi iti bhayataḥ
translated: But since these are entirely unwholesome, he said: “In regard to unwholesome states.” “Seeing fear”

original: dassanasīlo, paramāṇumattampi vajjaṃ sineruppamāṇaṃ viya katvā dassanasīlo. Sammā
analyzed: dassanasīlaḥ paramāṇumattam pi vajjam sineru pamāṇam viya katvā dassanasīlaḥ sammā
translated: He is one who sees danger in the slightest fault, who sees a fault even in the size of an atom.🔽Having undertaken: having undertaken well, having undertaken thoroughly.

original: ādiyitvāti sammadeva sakkaccaṃ sabbaso ca ādiyitvā. Sikkhāpadesūti niddhāraṇe bhummanti
analyzed: ādiyitvā ti sammadeva eva sakkaccam sabbaso ca ādiyitvā sikkhāpadesu iti niddhāraṇe bhummanti
translated: In the training precepts: in the analysis.

original: samudāyato avayavaniddhāraṇaṃ dassento “sikkhāpadesu taṃ taṃ sikkhāpada”ntiādimāha.
analyzed: samudāyataḥ avayava niddhāraṇam dassentaḥ sikkhāpadesu tam tam sikkhāpada nti ādim āha
translated: In the analysis of the collection, showing the analysis of the parts, he says, “In the training precepts, in this or that training precept.”🔽The intention is that the training precept should be undertaken and the training should be trained in.

original: Sikkhāpadaṃ samādātabbaṃ sikkhitabbañcāti adhippāyo. Sikkhāti adhisīlasikkhā. Pubbe
analyzed: sikkhāpadam samādātabbam sikkhitabbam ca ati adhippāyaḥ sikkhā ati adhi sīla sikkhā pubbe
translated: The training is the higher training in virtue.🔽The word pada in the previous phrase has the meaning of basis; here it should be regarded as having the meaning of portion.

original: pada-saddo adhiṭṭhānaṭṭho, idha bhāgatthoti daṭṭhabbanti āha – “sikkhākoṭṭhāsesū”ti.
analyzed: pada saddaḥ adhiṭṭhāna aṭṭhaḥ idha bhāga ttho ti daṭṭhabbanti āha sikkhākoṭṭhāsesu iti
translated: He says, “In the sections of the training.”

original: Mūlapaññattianupaññattiādibhedaṃ yaṃkiñci sikkhitabbaṃ pūretabbaṃ sīlaṃ, taṃ pana
analyzed: mūla paññatti anupaññatti ādi bhedam yaṃ kiñci sikkhitabbam pūretabbam sīlam tam pana
translated: Any training that should be trained in, fulfilled, is virtue, which is analyzed into the training precepts, etc.

original: dvāravasena duvidhamevāti āha – “kāyikaṃ vā vācasikaṃ vā”ti. Imasmiṃ atthavikappe
analyzed: dvāra vasena duvidham eva ati āha kāyikam vā vācasikam vā iti imasmin attha vikappe
translated: But that is twofold as physical and verbal.

original: sikkhāpadesūti ādhāre bhummaṃ sikkhābhāgesu kassaci visuṃ aggahaṇato. Tenāha – “taṃ
analyzed: sikkhāpadesu iti ādhāre bhummam sikkhā bhāgesu kassaci visum aggahaṇato tena āha tam
translated: In this interpretation of the meaning, in the training precepts is locative in the base.

original: taṃ sabba”nti. “Tato tvaṃ bhikkhu sīlaṃ nissāyā”ti vacanato anabhijjhā abyāpādasammādiṭṭhiyopi
analyzed: tam sabbam ti tatas tvam bhikkhu sīlam nissāya ati vacanataḥ anabhijjhāḥ a byāpāda sammādiṭṭhiyaḥ pi
translated: “All that is virtue.” And since it is said, “Then, bhikkhu, depending on virtue,” non-covetousness, non-ill will, and right view

original: sīlanti vuttā, tasmā imasmiṃ sutte “pātimokkhasaṃvarasīlameva kathita”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sīlanti vuttā tasmai imasmin sutte pātimokkha saṃvara sīlam eva kathitanti vuttam
translated: are also called “virtue.” Therefore it is said in this sutta that “only the virtue consisting in the restraint by the Patimokkha is taught.”

original: 7. Duccaritasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: duccarita sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Exposition of the Discourse on Bad Conduct

original: 413. Etthāpi manosucaritaṃ sīlaṃ nāmāti dassetīti katvā vuttaṃ “pacchimāpi tayo”ti.
analyzed: ettha api manaḥ su caritam sīlam nāma ati dasseti iti katvā vuttam pacchimā api tayā ti
translated: Here too, it is said that “the last three are also called ‘virtue’” in order to show that mental good conduct is also called “virtue.”

original: Anabhijjhāabyāpādasammādiṭṭhidhammā sīlaṃ hotīti veditabbā kāyavacīsucaritehi saddhiṃ
analyzed: anabhijjhā abyāpāda sammādiṭṭhi dhammā sīlam hoti iti veditabbā kāya vacī su caritehi saddhim
translated: The states of non-covetousness, non-ill will, and right view should be understood as “virtue” together with the bodily and verbal good conduct

original: manosucaritampi vatvā “tato tvaṃ bhikkhu sīlaṃ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāyā”ti vuttattā.
analyzed: manosu caritam pi vatvā tatas tvam bhikkhu sīlam nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya ati vutta ttā
translated: because it is said, “Then, bhikkhu, depending on virtue, established upon virtue,” after mentioning mental good conduct.🔽The rest is as already explained.

original: Sesaṃ vuttanayameva. Chaṭṭhasattamesūti chaṭṭhasattamavaggesu apubbaṃ natthi. Tena
analyzed: sesam vutta nayam eva chaṭṭha sattamesu iti chaṭṭha sattama vaggesu apubbam na atthi tena
translated: In the sixth and seventh: in the sixth and seventh vaggas there is nothing new. Therefore🔽it is said that “the meaning should be understood in the way already stated.” But in the Suttas on the Arousing of Mindfulness,

original: vuttaṃ “heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva attho veditabbo”ti. Vaggapeyyālato pana imasmiṃ satipaṭṭhānasaṃyutte
analyzed: vuttam heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva atthaḥ veditabbaḥ ti vagga peyyālataḥ pana imasmin sati paṭṭhāna saṃyutte
translated: which are the title of the vaggas and peyyas,

original: katipayavaggā saṅgahaṃ ārūḷhā, tathāpi tesaṃ atthavisesābhāvato ekaccesu potthakesu
analyzed: katipaya vaggā saṅgaham ārūḍhā tathā api tesam attha visesa abhāvataḥ ekaccesu potthakesu
translated: because there is no difference in their meaning. In some books🔽they are shown only by way of the headings, in others they are very brief.

original: mukhamattaṃ dassetvā saṃkhittā, ekaccesu atisaṃkhittāva, te saṅkhepavasena dve katvā🔽“chaṭṭhasattamesū”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: mukha mattam dassetvā saṃkhittāḥ ekaccesu te saṅkhepa vasena dve katvā  chaṭṭha sattamesu iti vuttam
translated: They are counted as two because they are brief.

original: Amatavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: amata vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the “Immortal” chapter is finished.

original: Satipaṭṭhānasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāna saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Satipaṭṭhāna Saṃyutta is finished.

original: 4. Indriyasaṃyuttaṃ🔽1. Suddhikavaggo
analyzed: indriya saṃyuttam  suddhika vaggo
translated: The Linked Discourses with the faculties🔽The section on the bare essentials

original: 1. Suddhikasuttavaṇṇanā🔽471. Catubhūmaka …pe… labbhanti kusalābyākatabhāvato tesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ indriyānaṃ. Vīriyindriyasamādhindriyāni…pe…
analyzed: suddhika sutta vaṇṇanā  labbhanti kusala abyākata bhāvato tesam tiṇṇam indriyānaṃ vīriyindriya samādhindriya
translated: The bare essentials🔽The faculties of energy and concentration are found in the four planes, in the three types of consciousness, and in the four paths and fruits.🔽The faculty of concentration is found in all types of consciousness, because it is shared by the three types of wholesome consciousness.

original: sabbattha labbhanti kusalattikasādhāraṇattā. Catubhūmaka …pe… vasenāti catubhūmakadhammaparicchedavasena
analyzed: sabbattha labbhanti kusala ttika sādhāraṇa ttā vasena ati catu bhūmaka dhamma pariccheda vasena
translated: The four planes, etc., are stated in the sense of the delimitation of states belonging to the four planes,

original: ceva kusalādīhi sabbasaṅgāhakadhammaparicchedavasena ca vuttanti attho.
analyzed: ca iva kusala ādīhi sabba saṅgāhaka dhamma pariccheda vasena ca vuttan ti attho
translated: and in the sense of the delimitation of states that include all wholesome, etc., states.

original: Dutiyasamaṇabrāhmaṇasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya samaṇa brāhmaṇa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The second discourse with brahmans

original: 477. Dukkhasaccavasenāti dukkhasaccabhāvena na pajānanti. Tañhi pariññeyyatāya dukkhasaccasaṅgahaṃ.
analyzed: dukkha sacca vasena ati dukkha sacca bhāvena na pajānanti tat hi pariññeyya tāya dukkha sacca saṅgaham
translated: As to the truth of suffering: they do not understand the faith faculty as the truth of suffering. For that is included in the truth of suffering because it has to be fully understood.

original: Samudayasaccavasenāti taṇhāvijjādiṃ saddhindriyassa samudayasaccabhāvena na pajānanti.
analyzed: samudaya sacca vasena ati taṇhā vijjā ādim saddhindriyassa samudaya sacca bhāvena na pajānanti
translated: As to the truth of origin: they do not understand craving, ignorance, etc., as the truth of origin of the faith faculty.

original: Nirodhanti saddhindriyassa anupādāya nirodhanimittaṃ nibbānaṃ. Paṭipadanti saddhindriyanirodhagāminiṃ🔽paṭipadaṃ ariyamaggaṃ. Sesesūti vīriyindriyādīsu.
analyzed: nirodhanti saddhi indriyassa an upādāya nirodha nimittam nibbānam paṭipadanti saddhi indriya nirodha gāminim  paṭipadam ariya maggam sesesu iti vīriya indriya ādīsu
translated: As to cessation: they do not understand the faith faculty’s cessation through non- grasping as Nibbāna. As to the path: they do not understand the noble path as the way leading to the cessation of the faith faculty.

original: Sukkapakkheti “saddhindriyaṃ pajānantī”tiādinayappavatte anavajjapakkhe. Adhimokkhavasena🔽āvajjanasamudayāti “atthi dinna”ntiādinayappavattapubbabhāgabhūtasaddhādhimokkhavasena
analyzed: sukka pakkha iti saddhi indriyam pajānanti iti ādi naya ppavatte anavajja pakkhe adhimokkha vasena  āvajjana samudayā ti atthi dinna nti ādi naya ppavatta pubbabhāga bhūta saddhā adhimokkha vasena
translated: As to the bright side: they do not understand the faith faculty as the bright side in the way stated thus, “They understand the faith faculty” , etc.🔽As to resolution: they do not understand the faith faculty’s resolution through the faith faculty itself.🔽As to the origin of adverting: they do not understand the faith faculty’s origin through the faith faculty’s resolution.🔽For the faith faculty’s resolution is the prior stage of the faith faculty’s origin.

original: āvajjanuppattiyā. Tasmā paṭhamuppannā saddhā eva hettha “āvajjana”nti vuttā, na manodvārāvajjanaṃ.
analyzed: āvajjan uppattiyā tasmā paṭhama uppannā saddhā eva ha itthā āvajjananti vuttā na manaḥ dvāra āvajjanam
translated: The faith faculty that arises first is called “adverting” here, not the mind-door adverting.🔽The same method applies in the case of the other faculties.

original: Esa nayo sesesupi. Tasmā paṭhamuppannā āvajjanā paggahuppattiṭṭhānānaṃ tikkhānaṃ
analyzed: esa nayaḥ sesesu pi tasmā paṭhama uppannā āvajjanā paggaha uppatti ṭhānānam tikkhānam
translated: The first-arisen adverting is the support for the arising of the first-arisen faith faculty.

original: vīriyindriyādīnaṃ paṭhamuppattiyā āvajjanapariyāyena vuttāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Dubbalā🔽hi paṭhamuppannā paggahābhāvato vīriyindriyādīnaṃ samudayoti balavabhāvappattavīriyindriyādikassa
analyzed: vīriya indriya ādīnam paṭhama uppattiyāḥ āvajjana pariyāyena vuttā ati daṭṭhabbam dubbalā  hi paṭhama uppannā paggaha abhāvataḥ vīriya indriya ādīnam samudayaḥ ti balava bhāva ppatta vīriya indriya ādikassa
translated: The faculties of energy, etc., should be regarded as stated by way of adverting, since they arise first.🔽For the first-arisen states of weak energy, etc., are the origin of the faculties of energy, etc., since they are the cause for their arising.

original: āvajjanaṭṭhāniyāni hontīti tesaṃ samudayoti vuttā, pubbe adhimuccanādivasena pavattassa
analyzed: āvajjana ṭṭhāniyāni honti iti tesam samudayaḥ ti vuttā pubbe adhimuccanā ādi vasena pavattassa
translated: The states that are the object of the adverting that has reached the state of strong energy, etc., are called the origin of the faculties of energy, etc.,🔽because they are the cause for their arising. The meaning is: the origin of the adverting that occurs by way of resolution, etc., previously.

original: āvajjanassa samudayāti attho. Puna chandavasenāti kattukāmatākusalacchandavasena🔽saddhādīnaṃ uppādetukāmatākārappavattassa chandassa vasena. Manasikāravasena āvajjanasamudayāti
analyzed: āvajjanassa puna chanda vasena ati kattu kāma tā kusala chanda vasena  saddhā ādīnam uppāda itu kāma tā ākāra ppavattassa chandassa vasena manasikāra vasena āvajjana samudayā ti
translated: Again, by way of desire means by way of the desire to arouse faith, etc., which occurs in the form of the desire to bring about faith, etc.🔽By way of attention means by way of the appropriate kind of attention that produces the weak adverting that occurs by way of the faith faculty, etc.

original: saddhindriyādivasena pavattassa dubbalassa tassa nibbattakayonisomanasikāravasena
analyzed: saddhi indriya ādi vasena pavattassa dubbalassa tassa nibbattaka yoniso manasikāra vasena
translated: The origin of adverting is by way of the arising of the adverting that is produced by the appropriate kind of attention.🔽In this way also means in the way stated by “by way of resolution,” etc. In the six suttas means

original: āvajjanassa uppattiyā. Evampīti “adhimokkhavasenā”tiādinā vuttākārenapi. Chasu suttesūti
analyzed: āvajjanassa uppattiyāḥ evam pi iti adhimokkha vasena ati ādinā vutta ākārena api chasu suttesu iti
translated: in the six suttas beginning with the one that deals with the faith faculty.

original: dutiyato paṭṭhāya chasu suttesu. Catusaccameva kathitaṃ. Assādaggahaṇena hi samudayasaccaṃ,
analyzed: dutiyataḥ paṭṭhāya chasu suttesu catu saccam eva kathitam assāda gahaṇena hi samudaya saccam
translated: In the next six Suttas, beginning with the second, the Four Truths are stated. For the truth of suffering is stated by the phrase “in the pleasures of the senses” ,🔽the truth of the origin by the phrase “in the gratification” ,

original: ādīnavaggahaṇena dukkhasaccaṃ, nissaraṇaggahaṇena nirodhamaggasaccāni gahitānīti.
analyzed: ādīnava ggahaṇena dukkha saccam nissaraṇa ggahaṇena nirodha magga saccāni gahitāni iti
translated: the truth of the path by the phrase “in the escape” .

original: Paṭhamasutte pana indriyānaṃ sarūpadassanamevāti.
analyzed: paṭhama sutte pana indriyānam sarūpa dassanam eva ati
translated: But in the first Sutta the faculties are shown in their individual characteristics.

original: 8. Dabbasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dabba sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Dabba Sutta

original: 478. Soto āpajjīyati etenāti sotāpatti, anāgataṃ pati paṭhamamaggo. Sototi ariyamaggasoto🔽daṭṭhabbo. Āpajjīyatītiādito paṭipajjīyati. Paṭhamamaggapaṭilābhanimittāni sotāpannassa
analyzed: etena ati sotāpatti anāgatam pati paṭhama maggo soto ti ariya magga soto  daṭṭhabbaḥ āpajjīyati iti āditaḥ paṭipajjīyati paṭhama magga paṭilābha nimittāni sotāpannassa
translated: is the first path in the future. The stream is the noble path.🔽It should be seen. It is entered upon is practiced from the beginning. The factors of stream-entry are stated here as the causes for the acquisition of the first path.

original: aṅgāni idha “sotāpattiyaṅgānī”ti vuttāni. Tāni pana tīsu ṭhānesu saddhā ariyakantasīlañcāti
analyzed: aṅgāni idha sotāpattiyaṅgāni iti vuttāni tāni pana tīsu ṭhānesu saddhā
translated: But they should be understood as faith and noble virtue in three places.

original: veditabbāni. Savisayeti sakavisaye. Jeṭṭhakabhāvadassanatthanti padhānabhāvadassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: veditabbāni sa visaya iti saka visaye jeṭṭhaka bhāva dassana attham ti padhāna bhāva dassana attham
translated: In one’s own domain is in one’s own sphere. In order to show the pre-eminent position is in order to show the foremost position.

original: Yattha saddhādiindriyānaṃ sātisayakiccaṃ, tesaṃ kiccātirekataṃ dassetunti attho.
analyzed: yattha saddhā ādi indriyānam sa atisaya kiccam tesam kicca atireka tam dassetun ti attho
translated: The meaning is that it shows the excess of their function, the excess of their activity, where there is the function of the faculties of faith, etc., in abundance.

original: Idāni tamatthaṃ upamāhi vibhāvetuṃ “yathā hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Patvāti attano kiccātirekaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: idāni tam attham upamāhi vibhāvetum yathā hi itiādi vuttam patvā ti attanaḥ kicca atireka ṭṭhānam
translated: Having reached the place that is beyond its own function,

original: paṭilabhitvā. Pubbaṅgamanti saddahanakiccesu purecāraṃ dhorayhaṃ. Sesāni vīriyindriyādīni.
analyzed: paṭilabhitvā pubbaṅgamanti saddahana kiccesu purecāram dhorayham sesāni vīriya indriya ādīni
translated: the ship is the leader in the matter of crossing over, and the other faculties, such as the faculty of energy, are the oars, etc.

original: Tadanvayānīti tadanugatāni tassa saddhindriyādikassa pakkhikāni. Esa nayo sesesupi.
analyzed: tad anvayāni iti tad anugatāni tassa saddhi indriya ādikassa pakkhikāni esa nayaḥ sesesu pi
translated: The faculties that are in conformity with it are those that are associated with it, those that are on its side, namely, the faculty of faith, etc. The same method applies to the rest .🔽The deliverances consisting in jhana: the deliverances called jhana are the faculties of concentration, since jhana is the predominance of concentration.

original: Jhānavimokkheti jhānasaṅkhāte vimokkhe samādhipadhānatāya jhānānaṃ. Evañca katvā
analyzed: jhāna vimokkha iti jhāna saṅkhāte vimokkhe samādhi padhāna tāya evam ca katvā
translated: And when it is put this way,

original: “sotāpattiyaṅgāni patvā”ti idañca vacanaṃ samatthitaṃ hoti. Saddhūpanisañhi sīlanti.
analyzed: idam ca vacanam samatthitam hoti sīlanti
translated: the statement “having reached the factors of stream-entry” is also justified, for virtue is dependent on faith.

original: Ariyasaccāni patvāti cattāri saccāni abhisametabbāni pāpuṇitvā.
analyzed: ariya saccāni patvā ati cattāri saccāni abhisametabbāni pāpuṇitvā
translated: Having reached the noble truths: having penetrated the four truths that must be penetrated.

original: 9-10. Paṭhamavibhaṅgasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The first section of the Vibhanga commentary

original: 479-480. Nepakkaṃ vuccati paññāti āha – “paññāyetaṃ nāma”nti. Nipāyati saṃkilesadhamme
analyzed: nepakkam vuccati paññā iti āha saṃkilesa dhamme
translated: “Discernment is called ‘skill’”: he said “this is called discernment”

original: visoseti nikkhāmetīti nipako, thiratikkhasatipuggalo, tassa bhāvo nepakkanti satiyāpi
analyzed: visoseti nikkhāmeti iti nipakaḥ thira tikkha sati puggalo tassa bhāvaḥ nepakkam ti satiyā api
translated: It is “skill” because it “drips” , “trickles” , “flows” , “drips” , “trickles” , “flows” , “disperses” , “scatters” , “eliminates” , “removes” , “throws out” , “throws forth” , “throws away” , “dissipates” , “disperses” , “scatters” , “eliminates” , “removes” , “throws out” , “throws forth” , “throws away” , “dissipates” , “disperses” , “scatters” , “eliminates” , “removes” , “throws out” , “throws forth” , “throws away” , “dissipates” , “disperses” , “scatters” , “eliminates” , “removes” , “throws out” , “throws forth” , “throws away” , “dissipates” , “disperses” , “scatters” , “eliminates” , “removes” , “throws out” , “throws forth” , “throws away” , “dissipates” , “disperses” , “scatters” , “eliminates” , “removes” , “throws out” , “throws forth” , “throws away” , “dissipates” , “dispers

original: nepakkabhāvo yujjateva. Evañhi “satinepakkenā”ti idaṃ vacanaṃ samatthitaṃ hoti, satiyā
analyzed: nepakka bhāvaḥ yujjatā iva evam hi sati nepakkena ati idam vacanam samatthitam hoti satiyā
translated: and the meaning of “alert” is appropriate. For in this way the words “with mindfulness and full awareness” are justified.

original: ca nepakkenāti evaṃ vuccamānena satiniddeso nāma kato hotiyeva. Asukaṃ nāma suttaṃ
analyzed: ca nepakkena ati evam vuccamānena satiniddesaḥ nāma kataḥ asukam nāma suttam
translated: And when it is said “with mindfulness and full awareness,” the indication of mindfulness is made in this way.

original: vā kammaṭṭhānaṃ vā me bhāsitanti. Vossajjīyati saṅkhāragataṃ etasmiṃ adhigateti vossaggo,
analyzed: vā kammaṭṭhānam vā me bhāsitanti vossajjīyati saṅkhāra gatam etasmin adhigatā iti vossaggaḥ
translated: “I have been taught such and such a sutta or such and such a meditation subject.”🔽“The relinquishing of the occurrence of formations” is Nibbāna.

original: nibbānaṃ. Taṃ ārammaṇaṃ karitvāti āha – “nibbānārammaṇaṃ katvā”ti. Gacchantiyāti
analyzed: nibbānam tam ārammaṇam karitvā iti āha nibbāna ārammaṇam katvā iti gacchantiyā iti
translated: “With Nibbāna as their object” means making Nibbāna their object.🔽“They go” means they occur, they are manifested, in the contemplation of the uprising and subsidence of the formations.

original: saṅkhārānaṃ udayañca vayañca udayabbayaṃ gacchantiyā bujjhantiyā. Tenāha “udayabbayapariggāhikāyā”ti.🔽Saddhāsatipaññindriyāni pubbabhāgāni “itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ, cirakatampi cirabhāsitampi
analyzed: udayam ca vayam ca udaya bbayam gacchantiyā bujjhantiyā tena āha udaya bbaya pariggāhikāya iti  saddhā sati paññindriyāni pubbabhāgāni iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham cirakatam pi cira bhāsitam pi
translated: “Contemplation of uprising and subsidence” is the contemplation of arising and vanishing.🔽“The faculties of faith, mindfulness, and understanding” are the prior stages.🔽“The Blessed One is … mindful and has understanding that comes from remembering what was done and said long ago” .

original: saritā anussaritā, udayatthagāminiyā paññāyā”ti ca vuttattā. “Āraddhavīriyo viharati,
analyzed: saritā anussaritā udaya ttha gāminiyā paññāyā ati ca vutta ttā āraddha vīriyaḥ viharati
translated: “He lives … with energy aroused” .

original: so anuppannāna”ntiādinā ca vuttattā vīriyindriyaṃ missakaṃ. “Vossaggārammaṇaṃ karitvā”ti
analyzed: so anuppanna ananti ādinā ca vutta ttā vīriya indriyam missakam vossagga ārammaṇam karitvā ati
translated: and because it is said, “He generates desire for the arising of unarisen …”, the faculty of energy is mixed.🔽Because it is said, “having made relinquishment the object”, the faculty of concentration is only supramundane when arisen.

original: vuttattā samādhindriyaṃ nibbattitalokuttarameva. Ayamevāti yvāyaṃ navame vutto. Ayameva
analyzed: vutta ttā samādhi indriyam nibbattita lokuttaram eva ayam eva ati yvā ayam navame vuttaḥ ayam eva
translated: This very same: the one stated in the ninth.🔽This very same

original: pubbabhāgamissakalokuttarattadhammaparicchedo.
translated: is the chapter on the mixed and supramundane states of consciousness that are preliminary to the path.

original: Suddhikavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Mudutaravaggo
analyzed: suddhika vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  mudutara vaggo
translated: The commentary on the section on the mixed states is finished.🔽The section on the easy way

original: 1. Paṭilābhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭilābha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The sutta on acquisition

original: 481. Sammappadhāne ārabbhāti sammappadhāne bhāvanāvasena ārabbha. Tenāha “bhāvento”ti.🔽Yathā vīriyindriyaniddese “cattāro sammappadhāne ārabbha vīriyaṃ paṭilabhatī”ti desanā
analyzed: sammappadhāne ārabbha ati sammappadhāne bhāvanā vasena ārabbha tena āha bhāvento iti  yathā vīriyindriya niddese cattāro sammappadhāne ārabbha vīriyam paṭilabhati iti desanā
translated: “With regard to the right endeavours”: with regard to the right endeavours by way of development. Hence it is said, “developing”.🔽Just as in the description of the faculty of energy it is said, “he acquires energy with regard to the four right endeavours”,

original: āgatā, evaṃ satindriyaniddese “cattāro satipaṭṭhāne ārabbha satiṃ paṭilabhatī”ti,
analyzed: āgatāḥ evam sati indriya niddese cattāro sati paṭṭhāne ārabbha satim paṭilabhati iti
translated: so in the description of the faculty of mindfulness it is said, “he acquires mindfulness with regard to the four foundations of mindfulness”,

original: tasmā “satindriyepi eseva nayo”ti vuttaṃ. Saddhindriyādiniddesesu pana na tathā deseti.
analyzed: tasmā sat indriye pi esā iva nayo ti vuttam saddhindriya ādi niddesesu pana na tathā
translated: and therefore it is said, “the same method applies to the faculty of mindfulness”. But in the descriptions of the faculties of faith, etc., it is not stated in this way.

original: 2. Paṭhamasaṃkhittasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The first brief suttas

original: 482. Indriyānaṃ tikkhādibhāvo vipassanāvasena vā maggavasena vā phalavasena vā gahetabboti🔽vuttaṃ “tatoti…pe… veditabba”nti. Nanu cettha mudubhāvo eva pāḷiyaṃ gahitoti? Saccametaṃ,
analyzed: indriyānam tikkha ādi bhāvaḥ vipassanā vasena vā magga vasena vā phala vasena vā gahetabbaḥ ti  vuttam tatotipe veditabbam ti nanu ca ittha mudu bhāvaḥ eva pāḷiyam gahitaḥ iti saccam etam
translated: The faculties’ being keen, etc., should be understood by way of insight, path, and fruition.🔽“From that” is said in order to show the meaning in brief.🔽But isn’t only the state of being pliable mentioned in the text? That is so,

original: taṃ pana tikkhabhāve asati na hoti tikkhādibhāvoti vuttaṃ. Yato hi ayaṃ mudu, ito
analyzed: tam pana tikkha bhāve asati na hoti tikkha ādi bhāvaḥ ti vuttam yatas hi ayam mudu itas
translated: but it is not possible for there to be keenness, etc., if there is no pliancy. For when this is pliable, it is then possible to say that it is keen,

original: taṃ tikkhanti vattabbataṃ labhati apekkhāsiddhattā tikkhamudubhāvānaṃ pārāpāraṃ viya.
analyzed: tam tikkhanti vattabba tam labhati apekkhā siddha ttā tikkha mudu bhāvānam pāra apāram viya
translated: since keenness and pliancy are established in mutual dependence, like the near and far shores of a river.

original: Idāni “tato”tiādinā saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ vitthārato dassetuṃ “samattānī”tiādi
analyzed: idāni tatas itiādinā saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham vitthārataḥ dassetum samattāni itiādi
translated: Now, in order to show in detail the meaning stated in brief by “from that,” etc., he said, “The faculties of the stream-enterer,” etc.🔽Herein, “perfected” means accomplished. The other is a synonym for that. Or “perfected” means “measured,”

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha samattānīti sampannāni. Itaraṃ tasseva vevacanaṃ. Samattānīti vā pariyattāni,
analyzed: vuttam tattha samattāni iti sampannāni itaram tassa iva vevacanam samattāni iti vā pariyattāni
translated: the meaning is “measured.”

original: samattānīti attho. “Tato mudutarāni dhammānusārīmaggassā”ti kasmā vuttaṃ? Tatoti
analyzed: samattāni iti attho tatas mudutarāni dhammānusārī maggassa ati kasmā vuttam tatas ti
translated: Why is it said that “the faculties of the stream-enterer are more pliable than those of the one practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry”?

original: hi sotāpattimaggavipassanindriyāni adhippetāniyeva, “tato mudutarānī”ti vuttapaṭhamamaggo
analyzed: hi sotāpatti magga vipassanī indriyāni adhippetāni yeva tatas mudutarāni iti vutta paṭhama maggaḥ
translated: For “from that” refers only to the faculties of insight of the path of stream-entry. The first path mentioned in the text as “more pliable”

original: dhammānusārī vā siyā saddhānusārī vāti byabhicarati? Nāyaṃ doso, sotāpattimaggekadesavaseneva
analyzed: dhamma anusārī vā siyā saddhā anusārī vā ati byabhicarati na ayam doso sotāpatti magga ekadesa vasena iva
translated: “Or he may be a Dhamma-follower or a faith-follower”: this is wrong. There is no fault,🔽because the classification of insight is intended in the sense of a portion of the path of stream-entry,

original: laddhabbapaṭhamamaggāpekkhāya vipassanāya vibhāgassa adhippetattā. Yo hi sotāpanno
analyzed: laddhabba paṭhama magga apekkhāya vipassanāya vibhāgassa adhippeta ttā yaḥ hi sotāpannaḥ
translated: since it is in order to show the first path that is to be obtained. For one who, after becoming a stream-enterer,

original: hutvā iriyāpathaṃ akopetvā yathānisinnova sakadāgāmimaggaṃ pāpuṇāti, tassa vipassanindriyāni
analyzed: hutvā iriyāpatham a kopetvā yathā nisinnaḥ uva sakadāgāmi maggam pāpuṇāti tassa vipassan indriyāni
translated: without changing posture, attains the path of once-returner while sitting in the same seat,🔽the faculties of insight are mentioned without classification.

original: sandhāya avibhāgena vuttaṃ – “tato mudutarāni sotāpattimaggassa vipassanindriyāni
analyzed: sandhāya avibhāgena vuttam tatas mudutarāni sotāpatti maggassa vipassanī indriyāni
translated: “The faculties of insight of the path of stream-entry are called more sluggish.”

original: nāmā”ti. Yo pana sotāpanno hutvā kālantarena sakadāgāmī hoti, tassa sotāpattimaggatthāya
analyzed: nāma ati yaḥ pana sotāpannaḥ hutvā kāla antarena sakadāgāmī hoti tassa sotāpatti magga tthāya
translated: But for one who, after becoming a stream-enterer, becomes a once-returner at a later time,🔽the faculties of insight that occurred for the purpose of the path of stream-entry are called “faculties of insight.”

original: pavattāni vipassanindriyāni nāma honti. So ce dhammānusārīgotto, tassa yathāvuttavipassanindriyato
analyzed: pavattāni vipassanī indriyāni nāma honti saḥ ce dhamma anusārī gottaḥ tassa yathā vutta vipassanī indriyato
translated: If he is of the type of Dhamma-follower, then his are more sluggish than the faculties of insight mentioned above.🔽Therefore it is said: “The faculties of the path of once-returner are called more sluggish than those.”

original: mudutarānīti “tato mudutarāni dhammānusārīmaggassā”ti vuttaṃ. Vipassanindriyāni nāmāti
analyzed: mudutarāni iti tatas mudutarāni dhamma anusārī maggassa ati vuttam vipassan indriyāni nāma ati
translated: “The faculties of insight” means

original: ānetvā sambandho. Dhammānusārīvipassanindriyato saddhānusārīvipassanindriyānaṃ mudubhāvassa
analyzed: ānetvā sambandhaḥ dhamma anusārī vipassanī indriyato saddhā anusārī vipassanī indriyānam mudu bhāvassa
translated: and he shows the connection. He shows the cause for the softness of the faith-understanding and the Dhamma-understanding of the faith-follower and the Dhamma-follower respectively.

original: kāraṇaṃ sayameva vakkhati. Dhammena paññāya maggasotaṃ anussaratīti dhammānusārī,
analyzed: kāraṇam sayam eva vakkhati dhammena paññāya magga sotam anussarati iti dhamma anusārī
translated: He recollects the stream of the path by means of the Dhamma, by means of understanding, thus he is a Dhamma-follower;

original: paññuttaro ariyo. Saddhāya maggasotaṃ anussaratīti saddhānusārī, saddhuttaro ariyo.
analyzed: paññuttaraḥ ariyaḥ saddhāya magga sotam anussarati iti saddhā anusārī saddhuttaraḥ ariyo
translated: he is a noble one with understanding in excess. He recollects the stream of the path by means of faith, thus he is a faith-follower; he is a noble one with faith in excess.

original: Evaṃ vipassanāvasena dassetvā maggavasena dassetuṃ “tathā”tiādi āraddhaṃ. Sampayogato
analyzed: evam vipassanā vasena dassetvā magga vasena dassetum tathā iti ādi āraddham sampayogato
translated: Having thus shown them by way of insight, he begins with “So too” in order to show them by way of the path.

original: sabhāvato ca arahattamaggapariyāpannāni arahattamaggindriyāni. Arahattaphalindriyānīti etthāpi eseva nayo.
analyzed: sabhāvato ca arahatta magga pariyāpannāni arahatta magga indriyāni arahatta phala indriyāni iti ettha api esā iva nayo
translated: The faculties included in the path of arahatship are the faculties of the path of arahatship, by way of association and by way of individual essence. The same method applies to the faculties of the fruit of arahatship.

original: Idāni phalavasena dassetuṃ “samattāni paripuṇṇānī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sotāpattimaggaṭṭhapuggalavasena
analyzed: idāni phala vasena dassetum samattāni paripuṇṇāni itiādi vuttam sotāpatti magga ṭṭha puggala vasena
translated: Now, in order to show them by way of the fruit, “complete” and “perfect” are said.🔽The difference is that the person who is established in the path of stream-entry is shown by way of the fruit of stream-entry. Therefore the intention is that the two are not found here in the third section.

original: nānattaṃ jātaṃ, tasmā te dvepi idha tatiyavāre na labbhantīti adhippāyo. Dhammānusārīsaddhānusārīnaṃ
analyzed: nānattam jātam tasmā te dve pi idha tatiya vāre na labbhanti iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The faculties of the Dhamma-follower and the faith-follower

original: nānattaṃ kathaṃ jātanti āha “āgamanenapi maggenapī”ti. Tadubhayaṃ dassento “saddhānusārīpuggalo”tiādimāha.
analyzed: nānattam katham jātanti āha āgamanena api maggena api iti tat ubhayam dassentaḥ saddhā anusārī puggalo ti ādim āha
translated: How is there diversity? He said: “By way of approach and by way of path.” Showing both of these, he said: “The person who is a faith-follower.”

original: Uddisāpentoti uddesaṃ gaṇhanto.
analyzed: uddisāpentaḥ iti uddesam gaṇhantaḥ
translated: “To recite” means to take up the recitation.

original: Maggo tikkho hoti upanissayindriyānaṃ tikkhavisadabhāvato. Tenāha “sūraṃ ñāṇaṃ vahatī”ti.
analyzed: maggaḥ tikkhaḥ hoti upanissaya indriyānam tikkha visada bhāvataḥ tena āha sūram ñāṇam vahati iti
translated: The path is sharp because the supporting conditions and faculties are sharp and clear. Therefore he said: “Sharp knowledge carries him along.”

original: Asaṅkhārenāti saraseneva. Appayogenāti tasseva vevacanaṃ. Dhammānusārīpuggalo hi
analyzed: asaṅkhārena ati sa rasena iva appayogena ati tassa iva vevacanam dhamma anusārī puggalaḥ hi
translated: “Without exertion” means by himself, by his own strength. “Without effort” is a synonym for that. For the person who is a Dhamma-follower

original: āgamanamhi kilese vikkhambhento appadukkhena appakasirena akilamantova vikkhambhetuṃ🔽sakkoti. Saddhānusārīpuggalo pana dukkhena kasirena kilamanto hutvā vikkhambhetuṃ
analyzed: āgamanamhi kilese vikkhambhento appa dukkhena appa kasirena a kilamantaḥ iva vikkhambhetuṃ  sakkoti saddhā anusārī puggalaḥ pana dukkhena kasirena kilamantaḥ hutvā vikkhambhetum
translated: can suppress the defilements on the approach to the path with little difficulty, with little trouble, without great weariness.

original: sakkoti, tasmā dhammānusārissa pubbabhāgamaggakkhaṇe kilesacchedakañāṇaṃ adandhaṃ
analyzed: sakkoti tasmai dhamma anusārissa pubbabhāga magga kkhaṇe kilesa chedaka ñāṇam adandham
translated: But the person who is a faith-follower can suppress them with difficulty, with trouble, and with great weariness. Therefore, at the moment of the path in the preliminary stage of the person who is a Dhamma-follower, the knowledge that severs the defilements is sharp,

original: tikhiṇaṃ hutvā vahati, yathā nāma tikhiṇena asinā kadaliṃ chindantassa chinnaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: tikhiṇam hutvā vahati yathā nāma tikhiṇena asinā kadalim chindantassa chinna ṭṭhānam
translated: and it carries him along. Just as when one cuts a plantain with a sharp knife, the place where it is cut

original: maṭṭhaṃ hoti, asi khippaṃ vahati, saddo na suyyati, balavavāyāmakiccaṃ na hoti, evarūpā
analyzed: maṭṭham hoti asi khippam vahati saddaḥ na suyyati balava vāyāma kiccam na hoti evarūpā
translated: The blade is not sharp, the sword moves slowly, a sound is heard, and great effort is needed.

original: dhammānusārino pubbabhāgabhāvanā hoti, saddhānusārino pana pubbabhāgakkhaṇe kilesacchedakañāṇaṃ
analyzed: dhamma anusārino pubbabhāga bhāvanā hoti saddhā anusārino pana pubbabhāga kkhaṇe kilesa chedaka ñāṇam
translated: Such is the development of the faith-follower in the preliminary stage. But in the case of the one who follows the Dhamma, the knowledge that cuts off the defilements

original: dandhaṃ na tikhiṇaṃ asūraṃ hutvā vahati, yathā nāma nātitikhiṇena asinā kadaliṃ chindantassa
analyzed: dandham na tikhiṇam asūram hutvā vahati yathā nāma na ati tikhiṇena asinā kadalim chindantassa
translated: moves slowly, not swiftly, not sharply, not keenly. Just as when one cuts a plantain trunk with a blunt knife,

original: chinnaṭṭhānaṃ na maṭṭhaṃ hoti, asi sīghaṃ na vahati, saddo suyyati, balavavāyāmakiccaṃ
analyzed: chinna ṭṭhānam na hoti asi sīgham na vahati saddaḥ balava vāyāma kiccam
translated: the cut surface is not smooth, the knife moves slowly, a sound is heard, and great effort is needed,

original: icchitabbaṃ hoti, evarūpā saddhānusārino pubbabhāgabhāvanā hoti. Evaṃ santepi kilesakkhaye
analyzed: icchitabbam hoti evarūpā saddhā anusārino pubbabhāga bhāvanā hoti evam sante pi kilesa kkhaye
translated: so too, in the case of the one who follows the Dhamma, the knowledge that cuts off the defilements moves slowly, not swiftly, not sharply, not keenly.

original: nānattaṃ natthi. Tenāha “kilesakkhaye panā”tiādi. Avasesā ca kilesā khīyanti saṃyojanakkhayāya yogattā.
analyzed: nānattam natthi tena āha kilesa kkhaye pana atiādi avasesā ca kilesā khīyanti saṃyojana kkhayāya yoga ttā
translated: But in the destruction of the defilements there is no difference between the two. Therefore it is said: “But in the destruction of the defilements there is no difference between the two” . And the remaining defilements are destroyed in the one who follows the Dhamma for the purpose of abandoning the fetters.

original: 3. Dutiyasaṃkhittasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya saṃkhitta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary Dutiyasaṅkhitta sutta: The second sutta in the Saṅkhyā vagga of the Saḷāyatana Samyutta.

original: 483. Tatoti phalato phalavemattatāya cariyamānattā. Indriyavemattatā saddhādīnaṃ
analyzed: tatas ti phalataḥ phala vematta tāya indriya vematta tā
translated: Tato: From the fruit. The difference in the faculties is due to the difference in the fruits. The difference in the fruits is due to the difference in the practice.

original: indriyānaṃ nānattena. Phalanānattanti arahattaphalādinānattaṃ. Puggalanānattanti
analyzed: indriyānam nānattena arahatta phala ādi nānattam puggala nānattanti
translated: “By the diversity of faculties” means by the diversity of the faculties of faith, etc. “By the diversity of fruits” means by the diversity of the fruits of stream-entry, etc. “By the diversity of persons” means by the diversity of the persons who are the supports for the fruits.

original: anāgāmiādipuggalanānattaṃ.
analyzed: anāgāmi ādi puggala nānattam
translated: “By the diversity of faculties” means by the diversity of faculties such as faith, etc. “By the diversity of fruits” means by the diversity of the fruit of arahatship, etc. “By the diversity of persons” means by the diversity of the nonreturners, etc.

original: 4. Tatiyasaṃkhittasuttavaṇṇanā🔽484. Sīlakkhandhādīhi saddhindriyādīhi ca parito pūraṇena paripūraṃ arahattamaggaṃ🔽karonto nipphattito arahattaphalaṃ ārādheti nipphādeti. Tayo padesamaggeti sīlakkhandhādīnaṃ
analyzed: tatiya saṃkhitta sutta vaṇṇanā  sīla kkhandha ādīhi saddhi indriya ādīhi ca paritas pūraṇena paripūram arahatta maggam  karontaḥ nipphattitaḥ arahatta phalam ārādheti nipphādeti tayo padesa maggeti sīlakkhandha ādīnam
translated: The third sutta in the “Abbreviated Texts” section🔽By fulfilling the path of arahatship with the aggregates of virtue, etc., and with the faculties of faith, etc., one realizes, i.e., attains, the fruit of arahatship as the culmination of that fulfillment.🔽The three “partial” paths are the three lower paths that are partial to the extent that the aggregates of virtue, etc., are not fulfilled.

original: apāripūriyā ekadesabhūte tayo heṭṭhimamagge. Padesaṃ heṭṭhimaphalattayaṃ. Catūsūti🔽imasmiṃ vagge paṭhamādīsu catūsu suttesu. Kāmañcettha tatiye “tatoti phalavasena
analyzed: apāripūriyāḥ ekadesa bhūte tayaḥ heṭṭhima magge padesam heṭṭhima phala ttayam catūsu iti  imasmin vagge paṭhama ādīsu catūsu suttesu kāmam ca ittha tatiye tatoti phala vasena
translated: The three “partial” fruits are the three lower fruits.🔽The four suttas are the first four suttas in this vagga.

original: nissakka”nti vuttaṃ, catutthe “paripūraṃ paripūrakārī ārādheti, padesaṃ padesakārī”ti,
analyzed: nissakkam ti vuttam catutthe paripūram paripūra kārī ārādheti padesam padesa kārī iti
translated: Although here in the third sutta it is said that one “goes forth by means of the fruit,” and in the fourth sutta that one “realizes the fulfilled by fulfilling, the partial by partially fulfilling,”

original: “catūsupi suttesu missakāneva indriyāni kathitānī”ti pana vacanato vipassanāvasenapi🔽yojanā labbhatevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: catūsu pi suttesu missakāni eva indriyāni kathitāni iti pana vacanataḥ vipassanā vasena api 🔽yojanā labbhatā iva ati daṭṭhabbam
translated: nevertheless, since it is said that “in all four suttas the faculties are mentioned as mixed,” it should be understood that the explanation can also be applied by way of insight.

original: 5-7. Paṭhamavitthārasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The first detailed exposition, etc.,

original: 485-487. Vipassanāvasena nissakkaṃ veditabbaṃ, na maggaphalavasena, imasmiṃ sutte🔽sabbasova vipassanindriyānaṃ eva adhippetattā. Idāni tamatthaṃ pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ “paripuṇṇāni
analyzed: vipassanā vasena nissakkam veditabbam na magga phala vasena imasmim sutte  sabbaso va vipassanī indriyānam eva adhippeta ttā idāni tam attham pākaṭam kātum paripuṇṇāni
translated: The meaning should be understood by way of insight, not by way of path and fruition, in this sutta,🔽because only the faculties of insight are intended here. Now, in order to make that meaning clear, it is said: “They are complete” , etc.

original: hī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Avihādīsu pañcasu suddhāvāsesu tattha tattha āyuvemajjhaṃ anatikkamitvā🔽antarā kilesaparinibbānena parinibbāyanato antarāparinibbāyī, asaṅkhārena appayogena
analyzed: hi itiādi vuttam aviha ādīsu pañcasu suddhāvāsesu tattha tattha āyu vemajjham an atikkamitvā  antarā kilesa parinibbānena parinibbāyanataḥ antarāparinibbāyī asaṅkhārena appayogena
translated: The “intermediately-disappeared” is one who attains Nibbāna in the five pure abodes beginning with Aviha, without exceeding the middle of the life span there,🔽by the disappearance of defilements in the interval. The “non-causative- disappearance” is one who attains Nibbāna without effort, spontaneously.

original: sarasatova parinibbāyanato asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī, tabbipariyāyato sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī,
analyzed: sa rasataḥ iva parinibbāyanataḥ asaṅkhāra parinibbāyī tad bipariyāyataḥ sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyī
translated: The “causative-disappearance” is one who attains Nibbāna with effort.

original: uddhaṃ vāhibhāvena uddhamassa taṇhāsotaṃ vaṭṭasotaṃ vāti uddhaṃsoto, uddhaṃ vā gantvā
analyzed: uddham vāhi bhāvena uddhamassa taṇhā sotam vaṭṭa sotam vāti uddhaṃsotaḥ uddham vā gantvā
translated: The “one bound upstream” is one who goes upstream, who goes against the stream of craving and the stream of the round of rebirths. Or the “one bound upstream” is one who goes upstream, who goes against the stream of the path.

original: paṭilabhitabbato uddhamassa maggasotanti uddhaṃsoto, akaniṭṭhabhavaṃ gacchatīti akaniṭṭhagāmīti
analyzed: paṭilabhitabbataḥ uddhamassa magga sotanti uddhaṃ sotaḥ akaniṭṭha bhavam gacchati iti akaniṭṭha gāmī iti
translated: The “one bound for the highest” is one who goes to the highest plane, the plane of the Akaniṭṭha gods.

original: evamettha saddattho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: evam ettha sadda atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: This is how the meaning should be understood here.

original: Imasmiṃ pana ṭhāneti “vipassanāvasena nissakka”nti vuttaṭṭhāne. Arahattamaggeyeva
analyzed: imasmin pana ṭhāne iti vipassanā vasena nissakkanti vutta ṭṭhāne arahatta magge iva eva
translated: “In this place” is the place referred to in the words “by insight without support.”

original: ṭhatvāti imasmiṃyeva bhave arahattamaggeyeva, na vipassanāya ca ṭhatvā. Pañca nissakkāni🔽nīharitabbānīti “tato mudutarehi antarāparinibbāyī hotī”tiādīni pañca nissakkāni
analyzed: ṭhatvā iti imasmin yeva bhave arahatta maggeya iva na vipassanāya ca ṭhatvā pañca nissakkāni  nīharitabbāni iti tatas mudutarehi antarā parinibbāyī hoti itiādīni pañca nissakkāni
translated: “Having stood in the Arahant path alone”: in this very existence, having stood in the Arahant path alone, not having stood in insight.🔽“The five kinds of non-clinging should be brought in”: the five kinds of non-clinging beginning with “then he becomes one who attains Nibbāna early in his next existence” should be brought in and explained.

original: niddhāretvā kathetabbāni. Idāni tamatthaṃ vivaranto “arahattamaggassa hī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: niddhāretvā kathetabbāni idāni tam attham vivarantaḥ arahatta maggassa hi iti ādim āha
translated: Now, in order to explain that meaning, the Master said, “The Arahant path is the support for the five kinds of non-clinging.”

original: Tattha avihādīsu uppajjitvā uppannasamanantarāya parinibbāyanato paṭhamaantarāparinibbāyī.🔽Tattha āyuppamāṇavemajjhaṃ appatvāva parinibbāyanato dutiyaantarāparinibbāyī, āyuvemajjhaṃ
analyzed: tattha a vihā ādīsu uppajjitvā uppanna samanantarāya parinibbāyanataḥ paṭhama antara aparinibbāyī  tattha āyu ppamāṇa vemajjham appatvā ava parinibbāyanataḥ dutiya antara aparinibbāyī āyu vemajjham
translated: Herein, the first kind of inter- mediate-state-attainer attains Nibbāna immediately after arising and being reborn in the fine-material or immaterial sphere.🔽The second kind of intermediate-state-attainer attains Nibbāna without reaching the middle of his life-span. The third kind of intermediate-state-attainer attains Nibbāna after reaching the middle of his life-span.

original: patvā parinibbāyanato tato paraṃ tatiyaantarāparinibbāyī veditabbo. “Pañca nissakkānī”ti
analyzed: patvā parinibbāyanataḥ tatas param tatiya antarāparinibbāyī veditabbo pañca nissakkāni iti
translated: “The five kinds of non-clinging” are mentioned,🔽but shouldn’t “one who attains Nibbāna without exertion and one who attains Nibbāna with exertion” be mentioned?

original: kasmā vuttaṃ? Nanu asaṅkhārasasaṅkhāraparinibbāyīti vattabbanti? Na vattabbanti dassento
analyzed: kasmā vuttam nanu asaṅkhāra sasaṅkhāra parinibbāyi iti vattabbanti na vattabbanti dassento
translated: In order to show that they should not be mentioned, the Master said:

original: āha “asaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyinopi eteva pañca janā”ti.
analyzed: āha asaṅkhāra parinibbāyissa sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyinaḥ api etā iva pañca janāti
translated: He says: “The five kinds of persons who attain extinction without exertion and with exertion are these same five.”

original: Tīṇi nissakkānīti “tato mudutarehi sotāpanno hotī”tiādīni tīṇi nissakkapadāni. Idha
analyzed: tīṇi nissakkāni iti tatas mudutarehi sotāpannaḥ hoti itiādīni tīṇi nissakka padāni idha
translated: Three kinds of emergence: the three terms “emergence” are the three terms beginning with “one becomes a stream-enterer with sluggish direct-knowledge faculties” . Here

original: sakadāgāmī na gahito, so anāgāmimagge ṭhatvā nīharitabbo, anāgāmimaggassa vipassanindriyehi🔽mudutarehi sakadāgāmī hoti. Sakadā…pe… mudutarānīti idaṃ sakadāgāmimaggassa vipassanindriyehi🔽ekabījisaṅkhātasotāpannavipassanindriyāni mudutarāni hontīti tīṇi katvā vuttaṃ. Dhammānusārītiādidvayaṃ
analyzed: sakadāgāmī na gahitaḥ saḥ anāgāmi magge ṭhatvā nīharitabbaḥ anāgāmi maggassa vipassanī indriyehi  mudutarehi sakadāgāmī hoti sakadāpe mudutarāni iti idam sakadāgāmi maggassa vipassanī indriyehi  eka bīji saṅkhāta sotāpanna vipassanī indriyāni mudutarāni honti iti tīṇi katvā vuttam dhamma anusārī iti ādi dvayam
translated: the once-returner is not included. He can be brought in by the non-returner path. For the non-returner path,🔽the once-returner is one with sluggish direct-knowledge faculties. The once-returner path,🔽the stream-enterer is one with more sluggish direct-knowledge faculties. The three are stated thus: “The direct-knowledge faculties of the stream-enterer called the single-opener are more sluggish than those of the once-returner.” The two beginning with “one following the Dhamma”

original: kolaṃkolādidvayena gahitaṃ hotīti. Sakadāgāmimaggassa hītiādi vuttasseva atthassa
analyzed: kolaṃkola ādi dvayena gahitam hoti iti sakadāgāmi maggassa hi itiādi vuttassa iva atthassa
translated: are included by the two beginning with “one who has attained to the view.” The once-returner path,

original: vivaraṇaṃ. Sesaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayameva. Chaṭṭhasattamāni vuttanayānevāti chaṭṭhasattamāni
analyzed: vivaraṇam sesam heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva chaṭṭha sattamāni vutta nayān eva ati chaṭṭha sattamāni
translated: the explanation is a mere amplification of the meaning stated thus.

original: suttāni dutiyatatiyesu vuttanayāneva. Tattha pana missakāni indriyāni kathitāni,
analyzed: suttāni dutiya tatiyesu vutta nayānā eva tattha pana missakāni indriyāni kathitāni
translated: The suttas are given in the same way as the second and third. But here the faculties are mixed,

original: idha pubbabhāgavipassanindriyāni kathitānīti ayameva viseso.
analyzed: idha pubba bhāga vipassanī indriyāni kathitāni iti ayam eva visesaḥ
translated: while there the faculties of the insight of the preliminary stage are given. This is the only difference.

original: 8. Paṭipannasuttavaṇṇanā🔽488. Tanti maggaphalavasena nissakkaṃ. Pāḷiyaṃ vuttameva “arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya
analyzed: paṭipanna sutta vaṇṇanā  tat ti magga phala vasena nissakkam pāḷiyam vuttam eva arahatta phala sacchikiriyāya
translated: The explanation of the “Path-attainer” type🔽“Free from lust”: free from lust by means of the paths and fruits. The text itself says: “he is one who has entered upon the way to the realization of the fruit of arahantship” .

original: paṭipanno hotī”tiādinā. Aṭṭhahīti catūhi phalehi catūhi ca maggehīti aṭṭhahi. Bahibhūto
analyzed: paṭipannaḥ hoti itiādinā aṭṭhahi iti catūhi phalehi catūhi ca maggehi iti aṭṭhahi bahibhūtaḥ
translated: “Eight”: four fruits and four paths.

original: na antobhāvo. Lokuttarāneva indriyāni kathitāni maggaphalacittuppādapariyāpannattā.
analyzed: na antobhāvaḥ indriyāni kathitāni magga phala cittuppāda pariyāpanna ttā
translated: “Outside”: not inside. Only supramundane faculties are mentioned, because they are included in the arising of the path and fruit consciousnesses.

original: 9-10. Sampannasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: sampanna sutta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “accomplished” type, etc.

original: 489-490. Indriyasampannoti ettha sampannasaddo paripūriatthoti āha “paripuṇṇindriyo”ti. Missakāni indriyāni kathitāni sāmaññatova desitattā.
analyzed: indriya sampannaḥ ti ettha sampanna saddo paripūri attho ti āha paripuṇṇa indriyaḥ ti missakāni indriyāni kathitāni sāmaññataḥ va desita ttā
translated: “Accomplished in faculties”: the word “accomplished” has the meaning of “fulfilled.” Therefore he says, “one whose faculties are fulfilled.” Mixed faculties are mentioned, because they are taught in a general way.

original: Mudutaravaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mudutara vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the “Easy” chapter is finished.

original: 3. Chaḷindriyavaggo
analyzed: chaṣ indriya vaggaḥ
translated: The chapter on the six faculties

original: 2. Jīvitindriyasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Faculty of life” sutta

original: 492. Itthibhāveti itthitāya. Indaṭṭhaṃ karoti tathāsattajanasāmaññakāraṇabhāvato.
analyzed: itthi bhāva iti itthitāya indaṭṭham karoti tathā satta jana sāmañña kāraṇa bhāvato
translated: Itthibhāva means the state of being a woman. It makes the sign of a woman, because it is the cause of the similarity of a group of six elements in a woman.

original: Itthiyā eva indriyaṃ itthindriyaṃ. Esa nayo purisindriye. Jīviteti sahajātadhammānaṃ🔽jīvane pālane pavattane. Vaṭṭindriyānīti vaṭṭahetubhūtāni indriyāni. Imesu hi upādinnaindriyesu
analyzed: itthiyāḥ eva indriyam itthi indriyam esa nayo purisa indriye jīvita iti sahajāta dhammānaṃ  jīvane pālane pavattane vaṭṭindriyāni iti vaṭṭa hetu bhūtāni indriyāni imesu hi upādinna aindriyesu
translated: The faculty of a woman is the faculty of a woman because it is the faculty of a woman. The same method applies in the case of the faculty of a man.🔽In the life faculty, it is the maintenance, the keeping alive, the occurrence of conascent states.

original: sati vaṭṭaṃ vattati paññāyati.
analyzed: sati vaṭṭam vattati paññāyati
translated: The faculties that are a wheel are faculties that are a cause of a wheel. For when there is the appropriating of these faculties, the wheel occurs, is seen.

original: 3. Aññindriyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: aññindriya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “Faculties” chapter is finished.

original: 493. Ajānitapubbaṃ dhammanti catusaccadhammamāha, tathā tesaṃyeva ñātadhammānanti.
analyzed: a jānita pubbam dhammanti catu sacca dhammam āha tathā tesam yeva ñāta dhammānam ti
translated: The “previously unknown state” is the four noble truths. So too with “known states.”

original: Ayaṃ panettha attho – ājānātīti aññā, paṭhamamaggena ñātamanatikkamitvā jānātīti
analyzed: ayam pana ittha atthaḥ ājānāti iti aññā paṭhama maggena ñātam an atikkamitvā jānāti iti
translated: The meaning here is this. It knows , thus it is a knower ; it knows without overstepping what is known by the first path.

original: attho. Sotāpannādīnaṃ chaariyānaṃ etaṃ nāmaṃ. Aññassa indriyāni aññindriyāni. Aññātāvīsūti
analyzed: attho sotāpanna ādīnam cha ariyānam etam nāmam aññassa indriyāni aññindriyāni aññātāvīsu iti
translated: This is the name for the six noble persons beginning with the stream-enterer. The faculties of the knower are the faculties of a knower. The “twenty knowers”

original: ājānitavantesu. Yasmā aggaphaladhammesu ñāṇakiccaṃ sātisayaṃ, tasmā taṃ kiccaṃ sesadhammesupi
analyzed: ājānitavantesu yasmai agga phala dhammesu ñāṇa kiccam sa atisayam tasmai tam kiccam sesa dhammesu pi
translated: are those who know. Since the function of knowledge is outstanding in the states of the highest fruit, that function is also

original: samāropetvā vuttaṃ “aññātāvīsu arahattaphaladhammesū”ti. Tattha tattha tesu tesu
analyzed: samāropetvā vuttam aññātāvīsu arahatta phala dhammesu ti tattha tattha tesu tesu
translated: and it is said that he is “one who has understood thus” in regard to the states of the fruition of arahantship. Herein, in regard to these and those paths and fruitions,

original: maggaphalesu. Tena tenākārenāti anaññātajānanādiākārena.
analyzed: magga phalesu tena tena ākārena ati anaññāta jānana ādi ākārena
translated: by that and that mode, by the mode of the non-knowing of what is to be known, etc.

original: 4. Ekabījisuttavaṇṇanā🔽494. Vipassanato nissakkanti vipassanindriyehi nissakkaṃ. Idāni tameva saṅkhepato
analyzed: ekabīji sutta vaṇṇanā  vipassanataḥ nissakkam ti vipassanī indriyehi nissakkam idāni tam eva saṅkhepataḥ
translated: The explanation of the “one who attains Nibbāna in the interval”

original: vuttamatthaṃ vivaranto “samattānī”tiādimāha. Tīṇi nissakkāni evamidha pañca nissakkāni🔽nīharitabbāni ekabījiādivibhāvanato. Tenāha “sakadāgāmimaggassa hī”tiādi. Sotāpattimaggassa
analyzed: vuttam attham vivarantaḥ samattāni iti ādim āha tīṇi nissakkāni evam idha pañca nissakkāni  nīharitabbāni eka bīji ādi vibhāvanataḥ tena āha sakadāgāmi maggassa hi itiādi sotāpatti maggassa
translated: “By emerging from insight”: by emerging from the faculties of insight. Now, in order to explain the meaning stated in brief, he says, “The three that are to be emerged from,” etc. Herein, the three that are to be emerged from are the faculties of insight. The three that are to be emerged from and the two that are to be emerged from make five that are to be emerged from.🔽They are to be emerged from by the analysis of the “one who attains Nibbāna in the interval,” etc. Therefore he says, “The faculties of insight of the stream-enterer who is entering upon the path of once-returnership,” etc.

original: vipassanindriyāni nāma tenattabhāvena sakadāgāmimaggaṃ pattuṃ gacchantassa sotāpannassa
analyzed: vipassanindriyāni nāma tenatta bhāvena sakadāgāmi maggam pattum gacchantassa sotāpannassa
translated: The faculties of insight of the stream-enterer who is entering upon the path of once-returnership are the faculties of insight of the stream-enterer who is going to the path of once-returnership in that existence.

original: vipassanindriyāni. Pañcapi te sotāpattimaggassa bhedāyevāti “sakadāgāmimagge ṭhatvā🔽nīharitabbānī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vipassanindriyāni pañca api te sotāpatti maggassa bhedāya iva ati sakadāgāmi magge  nīharitabbāni iti vuttam
translated: And the five are the differentiations of the path of stream-entry. Therefore it is said that they are to be emerged from by standing on the path of once-returnership.

original: Ekabījīti ettha khandhabījaṃ nāma kathitaṃ. Yassa hi sotāpannassa ekaṃ khandhabījaṃ
analyzed: ekabījī iti ettha khandha bījam nāma kathitam yassa hi sotāpannassa ekam khandha bījam
translated: Herein, the seed of the aggregates is called the “seed of the aggregates.” For the stream-enterer who has one seed of the aggregates,

original: atthi, ekaṃ attabhāvaggahaṇaṃ, so ekabīji nāma. Tenāha – “sotāpanno hutvā”tiādi.
analyzed: atthi ekam atta bhāva ggahaṇam so ekabīji nāma tena āha so utāpannaḥ hutvā itiādi
translated: there is one who takes up one existence, and he is called “one who goes to one place.” Hence it is said, “having become a stream-enterer.”

original: Mānusakaṃ bhavanti idaṃ panettha desanāmattaṃ, devabhavaṃ nibbattetītipi vattuṃ vaṭṭatiyeva.
analyzed: mānusakam bhavanti idam pana ittha desanā mattam deva bhavam nibbattā iti iti pi vattum vaṭṭatiyā iva
translated: “A human existence” is a mere statement of the teaching; it is also proper to say that he is reborn in a divine existence.

original: Bhagavatā gahitanāmānetāni. Ettakañhi pamāṇaṃ gato sattakkhattuparamo nāma hoti,
analyzed: bhagavatā gahita nāmāni etāni ettakam hi pamāṇam gataḥ satta kkhattu paramaḥ nāma hoti
translated: These are the names taken by the Exalted One. For one who has gone this far is called “one who goes to the limit of seven times,”

original: ettakaṃ kolaṃkolo, ettakaṃ ekabījīti bhagavatā etesaṃ nāmaṃ gahitaṃ.
analyzed: ettakam kolaṃkolaḥ ettakam ekabījī iti bhagavatā etesam nāmam gahitam
translated: and the Exalted One has taken the names of these, “one who goes in a skip,” and “one who goes to one place.”

original: Dve tayo bhaveti devamanussesu eva dve tayo bhave. Sambodhicatusaccadhammo paraṃ
analyzed: dve tayaḥ bhava iti deva manussesu eva dve tayaḥ bhave param
translated: “Two or three existences”: two or three existences among gods and humans. The Dhamma of the four noble truths is the supreme🔽awakening. He who has this as his destination, support, and refuge is “one who is intent on awakening.”

original: ayanaṃ nissayo gati etassāti sambodhiparāyaṇo. Kulato kulaṃ gacchatīti kolaṃkolo.
analyzed: ayanam nissayaḥ gati etassa ati sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ kulataḥ kulam gacchati iti kolaṃkolo
translated: “One who goes from family to family” is “one who goes in a skip.”

original: Sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyato paṭṭhāya hi nīcakule uppatti nāma natthi, mahābhogesu
analyzed: sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyataḥ paṭṭhāya hi nīca kule uppatti nāma natthi mahā bhogesu
translated: For, beginning with the realization of the fruit of stream-entry, there is no rebirth in a low family; he is reborn only in wealthy

original: kulesu eva nibbattatīti attho. Kevalopi hi kula-saddo mahābhogakulameva vadati. Dve
analyzed: kulesu eva nibbattati iti attho kevalaḥ api hi kula saddaḥ mahā bhoga kulam eva vadati dve
translated: families. For the word “family” refers only to a wealthy family. Two

original: vā tīṇi vā kulānīti devamanussavasena dve vā tayo vā bhaveti ayampi missakabhavena
analyzed: vā tīṇi vā kulāni iti deva manussa vasena dve vā tayaḥ vā bhave ti ayam pi missaka bhavena
translated: “The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”

original: kathito. Jātassa kumārassa viya ariyāya jātiyā jātassa nāmametaṃ, yadidaṃ niyatoti🔽sattakkhattuparamādikoti ca samaññāti dassento āha “bhagavatā gahitanāmavasenevā”tiādi.
analyzed: kathitaḥ jātassa kumārassa viya ariyāya jātiyā jātassa nāmam etam yat idam  satta kkhattu parama ādikā iti ca samaññā iti dassentaḥ āha bhagavatā gahita nāma vasena iva atiādi
translated: “The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”

original: Yadi pubbahetuniyamato sotāpanno ca niyatoti sotāpattimaggato uddhaṃ tiṇṇaṃ maggānaṃ🔽upanissayābhāvato pubbahetukiccaṃ natthīti sotāpattimaggassa upanissayabhāvo āpajjati.
analyzed: yadi pubba hetu niyamataḥ sotāpannaḥ ca niyataḥ ti sotāpatti maggato uddham tiṇṇam maggānam  upanissaya abhāvato pubba hetu kiccam natthi iti sotāpatti maggassa upanissaya bhāvaḥ āpajjati
translated: “The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”

original: Yadi tassapi pubbahetuupanissayo siyā, tāva niyamato sotāpattimagguppattito pubbe
analyzed: yadi tassa api pubba hetu upanissayaḥ siyā tāva niyamataḥ sotāpatti magga uppattito pubbe
translated: “The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”🔽“The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth, just as the name ‘prince’ is given to one born in the royal family.”

original: eva niyamito, yāvañca akaniṭṭhaṃ tassa pubbahetu nāma, ahetukatā āpannā, iccassa🔽ahetu appaccayā nipphatti pāpuṇāti. Kiñca hetu ce? Niyamato sotāpanno ca niyatoti
analyzed: eva niyamitaḥ yāvat ca akaniṭṭham tassa pubba hetu nāma ahetuka tā āpannā iccassa 🔽ahetu appaccayā nipphatti pāpuṇāti kiñca sotāpanno ca niyato ti
translated: “The name ‘definite’ is given to one who is born in the noble birth,

original: paṭhamamaggādhigameneva anukkamena upari tiṇṇaṃ maggānaṃ kiccāni nipphajjanti, evaṃ🔽sattakkhattuparamatādiniyame sati sattamabhavādito uddhaṃ pavattatāya dukkhassa mūlabhūtā
analyzed: paṭhama magga adhigamena iva anukkamena upari tiṇṇam maggānam kiccāni nipphajjanti evam  sattakkhattu parama tā ādi niyame sati sattama bhava āditaḥ uddham pavatta tāya dukkhassa mūla bhūtā
translated: and the functions of the three higher paths arise in succession with the first path’s arrival.

original: kilesā paṭhamamaggeneva khīṇāti upari tayo maggā akiccā siyuṃ. Tenāha “paṭhamamaggassa🔽upanissayo kato nāmā”tiādi.
analyzed: kilesā paṭhama maggena iva khīṇāti upari tayo maggāḥ akiccāḥ siyum tena āha paṭhama maggassa  upanissayaḥ kataḥ nāma atiādi
translated: So when the limitation of “at most seven times” is fulfilled, the defilements that are the root of suffering are exhausted with the first path alone since there is no more occurrence of suffering beyond the seventh existence. So the three higher paths would be without function. That is why it is said, “The first path is called the condition for the others” .

original: Yadi upari tayo maggā sattakkhattuparamāditaṃ niyamenti, tato ca añño sotāpanno natthīti
analyzed: yadi upari tayo maggā satta kkhattu parama āditam niyamenti tato ca aññaḥ sotāpanno na atthi iti
translated: If the three higher paths limited the “at most seven times” and so on, and if there were no other kind of stream-enterer apart from that,

original: sotāpattimaggassa akiccakatā nippayojanatā āpajjeyya. Atha sakkāyadiṭṭhiādippahānaṃ🔽tassa kiccaṃ, tesaṃ tesaṃ pahānena sattakkhattuparamādiniyamatāya. Bhavitabbaṃ, yāva
analyzed: sotāpatti maggassa akiccaka tā nippayojana tā āpajjeyya atha sakkāya diṭṭhi ādi ppahānam  tassa kiccam tesam tesam pahānena satta kkhattu parama ādi niyama tāya bhavitabbam yāva
