translated: then the stream-enterer’s path would be without function and pointless. But if the function of that path is the abandoning of the false view of individuality, etc.,🔽then it must be that the limitation of “at most seven times” is due to the abandoning of these or those .

original: uparimaggā eva hontīti sattabhavādito uddhamapavattanato tena vinānena sakkāyadiṭṭhiādippahānena
analyzed: upari maggāḥ eva honti iti satta bhava āditaḥ uddhama pavattanato tena vinā anena sakkāya diṭṭhi ādi ppahānena
translated: So the three higher paths would be without function and pointless too, since there would be no more occurrence of suffering beyond the seven existences, and since there would be no more abandoning of the false view of individuality, and so on, without that.

original: ca tena vinā bhavitabbanti āha – “paṭhamamagge anuppanneva upari tayo maggā uppannāti
analyzed: ca tena vinā bhavitabbanti āha paṭhama magge anuppannā iva upari tayo maggāḥ uppannā ati
translated: and that it must be without that, he says: “He falls into the view that the three higher paths are arisen even before the first path has arisen.”🔽The three paths: the three higher paths.

original: āpajjatī”ti. Tiṇṇaṃ maggānanti upari tiṇṇaṃ maggānaṃ. Vipassanā niyametīti yujjatīti
analyzed: āpajjati iti tiṇṇam maggānan ti upari tiṇṇam maggānam vipassanā niyameti iti yujjati iti
translated: It is proper to say that insight determines:

original: vuttamatthaṃ vivaranto “sace hī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: vutta mattham vivarantaḥ sace hi iti ādim āha
translated: explaining the meaning stated, he says “If, however, etc.”🔽The stream-enterer is one whose inclination is towards the round of rebirths.

original: Sotāpanno vaṭṭajjhāsayo. Tatrekacce pākaṭe paññāte dassento “anāthapiṇḍiko”tiādimāha.
analyzed: sotāpannaḥ tatra ekacce pākaṭe paññāte dassentaḥ anāthapiṇḍikā iti ādim āha
translated: Pointing out that some are obvious and well-known, he says “Anāthapiṇḍika, etc.”

original: Idhaṭṭhakavokiṇṇasukkhavipassakassāti yo imasmiṃ kāmabhave ṭhito manussadevavasena
analyzed: idhaṭṭhaka vokiṇṇa sukkha vipassakassa ati yaḥ imasmin kāma bhave ṭhitaḥ manussa deva vasena
translated: Herein, one who is established in this world of sensual existence, who is reborn in various states of existence as a human or god,

original: vokiṇṇabhavūpapattiko sukkhavipassako ca, tassa vasena. Nāmaṃ kathitanti sattakkhattuparamoti
analyzed: vokiṇṇa bhava upapattiko sukkha vipassako ca tassa vasena nāmam kathitanti satta kkhattu paramaḥ ti
translated: and who is a dry-insight meditator: according to him.🔽The name is stated: “At most seven times”

original: nāmaṃ kathitaṃ. Keci pana “kāmabhave sattakkhattuṃyeva uppajjati, na tato”ti vadanti, taṃ vīmaṃsitabbaṃ.
analyzed: nāmam kathitam keci pana kāma bhave satta kkhattum yeva uppajjati na tatas ti vadanti tat vīmaṃsitabbam
translated: the name is stated. But some say: “He is reborn only seven times in the world of sensual existence, not more than that,” and this should be investigated.

original: Sodhessāmīti jambudīpe kenaci tepiṭakena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ piṭakattayameva mayhaṃ
analyzed: sodhessāmi iti jambudīpe kenaci tepiṭakena bhikkhunā saddhim piṭaka ttayam eva mayham
translated: I will purify: in the Rose-Apple Island, together with a bhikkhu who is a master of the three Piṭakas, the three Piṭakas themselves

original: uggahaparipucchāvasena sodheyyāmīti paratīraṃ jambudīpaṃ gato. Yo bhikkhu sakkotīti🔽yojanā. Aniccānupassanādīsu ekamukhena abhiniviṭṭhenapi abhidhammapariyāyena tīhi
analyzed: uggaha paripucchā vasena sodheyyāmi iti para tīram jambudīpam gataḥ yaḥ bhikkhu sakkoti iti  yojanā anicca anupassanā ādīsu eka mukhena abhiniviṭṭhena api abhidhamma pariyāyena tīhi
translated: The meaning of the words is plain.🔽In the case of the contemplations of impermanence, etc.,

original: eva vimokkhehi maggaṃ labhatīti abhinivesabhedena tayo puggalā suññatato vuṭṭhitā,
analyzed: eva vimokkhehi maggam labhati iti abhinivesa bhedena tayo puggalā suñña tataḥ vuṭṭhitā
translated: one who is definitely committed to a single mode of practice can obtain the path by means of any one of the three doors of deliverance.🔽So there are three kinds of persons who emerge from the void, and three kinds who emerge from the desireless, making six.

original: tathā tayo appaṇihitato vuṭṭhitāti cha honti, teva saddhādhurapaññādhuravasena dvādasa🔽sakadāgāmino. Tathā arahanto, tayo antarāparinibbāyino eko upahaccaparinibbāyī eko
analyzed: tathā tayo appaṇihitataḥ vuṭṭhitā ati cha honti te va saddhādhura paññādhura vasena dvādasa  sakadāgāminaḥ tathā arahanto tayo antarā aparinibbāyino ekaḥ upahacca parinibbāyī ekaḥ
translated: These, as having the faith-following or the Dhamma-following type of progress, make twelve.

original: uddhaṃsoto akaniṭṭhagāmīti pañca, te asaṅkhārasasaṅkhāraparinibbāyibhedena dasāti
analyzed: uddhaṃsotaḥ akaniṭṭhagāmī iti pañca te asaṅkhāra sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyi bhedena dasā ati
translated: There are five kinds of non-returners who attain extinction in the intermediate state, one who attains it on rebirth, one who attains it without extra effort, one who attains it with extra effort, and one who goes upstream to the Pure Abodes and attains it there.🔽These, as having or not having a remainder of clinging, make ten.

original: avihādīsu catūsupi cattālīsa, akaniṭṭhe pana uddhaṃsoto natthīti aṭṭhacattālīsa anāgāmino.🔽Vipassanā kathitā sammasanacārassa kathitattā.
analyzed: aviha ādīsu catūsu pi cattālīsa akaniṭṭhe pana aṭṭhacattālīsa anāgāmino  vipassanā kathitā sammasana cārassa kathitattā
translated: There are forty in the four beginning with the Aviha realm, but not in the Akaniṭṭha realm, so there are forty-eight non-returners.🔽The explanation of insight is given because the practice of serenity has already been explained.

original: 5-10. Suddhakasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: suddhaka sutta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Sutta on the Purifier, etc.

original: 495-500. Yathā cakkhussa sahajātatadindriyanissitadhammesu adhipateyyaṃ anuvattanīyattā,🔽evaṃ taṃdvārikadhammesupi adhipateyyaṃ tehi anuvattanīyattāti vuttaṃ – “adhipateyyasaṅkhātena
analyzed: yathā cakkhussa sahajāta tad indriya nissita dhammesu adhipateyyam anuvattanīya ttā  evam taṃdvārika dhammesu pi adhipateyyam tehi anuvattanīya ttā iti vuttam adhipateyya saṅkhātena
translated: As the eye’s controlling power over the states of its own kind that are conascent with it and that are based on it is due to their being conformable to it,

original: indaṭṭhenā”ti. Esa nayo sesindriyādīsupi. Catusaccavasena kathitāni sabhāvādivibhāvanassa kathitattā.
analyzed: inda aṭṭhena ati esa nayo sesa indriya ādīsu pi catu sacca vasena kathitāni sabhāva ādi vibhāvanassa kathita ttā
translated: so too its controlling power over the states that are its own kinds that are not conascent with it but are based on it is due to their being conformable to it. That is why it is said that the controlling power is due to the controlling faculty’s being the proximate cause of them. The same method applies in the case of the other faculties. The faculties are taught in the four truths, because their individual essences, etc., are taught in the four truths.

original: Chaḷindriyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: chaḷindriya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the chapter on the six faculties is ended.

original: 4. Sukhindriyavaggo
analyzed: sukha indriya vaggo
translated: The chapter on the pleasure faculty

original: 1-5. Suddhikasuttādivaṇṇanā🔽501-505. Yathā cakkhu dassane adhipateyyaṭṭhena cakkhundriyaṃ, evaṃ sukhavedanā sukhane
analyzed: suddhika sutta ādi vaṇṇanā  yathā cakkhu dassane adhipateyya ṭṭhena cakkhu indriyam evam sukha vedanā sukhane
translated: The exposition of the Sutta on Purification, etc.

original: adhipateyyaṭṭhena sukhindriyaṃ. Esa nayo sesesupi. Sesaṃ tebhūmakanti sesaṃ bhūmittayavasena tebhūmakaṃ.
analyzed: adhipateyya ṭṭhena sukhindriyam esa nayo sesesu pi sesam tebhūmakam ti sesam bhūmi ttaya vasena tebhūmakam
translated: Just as the eye is the eye faculty in the sense of controlling power over seeing, so too pleasure is the pleasure faculty in the sense of controlling power over the experience of pleasure. The same method applies in the case of the rest. The rest is in three planes: the rest is in three planes according to the three planes.

original: 6. Paṭhamavibhaṅgasuttavaṇṇanā
translated: The first Vibhaṅga Sutta

original: 506. Kāyikanti ayamassa nissayavasena niddesoti āha – “kāyapasādavatthuka”nti. Sarūpaniddeso
analyzed: kāyikanti ayam assa nissaya vasena niddeso ti āha kāya pasāda vatthukanti sarūpa niddeso
translated: It is called “bodily well-being” because it is the footing for bodily well-being. The description of its individual essence is given in the Vibhaṅga:

original: sukhaṃ sukhindriyassa sarūpanti. Sādanīyaṭṭhena dhammapadāni attani assādayatīti🔽sātaṃ, madhuraṃ. Vedayitanti vediyanaṃ, anubhavananti attho. Aññadhammavisiṭṭhoti
analyzed: sukham sukha indriyassa sarūpanti sādanīya ṭṭhena dhamma padāni attani assādayati iti  sātam madhuram vedayitanti vediyanam anubhavananti atthaḥ añña dhamma visiṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: and pleasant is the nature of the pleasant faculty. The words of the Dhamma are “to be savored” in the sense of being relished in oneself.🔽“Delight” is sweet, delicious. “To be felt” : the meaning is, to be experienced. “Distinguished by other states” :

original: phassādīhi aññehi dhammehi visadiso. Kāyikanti pasādakāyasannissitaṃ. Cetasikanti🔽cetosannissitaṃ, tena vuttaṃ “ettha panā”tiādi. Kāyapasāda…pe… natthi, tasmā “cattāro
analyzed: phassa ādīhi aññehi dhammehi visadisaḥ kāyikam ti pasāda kāya sannissitam cetasikam ti  cetaḥ sannissitam tena vuttam ettha pana atiādi kāya pasādape natthi tasmā cattāro
translated: different from other states such as contact, etc. “Bodily” : dependent on the body that is the basis for confidence. “Mental” :

original: pasādakāye vatthuṃ katvā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pasādakāye vatthum katvā iti vuttam
translated: dependent on the mind. Therefore it is said: “Herein, etc.” There is no bodily confidence, etc., therefore it is said: “taking the four kinds of confidence as its basis.”

original: 9. Kaṭṭhopamasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kaṭṭhopama sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . The Discourse on the Simile of the Firewood, The Discourse on the Simile of the Firewood

original: 509. Dvinnaṃ araṇīnanti adharuttarāraṇīnaṃ. Kiñci dvayaṃ saṅghaṭṭitamattaṃ hutvā
analyzed: dvinnam araṇīnanti adhar uttarāraṇīnam kiñci dvayam saṅghaṭṭita mattam hutvā
translated: “Of the two sticks”: of the upper and lower sticks. Some pair of sticks may be merely in contact,

original: na samodhānagataṃ hotīti taṃnivattanatthaṃ “saṅghaṭṭanasamodhānā”ti vuttaṃ. Punappunaṃ
analyzed: na samodhāna gatam hoti iti tad nivattana attham saṅghaṭṭana samodhānā iti vuttam punappunam
translated: but not yet rubbed together. To exclude that, it is said: “rubbed together.” For the manifestation of heat is by the repeated rubbing together.

original: saṅghaṭṭanena hi tejopātubhāvo. Adharāraṇī viya vatthārammaṇaṃ asatipi vāyāme tajjasamphassapaccayato.
analyzed: saṅghaṭṭanena hi tejaḥ pātu bhāvaḥ adharāraṇī viya vattha ārammaṇam asati pi vāyāme tad ja samphassa paccayato
translated: The lower stick is like the object-support, and the upper stick is like the act of attention. Even without the act of attention, there is the condition of the contact born of that .

original: Uttarāraṇī viya phasso vatthārammaṇādiphassena pavattanato. Saṅghaṭṭo viya phassasaṅghaṭṭanaṃ
analyzed: uttarāraṇī viya phassaḥ vattha ārammaṇa ādi phassena pavattanataḥ saṅghaṭṭaḥ viya phassa saṅghaṭṭanam
translated: Contact is like the upper friction stick, because it occurs by striking the object-base, etc., with the contact. The striking of contact is like the striking of the two sticks.

original: araṇidvayasaṅghaṭṭanā viya phassasseva vatthārammaṇesu saṅghaṭṭanākārena pavattito.
analyzed: araṇi dvaya saṅghaṭṭanā viya phassassa iva vattha ārammaṇesu saṅghaṭṭana ākārena pavattitaḥ
translated: The occurrence of contact in the mode of striking the object-base, etc., is like the striking of the two friction sticks.

original: Aggi viya vedanā anudahanaṭṭhena khaṇikāvāyañca. Vatthārammaṇaṃ vā uttarāraṇī viya
analyzed: aggi viya vedanā anudahana ṭṭhena vattha ārammaṇam vā uttarāraṇī viya
translated: Feeling is like the fire, because it burns and because it is momentary. Or the object-base is like the upper friction stick,

original: indhanāpātagahaṇādīsu ussāhassa viya pavattisambhavato. Phasso adharāraṇī viya nirussāhanirīhatāvasena attasādhanato.
analyzed: indhana āpāta gahaṇa ādīsu ussāhassa viya pavatti sambhavataḥ phassaḥ adhara araṇī viya nirussāha nirīha tā vasena atta sādhanato
translated: because it is possible for it to occur in the mode of receiving the descent of the fire, like the effort in the case of the friction sticks. Contact is like the lower friction stick, because it is self-effacing and passive.

original: 10. Uppaṭipāṭikasuttavaṇṇanā🔽510. Rasanaṃ bhañjanaṃ nirujjhanaṃ raso. Yo yo dhammānaṃ raso yathādhammaraso, tena
analyzed: uppaṭipāṭika sutta vaṇṇanā  rasanam bhañjanam nirujjhanam rasaḥ yaḥ yaḥ dhammānam rasaḥ yathā dhamma rasaḥ tena
translated: The exposition of the faculties🔽The meaning of the word rasa is “that which is savoured” , “that which is tasted” , “that which is experienced” . The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which causes enjoyment .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is savoured .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is tasted .

original: yathādhammarasena. Paṭipāṭiyāti kamena, ubhayenapi dhammānaṃ pahānakkamenāti vuttaṃ
analyzed: yathā dhamma rasena paṭipāṭiyā ati kamena ubhayena api dhammānam pahāna kkamena ati vuttam
translated: The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is experienced .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is savoured .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is tasted .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is experienced .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is savoured .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is tasted .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is experienced .

original: hoti. Imasmiṃ indriyavibhaṅgeti imasmiṃ indriyasaṃyuttasaññite indriyavibhaṅge. Adesitattāti
analyzed: hoti imasmin indriya vibhaṅge iti imasmin indriya saṃyutta saññite indriya vibhaṅge a desita ttā ati
translated: The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is savoured .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is tasted .🔽The word rasa is derived from the verbal root rañj, to mean that which is experienced .

original: sesasuttāni viya “sukhindriya”ntiādinā adesitattā idaṃ uppaṭipāṭikasuttaṃ nāma. Valiyā
analyzed: sesa suttāni viya sukha indriya nti ādinā a desita ttā idam uppaṭipāṭikasuttam nāma valiyā
translated: “The pleasure faculty” and so on are not taught in the way the rest of the sutta is taught. So this sutta is called “The One with the Reversal.”

original: kharasamphassāya phuṭṭhassa. Tanti kaṇṭakavedanādiṃ. Etassa dukkhindriyassa.
analyzed: khara samphassāya phuṭṭhassa tanti kaṇṭaka vedanā ādim etassa dukkha indriyassa
translated: When he is touched by the rough contact of a thorn, etc., “that” means the pain faculty.

original: Tesaṃ tesanti domanassindriyādīnaṃ. Kāraṇavasenevāti taṃtaṃasādhāraṇakāraṇavasena. Tesañhi visesakāraṇaṃ dassento “pattacīvarādīnaṃ vā”ti āha.
analyzed: tesam tesanti domanassindriya ādīnam kāraṇa vasena iva ati taṃ taṃ asādhāraṇa kāraṇa vasena tesam hi visesa kāraṇam dassento patta cīvara ādīnam vā āha
translated: “Those” means the grief faculty, etc. “In accordance with their cause” means in accordance with their individual specific causes. For when he shows the specific causes of these, he says, “because of the bowl, the robe, etc.”🔽“In one unbroken stretch”: without repeatedly breaking off the process.

original: Ekatovāti punappunaṃ paduddhāraṇaṃ akatvā ekajjhameva. Dutiyajjhānādīnaṃ upacārakkhaṇe
analyzed: ekatas vā ati punappunam pad uddhāraṇam a katvā ekajjham eva dutiya jhāna ādīnam upacāra kkhaṇe
translated: The meaning is that they cease at the moment of access concentration to the second jhāna, etc.

original: eva nirujjhantīti ānetvā sambandho. Tesaṃ dukkhindriyadomanassādīnaṃ. Atisayanirodhoti🔽suṭṭhu pahānaṃ ujuppaṭipakkhena vūpasamo. Nirodhoyevāti nirodhamattameva. Nānāvajjaneti
analyzed: eva nirujjhanti iti ānetvā sambandhaḥ tesam dukkhindriya domanassa ādīnam atisaya nirodho ti  suṭṭhu pahānam uju paṭipakkhena vūpasamaḥ nirodho yeva ati nirodha mattam eva nānā vajjaneti
translated: The “complete cessation” of the pain faculty, grief faculty, etc., is their complete abandoning, their complete cessation by the tranquilization of their underlying tendencies.🔽“Cessation itself” is mere cessation.

original: yena āvajjanena appanāvīthi hoti, tato bhijjāvajjane, anekāvajjane vā. Appanāvīthiyañhi
analyzed: yena āvajjanena appanāvīthi hoti tatas bhijja āvajjane aneka āvajjane vā appanāvīthiyam hi
translated: “In the various kinds of adverting”: in the adverting that is the path of preparation for absorption. For the process of absorption is broken by the adverting that occurs in the interval between the path of preparation and absorption. Or the meaning can be taken as “in the various kinds of adverting” in the process of absorption itself.

original: upacāro ekāvajjano, itaro anekāvajjano anekakkhattuṃ pavattanato. Visamanisajjāya
analyzed: upacāraḥ eka āvajjanaḥ itaraḥ aneka āvajjanaḥ aneka khattum pavattanataḥ visama nisajjāya
translated: The former is the kind that is the object of a single adverting, the latter that of many advertings, because it occurs many times.

original: uppannakilamatho visamāsanupatāpo. Pītipharaṇenāti pītiyā pharaṇarasattā. Pītisamuṭṭhānānaṃ
analyzed: uppanna kilamathaḥ pīti pharaṇena ati pītiyā pharaṇa rasa ttā pīti samuṭṭhānānam
translated: The fatigue that arises through sitting in an uncomfortable posture is the discomfort of sitting in an uncomfortable posture.🔽Because it is the nature of happiness to spread, or because it pervades the body that has arisen through happiness,

original: vā paṇītarūpānaṃ kāyassa byāpanato vuttaṃ. Tenāha “sabbo kāyo sukhokkanto hotī”ti.🔽Vitakkavicārapaccayepīti pi-saddo aṭṭhānapayutto, so “pahīnassā”ti ettha ānetvā sambandhitabbo
analyzed: vā paṇīta rūpānam kāyassa byāpanataḥ vuttam tena āha sabbaḥ kāyo sukha ukkanto hoti iti  vitakka vicāra paccaye pi iti pi saddaḥ aṭṭhāna payuttaḥ saḥ pahīnassa ati ettha ānetvā sambandhitabbaḥ
translated: it is said, “The whole body seems as if it has been smeared with butter.”🔽The word “also” in the clause, “because of applied thought and sustained thought” is misplaced; it should be construed with “abandoned” in the clause, “even though the grief faculty has been abandoned.”

original: “pahīnassapi domanassindriyassā”ti. Etaṃ domanassindriyaṃ uppajjatīti sambandho.
analyzed: pahīnassa api domanassa indriyassa ati etam domanassa indriyam uppajjati iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The construction is: “The grief faculty arises in him.”

original: “Tassa mayhaṃ aticiraṃ vitakkayato vicārayato kāyopi kilami, cittampi vihaññī”ti
analyzed: tassa mayham aticiram vitakkayataḥ vicārayataḥ kāyaḥ api kilami cittam pi vihaññi iti
translated: Because of the words, “While I was thinking and pondering for a long time, my body became fatigued and my mind was upset,”

original: ca vacanato kāyacittakhedānaṃ vitakkavicārapaccayatā veditabbā. Vitakkavicārabhāve
analyzed: ca vacanataḥ kāya citta khedānam vitakka vicāra paccaya tā veditabbā vitakka vicāra bhāve
translated: the fatigue of body and the upset of mind should be understood as having applied thought and sustained thought as their condition.

original: uppajjati domanassindriyanti ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ. Tatthassa siyā uppattīti tattha
analyzed: uppajjati domanassindriyan ti ānetvā sambandhitabbam tatthassa siyā uppatti iti tattha
translated: The grief faculty arises in one who has applied thought and sustained thought should be construed as follows: “There, in that case, its arising is … ”

original: dutiyajjhānupacāre assa domanassassa uppatti bhaveyya. “Tatthassa siyā uppattī”ti
analyzed: dutiya jhāna upacāre assa domanassassa uppatti bhaveyya tattha assa siyā uppatti iti
translated: then there would be the arising of grief in the second jhāna too.🔽This statement, “There might be its arising there,”

original: idaṃ parikappavacanaṃ upacārakkhaṇe domanassassa suppahīnabhāvadassanatthaṃ. Tathā
analyzed: idam parikappa vacanam upacāra kkhaṇe domanassassa su pahīna bhāva dassana attham tathā
translated: is said in order to show that grief is well suppressed in the second-jhāna access.

original: hi vuttaṃ “na tveva dutiyajjhāne pahīnapaccayattā”ti. Pahīnampi somanassindriyaṃ🔽pīti viya na dūreti katvā “āsannattā”ti vuttaṃ. Nānāvajjanupacāre pahīnampi pahānaṅgaṃ
analyzed: hi vuttam na tu eva dutiya jhāne pahīna paccaya ttā ati pahīnam pi somanassa indriyam  pi iti viya na dūra iti katvā āsanna ttā iti vuttam nānā vajjan upacāre pahīnam pi pahāna aṅgam
translated: For it is said: “But not because of the abandoning of the conditions for it in the second jhāna” .🔽And although the joy faculty is abandoned, it is not far removed, like the happiness, and so it is said that it is “near” .

original: paṭipakkhena avihatattā antarantarā uppajjeyyāti imamatthaṃ dassento “appanāppattāyā”tiādimāha.🔽“Tādisāya āsevanāya icchitabbattā yathā maggavīthito pubbe dve tayo javanavārā sadisānupassanāva
analyzed: paṭipakkhena avihata ttā antarantarā uppajjeyya ti imam attham dassentaḥ appanā appattāya iti ādim āha  tādisāya āsevanāya icchitabba ttā yathā magga vīthitaḥ pubbe dve tayo javana vārā
translated: And although the factor of abandoning is abandoned in the access of the different perception, it might arise again from time to time because it is not suppressed by its opposite. Showing this, he said, “When the access has been reached” .

original: pavattanti, evamidhāpi appanāvārato pubbe dve tayo javanavārā upekkhāsahagatāva pavattantī”ti
analyzed: pavattanti evam idha api appanā vārato pubbe dve tayo javana vārāḥ upekkhā sahagatāḥ ava pavattanti iti
translated: “Because it is desirable that it be cultivated in this way, just as previously, before the path, two or three impulsions occur in the same way in the same mode of perception, so too here, before the impulsion of absorption, two or three impulsions occur accompanied by equanimity” .

original: vadanti. Aparisesanti suvikkhambhitanti katvā vikkhambhanena anavasesaṃ.
analyzed: vadanti su vikkhambhitanti katvā vikkhambhanena anavasesam
translated: “Without remainder” : without remainder by suppression, that is, by very thorough suppression.

original: Tathattāyāti tathabhāvāya paṭhamajjhānasamaṅgitāya. Sā panassa uppādanena vā uppannassa
analyzed: tathattāya ati tathabhāvāya paṭhamajjhāna samaṅgi tāya sā panassa uppādanena vā uppannassa
translated: For the purpose of thatness: for the purpose of the state of thatness, for the purpose of the possession of the first jhāna. And that comes about either through its arising or through its attainment,

original: samāpajjanena vā hotīti vuttaṃ “uppādanatthāya samāpajjanatthāyā”ti. Dvīsūti navamadasamesu suttantesu.
analyzed: samāpajjanena vā hoti iti vuttam uppādana tthāya samāpajjana tthāya ati dvīsu iti navama dasamesu suttantesu
translated: which is why it is said “for the purpose of its arising, for the purpose of its attainment.” In two: in the two sutta-texts in the ninth and tenth months.

original: Sukhindriyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sukhindriya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sukhindriya Vagga is finished.

original: 5. Jarāvaggo
analyzed: jarā vaggo
translated: The Chapter on Age

original: 1. Jarādhammasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: jarā dhamma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Discourse on the Nature of Being Subject to Old Age

original: 511. Pamukhe, pāsādassa ca pacchimabhāge ātapo pacchātapo, tasmiṃ pacchātape. So
analyzed: pamukhe pāsādassa ca pacchima bhāge ātapo pacchātapo tasmin pacchātape so
translated: In front: in the front part of the palace. The sun’s heat at the back of the palace is “the heat at the back.”

original: hi pāsādassa pamukhabhāvena kato. Kiṃ pana bhagavato vajirasāraṃ sarīraṃ otāpetabbaṃ
analyzed: hi pāsādassa pamukha bhāvena kataḥ kim pana bhagavataḥ vajira sāram sarīram otāpetabbam
translated: For that is made in the front part of the palace. But why should the Blessed One’s body, which is as hard as the vajra,

original: hotīti āha – “sammāsambuddhassā”tiādi. Ayañca imaṃ suttaṃ desitasamaye. Na sakkoti
analyzed: hoti iti āha sammāsambuddhassa atiādi ayaṃ ca imam suttam desita samaye na sakkoti
translated: need to be warmed? “The Fully Enlightened One’s” is said. And at the time when this sutta was taught,

original: byāmappabhāya kāyaci pabhāya anabhibhavanīyattā. Kiñcāpi buddhābhā sūriyābhāya anabhibhavanīyā,
analyzed: byāma ppabhāya kāyaci pabhāya an abhibhavanīya ttā kiñca api buddha ābhā sūriya ābhāya an abhibhavanīyā
translated: it could not be outshone by the radiance of the eyes or by any other radiance. And although the radiance of the Enlightened One cannot be outshone by the radiance of the sun,

original: ghammasabhāvatāya pana rasmīnaṃ parito pharantī sūriyābhā tikhiṇā uṇhāti āha “rasmiteja”nti.
analyzed: pana rasmīnam paritas āha
translated: nevertheless the sun’s rays, which spread around and are sharp and hot because of the nature of the rays, outshine the radiance of the moon, which is not like that. So it is said “the rays’ heat.”

original: Idāni tamatthaṃ upamāya vibhāvetuṃ “yatheva hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: idāni tam attham upamāya vibhāvetum yathā iva hi itiādi vuttam
translated: Now, in order to illustrate that meaning by means of a simile, the following is said: “Just as, etc.”

original: Suvaṇṇāvaṭṭaṃ viyāti acche suvaṇṇapatte vinivattaāvaṭṭaṃ viya. Garahaṇacchariyaṃ
analyzed: suvaṇṇa avaṭṭam acche suvaṇṇa patte vinivatta āvaṭṭam viya garahaṇa chariyam
translated: “Like a golden chain”: like a chain of gold leaves turned back to back.

original: nāma kiretaṃ “acchariyametaṃ avisicchephalavada”ntiādīsu viya. Na evametarahīti attano
analyzed: nāma kiretam na evam etarahi iti
translated: “The wonder of its being grasped” is, it seems, like that mentioned in the passage beginning, “This is a wonder, this is marvelous, that the fruit of the unblemished is unblemished” .🔽“Not so the other” : he speaks in terms of his own clarity, not in terms of the other’s.

original: pākaṭavasena vadati, na itaresampīti. Sirājālāti sirāsantānā. Evarūpaṃ na hotīti
analyzed: pākaṭa vasena vadati na sirā santānāḥ evarūpam na iti
translated: “A network of rays”: a series of rays. “Is not like that”

original: aññesaṃ pākatikasattānaṃ vuttākāraṃ viya na hoti puññasambhārassa uḷāratamattā vipaccanassa
analyzed: aññesam pākatika sattānam vutta ākāram viya na hoti puñña sambhārassa uḷāratama tā vipaccanassa
translated: because the accumulation of his merit is very great and the end of his retribution is not yet reached.

original: pariyantagatattā. Tenāha “aññesaṃ apākaṭa”nti. Valiyāvaṭṭakanti appakaṃ valiyāvaṭṭaṃ.
analyzed: tena āha aññesam apākaṭanti valiyā vaṭṭakanti appakam valiyā vaṭṭam
translated: Therefore he says, “It is not clear to the others.” “A little curl of hair”: a small curl of hair.🔽Therefore he says, “The size of the tip of a hair.” “All of them”: the network of rays.

original: Tenāha “kesaggappamāṇa”nti. Sabbānīti sirājālāni. Purato vaṅkoti thokaṃ purato natamattaṃ
analyzed: tena āha kesagga ppamāṇam ti sabbāni iti sirājālāni puratas vaṅko ti thokam puratas nata mattam
translated: “A little bent forward”: he says this referring to a slight bending forward.

original: sandhāyāha. Tena vuttaṃ “svāyaṃ aññesaṃ apākaṭo”ti. Nayaggāhatoti anumānato. Dhī
analyzed: sandhāya āha tena vuttam svāyam aññesam apākaṭaḥ ti naya ggāhato ti anumānataḥ dhī
translated: Therefore it is said, “This is not clear to the others.” “By inference”: by inference.

original: tanti dhī-saddayoge upayogavacanaṃ. Dhīti jigucchanatthe nipāto. Dhikkāroti jigucchāpayogo.
analyzed: tanti dhī sadda yoge upayoga vacanam dhī iti jigucchana atthe nipātaḥ dhikkāro iti jiguccha apayogaḥ
translated: The word “dhi” is used in the sense of “use” in the compound “dhi-saddayoge.” The particle “dhi” has the meaning of “contempt.” “Dhikkāra” is the use of contempt.

original: Taṃ phusatūti tuyhaṃ pāpuṇātu.
analyzed: tam phusatu iti tuyham pāpuṇātu
translated: “May it touch you” means “may it come to you.”

original: 2. Uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: uṇṇābha brāhmaṇa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Discourse on the Brahmin of the Uṇṇābha Clan

original: 512. Aññamaññassāti añño aññassa. Na paccanubhoti attano avisayabhāvato. Idāni taṃ aññavisayataṃ anvayato byatirekato vibhāvetuṃ “sace hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: aññam aññassa āti aññaḥ aññassa na paccanubhoti attanaḥ avisaya bhāvataḥ idāni tam añña visaya tam anvayataḥ byatirekataḥ vibhāvetum sace hi itiādi vuttam
translated: “One another’s” means “one’s own and another’s.” “Does not experience” means “is not the domain of one’s own.” Now, in order to clarify that other-domain by way of concomitance and non-concomitance, “If, indeed” and so forth are stated.

original: Visayāni paṭisaranti etthāti paṭisaraṇaṃ. Indriyaviññāṇāni hi asatipi tādise adhippāye
analyzed: visayāni paṭisaranti ettha ati paṭisaraṇam indriya viññāṇāni hi asati pi tādise adhippāye
translated: “The resort” is that to which the objects return. For, although there is no such intention,

original: attano ārammaṇassa yāthāvato sampajānanato pavedanavijānanāni karontāni viya pavattanti,
analyzed: attanaḥ ārammaṇassa yāthāvataḥ sampajānanataḥ pavedana vijānanāni karontāni viya pavattanti
translated: the sense-cognitions occur as if they were cognizing and discerning their objects as they are.

original: tathā lokassa aññattha siddhito. Tenāha bhagavā – “mano paṭisaraṇaṃ, manova nesaṃ
analyzed: tathā lokassa aññattha siddhito tena āha bhagavā
translated: So it is established elsewhere in the world. Therefore, the Blessed One said: “The mind is the resort. The mind alone experiences the domain and the object of each.

original: gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhotī”ti manodvārikajavanamano hi savisesaṃ manovisayaṃ paccanubhoti,
analyzed: gocara visayam paccanubhoti iti manaḥ dvārika javana manaḥ hi sa visesam manaḥ visayam paccanubhoti
translated: ” For, the mind-door adverting consciousness experiences the mind-object with distinction.

original: pañcadvārikajavanamano mananamattameva paccanubhavati. Rajjanādiggahaṇañcettha nidassanamattaṃ,
analyzed: pañca dvārika javana manaḥ manana mattam eva pat anubhavati rajjana ādi ggahaṇam ca ittha nidassana mattam
translated: The mind that occurs in the five doors experiences only the thinking. The mention of greed, etc., is by way of illustration.

original: tasmā saddahanādipi gahitamevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ, pañcadvārappavattivasena tathā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tasmā sat dahana ādi pi gahitam evā ti daṭṭhabbam pañca dvāra ppavatti vasena tathā vuttam
translated: Therefore it should be regarded as including approval, etc., too. It is said thus because of the occurrence in the five doors.

original: Ekasmiṃ pana dvāreti cakkhudvāre.
analyzed: ekasmin pana dvāre iti cakkhu dvāre
translated: “In one door”: in the eye door.

original: Dubbalabhojakāti appānubhāvā rājabhoggā. Āyanti bhoguppattiṭṭhānaṃ. Yottabandhādinimittaṃ🔽laddhabbakahāpaṇo yottakahāpaṇo. Addubandhādinimittaṃ gahetabbakahāpaṇo addukahāpaṇo.
analyzed: dubbala bhojakā ti appa anubhāvāḥ rāja bhoggāḥ āyanti bhoga uppatti ṭṭhānam yotta bandha ādi nimittam  laddhabba kahāpaṇaḥ yotta kahāpaṇaḥ addu bandha ādi nimittam gahetabba kahāpaṇaḥ addu kahāpaṇaḥ
translated: “Weakly supported”: of little power. “Income”: the source of income. “Wager”: the money won in gambling. “Wages”: the money earned by work.🔽“A coin won in gambling”: a coin won by gambling. “A coin earned by work”: a coin earned by work.

original: Māghātaghosanāya katāya hiṃsānimittaṃ gahetabbakahāpaṇo māpahārakahāpaṇo. Tassa parimāṇaṃ
analyzed: mā āghāta ghosanāya katāya hiṃsā nimittam gahetabba kahāpaṇaḥ mā apahāra kahāpaṇaḥ tassa parimāṇaṃ
translated: “A coin to be taken away”: a coin to be taken away as a fine. For when the proclamation is made, “Pay the fine!” the fine is to be taken away.

original: dassetuṃ “aṭṭhakahāpaṇo”tiādi vuttaṃ. Satavatthukanti satakarīsavatthukaṃ.
analyzed: dassetum aṭṭha kahāpaṇa iti ādi vuttam sata vatthukanti sata karīsa vatthukam
translated: To show the measure of that, it is said, “eight coins,” etc. “With six elephant loads of goods”: with goods that can be carried by six elephants.

original: Maggasatīti ariyamaggasati. Bhāvanamanuyuñjantassa hi javanamano ussakkitvāva maggasatiṃ
analyzed: magga sati iti ariya magga sati bhāvanam anuyuñjantassa hi javana manaḥ ussakkitvā ava magga satim
translated: “The mindfulness of the path”: the mindfulness of the noble path. For when one is devoted to development, the mind that occurs in the five doors is restrained by the mindfulness of the path.

original: paṭisarati tappariyosānattā. Tanti nibbānaṃ. Sāti phalavimutti. Paṭisarati aggamaggasatiyā.
analyzed: paṭisarati tad pariyosāna ttā tanti nibbānam sāti phala vimutti paṭisarati aggamagga satiyā
translated: it is the end of that, thus it is the end of that . T = Nibbāna. S = the deliverance of fruition. It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that . It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽Both Nibbāna and the deliverance of fruition are established only in the path.🔽There is no end of that , thus it is the end of that .

original: Phalavimutti nibbānanti ubhayaṃ maggassa siddhāyevāti. Ārammaṇavasena natthi etassa
analyzed: phala vimutti nibbānanti ubhayam maggassa siddhāya eva ati ārammaṇa vasena natthi etassa
translated: It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .

original: paṭisaraṇanti appaṭisaraṇaṃ asaṅkhatāmatassa santiniccasabhāvattā. Sayaṃ pana sabbesaṃyeva
analyzed: paṭisaraṇanti appaṭisaraṇam asaṅkhata matassa santi nicca sabhāva ttā sayam pana sabbesam yeva
translated: It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .

original: ariyānaṃ paṭisaraṇaṃ. Tenāha “nibbānaṃ arahato gatī”ti. Nibbānaṃ anupaviṭṭhaṃ nibbānanissayattā.🔽Na tato paraṃ gacchati gatassa aññassa tādisassa abhāvā. Nibbānaṃ pari sabbaso osānanti nibbānapariyosānaṃ.
analyzed: ariyānam paṭisaraṇam tena āha nibbānam arahataḥ gatī iti nibbānam anupaviṭṭham nibbāna nissaya ttā  na tatas param gacchati gatassa aññassa tādisassa abhāvā nibbānam pari sabbasas osānanti nibbāna pariyosānam
translated: It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .

original: Mūlajātā jātamūlā. Tato eva patiṭṭhitā. Kā panassāti āha “maggena āgatasaddhā”ti.
analyzed: mūla jātā jāta mūlā tatas eva patiṭṭhitā kā panassa ati āha maggena āgata saddhā iti
translated: It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .🔽It is the end of that , thus it is the end of that .

original: Maggo daḷhāya asaṃhāriyasaddhāya mūlaṃ diṭṭhisampayuttāni ceva vicikicchācittañcāti
analyzed: maggaḥ daḷhāya asaṃhāriya saddhāya mūlam diṭṭhi sampayuttāni ca iva vicikicchā cittam ca ati
translated: It is the end

original: pañca akusalacittāni samucchedavasena pahīnāni. Pañca nīvaraṇānīti ettha apāyagamanīyāni🔽paṭhamamaggeneva pahīnāni, itarāni vikkhambhanavasena jhānena pahīnānīti pañcasu
analyzed: pañca akusala cittāni samuccheda vasena pahīnāni pañca nīvaraṇāni iti ettha apāya gamanīyāni  paṭhama maggena iva pahīnāni itarāni vikkhambhana vasena jhānena pahīnāni iti pañcasu
translated: and the five unprofitable consciousnesses are given up by cutting them off. As to the five hindrances, those that lead to the states of loss

original: orambhāgiyakilesasaṃyojanesu ekadesavigameneva bahiddhāsaṃyojano viya jātoti vuttaṃ
analyzed: orambhāgiya kilesa saṃyojanesu eka desa vigamena iva bahiddhā saṃyojanaḥ viya jātaḥ iti vuttam
translated: are given up by the first path, while the others are given up by the jhāna that surpresses them. So he is said to be “one who has gone outside the fetters” in the sense that he has gone outside the five lower fetters and the five hither fetters.

original: “jhānaanāgāmiṭṭhāne ṭhito”ti. Tenāha “so aparihīna…pe… nibbāyeyyā”ti.
analyzed: jhāna anāgāmi ṭhāne ṭhito ti tena āha saḥ a parihīna pe nibbāyeyya ati
translated: He is said to be “standing on the fruit of non-return” because he is standing on the fruit of non-return by the jhāna that surpresses the hindrances. Hence it is said: “He would not fall back … he would make an end of suffering” .

original: 5. Paṭhamapubbārāmasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭhama pubbārāma sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The first of the Suttas in the Pubbārāma Group

original: 515. Pubbakoṭṭhake evaṃ āgatasuttaṃ ādiṃ katvā phalindriyāneva kathitāni aggaphalavasena desanāya āgatattā.
analyzed: pubba koṭṭhake evam āgata suttam ādim katvā phalindriyāni eva kathitāni agga phala vasena desanāya āgata ttā
translated: The first sutta in the Pubbārāma Group, which is given as the first in the Pubbārāma, is called “The First Sutta” . The faculties and powers are taught in it. They are called “the first” because they are taught as the foremost fruit.

original: 10. Āpaṇasuttavaṇṇanā🔽520. Upari saha vipassanāya tayo maggāti vipassanāya saha sotāpattiphalato upari
analyzed: āpaṇa sutta vaṇṇanā  upari saha vipassanāya tayo maggā ti vipassanāya saha sotāpatti phalato upari
translated: The Āpaṇa Sutta

original: tayo maggā. Maggādhigamena idāni paccakkhabhūtattā “ime kho te dhammā”ti vuttā. Tattha
analyzed: tayo maggā magga adhigamena idāni paccakkha bhūta ttā ime kho te dhammā ti vuttā tattha
translated: The three paths above with insight: the three paths above the fruit of stream-entry with insight. They are called “these states” because they are now evident with the obtaining of the paths. Herein,

original: yaṃ aggabhūtaṃ, tassa vasena dassetuṃ “arahattaphalindriyaṃ nāmā”ti vuttaṃ indriyabhāvasāmaññena
analyzed: yam agga bhūtam tassa vasena dassetum arahatta phalindriyam nāma ati vuttam indriya bhāva sāmaññena
translated: The words “the faculty of the fruition of Arahantship” are said in order to show that by the predominance of what is the foremost.🔽They are stated together by the similarity of their faculty nature.

original: ekajjhaṃ katvā. Ativijjhitvā passāmīti sacchikatvā yāthāvato passāmi. Catūhi indriyehīti
analyzed: ekajjham katvā ativijjhitvā passāmi iti sacchikatvā yāthāvataḥ passāmi catūhi indriyehi iti
translated: “I see by penetrating” means “I see by penetrating and seeing in accordance with actuality.”🔽“By four faculties” means by the four faculties beginning with the energy faculty.

original: vīriyindriyādīhi catūhi indriyehi. Sā vipassanāmaggaphalasahagatā siyāti missakā vuttā.
analyzed: vīriya indriya ādīhi catūhi indriyehi sā vipassanā magga phala sahagatā siyā ti missakā vuttā
translated: That insight is said to be mixed because it is accompanied by the path and fruition.

original: Jarāvaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jarā vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the Jarāvagga is finished.

original: 6. Sūkarakhatavaggo
analyzed: sūkara khata vaggo
translated: The Sūkarakhatavagga

original: 1. Sālasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sāla sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sālasutta

original: 521. Sūrabhāvenāti atisūrabhāvena. Bujjhanatthāyāti saccapaṭivedhāya.
analyzed: sūra bhāvena ati ati sūra bhāvena bujjhana tthāya ati sacca paṭivedhāya
translated: By the quality of being very fragrant: by the quality of being extremely fragrant. For the purpose of awakening: for the purpose of penetrating the truth.

original: 2. Mallikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: mallika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Mallikasutta🔽Four faculties: the remaining four faculties, leaving out the wisdom faculty.

original: 522. Cattāri indriyānīti paññindriyaṃ ṭhapetvā sesāni cattāri. “Ariyañāṇaṃ lokuttara”nti🔽vuttaṃ maggañāṇaṃ katvā. Ariya-saddo pana yathā tathā visuddhepi hotīti tādisaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: cattāri indriyāni iti paññindriyam ṭhapetvā sesāni cattāri ariya ñāṇam lokuttaranti  vuttam magga ñāṇam katvā ariya saddaḥ pana yathā tathā visuddhe api hoti iti tādisam sandhāya
translated: The knowledge of the noble ones is supramundane.🔽The word “noble” is used for what is purified in a certain way, so it is said “that too” and so on, referring to that kind.

original: vuttaṃ “tampi panā”tiādi. Yathā hi cattārindriyāni missakāni, evaṃ paññindriyampi
analyzed: vuttam tam pi pana atiādi yathā hi cattāri indriyāni missakāni evam paññindriyam pi
translated: Just as the four faculties are mixed, so too the wisdom faculty is mixed.

original: missakanti vuccamāne na koci virodhoti adhippāyenāha “tampi pana…pe… vaṭṭatī”ti.
analyzed: missakam ti vuccamāne na koci virodhaḥ ti adhippāyena āha tam pi panape vaṭṭati iti
translated: and there is no contradiction in saying ‘mixed’. With this intention he says ‘That is allowable too, etc.’

original: 3. Sekhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sekha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the verse on the disciple in higher training

original: 523. Na sakkoti indriyānaṃ aparipakkattā. Atthīti pajānāti nayaggāhena, na paccakkhato. Na hi ariyāpi anadhigataṃ maggaphalaṃ paccavekkhituṃ sakkonti.
analyzed: na sakkoti indriyānam a paripakka ttā atthi iti pajānāti naya ggāhena na paccakkhataḥ na hi ariyāḥ api anadhigatam magga phalam paccavekkhitum sakkonti
translated: he cannot because his faculties are not ripe. He knows that it exists by the method of inference, not by direct knowledge. For even noble persons cannot review a path and its fruition that has not been reached.

original: 6. Patiṭṭhitasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: patiṭṭhita sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the verse on the established one

original: 526. Sāsavesūti caturāsavavinimuttesu sesadhammesu ārammaṇesu. Tesupi uppajjanakaanatthato cittaṃ rakkhati nāma.
analyzed: sa āsavesu ti catur āsava vinimuttesu sesa dhammesu ārammaṇesu tesu pi uppajjanaka anatthataḥ cittam rakkhati nāma
translated: in those with cankers: in the remaining ideas that are objects, which are free from the four cankers. For it is in the sense of not giving an opportunity for arising that he guards his mind against them too.

original: 8. Sūkarakhatasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sūkarakhata sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the verse on the pig’s young🔽with reference to that: with reference to that pig’s trough. This is what is said:

original: 528. Taṃ sandhāyāti taṃ sūkarakhataleṇaṃ sandhāya. Etaṃ “sūkarakhatāya”nti vacanaṃ
analyzed: tam sandhāya ati tam sūkarakhataleṇam sandhāya etam sūkarakhatāyanti vacanam
translated: ‘in the manner of a pig’s trough’

original: vuttaṃ. Bhāvanapuṃsakanti bhāvajotakaṃ napuṃsakavacanaṃ yathā “visamaṃ vātā vāyanti,
analyzed: vuttam bhāva napuṃsakanti bhāva jotakam napuṃsaka vacanam yathā visamam vātāḥ vāyanti
translated: is said. The neuter form bhāvanā is a neuter form that indicates a state, like ‘uneven winds blow’🔽and ‘sit down at one side’ . The practice of the duties is a rival in the sense of a companion,

original: ekamantaṃ nisīdī”ti. Kiccapaṭipatti tesaṃ saṃkāsanaṭṭhena sapatiso, sapatiso eva
analyzed: ekamantam nisīdi iti kicca paṭipatti tesam saṃkāsana ṭṭhena sa patiso sa patiso eva
translated: a rival is just a companion,

original: sappatisso, sajeṭṭhakoti āha “sappatissoti sajeṭṭhako”ti.
analyzed: sappatissaḥ sajeṭṭhako ti āha sappatissaḥ ti sajeṭṭhako ti
translated: He is the one with the best of all, the chief of the free, he said.

original: Sūkarakhatavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sūkarakhata vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Sūkara-khatavivana is ended.

original: 7. Bodhipakkhiyavaggavaṇṇanā🔽531-650. Sattānaṃ phalānaṃ hetubhūtāni “imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ
analyzed: bodhi pakkhiya vagga vaṇṇanā  sattānam phalānam hetu bhūtāni imesam kho bhikkhave pañcannam indriyānam
translated: The section on the factors of enlightenment🔽The five faculties stated in the way beginning, “Bhikkhus, it is owing to the development of these five faculties”

original: bhāvitattā”tiādinā vuttāni, pañcindriyāniyeva phalūpacārena “satta phalānī”ti vuttāni.🔽Tāni ca pubbabhāgāni “imesaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā…pe… sattānisaṃsā
analyzed: bhāvita ttā ati ādinā vuttāni phala upacārena satta phalāni iti vuttāni  tāni ca pubba bhāgāni imesam bhikkhave pañcannam indriyānam bhāvita ttāpe satta anisaṃsā
translated: are called the seven fruits by way of a figurative use of effect-language.

original: pāṭikaṅkhā”ti vacanato. Tesanti sattānaṃ phalānaṃ. “Dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phala”nti
analyzed: pāṭikaṅkhā ati vacanato tesanti sattānam phalānam dvinnam phalānam aññataram phalanti
translated: And they are the prior states of the seven fruits, since it is said, “Bhikkhus, it is owing to the development of these five faculties that the seven fruits and benefits may be expected” .

original: evaṃ atītasutte vuttāni heṭṭhā dve phalāni nāmāti vadanti. Yehi pana indriyehi aññatra
analyzed: evam atīta sutte vuttāni heṭṭhā dve phalāni nāma ati vadanti yehi pana indriyehi aññatra
translated: And the two fruits stated in the way beginning, “One of two fruits may be expected” in the previous sutta are called the two fruits below,

original: pana antarāparinibbāyiṃ sesāni phalāni honti, tāni cattāri sapubbabhāgāni lokuttarānīti vuttaṃ siyā.
analyzed: pana antarā parinibbāyim sesāni phalāni honti tāni cattāri sa pubbabhāgāni lokuttarāni iti vuttam siyā
translated: but it may be said that the four other fruits with their prior states are the supramundane faculties by which the once-returner and the non-returner are distinguished.

original: Indriyasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: indriya saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the Linked Discourses with Faculties is ended.

original: 5. Sammappadhānasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā
translated: 5. The Connected Discourses on Right Striving

original: 651-704. Sammappadhānasaṃyutte pubbabhāgavipassanāva kathitā “akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāyā”tiādivacanato.
analyzed: sammappadhāna saṃyutte pubba bhāga vipassanā ava kathitā akusalānam dhammānam pahānāya iti ādi vacanato
translated: In the Connected Discourses on Right Striving, insight in the preliminary stage is taught, since it is said, “for the abandoning of unwholesome thoughts” .

original: Sammappadhānasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sammappadhāna saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Connected Discourses on Right Striving is completed.

original: 6. Balasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: bala saṃyutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Connected Discourses on the Powers

original: 705-812. Balasaṃyutte balāni missakāneva kathitāni “vivekanissita”nti vacanato.
analyzed: balasaṃyutte balāni kathitāni viveka nissitanti vacanataḥ
translated: In the Connected Discourses on the Powers, the powers are taught as mixed, since it is said, “based on seclusion” .

original: Balasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bala saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Connected Discourses on the Powers is completed.

original: 7. Iddhipādasaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: iddhipāda saṃyuttam
translated: The Connected Discourses on the Bases of Psychic Power

original: 1. Cāpālavaggo
analyzed: cāpāla vaggo
translated: The Chapter on the Arrow

original: 1. Apārasuttavaṇṇanā🔽813. Chandaṃ nissāya pavatto samādhīti kattukamyatāchandaṃ adhipatiṃ katvā paṭiladdhasamādhi🔽chandhasamādhi. Padhānasaṅkhārāti catukiccasādhakassa sammappadhānavīriyassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: apāra sutta vaṇṇanā  chandam nissāya pavattaḥ samādhi iti kattu kamyatā chandam adhipatim katvā paṭiladdha samādhi  chandha samādhi padhāna saṅkhārā ati catu kicca sādhakassa sammappadhāna vīriyassa etam adhivacanam
translated: The Discourse on the Other Shore🔽Concentration arisen with zeal as its basis: concentration attained with the will to act as its dominant condition.🔽Concentration through will. Striving formations: this is a designation for right effort, which accomplishes the fourfold task.

original: Tehīti chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārehi. Iddhiyā pādanti nipphattipariyāyena ijjhanaṭṭhena,
analyzed: tehi iti chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhārehi iddhiyā nipphatti pariyāyena ijjhanaṭṭhena
translated: By means of these: by means of the will, concentration, and striving formations. The bases of psychic power: in the sense of succeeding by the method of success,

original: ijjhanti etāya saddhā iddhā vuddhā ukkaṃsagatā hontīti iminā vā pariyāyena “iddhī”ti🔽saṅkhātānaṃ upacārajjhānādikusalacittasampayuttānaṃ chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārānaṃ
analyzed: ijjhanti etāya saddhāḥ iddhāḥ vuddhāḥ ukkaṃsa gatāḥ honti iti iminā vā pariyāyena iddhi iti  saṅkhātānam upacāra jhāna ādi kusala citta sampayuttānam chanda samādhi padhāna saṅkhārānam
translated: Or alternatively, they are “powers” in the sense that they are the cause of the arising of the various kinds of supernormal knowledge.🔽They are the four kinds of concentration associated with profitable cognizance, namely, access concentration, etc., which are called “powers” in the sense of being the cause of the arising of the various kinds of supernormal knowledge.

original: adhiṭṭhānaṭṭhena pādabhūtaṃ, sesacittacetasikarāsinti attho. Sā eva ca yathāvuttaiddhi
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena pāda bhūtam sesa citta cetasika rāsinti sā eva ca yathā vuttā etdhi
translated: They are the footing in the sense of being the foundation for the states of faith, etc., which are called “powers” in the sense of being the cause of the arising of the various kinds of supernormal knowledge.🔽And that same “power” is called “base” in the sense of being the foundation for the various kinds of supernormal knowledge.

original: yasmā heṭṭhimā heṭṭhimā uparimāya uparimāya pādabhūtā, tasmā vuttaṃ “iddhibhūtaṃ🔽vā pādanti iddhipāda”nti. Sesesūti vīriyasamādhiādīsu. Tattha hi vīriyaṃ cittaṃ vīmaṃsaṃ
analyzed: yasmā heṭṭhimā heṭṭhimā uparimāya uparimāya pāda bhūtā tasmā vuttam iddhi bhūtam  vā iddhipādanti sesesu uti vīriya samādhi ādīsu tattha hi vīriyam cittam vīmaṃsam
translated: And since the lower is the foundation for the higher, it is said that “the ‘base’ is a ‘power’ and the ‘power’ is a ‘base’ ” .🔽In the other three, namely, the concentration due to energy, the concentration due to cognizance, and the concentration due to inquiry,

original: adhipatiṃ katvā paṭiladdhasamādhi vīmaṃsāsamādhīti attho veditabbo. Idhāti imasmiṃ
analyzed: adhipatim katvā paṭiladdha samādhi vīmaṃsā samādhi iti atthaḥ veditabbaḥ idha ati imasmin
translated: the concentration obtained by making energy, cognizance, and inquiry respectively predominant should be understood as concentration due to energy, concentration due to cognizance, and concentration due to inquiry.

original: iddhipādasaṃyutte. Ekaparicchedova atthaniddeso.🔽5. Iddhipadesasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: iddhipāda saṃyutte eka paricchedaḥ u va attha niddeso  iddhi padesa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Herein, the explanation of the meaning is confined to this single section.🔽The explanation of the “bases of success” .🔽“Bases of success”: the bases of success are the three paths and the three fruits.

original: 817. Iddhipadesanti iddhiyā ekadesaṃ. Ko pana soti āha – “tayo ca magge tīṇi ca phalānī”ti.🔽6. Samattasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: iddhiyā eka desam kaḥ pana saḥ ti āha tayo ca magge tīṇi ca phalāni iti 🔽samatta sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the “perfections” .

original: 818. Samattanti sāmaññassa samaṃ attanaṃ ijjhanaṃ samattaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ. Vivaṭṭapādakā eva iddhipādā kathitā “apārā pāraṃ gamanāya saṃvattantī”tiādivacanato.
analyzed: samattanti sāmaññassa samam attanam ijjhanam samattam paripuṇṇam vivaṭṭa pādakā eva iddhipādā kathitā apārā pāram gamanāya saṃvattanti iti ādi vacanato
translated: “Complete” : the complete, fulfilled, self-perfected state of the commonalty of recluseship. The bases of success are called “bases of success” because they lead to the crossing over of the flood, etc., as stated in the texts.

original: 10. Cetiyasuttavaṇṇanā🔽822. Udenayakkhassa cetiyaṭṭhāneti udenassa nāma yakkhassa devāyatanasaṅkhepena iṭṭhakāhi
analyzed: cetiya sutta vaṇṇanā  udena yakkhassa cetiya ṭṭhāne ti udenassa nāma yakkhassa devāyatana saṅkhepena
translated: . The explanation of the Cetiya Sutta

original: kate mahājanassa cittīkataṭṭhāne. Katavihāroti bhagavantaṃ uddissa tattha katavihāro.
analyzed: kate mahājanassa cittīkata ṭṭhāne kata vihāro ti bhagavantam uddissa tattha kata vihāro
translated: “The shrine of the spirit Udena” : in brief, a shrine of the gods, built of bricks, at a place that inspired awe in the minds of the people. “The monastery built there” : the monastery built there for the Blessed One.

original: Vuccatīti purimavohārena “udenacetiya”nti vuccati. Gotamakādīsupīti gotamakacetiyanti
analyzed: vuccati iti purima vohārena udenacetiyanti vuccati gotamaka ādīsu pi iti gotamaka cetiyanti
translated: “Is called” : is referred to by the old designation “Udena’s shrine.” “Gotamaka, etc.” : in the same way, “Gotamaka’s shrine,” etc.

original: evamādīsupi. Eseva nayoti cetiyaṭṭhāne katavihārabhāvaṃ atidisati. Vaḍḍhitāti bhāvanāpāripūrivasena
analyzed: evamādīsu pi cetiya ṭṭhāne kata vihāra bhāvam atidisati vaḍḍhitā ati bhāvanā pāripūri vasena
translated: “This is the method” : he shows that the monastery was built at the shrine. “Flourished” : was developed by the completion of development.

original: paribrūhitā. Punappunaṃ katāti bhāvanāya bahulīkaraṇavasena aparāparaṃ pavattitā
analyzed: paribrūhitā punappunam katā ati bhāvanāya bahulīkaraṇa vasena apara aparam
translated: “Was repeatedly made” : was repeatedly made to occur by the repeated performance of development.

original: ānītā. Yuttayānaṃ viya katāti yathā yuttamājaññayānaṃ chekena sārathinā adhiṭṭhitaṃ
analyzed: ānītāḥ yutta yānam viya katā ati yathā yuttam ājañña yānam chekena sārathinā adhiṭṭhitam
translated: “Brought”: just as a well-harnessed chariot is controlled by a skillful charioteer,

original: yathāruci pavattimarahati, evaṃ yathāruci pavattanārahataṃ gamitā. Patiṭṭhānaṭṭhenāti🔽adhiṭṭhānaṭṭhena. Vatthu viya katāti sabbaso upakkilesavisodhanena iddhivisesānaṃ
analyzed: yathāruci pavattim arahati evam yathāruci pavattana arahatam gamitā patiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena ati  adhiṭṭhāna ṭṭhena vatthu viya katā ati sabbaso upakkilesa visodhanena iddhi visesānam
translated: “They have been brought” : they have been brought to the state of being able to occur in any way desired, just as a well-trained chariot can be directed by the charioteer to go in any way he wishes.🔽“They have been made to stand firm” : they have been made to stand firm in the sense of being established.🔽“They have been made like the ground” : they have been made like a well-cleared piece of ground, which is the basis for the occurrence of the various kinds of success, by completely purifying them of all defilements.

original: pavattiṭṭhānabhāvato suvisodhitaparissayavatthu viya katā. Adhiṭṭhitāti paṭipakkhadūrībhāvato
analyzed: pavatti ṭṭhāna bhāvataḥ su visodhita parissaya vatthu viya katā adhiṭṭhitā ati paṭipakkha dūrībhāvato
translated: “They have been established” : they have been established by the power of well-developed meditation, which has removed all opposition, and thus have become fit for the various kinds of resolve.

original: subhāvitabhāvena taṃtaṃadhiṭṭhānayogyatāya ṭhapitā. Samantato citāti sabbabhāgena🔽bhāvanupacayaṃ gamitā. Tenāha “suvaḍḍhitā”ti. Suṭṭhu samāraddhāti iddhibhāvanāya
analyzed: su bhāvita bhāvena taṃ taṃ adhiṭṭhāna yogyatāya ṭhapitā samantataḥ citā ati sabba bhāgena  bhāvan upacayam gamitā tena āha su vaḍḍhitā iti suṭṭhu samāraddhā iti iddhi bhāvanāya
translated: “They have been made to stand firm all around” : they have been brought to the state of being well-developed in every way.

original: sikhappattiyā sammadeva saṃsevitā.
analyzed: sikhappattiyā sammad eva saṃsevitā
translated: “They have been well-increased” : they have been well-practiced by the attainment of skill in the development of success.🔽“They have been made independent” : by the words “of anyone at all” they have been made independent.

original: Aniyamenāti “yassa kassacī”ti aniyatavacanena. Niyametvāti “tathāgatassā”ti sarūpaggahaṇena
analyzed: aniyamena ati yassa kassaci iti aniyata vacanena niyametvā ati tathāgatassa ati sarūpa ggahaṇena
translated: “They have been made dependent” : by the words “of a Tathāgata” they have been made dependent.

original: niyametvā. Āyuppamāṇanti paramāyuppamāṇaṃ vadati. Tasseva gahaṇe kāraṇaṃ brahmajālavaṇṇanāyaṃ
analyzed: niyametvā āyu pamāṇam ti parama āyu pamāṇam vadati tassa iva gahaṇe kāraṇam brahmajāla vaṇṇanāyam
translated: “He has fixed it”: he has stated the maximum life-span. The reason for his doing so should be understood in the way stated in the Brahmajāla Commentary.

original: vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Mahāsīvatthero pana mahābodhisattānaṃ carimabhave paṭisandhidāyino
analyzed: vutta nayena iva veditabbam mahāsīva theraḥ pana mahā bodhisattānam carima bhave paṭisandhi dāyinaḥ
translated: But the Elder Maha-Siva said: “The maximum life-span of Buddhas is stated in the texts as being able to ward off the danger of death.

original: kammassa asaṅkheyyāyukatāsaṃvattanasamatthataṃ hadaye ṭhapetvā buddhānaṃ āyusaṅkhārassa🔽parissayavikkhambhanasamatthatā pāḷiyaṃ āgatā evāti imaṃ bhaddakappameva tiṭṭheyyāti avoca.🔽Khaṇḍiccādīhi abhisuyyatīti etena yathā iddhibalena jarāya na paṭighāto, evaṃ tena
analyzed: kammassa asaṅkheyya āyuka tā saṃvattana samattha tam hadaye ṭhapetvā buddhānam āyu saṅkhārassa  parissaya vikkhambhana samattha tā pāḷiyam āgatā eva ati imam bhadda kappam eva tiṭṭheyya ati avoca  khaṇḍicca ādīhi etena yathā iddhi balena jarāya na paṭighātaḥ evam tena
translated: So let this good statement stand: that the maximum life-span of Buddhas is incalculable.”🔽“He is envious of the Buddha’s life-span” : by this it is implied that just as there is no resistance to ageing through the power of psychic potency, so there is no resistance to death.

original: maraṇassapi na paṭighātoti atthato āpannamevāti. “Kva saro khitto, kvacani patito”ti
analyzed: maraṇassa api na paṭighāto ti atthataḥ āpannam eva ati kva saraḥ khittaḥ kvacani patito ti
translated: “Where was the arrow shot? Where did it fall?”

original: aññathā vuṭṭhitenapi theravādena aṭṭhakathāvacanameva samatthitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Tenāha
analyzed: aññathā vuṭṭhitena api thera vādena aṭṭhakathā vacanam eva samatthitan ti daṭṭhabbam tena āha
translated: The Elder’s statement, which is given in a different way, should be understood as the statement of the commentary. Therefore he said:

original: “so pana na ruccati…pe… niyamita”nti.
analyzed: saḥ pana na
translated: “But that is not acceptable … fixed.”

original: Pariyuṭṭhitacittoti yathā kiñci atthānatthaṃ sallakkhetuṃ na sakkā, evaṃ abhibhūtacitto.
analyzed: pariyuṭṭhita cittaḥ ti yathā kiñci attha anattham sallakkhetum na sakkā evam abhibhūta cittaḥ
translated: “His mind was overwhelmed” means that his mind was so overpowered that he was unable to discern what was beneficial or harmful.

original: So pana abhibhavo mahatā udakoghena appakassa udakassa ajjhottharaṇaṃ viya ahosīti
analyzed: saḥ pana abhibhavaḥ mahatā udaka oghena appakassa udakassa ajjhottharaṇam viya ahosi iti
translated: But that overpowering was like a great flood of water overwhelming a little water.

original: vuttaṃ “ajjhotthaṭacitto”ti. Aññoti therato, ariyehi vā añño yo koci paro puthujjano.
analyzed: vuttam ajjhotthaṭa cittaḥ ti aññaḥ ti therataḥ ariyehi vā aññaḥ yaḥ koci paraḥ puthujjanaḥ
translated: Therefore it is said, “His mind was overwhelmed.” “Another” means someone other than the Elder, or anyone else, whether noble or ordinary.

original: Puthujjanaggahaṇañcettha yathā sabbena sabbaṃ appahīnavipallāso mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto
analyzed: puthujjana ggahaṇam ca ittha yathā sabbena sabbam appahīna vipallāsaḥ mārena pariyuṭṭhita cittaḥ
translated: The inclusion of ordinary people here is to show that one whose perversions have not been completely abandoned by any means, and whose mind is overwhelmed by Mara,

original: kiñci atthānatthaṃ sallakkhetuṃ na sakkoti, evaṃ thero bhagavatā kataṃ nimittobhāsaṃ
analyzed: kiñci attha anattham sallakkhetum na sakkoti evam theraḥ bhagavatā katam nimitta ubhāsam
translated: is unable to discern what is beneficial or harmful, just as the Elder was unable to discern the sign manifested by the Blessed One.

original: sabbaso na sallakkhesīti dassanatthaṃ. Tenāha “māro hī”tiādi. Cattāro vipallāsāti
analyzed: sabbasas na sallakkhesi iti dassana attham tena āha māraḥ hi itiādi cattāro vipallāsā ti
translated: Therefore it is said, “For Mara,” etc. “The four perversions” are:

original: asubhe “subha”nti saññāvipallāso, cittavipallāso, dukkhe “sukha”nti saññāvipallāso,
analyzed: asubhe subhanti saññā vipallāso citta vipallāso dukkhe sukhanti saññā vipallāso
translated: the perversion of perception, the perversion of mind, the perversion of perception, and the perversion of mind regarding the foul as beautiful, and regarding suffering as happiness.

original: cittavipallāsoti ime cattāro vipallāsā. Tenāti yadipi itare aṭṭha vipallāsā pahīnā,
analyzed: citta vipallāso ti ime cattāraḥ vipallāsā tena ati yadi pi itare aṭṭha vipallāsā pahīnā
translated: These are the four perversions. “Although the other eight perversions were abandoned,” etc.

original: yathāvuttānaṃ catunnaṃ vipallāsānaṃ appahīnabhāvena. Assāti therassa.🔽Maddatīti phusanamattena maddanto viya hoti, aññathā tena maddite sattānaṃ maraṇameva
analyzed: yathāvuttānam catunnam vipallāsānam appahīna bhāvena therassa  maddati iti phusana mattena maddantaḥ viya hoti aññathā tena maddite sattānam maraṇam eva
translated: By the fact that the four perversions mentioned are unabandoned in him. Assa means “of the Elder.”🔽Maddati means he is as if intoxicated by the mere touch. Otherwise, if he were not,

original: siyā, kiṃ sakkhissati na sakkhissatīti adhippāyo. Kasmā na sakkhissati? Nanu esa
analyzed: siyā kim sakkhissati na sakkhissati iti adhippāyaḥ kasmā na sakkhissati nanu esa
translated: the intention is that he would be able to kill beings by his mere touch. Why would he not be able to? Is he not

original: aggasāvakassa mahiddhikassa mahānubhāvassa kucchiṃ paviṭṭhoti? Saccaṃ paviṭṭho, tañca
analyzed: aggasāvakassa mahiddhikassa mahā anubhāvassa kucchim paviṭṭhaḥ ti saccam paviṭṭhaḥ tat ca
translated: one who has entered the belly of the Elder, who is a great disciple of great power and influence? It is true that he has entered

original: kho attano mahānubhāvassa dassanatthaṃ, na vibādhanādhippāyena. Vibādhanādhippāyena
analyzed: kho attanaḥ mahā anubhāvassa dassana attham na vibādhana adhippāyena vibādhana adhippāyena
translated: him, but that is in order to show his own great power, not with the intention of harming him. But with the intention of harming

original: pana idha “kiṃ sakkhissatī”ti vuttaṃ hadayamaddanassa adhikatattā. Nimittobhāsanti🔽ettha “tiṭṭhatu bhagavā kappa”nti sakalakappaṃ avaṭṭhānayācanāya “yassa kassaci,
analyzed: pana idha kim sakkhissati iti vuttam hadaya maddanassa adhikata ttā  ettha tiṭṭhatu bhagavā kappanti sakala kappam avaṭṭhāna yācanāya yassa kassaci
translated: him, “What will he be able to do?” is said here, because of the predominance of the heart-rending. Nimittobhāsanti

original: ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā”tiādinā aññāpadesena attano caturiddhipādabhāvanānubhāvena
analyzed: ānanda cattāro iddhipādāḥ bhāvitā ati ādinā añña apadesena attano catur iddhipāda bhāvanā anubhāvena
translated: here, “Let the Blessed One remain, venerable sir, for an aeon” is the request to remain for an entire aeon. “Whoever has developed the four roads to power, Ānanda” and so on is the indication of his own knowledge by the power of his development of the four roads to power.

original: kappaṃ avaṭṭhānasamatthatāvasena saññuppādanaṃ nimittaṃ. Tathā pana pariyāyaggahaṇaṃ
analyzed: kappam avaṭṭhāna samattha tā vasena saññā uppādanam nimittam tathā pana pariyāya ggahaṇam
translated: The sign is the production of perception by the power of remaining for an eon. The illumination is the revealing of one’s own intention straightforwardly,

original: muñcitvā ujukaṃyeva attano adhippāyavibhāvanaṃ obhāso. Jānantoyevāti mārena pariyuṭṭhitabhāvaṃ
analyzed: muñcitvā ujukam yā iva attanaḥ adhippāya vibhāvanam obhāsaḥ jānantaḥ yā iva ati mārena pariyuṭṭhita bhāvam
translated: after abandoning the roundabout way of speaking. “Though knowing”: though knowing the state of being beset by Māra.

original: jānanto eva. Attano aparādhahetuko sattānaṃ soko tanuko hoti, na balavāti āha – “dosāropanena🔽sokatanukaraṇattha”nti. Kiṃ pana thero mārena pariyuṭṭhitacittakāle pavattiṃ pacchā
analyzed: jānantaḥ eva attanaḥ aparādha hetuko sattānam sokaḥ tanukaḥ hoti na balavā ati āha dosa āropanena  soka tanu karaṇa ttham ti kim pana theraḥ mārena pariyuṭṭhita citta kāle pavattim pacchā
translated: The sorrow of beings is slight, not strong, because of his own fault. Therefore it is said: “for the purpose of making sorrow slight by the imputation of hate.”

original: jānātīti? Na jānāti sabhāvena, buddhānubhāvena pana jānāti.🔽Anatthe niyojento guṇamāraṇena māreti, virāgavibandhanena vā jātinimittatāya tattha🔽tattha jātaṃ mārento viya hotīti “māretīti māro”ti vuttaṃ. Atipāpattā pāpimā. Kaṇhadhammasamannāgato
analyzed: jānāti iti na jānāti sabhāvena buddha anubhāvena pana jānāti  anatthe niyojentaḥ guṇa māraṇena māreti virāga vibandhanena vā jāti nimitta tāya  tattha jātam mārentaḥ viya hoti iti māreti iti māro ti vuttam ati pāpattā pāpimā kaṇha dhamma samannāgato
translated: But how does the Elder know the occurrence after the time of being beset by Māra? He does not know by his own nature, but he knows by the power of the Buddha.

original: kaṇho. Virāgādiguṇānaṃ antakaraṇato antako. Sattānaṃ anatthāvahaṃ paṭipattiṃ na muñcatīti
analyzed: kaṇhaḥ virāga ādi guṇānam anta karaṇataḥ antakaḥ sattānam anattha āvaham paṭipattim na muñcati iti
translated: By killing off the virtues, he kills by the imputation of evil. Or, by obstructing the fading away of lust, he is like one who kills what is born here and there by the sign of birth. Therefore it is said: “he kills, thus he is Māra.” The worst of sinners is pāpimā. The one endowed with black states is kaṇha. He is antaka because he makes an end of the virtues of fading away, etc. He does not release the practice that brings harm to beings.

original: namuci. Attano mārapāsena pamatte bandhati, pamattā vā bandhū etassāti pamattabandhu.🔽Sattamasattāhato paraṃ satta ahāni sandhāyāha “aṭṭhame sattāhe”ti, na pana pallaṅkasattāhādi
analyzed: namuci attanaḥ māra pāsena pamatte bandhati pamattā vā bandhū etassa ati pamatta bandhu  sattama sattāhataḥ param satta ahāni sandhāya āha aṭṭhame sattāha iti na pana pallaṅka sattāha ādi
translated: Namuci. He binds the negligent with his own Mara-snare, or the negligent are bound by him, thus he is the negligent’s friend.

original: viya niyatakiccassa aṭṭhamasattāhassa nāma labbhanato. Sattamasattāhassa hi parato
analyzed: viya niyata kiccassa aṭṭhama sattāhassa nāma labbhanato sattama sattāhassa hi paratas
translated: After the seventh week he said “in the eighth week” referring to the seven days following the seventh week, but not because there is such a thing as an eighth week of a fixed span of time as there is with the seven weeks beginning with the week of the seat . For after the seventh week

original: ajapālanigrodhamūle brahmuno sakkassa ca paṭiññātadhammadesanaṃ bhagavantaṃ ñatvā
analyzed: ajapāla nigrodha mūle brahmuno sakkassa ca paṭiññāta dhamma desanam bhagavantam ñatvā
translated: Brahma and Sakka knew that the Blessed One was ready to teach the Dhamma after they had made their request at the root of the Ajapala Nigrodha tree.

original: “idāni satte dhammadesanāya mama visayaṃ atikkāmessatī”ti sañjātadomanasso hutvā🔽ṭhito cintesi, “handāhaṃ dāni naṃ upāyena parinibbāpessāmi, evamassa manoratho aññathattaṃ🔽gamissati, mama manoratho ijjhissatī”ti cintetvā bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ
analyzed: idāni satte dhamma desanāya mama visayam atikkāmessati iti sañjāta domanassaḥ hutvā  ṭhitaḥ cintesi handa aham dāni naṃ upāyena parinibbāpessāmi evam assa manorathaḥ aññathattam  gamissati mama manorathaḥ ijjhissati iti cintetvā bhagavantam upasaṅkamitvā ekamantam
translated: So Mara was dispirited and thought, “Now in seven days he will overstep my domain by teaching the Dhamma,

original: ṭhito – “parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā”tiādinā parinibbānaṃ yāci. Taṃ sandhāya
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ parinibbātu dāni bhante bhagavā ati ādinā parinibbānam yāci tam sandhāya
translated: and his wish will be fulfilled and mine frustrated.” So he went to the Blessed One and stood at one side saying, “Let the Blessed One now attain complete extinction,” and so on, and asked for his extinction. This is the context.

original: vuttaṃ “aṭṭhame sattāhe”tiādi. Tattha ajjāti āyusaṅkhāravossajjanadivasaṃ sandhāyāha.🔽Bhagavā cassa atibandhanādhippāyaṃ jānantopi taṃ anāvikatvā parinibbānassa akālabhāvameva
analyzed: vuttam aṭṭhame sattāhe tiādi tattha ajjā iti āyu saṅkhāra vossajjana divasam sandhāya āha  bhagavā ca ssa atibandhana adhippāyam jānantaḥ api tam anāvika tvā parinibbānassa akāla bhāvam eva
translated: “On the eighth day after his birth” and so on. Herein, today is the day on which he relinquished his life formation.🔽Although the Blessed One knew the purpose of his request, he did not reveal it.🔽He refused the request, showing that the time for his final extinction had not yet come.

original: pakāsento yācanaṃ paṭikkhipi. Tenāha “na tāvāha”ntiādi.🔽Maggavasena byattāti saccapaṭivedhaveyyattiyena byattā. Tatheva vinītāti maggavasena🔽kilesānaṃ samucchedavinayena vinītā. Tathā visāradāti ariyamaggādhigameneva satthusāsane
analyzed: pakāsentaḥ yācanam tena āha na tau aham itiādi  magga vasena byattā ati sacca paṭivedha veyyattiyena byattā tathā iva vinītā ati magga vasena  kilesānam samuccheda vinayena vinītā tathā visāradā ati ariya magga adhigamena iva satthu sāsane
translated: That is why he said, “Not yet, Ananda.”🔽“Accomplished”: accomplished by the penetration of the truths.🔽“Well trained”: well trained by the training in the complete destruction of the defilements by means of the path.

original: vesārajjappattiyā visāradā, sārajjakarānaṃ diṭṭhivicikicchādipāpadhammānaṃ vigamena🔽visāradabhāvaṃ pattāti attho. Yassa sutassa vasena vaṭṭadukkhato nissaraṇaṃ sambhavati,
analyzed: vesārajja ppattiyā visāradā sārajja karānam diṭṭhi vicikicchā ādi pāpa dhammānam vigamena  visārada bhāvam pattā ti attho yassa sutassa vasena vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ nissaraṇam sambhavati
translated: “Confident”: confident by the attainment of fearlessness in the Master’s Dispensation through the acquisition of the noble path. The meaning is that they have become confident by the absence of the states of defilement that cause fear, such as false views and doubt.🔽The “learning” meant here is that by means of which escape from the suffering of the round is possible.

original: taṃ idha ukkaṭṭhaniddesena “suta”nti adhippetanti āha “tepiṭakavasenā”ti. Tiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: tam idha ukkaṭṭha niddesena sutanti adhippetanti āha tepiṭaka vasena ati tiṇṇam
translated: That is why he said “the learning of the three baskets.”

original: piṭakānaṃ samūho tepiṭakaṃ, tīṇi vā piṭakāni tipiṭakaṃ, tipiṭakameva tepiṭakaṃ, tassa
analyzed: piṭakānam samūhaḥ tepiṭakam tīṇi vā piṭakāni ti piṭakam ti piṭakam eva tepiṭakam tassa
translated: The word tipitaka is derived from the word piṭaka in the sense of a collection, and from the word piṭaka in the sense of a basket. The word tipitaka is also derived from the word piṭaka in the sense of a basket, and from the word piṭaka in the sense of a collection.🔽The same: the same as that called “learning” because it is to be heard.

original: vasena. Tadevāti yaṃ taṃ tepiṭakaṃ sotabbabhāvena sutanti vuttaṃ, tameva. Dhammanti
analyzed: vasena tat eva ati yam tam tepiṭakam sotabba bhāvena sutan ti vuttam tam eva dhammam ti
translated: Dhamma: the dhamma as text.

original: pariyattidhammaṃ. Dhārentīti suvaṇṇabhājane pakkhittasīhavasaṃ viya avinassantaṃ🔽katvā suppaguṇasuppavattibhāvena dhārenti hadaye ṭhapenti. Iti pariyattidhammavasena
analyzed: pariyatti dhammam dhārenti iti suvaṇṇa bhājane pakkhitta sīha vasam viya a vinassantam  katvā suppa guṇa suppavatti bhāvena dhārenti hadaye ṭhapenti iti pariyatti dhamma vasena
translated: They bear in mind: they bear it in mind by keeping it from being lost, as one keeps saffron in a casket, and they place it in the heart by making it well grounded and well mastered.

original: bahussutadhammadharabhāvaṃ dassetvā idāni paṭivedhavasenapi taṃ dassento “atha vā”tiādi
analyzed: bahu ssuta dhamma dhara bhāvam dassetvā idāni paṭivedha vasena api tam dassentaḥ atha vā ati ādi
translated: Having thus shown that he is one who has learned much and bears in mind the Dhamma as text, he now shows that he is also one who has penetrated the Dhamma by saying “Or else, the Dhamma of the noble ones” and so on.

original: vuttaṃ. Ariyadhammassāti maggaphaladhammassa, navavidhassa vā lokuttaradhammassa.🔽Anudhammabhūtanti adhigamāyānurūpaṃ dhammabhūtaṃ. Anucchavikapaṭipadanti tameva vipassanādhammamāha,
analyzed: vuttam ariya dhammassa āti magga phala dhammassa navavidhassa vā lokuttara dhammassa  anu dhamma bhūtanti adhigamāya anurūpam dhamma bhūtam anucchavika paṭipadam ti tam eva vipassanā dhammam āha
translated: The Dhamma of the noble ones: the path and fruition dhammas, or the supramundane dhammas of the ninefold supramundane Dhamma.🔽The Dhamma that is in conformity with that: the Dhamma that is in conformity with the attainment. The practice that is in conformity with that: the same insight Dhamma is called the practice that is in conformity with that, or the six kinds of purification.

original: chabbidhā visuddhiyo vā. Anudhammanti nibbānadhammassa anudhammo, yathāvuttapaṭipadā,
analyzed: chabbidhāḥ visuddhiyaḥ vā nibbāna dhammassa anudhammaḥ yathā vutta paṭipadā
translated: The Dhamma that is in conformity with the Dhamma of extinction: the practice that is in conformity with the Dhamma of extinction is the practice described above,

original: tassānurūpaṃ abhisallekhitaṃ appicchatādidhammaṃ. Caraṇasīlāti samādāya vattanasīlā.
analyzed: tassa anurūpam abhisallekhitam appiccha tā ādi dhammam caraṇa sīlā ati samādāya vattana sīlā
translated: and the virtue of practice is the virtue of conduct undertaken.

original: Anumaggaphaladhammo etissāti vā anudhammā, vuṭṭhānagāminivipassanā, tassa caraṇasīlā.
analyzed: anumagga phala dhammaḥ etissa ati vā anudhammā vuṭṭhāna gāmini vipassanā tassa caraṇa sīlā
translated: Or alternatively, the virtue of practice is the virtue of the way that leads to the fruit of the path.

original: Attano ācariyavādanti attano ācariyassa sammāsambuddhassa vādaṃ. Sadevakassa lokassa
analyzed: attanaḥ ācariya vādanti attanaḥ ācariyassa sammāsambuddhassa vādam sa devakassa lokassa
translated: The doctrine of his own teacher: the doctrine of his own teacher, the Perfect Buddha.🔽The Blessed One is a teacher to the world with its deities

original: ācārasikkhāpanena ācariyo, bhagavā, tassa vādo, catusaccadesanā.
analyzed: ācāra sikkhāpanena ācariyaḥ bhagavā tassa vādo catu sacca desanā
translated: because he teaches the training in good behaviour. His doctrine is the teaching of the Four Noble Truths.

original: Ācikkhissantīti ādito kathessanti, attanā uggahitaniyāmena pare uggaṇhāpessantīti🔽attho. Desessantīti vācessanti, pāḷiṃ sammā pabodhessantīti attho. Paññapessantīti🔽pajānāpessanti, saṅkāsessantīti attho. Paṭṭhapessantīti pakārehi ṭhapessanti, pakāsessantīti
analyzed: ācikkhissanti iti āditas kathessanti attanā uggahita niyāmena pare uggaṇhāpessanti iti  attho desessanti iti vācessanti pāḷim sammā pabodhessanti iti attho paññapessanti iti  pajānāpessanti saṅkāsessanti iti attho paṭṭhapessanti iti pakārehi ṭhapessanti pakāsessanti iti
translated: They will teach: they will teach from the beginning, they will cause others to learn by the method they themselves have learned.🔽This is the meaning. They will expound: they will cause to be recited, they will cause to be rightly understood by the text. This is the meaning. They will demonstrate: they will cause to be known, this is the meaning. They will reveal: they will make it clear.

original: attho. Vivarissantīti vivaṭaṃ karissanti. Vibhajissantīti vibhattaṃ karissanti. Uttānīkarissantīti
analyzed: atthaḥ vivarissanti iti vivaṭam karissanti vibhajissanti iti vibhattam karissanti uttānīkarissanti iti
translated: They will expound: they will make it clear by means of the analysis. This is the meaning. They will make it plain:

original: anuttānaṃ gambhīraṃ uttānaṃ pākaṭaṃ karissanti. Sahadhammenāti ettha dhamma-saddo
analyzed: anuttānam gambhīram uttānam pākaṭam karissanti sahadhammena ati ettha dhamma saddaḥ
translated: will make the profound clear and evident. In accordance with the Dhamma: here the word dhamma is🔽

original: kāraṇapariyāyo “hetumhi ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā”tiādīsu viyāti āha “sahetukena sakāraṇena vacanenā”ti.
analyzed: kāraṇa pariyāyaḥ hetumhi ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā ti ādīsu viyā ti āha sa hetukena sa kāraṇena vacanena ati
translated: They will make the profound clear and evident. With the Dhamma: here the word dhamma is a synonym for cause, as in the passages, “Knowledge about a cause is the discrimination of the Dhamma” . Therefore the commentator says, “with a statement that has a cause, that has a reason.”

original: Sappāṭihāriyanti sanissaraṇaṃ. Yathā paravādaṃ bhañjitvā sakavādo patiṭṭhahati, evaṃ🔽hetudāharaṇehi yathādhigatamatthaṃ sampādetvā dhammaṃ kathessanti. Tenāha “niyyānikaṃ
analyzed: sa pāṭihāriyanti sa nissaraṇam yathā paravādam bhañjitvā saka vādaḥ patiṭṭhahati evam  hetu dāharaṇehi yathā adhigatam attham sampādetvā dhammam kathessanti tena āha niyyānikam
translated: With its outcome: with its escape. Just as, after refuting the doctrine of another, one’s own doctrine is established,

original: katvā dhammaṃ desessantī”ti, navavidhaṃ lokuttaraṃ dhammaṃ pabodhessantīti attho.🔽Ettha ca “paññapessantī”tiādīhi chahi padehi cha atthapadāni dassitāni, ādito pana🔽dvīhi padehi cha byañjanapadāni. Ettāvatā tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ saṃvaṇṇanānayena
