translated: Although mindfulness of breathing is included by the taking of the ten recollections,

original: sannipatitabhikkhūsu bahūnaṃ sappāyā sātthikā ca, tasmā puna gahitā. Tathā hi bhagavā
analyzed: sannipatita bhikkhūsu bahūnam sappāyā sātthikā ca tasmā puna gahitā tathā hi bhagavā
translated: it is useful and beneficial to many of the bhikkhus who assemble there, and that is why it is mentioned again. For the Blessed One

original: tameva kammaṭṭhānaṃ imasmiṃ sutte kathesi. Āhāre paṭikūlasaññā asubhakammaṭṭhānasadisā,
analyzed: tam eva kammaṭṭhānam imasmim sutte kathesi āhāre paṭikūla saññā asubha kammaṭṭhāna sadisā
translated: taught that same meditation subject in this sutta. Mindfulness occupied with the repulsiveness of food is similar to the meditation subject of foulness,

original: cattāro pana āruppā ādikammikānaṃ ayogyāti tesaṃ idha aggahaṇaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: cattāro pana āruppāḥ ādikammikānam ayogyāḥ ti tesam idha aggahaṇam daṭṭhabbam
translated: but the four immaterial states are unsuitable for beginners, and so their omission should be understood.

original: Vesāliṃ upanissāyāti vesālīnagaraṃ gocaragāmaṃ katvā. Muhuttenevāti satthari saddhamme🔽ca gāravena upagatabhikkhūnaṃ vacanasamanantarameva uṭṭhahiṃsūti katvā vuttaṃ. Buddhakāle
analyzed: vesālim upanissāya ati vesālī nagaram gocara gāmam katvā muhuttena iva ati satthari saddhamme  ca gāravena upagata bhikkhūnam vacana samanantaram eva uṭṭhahiṃsu iti katvā vuttam buddha kāle
translated: “Having taken Vesali as their resort”: having made the city of Vesali their village for collecting alms. “In a moment”: this is said with reference to the fact that they rose up immediately after the bhikkhus had approached out of respect for the Master and the True Idea.

original: kira bhikkhū bhagavato sandesaṃ sirasā sampaṭicchituṃ ohitasotā viharanti.🔽Ānāpānapariggāhikāyāti assāsapassāse pariggaṇhanavasena pavattāya satiyā. Sampayutto
analyzed: kira bhikkhū bhagavato sandesam sirasā sampaṭicchitum ohita sotāḥ viharanti  āna apāna pariggāhikāya ati assāsa passāse pariggaṇhana vasena pavattāya satiyā sampayuttaḥ
translated: “Having taken Vesali as their resort”: having made the city of Vesali their resort, that is, their village for gathering alms. “In no long time”: they rose up immediately after the bhikkhus who had come out of respect for the Master and for the True Idea had spoken. It seems that at the time of the Buddha the bhikkhus lived with their ears attuned to the Master’s message.🔽“With mindfulness occupied with in-breaths and out-breaths”: with mindfulness occurring by way of discerning in-breaths and out-breaths.

original: samādhīti tāya sampayuttaaññamaññapaccayabhūtāya uppanno samādhi. Ānāpānassatiyaṃ🔽vā samādhīti iminā upanissayapaccayasabhāvampi dasseti, ubhayatthāpi sahajātādīnaṃ🔽sattannampi paccayānaṃ vasena paccayabhāvaṃ dasseti. “Yathāpaṭipannā me sāvakā cattāro
analyzed: samādhi iti tāya sampayutta aññamañña paccaya bhūtāya uppannaḥ samādhi āna apāna ssatiyam  vā samādhi iti iminā upanissaya paccaya sabhāvam pi dasseti ubhayattha api sahajāta ādīnam  sattannam pi paccayānam vasena paccaya bhāvam dasseti yathā paṭipannāḥ me sāvakā cattāro
translated: “Concentration associated with that”: concentration arisen with that as its associated cause, that is, with that as its condition by way of mutuality.🔽Or alternatively, “concentration in mindfulness of breathing” shows that it has the nature of a condition by way of decisive support too. And in both cases it shows that it has the nature of a condition by way of the seven conditions, that is, by way of conascence, etc.

original: satipaṭṭhāne bhāventī”tiādīsu uppādanavaḍḍhanaṭṭhena bhāvanāti vuccatīti tadubhayavasena
analyzed: satipaṭṭhāne bhāventi itiādīsu uppādana vaḍḍhana ṭṭhena bhāvanā ati vuccati iti tad ubhaya vasena
translated: “My disciples, when they develop the four foundations of mindfulness in such a way” , it is said that development is in the sense of arising and increase.

original: atthaṃ dassento “bhāvitoti uppādito vaḍḍhito vā”ti āha. Tattha bhāvaṃ vijjamānataṃ
analyzed: attham dassentaḥ bhāvito ti uppāditaḥ vaḍḍhitaḥ vā ti āha tattha bhāvam vijjamāna tam
translated: and he shows the meaning of “developed” as “arisen” or “increased.” Herein,

original: ito gatoti bhāvito, uppādito paṭiladdhamattoti attho. Uppanno pana laddhāsevano bhāvito,
analyzed: itas gataḥ ti bhāvitaḥ uppādito paṭiladdha matto ti attho uppannaḥ pana laddha āsevanaḥ bhāvito
translated: he has gone from this to existence, thus he is developed ; the meaning is, he has arisen and has just reached it. But when he has arisen and has reached it by practice, he is developed ;

original: paguṇabhāvaṃ āpādito vaḍḍhitoti attho. Bahulīkatoti bahulaṃ pavattito. Tena āvajjanādivasībhāvappattimāha.
analyzed: paguṇa bhāvam āpāditaḥ vaḍḍhito ti attho bahulīkato ti bahulam pavattitaḥ tena āvajjana ādivasībhāva ppattim āha
translated: the meaning is, he has reached the state of being possessed of excellence and has been increased. Repeatedly practiced: practiced in abundance. By that he shows the state of having reached mastery in adverting, and so on.

original: Yo hi vasībhāvamāpādito, so icchiticchitakkhaṇe samāpajjitabbato punappunaṃ pavattissati.
analyzed: yaḥ hi vasībhāvam āpāditaḥ saḥ icchiti chita khaṇe samāpajjitabbataḥ punappunam pavattissati
translated: For what has reached mastery will occur again and again at will, at the desired time, because it has to be entered upon.🔽Hence it was said above “done again and again.”🔽Just as in the passage beginning, “Here, bhikkhus, is a recluse” ,

original: Tena vuttaṃ “punappunaṃ kato”ti. Yathā “idheva, bhikkhave, samaṇo, vivicceva kāmehī”ti
analyzed: tena vuttam punappunam kataḥ ti yathā idha iva bhikkhave samaṇaḥ vivicca iva kāmehi iti
translated: and in the passage beginning, “Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu, quite secluded from sensual desires” ,

original: ca evamādīsu paṭhamapade vutto eva-saddo dutiyādīsupi vuttoyeva hoti, evamidhāpīti
analyzed: ca evamādīsu paṭhama pade vuttaḥ eva saddo dutiya ādīsu pi hoti evam idha api iti
translated: the word “here” is used in the second and following sentences though it is only used in the first, so too here;🔽hence it was said above “The word ‘here’ should be understood to be reiterated in both instances” .

original: āha “ubhayattha evasaddena niyamo veditabbo”ti. Ubhayattha niyamena laddhaguṇaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: āha ubhayattha eva saddena niyamaḥ veditabbaḥ iti ubhayattha niyamena laddha guṇam dassetuṃ
translated: In order to show the excellence obtained by the reiteration in both instances,

original: “ayaṃ hī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ayam hi itiādi vuttam
translated: it was said above “For this … is the meaning” .

original: Asubhakammaṭṭhānanti asubhārammaṇaṃ jhānamāha. Tañhi asubhesu yogakammabhāvato yogino
analyzed: asubha kammaṭṭhānam ti asubha ārammaṇam jhānam āha tat hi asubhesu yoga kamma bhāvataḥ yogino
translated: The meditation subject of foulness is the jhāna that has foulness as its object. For that is so called because it is the work of the yogin in the objects of foulness.

original: sukhavisesānaṃ kāraṇabhāvato ca “asubhakammaṭṭhāna”nti vuccati. Kevalanti iminā ārammaṇaṃ🔽nivatteti. Paṭivedhavasenāti jhānapaṭivedhavasena. Jhānañhi bhāvanāvisesena ijjhantaṃ
analyzed: sukha visesānam kāraṇa bhāvato ca asubha kammaṭṭhānanti vuccati kevalam ti iminā ārammaṇam  nivattā iti paṭivedha vasena ati jhāna paṭivedha vasena jhānam hi bhāvanā visesena ijjhantam
translated: “The meditation subject of foulness”: he is referring to jhāna with foulness as its object. For that is called “the meditation subject of foulness” because it is the work of a yogin to apply himself to foulness and because it is a cause for the various kinds of happiness.🔽By “bare” he excludes the object.

original: attano visayaṃ paṭivijjhantameva pavattati yathāsabhāvato paṭivijjhiyati cāti paṭivedhoti
analyzed: attanaḥ visayam paṭivijjhantam eva pavattati yathā sabhāvataḥ ca ati paṭivedhaḥ ti
translated: “By penetration”: by the penetration of jhāna. For jhāna occurs penetrating its object by penetrating it with its own state of being, and so it is called “penetration.”

original: vuccati. Oḷārikārammaṇattāti bībhacchārammaṇattā. Paṭikūlārammaṇattāti jigucchitabbārammaṇattā.
analyzed: vuccati oḷārika ārammaṇa ttā ati bībhaccha ārammaṇa ttā paṭikūla ārammaṇa ttā ati jigucchitabba ārammaṇa ttā
translated: “Because of the grossness of the object”: because of the repulsiveness of the object. “Because of the object’s unattractiveness”: because of the object’s loathsome nature.🔽“By means of”: either by means of a reason or by means of a simile.

original: Pariyāyenāti kāraṇena, lesantarena vā. Ārammaṇasantatāyāti anukkamena vicitabbataṃ🔽pattārammaṇassa paramasukhumataṃ sandhāyāha. Santehi sannisinne ārammaṇe pavattamāno
analyzed: pariyāyena ati kāraṇena lesa antarena vā ārammaṇa santatāya ati anukkamena 🔽patta ārammaṇassa parama sukhuma tam sandhāya āha santehi sannisinne ārammaṇe pavattamāno
translated: “By the object’s continuity”: he says this referring to the object’s extreme subtlety when it has reached variety by gradual progression.🔽“When the object is being attended to quietly” means when the object is occurring with a quiet mind.

original: dhammo sayampi sannisinnova hoti. Tenāha “santo vūpasanto nibbuto”ti, nibbutasabbapariḷāhoti🔽attho. Ārammaṇasantatāya tadārammaṇānaṃ dhammānaṃ santatā lokuttaradhammārammaṇāhi
analyzed: dhammo sayam pi sannisinnaḥ eva hoti tena āha santaḥ vūpasantaḥ nibbutaḥ nibbuta sabba pariḷāho ti  atthaḥ ārammaṇa santatāya tad ārammaṇānam dhammānam santatā lokuttara dhamma ārammaṇāhi
translated: Dhamma is itself still and quiet. Hence it was said: “He is peaceful, calmed down, and quenched” . The meaning is: he has quenched all his fevers.

original: paccavekkhaṇāhi veditabbā.🔽Nāssa santapaṇītabhāvāvahaṃ kiñci secananti asecanako. Asecanakattā anāsittako, anāsittakattā
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇāhi veditabbā  na assa santa paṇīta bhāva āvaham kiñci asecanakaḥ asecanakattā anāsittakaḥ anāsittakattā
translated: The still and quiet state of the associated states should be understood as the still and quiet state of the object, by the still and quiet state of the supramundane states that are the object.🔽There is nothing to sprinkle on him to make him still and quiet. He is not to be sprinkled on. Because he is not to be sprinkled on,🔽he is not to be sprinkled over. Because he is not to be sprinkled over,

original: eva abbokiṇṇo, asammisso parikammādinā. Tato eva pāṭiyekko visuṃyeveko. Āveṇiko asādhāraṇo.
analyzed: eva abbokiṇṇaḥ asammissaḥ parikamma ādinā tatas eva pāṭiyekkaḥ visuṃyevekaḥ āveṇikaḥ asādhāraṇaḥ
translated: he is not to be mixed up with preliminary work, etc., that is, he is not to be mixed up. Because of that he is separate, that is, he is alone by himself. He is unique, that is, he is not shared in common.

original: Sabbametaṃ sarasato eva santabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ vuttaṃ, parikammaṃ vā santabhāvanimittaṃ.
analyzed: sabbam etam sarasatas eva santa bhāvam dassetum vuttam parikammam vā santa bhāva nimittam
translated: All this is said to show the state of stillness that is due to his being serene, or the preliminary work is the sign of the state of stillness.

original: Parikammanti ca kasiṇakaraṇādinimittuppādapariyosānaṃ, tādisaṃ ettha natthīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: parikammanti ca kasiṇa karaṇa ādi nimitta uppāda pariyosānam tādisam ettha natthi iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: And the preliminary work ends with the arising of the sign of the kasiṇa, etc., which is what is intended here by “preliminary work.”

original: Tadā hi kammaṭṭhānaṃ nirassādattā asantaṃ appaṇītaṃ siyā. Upacāre vā natthi ettha
analyzed: tadā hi kammaṭṭhānam asantam appaṇītam siyā upacāre vā natthi ettha
translated: For then the meditation subject would be unappealing and not still and quiet because it would lack appeal. Or alternatively, there is no preliminary work here,

original: santatāti yojanā. Yathā upacārakkhaṇe nīvaraṇādivigamena aṅgapātubhāvena ca paresaṃ🔽santatā hoti, na evamimassa. Ayaṃ pana ādisamannā…pe… paṇīto cāti yojanā. Kecīti🔽uttaravihāravāsino. Anāsittakoti upasecanena anāsittako. Tenāha – “ojavanto”ti ojavantasadisoti
analyzed: santatā iti yojanā yathā upacāra kkhaṇe nīvaraṇa ādi vigamena aṅga pātubhāvena ca paresam  santatā hoti na evam imassa ayam pana ca ati yojanā keci iti  uttaravihāra vāsinaḥ anāsittakaḥ iti upasecanena anāsittakaḥ tena āha ojavantaḥ iti ojavanta sadisaḥ iti
translated: The construction is “a series.” Just as the series of others is a series in the sense of being a succession of states of consciousness and mental factors that are devoid of the hindrances, etc., at the moment of access, so this is not. But the construction is “it is endowed with the beginning, etc., and is excellent.” “Some” are the residents of the Northern Monastery. “Not astringent” means not astringent through astringency. Hence he says, “like something oily.”🔽

original: attho. Madhuroti iṭṭho. Cetasikasukhapaṭilābhasaṃvattanaṃ tikacatukkajjhānavasena,
analyzed: atthaḥ madhuro ti iṭṭho cetasika sukha paṭilābha saṃvattanam tika catukka jhāna vasena
translated: The construction is “a series.” As in the case of others, who have a series in the sense of a continuity of aggregates, owing to the absence of the hindrances, etc., at the moment of access, so this has not. But the construction is “beginning with the desirable, etc., it is subtle.” “Some” are the residents of the Uttaravihāra. “Not over-acid” : not over-sour. Hence he says “rich in sap.” The meaning is: like something rich in sap. “Sweet” : agreeable. The condition for the obtaining of mental pleasure should be understood as being the triple-quadruple-quadruple-quadruple jhāna,

original: upekkhāya vā santabhāvena sukhagatikattā sabbesampi jhānānaṃ vasena veditabbaṃ. Jhānasamuṭṭhānapaṇītarūpaphuṭṭhasarīratāvasena
analyzed: upekkhāya vā santa bhāvena sukha gatika ttā sabbesam pi jhānānam vasena veditabbam jhāna samuṭṭhāna paṇīta rūpa phuṭṭha sarīra tā vasena
translated: or else as being equanimity in the sense of composure, since all jhāna is a condition for the obtaining of pleasure. But the condition for the obtaining of bodily pleasure should be understood as the state of the body’s being suffused with the subtle refined jhāna- derived matter that arises along with the jhāna,

original: pana kāyikasukhapaṭilābhasaṃvattanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, tañca kho jhānato vuṭṭhitakāle.
analyzed: pana kāyika sukha paṭilābha saṃvattanam daṭṭhabbam tat ca kho jhānataḥ vuṭṭhita kāle
translated: and that occurs in excess of what is necessary for the maintenance of the body. And that is only at the moment of emerging from jhāna.

original: Imasmiṃ pakkhe “appitappitakkhaṇe”ti idaṃ hetumhi bhummavacanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: imasmin pakkhe appita ppita khaṇā iti idam hetumhi bhumma vacanam daṭṭhabbam
translated: In this case the words “at each moment of its occurrence” should be regarded as a locative absolute.

original: Avikkhambhiteti jhānena sakasantānato anīhate appahīne. Akosallasambhūteti akosallaṃ🔽vuccati avijjā, tato sambhūte. Avijjāpubbaṅgamā hi sabbe pāpadhammā. Khaṇenevāti🔽attano pavattikkhaṇeneva. Antaradhāpetīti ettha antaradhāpanaṃ vināsanaṃ, taṃ pana
analyzed: a vikkhambhitā iti jhānena saka santānataḥ an īhate appahīne akosalla sambhūtā iti akosallam  vuccati avijjā tatas sambhūte avijjā pubbaṅgamāḥ hi sabbe pāpa dhammāḥ khaṇena iva ati  attanaḥ pavatti kkhaṇena iva antaradhāpeti iti ettha antaradhāpanam vināsanam tam pana
translated: ‘Not suppressed’ means not removed, not abandoned, from his own continuity by jhāna. ‘Arisen from unskillfulness’ : unskillfulness is a term for ignorance. ‘Arisen from that’ means arisen from ignorance, for all bad ideas have ignorance as their forerunner. ‘In a moment’ means in the moment of his own occurrence. ‘He causes to disappear’ : here, the causing to disappear is the destroying.

original: jhānakattukaṃ idhādhippetanti pariyuṭṭhānappahānaṃ hotīti āha – “vikkhambhetī”ti.🔽Vūpasametīti visesena upasameti. Visesena upasamanaṃ pana sammadeva upasamanaṃ hotīti🔽āha “suṭṭhu upasametī”ti. Sāsanikassa jhānabhāvanā yebhuyyena nibbedhabhāgiyā hotīti🔽āha “nibbedhabhāgiyattā”ti. Ariyamaggassa pādakabhūto ayaṃ samādhi anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā
analyzed: jhāna kattukam idha adhippetanti pariyuṭṭhāna ppahānam hoti iti āha vikkhambheti iti  vūpasameti iti visesena upasameti visesena upasamanam pana sammat eva upasamanam hoti iti  āha suṭṭhu upasameti iti sāsanikassa jhāna bhāvanā yebhuyyena nibbedha bhāgiyā hoti iti  āha nibbedha bhāgiya ttā ati ariya maggassa pādaka bhūtaḥ ayam samādhi anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā
translated: ‘Not suppressed’ means not removed, not abandoned, from his own mental continuity by jhāna. ‘Arisen from unskillfulness’ : unskillfulness is a term for ignorance. ‘Arisen from that’ means arisen from ignorance, for all unprofitable things have ignorance as their forerunner. ‘In a moment’ means in the moment of his own occurrence. ‘Causes to disappear’ : here the causing of disappearance is the destroying. But that is not what is intended here. What is intended is the abandoning of the obsession. That is why it is said: ‘suppresses’.

original: ariyamaggabhāvaṃ upagato viya hotīti āha “anupubbena ariyamaggavuḍḍhippatto”ti. Ayaṃ
analyzed: ariya magga bhāvam upagataḥ viya hoti iti āha anupubbena ariya magga vuḍḍhi ppatto ti ayaṃ
translated: ‘Causes to subside’ means causes to subside specially. But the special subsiding is the complete subsiding. That is why it is said: ‘completely subsides’. The jhāna development of one who is a disciple of the Master is mostly of the kind that leads to penetration. That is why it is said: ‘because it leads to penetration’. This concentration, being a footing for the noble path, having been gradually increased, becomes as if it had reached the noble path. That is why it is said: ‘it reaches gradual increase in the noble path’.

original: panattho virāganirodhapaṭinissaggānupassanānaṃ vasena sammadeva yujjati. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: panatthaḥ virāga nirodha paṭinissagga anupassanānam vasena sammat eva yujjati sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: The meaning of “destruction” is only correct in the case of contemplation of dispassion, cessation, and relinquishment. The rest is easy to understand.

original: 10. Kimilasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: kimila sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the Kimila Sutta

original: 986. Theroti ānandatthero. Ayaṃ desanāti “kathaṃ vibhāvito nu kho kimilā”tiādinā🔽pavattā desanā. Kāyaññataranti rūpakāye aññatarakoṭṭhāse. Evanti yathā ānāpānaṃ anussaranto
analyzed: theraḥ iti ānanda theraḥ ayam katham vibhāvitaḥ nu kho kim ilā ti ādinā  pavattā desanā rūpa kāye aññatara koṭṭhāse evanti yathā āna apānam anussaranto
translated: The Elder: the Elder Ananda. This teaching: the teaching given in the passage beginning, “How, friends, is Kimila developed in contemplation of the body as a body?”

original: bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī jāto, evaṃ sabbattha vāresu vedanānupassītiādi attho veditabbo.🔽Desanāsīsanti desanāpadesaṃ. Manasikārapadesena vedanā vuttāti taṃ sabbaṃ sarūpato
analyzed: bhikkhu kāye kāya anupassī jātaḥ evam sabbattha vāresu vedanā anupassī iti ādi atthaḥ veditabbo  desanā sīsanti desanā padesam manasikāra padesena vedanā vuttā iti tat sabbam sarūpato
translated: Any part of the body: any part of the material body. Thus: just as a bhikkhu becomes one who contemplates the body as a body by recollecting the in-breaths and out-breaths, so too in each case he becomes one who contemplates feelings as feelings, and so on.

original: aññāpadesato apadisati. Yatheva hītiādinā tattha nidassanaṃ dasseti. Cittasaṅkhārapadadvayeti
analyzed: aññā apadesataḥ apadisati yathā iva hi itiādinā tattha nidassanam dasseti citta saṅkhāra pada dvaya iti
translated: The starting point of the teaching: the point of departure for the teaching. Feeling is stated by way of the point of departure for attention. He shows all that by way of a different point of departure, namely, by way of the point of departure for the teaching. For just as …

original: “cittasaṅkhārapaṭisaṃvedī passambhayaṃ cittasaṅkhāra”nti etasmiṃ padadvaye.
analyzed: citta saṅkhāra paṭisaṃvedī etasmim pada dvaye
translated: In the two terms “contemplating the formation of ideas” and “calming the formation of ideas”: in the two terms “contemplating the formation of ideas” and “calming the formation of ideas.”

original: Evaṃ santepīti pītimanasikāracittasaṅkhārapadesena yadi vedanā vuttā, evaṃ santepi.
analyzed: evam sante api iti pīti manasikāra citta saṅkhāra padesena yadi vedanā vuttā evam sante api
translated: “Even so” means: even if feeling is stated by the words “the mental formation of thinking of joy,”

original: Esā yathāvuttā vedanā ārammaṇaṃ na hoti. Vedanārammaṇā ca anupassanā, tasmā vedanānupassanā
analyzed: esā yathā vuttā vedanā ārammaṇam na hoti vedanā ārammaṇā ca anupassanā tasmā vedanā anupassanā
translated: this feeling as stated is not the object. And the contemplation is not of feeling as object. Therefore the contemplation of feeling

original: na yujjati. Yadi evaṃ mahāsatipaṭṭhānādīsu “vedanā vediyatī”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ kathanti🔽āha – “mahāsatipaṭṭhānādīsupī”tiādi. Tattha sukhādīnaṃ vatthunti sukhādīnaṃ uppattiyā
analyzed: na yujjati yadi evam mahā sati paṭṭhāna ādīsu vedanā vediyati iti vuttam tam kathan ti  āha mahāsati paṭṭhāna ādīsu pi itiādi tattha sukha ādīnam vatthum ti sukha ādīnam uppattiyā
translated: is not tenable. If it is so, how is it that in the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta it is said: “He knows feeling as it arises, as it is present, as it disappears”?

original: vatthubhūtaṃ rūpasaddādiṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā vedanā vediyati, na puggalo puggalasseva
analyzed: vatthu bhūtam rūpa sadda ādim ārammaṇam katvā vedanā na puggalaḥ puggalassa iva
translated: The answer is: “In the Mahāsatipaṭṭhāna Sutta, etc.” Herein, “the basis of pleasure, etc.” means: taking as object visible forms, sounds, etc., which are the basis for the arising of pleasure, etc., feeling feels. It does not feel a person, because there is no such thing as a person.

original: abhāvato. Vedanāppavattiṃ upādāya nissāya yathā “puggalo vedanaṃ vediyatī”ti vohāramattaṃ
analyzed: abhāvataḥ vedanā appavattim upādāya nissāya yathā puggalaḥ vedanam vediyati iti vohāra mattam
translated: The mere expression “a person feels feeling” is used by way of the occurrence of feeling and by way of the support of feeling.

original: hoti. Evaṃ idhāpi vedanāya assāsapassāse ārabbha pavatti, tathā pavattamanasikārasīsena
analyzed: hoti evam idha api vedanāya assāsa passāse ārabbha pavatti tathā pavatta manasikāra sīsena
translated: In the same way here, the occurrence of in-breaths and out-breaths in dependence upon feeling, and the thinking of that occurrence,

original: “vedanāsu vedanānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharatī”ti vutto. Taṃ sandhāyāti taṃ
analyzed: vedanāsu vedanā anupassī bhikkhu tasmin samaye viharati iti vuttaḥ tam sandhāya ati tam
translated: are the reason why it is said: “On that occasion a bhikkhu abides contemplating feelings as feelings.” The reference is to that.

original: vedanāya ārammaṇabhāvaṃ sandhāya. Ādīnaṃ padānaṃ. Etassa “vedanānupassanā na yujjatī”ti vuttaanuyogassa.
analyzed: vedanāya ārammaṇa bhāvam sandhāya ādīnam padānam etassa vedanā anupassanā na yujjati iti vutta anuyogassa
translated: “The application” is the application of the words “the contemplation of feeling is not tenable” .

original: Sappītike dve jhāne samāpajjatīti pītisahagatāni paṭhamadutiyajjhānāni paṭipāṭiyā
analyzed: sappītike dve jhāne samāpajjati iti pīti sahagatāni paṭhama dutiya jhānāni paṭipāṭiyā
translated: “He enters upon and dwells in the two jhānas that have happiness” : he enters upon and dwells in the first and second jhānas that are accompanied by happiness.🔽“In succession” : in regular succession.

original: samāpajjati. Tassāti tena. Paṭisaṃviditasaddāpekkhāya hi kattuatthe etaṃ sāmivacanaṃ.🔽Samāpattikkhaṇeti samāpajjanakkhaṇe. Jhānapaṭilābhenāti jhānena samaṅgībhāvena. Ārammaṇatoti
analyzed: samāpajjati tassa ati tena paṭisaṃvidita sadda apekkhāya hi kattu atthe etam sāmi vacanam  samāpatti khaṇe iti samāpajjana kkhaṇe jhāna paṭilābhena ati jhānena samaṅgībhāvena ārammaṇato ti
translated: “He” : by him. For this is a genitive of cause.🔽“At the moment of their attainment” : at the moment of their attainment.🔽“By the obtaining of the jhānas” : by the state of being possessed of the jhānas.

original: ārammaṇamukhena tadārammaṇajhānapariyāpannā pīti paṭisaṃviditā hoti, ārammaṇassa
analyzed: ārammaṇa mukhena tad ārammaṇa jhāna pariyāpannā pīti paṭisaṃviditā hoti ārammaṇassa
translated: “By way of the object” : the happiness that is included in the jhāna that has that as its object is known by way of the object.

original: paṭisaṃviditattāti vuttaṃ hoti. Yathā nāma sappapariyesanaṃ carantena tassa āsaye
analyzed: paṭisaṃvidita ttā iti vuttam hoti yathā nāma sappa pariyesanam carantena tassa āsaye
translated: What is meant is that the object is known.

original: paṭisaṃvidite sopi paṭisaṃvidito hoti mantāgadabalena tassa gahaṇassa sukarattā,
analyzed: paṭisaṃvidite saḥ api paṭisaṃviditaḥ hoti mantā gada balena tassa gahaṇassa sukara ttā
translated: Just as when someone is searching for a snake and he finds its abode, then the snake is found too, because it is easy to catch it by the power of finding its lair,

original: evaṃ pītiyā āsayabhūte ārammaṇe paṭisaṃvidite sā pīti paṭisaṃviditāva hoti salakkhaṇato
analyzed: evam pītiyāḥ āsaya bhūte ārammaṇe paṭisaṃvidite sā pīti paṭisaṃviditā ava hoti sa lakkhaṇato
translated: so too, when the object, which is the abode of happiness, is known, then that happiness is known too, by its specific characteristic;

original: sāmaññalakkhaṇato ca tassā gahaṇassa sukarattā. Vipassanakkhaṇeti vipassanāpaññāya🔽tikkhavisadabhāvappattāya visayato dassanakkhaṇe. Lakkhaṇappaṭivedhenāti pītiyā salakkhaṇassa
analyzed: sāmañña lakkhaṇato ca tassāḥ gahaṇassa sukara ttā vipassana kkhaṇā iti vipassanā paññāya  tikkha visada bhāva ppattāya visayataḥ dassana kkhaṇe lakkhaṇa ppaṭivedhena ati pītiyā sa lakkhaṇassa
translated: and because it is easy to apprehend it by its general characteristics.🔽At the moment of seeing the object: at the moment of seeing the object by means of insight knowledge that has reached the state of keenness and lucidity.

original: sāmaññalakkhaṇassa ca paṭivijjhanena. Yañhi pītiyā visesato sāmaññato ca lakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: sāmañña lakkhaṇassa ca paṭivijjhanena yat hi pītiyāḥ visesataḥ sāmaññato ca lakkhaṇam
translated: By penetration of the characteristics: by penetration of the characteristics of happiness and the general characteristics of formations.

original: tasmiṃ vidite sā yāthāvato viditā eva hoti. Tenāha “asammohato pīti paṭisaṃviditā hotī”ti.
analyzed: tasmin vidite sā yāthāvataḥ viditā eva hoti tena āha a sammohataḥ pi iti paṭisaṃviditā hoti iti
translated: For when the characteristic of happiness as a particular and as a general nature is known, then happiness is known as it actually is. Hence it is said: “Through non-delusion happiness is well penetrated.”

original: Idāni tamatthaṃ pāḷiyā eva vibhāvetuṃ “vuttañheta”ntiādimāha. Tattha dīghaṃ assāsavasenāti🔽dīghassa assāsassa ārammaṇabhūtassa vasena. Pajānato sā pīti paṭisaṃviditā hotīti🔽sambandho. Cittassa ekaggataṃ avikkhepaṃ pajānatoti jhānapariyāpannaṃ “avikkhepo”ti
analyzed: idāni tam attham pāḷiyā eva vibhāvetum vuttam ha etat ti ādim āha tattha dīgham assāsa vasena ati  dīghassa assāsassa ārammaṇa bhūtassa vasena pajānato sā pi iti paṭisaṃviditā hoti iti  sambandhaḥ cittassa ekagga tam avikkhepam pajānato ti jhāna pariyāpannam avikkhepaḥ ti
translated: Now, in order to elucidate that meaning by means of the texts, he said: “It is said” and so on. Herein, by means of long in-breath: by means of the long in-breath that is the object.🔽When he knows: when he knows that happiness is well penetrated.🔽By means of the unification of mind and non-distraction: by means of the unification of mind that is called “non-distraction” and is included in jhāna, when he knows it by means of the understanding associated with it. For just as the object is called “long” or “short” according to the in-breath or out-breath that is long or short,

original: laddhanāmaṃ cittassekaggataṃ taṃsampayuttāya paññāya pajānato. Yathā hi ārammaṇamukhena
analyzed: laddha nāmam cittassa ekagga tam tad sampayuttāya paññāya pajānataḥ yathā hi ārammaṇa mukhena
translated: so too, the unification of mind is called “long” or “short” according to the in-breath or out-breath that is long or short.

original: pīti paṭisaṃviditā hoti, evaṃ taṃsampayuttadhammāpi ārammaṇamukhena paṭisaṃviditā🔽eva hontīti. Sati upaṭṭhitā hotīti dīghaṃ assāsavasena jhānasampayuttā sati tasmiṃ
analyzed: pi iti paṭisaṃviditā hoti evam tad sampayutta dhammā api ārammaṇa mukhena paṭisaṃviditā  eva honti iti sati upaṭṭhitā hoti iti dīgham assāsa vasena jhāna sampayuttā sati tasmiṃ
translated: And so too the states associated with it are discerned by way of the object.

original: ārammaṇe upaṭṭhitā ārammaṇamukhena jhānepi upaṭṭhitā nāma hoti. Tāya satiyāti evaṃ
analyzed: ārammaṇe upaṭṭhitā ārammaṇa mukhena jhāne pi upaṭṭhitā nāma hoti tāya satiyā ati evam
translated: When mindfulness is established, the mindfulness associated with the jhāna is established on that object, and so it is said that the jhāna is established on that object too.

original: upaṭṭhitāya tāya satiyā yathāvuttena tena ñāṇena suppaṭividitattā ārammaṇassa tassa🔽vasena tadārammaṇā sā pīti paṭisaṃviditā hoti. Dīghaṃ passāsavasenātiādīsupi imināva
analyzed: upaṭṭhitāya tāya satiyā yathā vuttena tena ñāṇena su paṭividita ttā ārammaṇassa tassa  vasena tad ārammaṇā sā pi iti paṭisaṃviditā hoti dīgham iminā ava
translated: With that mindfulness: with that mindfulness thus established. By that knowledge: by the knowledge of the way described. The happiness is discerned: the happiness is discerned by him in the way of objectification of the object.

original: nayena attho veditabbo. Tena vuttaṃ “eteneva nayena avasesapadānipi atthato veditabbānī”ti.
analyzed: nayena atthaḥ veditabbo tena vuttam etena iva nayena avasesa padāni pi atthataḥ veditabbāni iti
translated: In the case of the rest of the clauses beginning with “On long in-breath” the meaning should be understood in the same way. Hence it was said: “The remaining terms should be understood in the same way in meaning” .

original: Yathevātiādīsu ayaṃ saṅkhepattho – jhānapaṭilābhena yathā ārammaṇato pītiādayo paṭisaṃviditā
analyzed: yathā iva ati ādīsu ayam saṅkhepa atthaḥ jhāna paṭilābhena yathā ārammaṇataḥ pīti ādayo paṭisaṃviditā
translated: In the way stated: this is the meaning in brief: just as the happiness, etc., are discerned by him through the obtaining of the jhāna by making them objects of consciousness,

original: honti tena vinā tesaṃ appavattanato. Evaṃ jhānasampayuttena taṃpariyāpannena vedanāsaṅkhātamanasikārapaṭilābhena🔽ārammaṇato vedanā paṭisaṃviditā hoti aruṇuggamena viya sūriyassa tena vinā vedanāya
analyzed: honti tena vinā tesam appavattanato evam jhāna sampayuttena taṃ pariyāpannena vedanā saṅkhāta manasikāra paṭilābhena  ārammaṇataḥ vedanā paṭisaṃviditā hoti aruṇuggamena viya sūriyassa tena vinā vedanāya
translated: because they do not occur without it. So feeling is well known to him as object through the obtaining of the kind of attention associated with jhāna and included in the jhāna.🔽because feeling does not occur without it. So feeling is well known to him as object through the dawning of the sun,

original: appavattanato. Tasmā vuttanayena atisayappavatti vedanā suppaṭividitā, tasmā suvuttametanti
analyzed: appavattanato tasmā vutta nayena atisaya ppavatti vedanā suppaṭividitā tasmā su vuttam etat ti
translated: because the sun does not rise without it. Consequently, since it occurs in excess, feeling is well known to him in the way already stated. That is why it was said above, “So it is well said that … feeling is well known to him” .

original: pubbe vuttacodanaṃ nirākaroti.
analyzed: pubbe vutta codanam nirākaroti
translated: He thus answers the question asked above.

original: Ārammaṇeti assāsapassāsanimittaṃ vadati. Cittānupassīyeva nāmesa hoti asammohato
analyzed: ārammaṇa iti assāsa passāsa nimittam vadati citta anupassīyā iva nāma esa hoti a sammohato
translated: “Object” : he says the sign of the in-breaths and out-breaths. “He is only contemplating cognizance” because there is no confusion.

original: cittassa paṭisaṃviditattā. Tenāha “tasmā”tiādi. Cittapaṭisaṃviditavasenāti ādi-saddena
analyzed: cittassa paṭisaṃvidita ttā tena āha tasmā atiādi citta paṭisaṃvidita vasena ati ādi saddena
translated: because of the well-knownness of cognizance. That is why he said “Therefore” , etc. By means of the well-knownness of cognizance, etc.,

original: itarā tissopi cittānupassanā saṅgaṇhāti.🔽Soti dhammānupassanaṃ anuyutto bhikkhu. Yaṃ taṃ pahānaṃ pahāyakañāṇaṃ. Paññāyāti
analyzed: itarā tissaḥ api citta anupassanā saṅgaṇhāti  so ti dhamma anupassanam anuyuttaḥ bhikkhu yam tam pahānam pahāyaka ñāṇam paññāya ati
translated: the word “etc.” includes the other two kinds of contemplation of cognizance too.

original: aparāya vipassanāpaññāya aniccavirāgādito disvā duvidhāyapi ajjhupekkhitā hoti. Idañhi
analyzed: aparāya vipassanā paññāya anicca virāga āditaḥ disvā duvidhāya api ajjhupekkhitā hoti idam hi
translated: “He” : the bhikkhu devoted to contemplation of mental objects. “That” : the abandoning, which is the knowledge that abandons. “By means of understanding” : by means of the subsequent insight-understanding, having seen as impermanent, as painful, as a disease, etc., it is looked on with equanimity in two ways. For this is said:

original: catukkanti aniccānupassanādivasena vuttaṃ catukkaṃ. Tassāpi dhammānupassanāya. Pajahatīti🔽pahānanti āha “niccasaññaṃ…pe… pahānakarañāṇaṃ adhippeta”nti. Vipassanāparamparanti🔽paṭipāṭiyā vipassanamāha. Pathapaṭipannaṃ ajjhupekkhatīti majjhimāya paṭipattiyā
analyzed: catukkanti anicca anupassanā ādi vasena vuttam catukkam tassa api dhamma anupassanāya pajahati iti  pahānam ti āha pahāna karañāṇam adhippetanti vipassanā paramparanti  paṭipāṭiyā vipassanam āha patha paṭipannam ajjhupekkhati iti majjhimāya paṭipattiyā
translated: The “fourfold” is the fourfold beginning with contemplation of impermanence.🔽“Abandoning” is the knowledge of abandoning.🔽“The succession of insight” is insight in the order stated.

original: sammadeva vīthipaṭipannaṃ bhāvanācittaṃ paggahaniggahānaṃ akaraṇena ajjhupekkhati.
analyzed: sammad eva vīthi paṭipannam bhāvanā cittam paggaha niggahānam a karaṇena ajjhupekkhati
translated: “He looks on with equanimity at the mind that has entered into the way” means that he looks on with equanimity at the development-consciousness that has entered upon the path by not making any effort to quicken or retard it.

original: Ekato upaṭṭhānanti yasmā majjhimasamathavīthinātivattiyā tattha ca pakkhandanena
analyzed: ekatas upaṭṭhānam ti yasmā majjhima samatha vīthinā ativattiyā tattha ca pakkhandanena
translated: “The single way of its appearance” means that since it has gone beyond the middle way of equanimity and has entered upon that,

original: indriyānaṃ ekarasabhāvena, tatramajjhattatāya bhāvato avisesaṃ ekaggabhāvūpagamanena
analyzed: eka rasa bhāvena tatram ajjhatta tāya bhāvataḥ avisesam ekagga bhāva upagamanena
translated: the faculties have a single function by their non-difference in actuality through their being the middle in that, and they have a single way of appearance by their having arrived at unity.🔽Therefore he looks on with equanimity at it by not doing anything to it.

original: ekantato upaṭṭhāti, tasmā na tattha kiñci kātabbanti ajjhupekkhati. Tatthāti evaṃ
analyzed: ekantataḥ upaṭṭhāti tasmā na tattha kiñci kātabbanti ajjhupekkhati tattha ati evam
translated: “There” means in that equanimity.

original: ajjhupekkhane. Sahajātānampi ajjhupekkhanā hoti tesaṃ pavattanākārassa ajjhupekkhanato.
analyzed: ajjhupekkhane sahajātānam pi ajjhupekkhanā hoti tesam pavattana ākārassa ajjhupekkhanato
translated: There is looking on with equanimity at what is conascent with it too, because of looking on with equanimity at the mode of its occurrence.

original: “Paññāya disvā”ti vuttattā ārammaṇaajjhupekkhanā adhippetā. Na kevalaṃ nīvaraṇādidhamme
analyzed: paññāya disvā iti vutta ttā ārammaṇa ajjhupekkhanā adhippetā na kevalam nīvaraṇa ādi dhamme
translated: And not only the states beginning with the hindrances are looked on with equanimity;

original: ajjhupekkhitā, atha kho abhijjhā …pe… paññāya disvā ajjhupekkhitā hotīti yojanā.🔽Paṃsupuñjaṭṭhāniyassa kilesassa uppattiṭṭhānadassanatthaṃ “catumahāpatho viya cha🔽āyatanāni”icceva vuttaṃ. Kāyādayo cattāro ārammaṇasatipaṭṭhānā. Catūsu ārammaṇesūti
analyzed: ajjhupekkhitā atha kho abhijjhā pe paññāya disvā ajjhupekkhitā hoti iti yojanā  paṃsu puñja ṭṭhāniyassa kilesassa uppatti ṭṭhāna dassana attham catu mahāpathaḥ viya cha  āyatanāni icca iva vuttam kāya ādayo cattāro ārammaṇa sati paṭṭhānā catūsu ārammaṇesu iti
translated: but also covetousness, grief, and the rest are looked on with equanimity by seeing them with wisdom.🔽The six bases are said to be “like a crossroads” in order to show the place of origin of the defilements that have the dust-heap as their object.🔽The four foundations of mindfulness that have a body, etc., as their object are the four foundations of mindfulness that occur with regard to the four objects,

original: kāyādīsu catūsu ārammaṇesu pavattā cattāro satipaṭṭhānā paṃsupuñjaṭṭhāniyassa kilesassa upahananato.
analyzed: kāya ādīsu catūsu ārammaṇesu pavattā cattāro sati paṭṭhānā paṃsu puñja ṭṭhāniyassa kilesassa upahananato
translated: the body, and so on. They are “like a dust-heap” because they are the means for the removal of the defilements that have the dust-heap as their object.

original: Ekadhammavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: eka dhamma vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the First Division is ended.

original: 2. Dutiyavaggo
analyzed: dutiya vaggo
translated: The Second Division

original: 1-2. Icchānaṅgalasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Icchānangala Sutta, etc.

original: 987-988. Kasmātiādi vihārasamāpattiācikkhaṇe kāraṇaṃ vibhāvetuṃ āraddhaṃ.
analyzed: kasmā iti ādi vihāra samāpatti ācikkhaṇe kāraṇam vibhāvetum āraddham
translated: “Why?” is said in order to show the reason for the teaching of the abiding and the attainment.

original: Eva-vākāroti eva-kāro vā-kāro ca. Ekantasantattā ekantena santamanasikārabhāvato.
analyzed: eva vākāraḥ iti evakāraḥ vākāraḥ ca ekanta santattā ekantena santa manasikāra bhāvataḥ
translated: “In this way”: the “eva” and the “vā” are used for emphasis. The mind is “entirely calmed” because it is entirely calmed by the attention given to it.

original: Sekkhavacaneneva tesaṃ sikkhitabbassa atthibhāve siddhepi sikkhitabbarahitesu tesupi
analyzed: sekkha vacanena iva tesam sikkhitabbassa atthi bhāve siddhe pi sikkhitabba rahitesu tesu pi
translated: Although the existence of what is to be trained in is established by the very words “one in training,”🔽

original: sekkhapariyāyassa vuccamānattā sikkhitabbasaddena sekkhe visesetvā vuttā. Āsavakkhayatthaṃ
analyzed: sekkha pariyāyassa vuccamāna ttā sikkhitabba saddena sekkhe visesetvā vuttāḥ āsava kkhaya ttham
translated: Although the existence of what is to be trained in is established by the word “learner” itself, they are stated with the word “to be trained in” after distinguishing learners from those who have nothing more to train in by specifying what is to be trained in in them.🔽Although there is no what is to be trained in for the purpose of the destruction of cankers,

original: sikkhitabbassa abhāvepi diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāratthaṃ jhānādisikkhanena vinā sikkhitabbābhāvā🔽“asekkhā nāmā”ti vuttā. Buddhānaṃ pana sabbaso sammadeva pariniṭṭhitasikkhattā “sikkhāmī”ti
analyzed: sikkhitabbassa abhāve pi diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra attham jhāna ādi sikkhanena vinā sikkhitabba abhāvā  asekkhā nāma ati vuttā buddhānam pana sabbaso sammat eva pariniṭṭhita sikkha ttā sikkhāmi iti
translated: there is no what is to be trained in without training in jhāna, etc., for the purpose of abiding in bliss here and now.🔽So they are called “those who have nothing more to train in” . But since the training of Buddhas is completely and perfectly finished, they do not say “I am training” .

original: na vuttaṃ. Ānāpānajjhānaphalasamāpatti tathāgatavihāro.
analyzed: na vuttam āna apāna jhāna phala samāpatti tathāgata vihāraḥ
translated: The attainment of the jhāna that is the fruit of mindfulness of breathing is the abiding of a Perfect One.

original: 3-10. Paṭhamaānandasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the first sutta in the Ānanda vagga,

original: 989-996. Aniccādivasenāti aniccadukkhānattavasena. Pavicinati pakārehi vicinati. Nikkilesāti apagatakilesā vikkhambhitakilesā. Pītisambojjhaṅgo, passaddhisambojjhaṅgoti pāṭho.
analyzed: anicca ādi vasena ati anicca dukkha anatta vasena pavicinati pakārehi vicinati nikkilesā ati apagata kilesā vikkhambhita kilesā pīti sambojjhaṅgo passaddhi sambojjhaṅgo ti pāṭhaḥ
translated: By way of impermanence, etc.: by way of impermanence, pain, and not-self. He examines by means of the aspects. Free from defilements: devoid of defilements, suppressed defilements. The factor of complete enlightenment that is rapture, the factor of complete enlightenment that is tranquillity.

original: Yāya anosakkanaṃ anativattanañca hoti, ayaṃ tatramajjhattupekkhā majjhattākāroti vuttā. Ekacittakkhaṇikāti ekacittuppādapariyāpannattā.
analyzed: yāya anosakkanam an ativattanam ca hoti ayam tatra majjhatta upekkhā majjhatta ākāraḥ iti vuttā eka citta khaṇikā ati eka citta uppāda pariyāpanna ttā
translated: It is called momentary because it is included in a single consciousness-moment.🔽It is called sixteen- factored because it is four fours.

original: Cattunnaṃ catukkānaṃ vasena soḷasakkhattukā. Ānāpānasannissayena pavattattā ārammaṇavasena
analyzed: cattunnam catukkānam vasena soḷasa kkhattukāḥ āna apāna sannissayena pavattattā ārammaṇa vasena
translated: It is called mindfulness of breathing as a meditation subject because it occurs with breathing as its object since it occurs with the support of in-breaths and out-breaths.🔽But later on it is also allowable to call it mindfulness of breathing since it is the mindfulness that has that as its object.

original: pavattā ānāpānārammaṇāpi aparabhāge sati ānāpānassatīti pariyāyena vattabbataṃ arahatīti🔽“ānāpānassati missakā kathitā”ti vuttaṃ. Ānāpānamūlakāti ānāpānasannissayena pavattā
analyzed: pavattā āna apāna ārammaṇā api apara bhāge sati āna apāna ssati iti pariyāyena vattabba tam arahati iti  ānāpāna sati missakā kathitā ati vuttam ānāpāna mūlakā ati ānāpāna sannissayena pavattā
translated: It is called mindfulness of breathing in brief because it occurs with the support of in-breaths and out-breaths.🔽It is called the four foundations of mindfulness because it occurs with the four foundations of mindfulness as its object.

original: satipaṭṭhānā. Tesaṃ mūlabhūtāti tesaṃ satipaṭṭhānānaṃ mūlakāraṇabhūtā. Bojjhaṅgamūlakāti🔽bojjhaṅgapaccayabhūtā. Tepi bojjhaṅgāti ete vīsati satipaṭṭhānahetukā bojjhaṅgā.
analyzed: sati paṭṭhānā tesam mūla bhūtā ati tesam sati paṭṭhānānam mūla kāraṇa bhūtā bojjhaṅga mūlakā ati  bojjhaṅga paccaya bhūtā te pi bojjhaṅgā ti ete vīsati sati paṭṭhāna hetukā bojjhaṅgā
translated: It is called the four noble truths because it occurs with the four noble truths as its object.🔽It is called the seven enlightenment factors because it occurs with the seven enlightenment factors as its condition.

original: Vijjāvimuttipūrakāti tatiyavijjāya tassa phalassa ca paripūraṇavasena pavattā bojjhaṅgā.
analyzed: vijjā vimutti pūrakā ati tatiya vijjāya tassa phalassa ca paripūraṇa vasena pavattā bojjhaṅgā
translated: It is called the three true insights because it occurs with the three true insights as its object.🔽It is called the four noble persons because it occurs with the four noble persons as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good men because it occurs with the three kinds of good men as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good women because it occurs with the three kinds of good women as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good gods because it occurs with the three kinds of good gods as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good families because it occurs with the three kinds of good families as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good persons because it occurs with the three kinds of good persons as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good recluses because it occurs with the three kinds of good recluses as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good brahmans because it occurs with the three kinds of good brahmans as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good nobles because it occurs with the three kinds of good nobles as its object.🔽It is called the three kinds of good kings because it occurs with the three kinds of good kings as its object.

original: Phalasampayuttāti catutthaphalasampayuttā, catubbidhaphalasampayuttā vā.
analyzed: phala sampayuttā ati catuttha phala sampayuttā catubbidha phala sampayuttā vā
translated: “Endowed with fruit” means endowed with the fourth fruit or with the fourfold fruit.

original: Dutiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dutiya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the second section is finished.

original: Ānāpānasaṃyuttavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: āna apāna saṃyutta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Ānāpānasamyutta is finished.

original: 11. Sotāpattisaṃyuttaṃ
analyzed: sotāpatti saṃyuttam
translated: The Connected Discourses with Sotapatti

original: 1. Veḷudvāravaggo
analyzed: veḷu dvāra vaggo
translated: The Veḷudvāra Vagga

original: 1. Cakkavattirājasuttavaṇṇanā🔽997. Anuggahagarahaṇesu nipātoti anuggaṇhanagarahatthajotako nipāto. Kimettha anuggaṇhāti,
analyzed: cakkavatti rāja sutta vaṇṇanā  anuggaha gara haṇesu nipātaḥ iti anuggaṇhana gara hattha jotakaḥ nipātaḥ kim ettha anuggaṇhāti
translated: The Discourse on the Wheel-Turning Monarch🔽“In the case of the praise and blame of the four”: what does he praise here, and what does he blame?

original: kiṃ vā garahatīti āha “catunna”ntiādi. Tattha anuggaṇhanto anucchavikaṃ katvā gaṇhanto.🔽Garahanto nindanto. Issarasīlo issaro, tassa bhāvo issariyaṃ, pabhutā. Adhīnaṃ pati🔽adhipati, tassa bhāvo ādhipaccaṃ, sāmibhāvoti āha – “issariyādhipacca”ntiādi. Anantakānīti antarahitāni.
analyzed: kim vā garahati iti āha tattha anuggaṇhantaḥ anucchavikam katvā gaṇhantaḥ  garahantaḥ nindantaḥ issara sīlaḥ issaraḥ tassa bhāvaḥ issariyam pabhu tā adhīnam pati  adhipati tassa bhāvaḥ ādhipaccam sāmibhāvaḥ ti āha issariya adhipacca ntiādi anantakāni iti anta rahitāni
translated: He says, “The praise and blame of the four noble lineages,” and so on. Herein, in praising he takes them as appropriate.🔽In blaming he censures them. “The nature of a lord” is lordship, sovereignty, mastery. “Dependent” is subordinate.🔽“Dominion” is the state of being a lord, the state of being a master. He says, “the praise and blame of lordship and dominion,” and so on. “The infinite” is the hidden.

original: Aveccappasādenāti vatthuttayassa guṇe yāthāvato avecca pavisitvā pasādo. So pana
analyzed: avecca ppasādena ati vatthuttayassa guṇe yāthāvataḥ avecca pavisitvā pasādaḥ saḥ pana
translated: “With confidence in the Dhamma”: confidence that has penetrated the qualities of the three objects as they really are.

original: kenaci calanarahitoti āha “acalappasādenā”ti. Maggenāti ariyamaggena. Āgatappasādo
analyzed: kenaci calana rahitaḥ ti āha acala ppasādena ati maggena ati ariya maggena āgata ppasādaḥ
translated: “With unshakable confidence” means with confidence that is not shaken by anyone. “By the path” means by the noble path. “Confidence that has come”

original: tassa adhigamena laddhappasādo. Apubbaṃ acarimanti ekajjhaṃ. Ariyasāvakānañhi ariyamaggo
analyzed: tassa adhigamena laddha ppasādaḥ apubbam acarimanti ekajjham ariya sāvakānam hi ariya maggaḥ
translated: is confidence that has been obtained by the realization of that path. “We have never before” means all together. For the noble path,

original: uppajjantova tīsu vatthūsu aveccappasādaṃ āvahanto eva uppajjati. Tesanti visayabhūtānaṃ
analyzed: uppajjantaḥ iva tīsu vatthūsu avecca pasādam āvahantaḥ eva uppajjati tesanti visaya bhūtānam
translated: which arises in noble disciples, arises only by arousing the three kinds of confidence in the three objects. “In them” is said in terms of the three objects.

original: tiṇṇaṃ vatthūnaṃ vasena tidhā vutto. Yasmā ca atthato eko, tasmāva ninnānākaraṇo
analyzed: tiṇṇam vatthūnam vasena tidhā vuttaḥ yasmā ca atthataḥ eko ninnānākaraṇaḥ
translated: And since it is the same in meaning, it is not differentiated,

original: hoti pavattaṭṭhānabhede satipi. Ariyasāvakassa hītiādinā nayena tamatthaṃ vivarati.
analyzed: hoti pavatta ṭṭhāna bhede ariya sāvakassa hi iti ādinā nayena tam attham vivarati
translated: even though there is a difference in the basis of occurrence. “For a noble disciple” and so on. He explains the meaning in this way.

original: Pasādo okappanā. Pemaṃ bhatti. Gāravaṃ garukaraṇaṃ. Mahantaṃ uḷāraṃ. Etaṃ vibhāgena
analyzed: pasādaḥ okappanā bhatti gāravam garu karaṇam mahantam uḷāram etam vibhāgena
translated: Confidence is conviction. Love is affection. Respect is reverence. Great is lofty. This is not differentiated

original: natthi sabbattha samānattā.
analyzed: na atthi sabbattha samāna ttā
translated: because it is the same everywhere.

original: Evanti bhavantarepi akopanīyatāya. Sadisavasenāti aññehi akhaṇḍādīhi sadisavasena.
analyzed: evam ti bhavantare pi akopanīyatāya sadisa vasena ati aññehi akhaṇḍa ādīhi sadisa vasena
translated: Thus is because it cannot be shaken even in another existence. By way of similarity means by way of being similar to the other kinds of unbrokenness and so on.

original: Tenāha “mukhavaṭṭi yañhi chinne”tiādi. Khaṇḍā etissā atthīti khaṇḍā. Esa nayo sesesupi.
analyzed: tena āha mukhavaṭṭi yat hi chinnā itiādi khaṇḍā etissā atthi iti khaṇḍā esa nayo sesesu pi
translated: Hence he said: “When the mouth-cavity is broken up” , etc. It has a crack , thus it is cracked . The same method applies to the rest.🔽The division of virtue into beginning, middle, and end should be understood according to the order in which it is given in the Pāṭimokkha.

original: Pātimokkhe āgatānukkamena sīlassa ādimajjhavibhāgo veditabbo. Dvinnaṃ vā tiṇṇaṃ vāti
analyzed: pātimokkhe āgata anukkamena sīlassa ādi majjha vibhāgaḥ veditabbaḥ dvinnam vā tiṇṇam vā ati
translated: Or else, of the two or three sections of virtue,

original: sīlakoṭṭhāsānaṃ. Ekantaraṃ bhinnanti abhinnena ekantaraṃ hutvā bhinnaṃ. Tesaṃ khaṇḍādīnaṃ.
analyzed: sīla koṭṭhāsānam ekantaram bhinnanti abhinnena ekantaram hutvā bhinnam tesam khaṇḍa ādīnam
translated: the one that is broken is broken in the middle of the unbroken part.

original: “Bhujissehī”ti uttarapadalopena niddesoti āha “bhujissabhāvakarehī”ti. Idaṃ vītikkantanti
analyzed: bhujissehi iti uttara pada lopena niddeso ti āha bhujissa bhāva karehi iti idam vītikkantanti
translated: “By the most venerable” : the demonstrative pronoun “that” is omitted, thus it is said: “by those who are the most venerable in virtue of the making of virtue.”🔽This virtue is beyond the reach of:

original: idampi sīlaṃ vītikkantaṃ. “Ayaṃ sīlassa vītikkamo”ti evaṃ parāmasituṃ asakkuṇeyyehi.
analyzed: idam api sīlam vītikkantam ayam sīlassa vītikkamaḥ ti evam parāmasitum a sakkuṇeyyehi
translated: this virtue is beyond the reach of the grasping of the thought “This is the transgression of virtue.”

original: 2. Brahmacariyogadhasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: brahmacariyogadha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the sutta on the foundation of the holy life

original: 998. Yesanti aniyamato saddhādīnamādhārabhūtapuggaladassanaṃ. Buddhe pasādo gahito.
analyzed: aniyamataḥ saddhā ādīnam ādhāra bhūta puggala dassanam buddhe pasādaḥ gahito
translated: “Those” : the seeing of persons who are the foundation of faith, etc., is not definite. Confidence in the Buddha is included.

original: So hi itarehi paṭhamaṃ gahetabboti. Ariyakantāni sīlāni gahitāni sotāpannassa sīlānaṃ
analyzed: so hi itarehi paṭhamam gahetabbaḥ ti ariya kantāni sīlāni gahitāni sotāpannassa sīlānaṃ
translated: For that should be taken first. The virtue dear to the noble ones is included. The virtue of a stream-enterer is included.

original: adhippetattā. Saṅghe pasādo gahito dhammappasādassa anantaraṃ vuccamānattā. Dhamme🔽pasādo gahito aveccappasādabhāvato. Sotaṃ ariyamaggaṃ ādito patti sotāpatti, tassā
analyzed: adhippeta ttā saṅghe pasādaḥ gahitaḥ dhamma ppasādassa anantaram vuccamāna ttā dhamme  pasādaḥ gahitaḥ avecca pasāda bhāvataḥ sotam ariya maggam āditaḥ patti sotāpatti tassā
translated: because it is the first. Confidence in the Community is mentioned next to confidence in the Dhamma because it is mentioned next to confidence in the Dhamma. Confidence in the Dhamma is mentioned next to confidence in the Community because it is the basis for the confidence in the Community. The stream is the noble path. The first acquisition of that is stream-entry. The stream is the noble path.

original: aṅgāni sotāpattiyaṅgāni. Paccentīti pajāyanti adhigacchanti. Tenāha “pāpuṇantī”ti.🔽Brahmacariyanti maggabrahmacariyaṃ. Katarapasādo vattamānoti adhippāyo. Maggappasādoti
analyzed: aṅgāni sa utāpattiyaṅgāni paccenti iti pajāyanti adhigacchanti tena āha pāpuṇanti iti  brahmacariyanti magga brahmacariyam katara pasādaḥ vattamānaḥ ti adhippāyaḥ magga ppasādaḥ ti
translated: because of its being intended. Confidence in the Community is mentioned next to confidence in the Dhamma because it is mentioned next to confidence in the Dhamma. Confidence in the Dhamma is mentioned because of its being confidence in the sense of conviction. The stream is the noble path. The entry to it is the stream-entry. The factors of that are the factors of stream-entry. They reach it, are born into it, attain it. Hence it is said: “they reach it.”

original: maggasampayutto pasādo. Āgatamaggassāti adhigatamaggassa. Missakappasādo esoti tasmā
analyzed: magga sampayutto pasādaḥ āgata maggassa ati adhigata maggassa missaka ppasādaḥ eso ti tasmā
translated: The life of purity is the path-life of purity. The meaning is: in which confidence is there? Confidence in the path is confidence associated with the path. Of one who has attained the path: of one who has reached the path. The confidence of both elders is mixed. Therefore

original: ubhopi therā paṇḍitā bahussutā.
analyzed: ubho api therā paṇḍitā bahu sutā
translated: both elders are wise and learned.

original: 3. Dīghāvuupāsakasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dīghāvu upāsaka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Discourse on the Lay Follower Dīghāvu

original: 999. Yadaggena tasmiṃ upāsake yathāvuttāni sotāpattiyaṅgāni saṃvijjanti, tadaggena
analyzed: yadaggena tasmin upāsake yathā vuttāni sotāpattiyaṅgāni saṃvijjanti tadaggena
translated: To the extent that the lay follower has the factors of stream-entry as described, to that extent

original: so tesu vattissatīti āha “catūsu sotāpattiyaṅgesu sandissasī”ti. Vijjaṃ bhajantīti
analyzed: saḥ tesu vattissati iti āha catūsu sotāpattiyaṅgesu sandissasi iti vijjam bhajanti iti
translated: he will be established in them. Therefore it is said: “You will be seen to have the four factors of stream-entry.” They will be sharing in the knowledge:

original: vijjābhāgiyā, tesu koṭṭhāsesu pariyāpannāti vuttaṃ “vijjābhāgiyeti vijjākoṭṭhāsike”ti.
analyzed: vijjā bhāgiyā tesu koṭṭhāsesu pariyāpannā iti vuttam vijjā bhāgiyā iti vijjā koṭṭhāsikā iti
translated: and the factors of the path are included in the factors of the path.

original: 4-5. Paṭhamasāriputtasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The first sutta of the Sāriputta group

original: 1000-1001. “Sotāpattī”ti paṭhamamaggo adhippeto, tassa adhigamūpāyo sotāpattiyaṅgaṃ.
analyzed: sotāpatti iti paṭhama maggaḥ adhippeto tassa adhigama upāyo sotāpattiyaṅgam
translated: The first path is intended here by “stream-entry.” The means to its attainment is the factor of stream-entry.

original: Tenāha “sotāpattiyā pubbabhāgapaṭilābhaṅga”nti. Sotāpattiatthāyāti sotāpattimaggatthāya.
analyzed: tena āha sotāpattiyā pubba bhāga paṭilābha aṅgam ti sotāpatti atthāya ati sotāpatti magga atthāya
translated: Hence it is said: “the factor of the acquisition of the preliminary stage of stream-entry.” For the sake of stream-entry: for the sake of the path of stream-entry.

original: Aṅganti kāraṇaṃ. Itare ratanattayappasādādayo. Pubbabhāgiyāya sotāpattiyā aṅgaṃ kāraṇanti.
analyzed: aṅgam ti kāraṇam itare ratana ttaya ppasāda ādayo pubbabhāgiyāya sotāpattiyāḥ aṅgam kāraṇam ti
translated: A factor is a cause. The other things, such as the three jewels, are the preliminary factors of stream-entry.

original: 6. Thapatisuttavaṇṇanā🔽1002. (Vitānaṃ kāyānaṃ kālanakāya, kāraṇassa upagatānaṃ sātapariyā sijjhati. Tattha
analyzed: thapati sutta vaṇṇanā  vitānam kāyānam kālanakāya kāraṇassa upagatānam sāta pariyā sijjhati tattha
translated: The sutta on the householder Thapati

original: kāyaparipajjhāyamukhena tantiṃ ṭhapesi bhagavā. Na hi passatha namatthehi karaṇe🔽niratthako piti vattati. “Niyatattā”ti vuttaṃ. Tameva niyamaṃ “majjhimapadeseyevā”ti
analyzed: tantim ṭhapesi bhagavā na hi passatha namatthehi karaṇe 🔽niratthakaḥ p iti vattati niyata ttā ati vuttam tam eva niyamam majjhima padeseya iva āti
translated: (The canopy of the body, the body’s time, the reason, the approach, the satisfaction, the attainment, the body’s exhaustion, the body’s end, the body’s destruction, the body’s cessation, the body’s cooling, the body’s freedom from bondage, the body’s non-reliance, the body’s non-dependence, the body’s non-clinging, the body’s non-grasping, the body’s non-attachment, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-obstruction, the body’s non-

original: avadhāraṇena vibhāveti. Mahāmaṇḍalacārikaṃ carantopi majjhimapadesassa antanteneva
analyzed: avadhāraṇena vibhāveti mahā maṇḍala cārikam carantaḥ api majjhima padesassa anta antena iva
translated: He distinguishes by the word “only.” Even when he goes on a tour of the great monastery, he goes only as far as the border of the Middle Country.

original: carati. Tattha ca vineyyajanassa samosaraṇatā mattapanavācamahatthasupananti.) [Etthantare
analyzed: carati tattha ca vineyya janassa samosaraṇa tā etthantare
translated: And there is the gathering together of those to be tamed. The word of the Teacher is powerful.

original: pāṭho asuddho dussodhanīyo ca, suddhapāṭho gavesitabbo.] Aruṇuṭṭhāpanampi tattheva
analyzed: pāṭhaḥ asuddhaḥ dussodhanīyaḥ ca suddha pāṭhaḥ gavesitabbo aruṇuṭṭhāpanam pi tattha eva
translated: [In the middle of this, the text is corrupt and difficult to understand. The correct text should be sought.] The rising of the dawn also takes place there.

original: hoti. Paccantapadese pana dūre vineyyajanā honti, tattha gantvā maggaphalesu patiṭṭhāpetvā🔽tato paccāgantvā majjhimapadese eva vāsaṃ upagacchati, tattha manussehi katānaṃ kārānaṃ
analyzed: hoti paccanta padese pana dūre vineyya janāḥ honti tattha gantvā magga phalesu patiṭṭhāpetvā  tatas paccāgantvā majjhima padese eva vāsam upagacchati tattha manussehi katānam kārānam
translated: But in the border country, those to be tamed are far away. Having gone there and established them in the fruits of the path,

original: mahapphalabhāvaniyamanatthanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Āsanne no bhagavā”ti idaṃ nidassanamattanti
analyzed: mahat phala bhāva niyamana atthanti daṭṭhabbam āsanne naḥ bhagavā ti idam nidassanamattam ti
translated: he returns and takes up residence in the Middle Country itself. It should be seen that it is for the purpose of determining the great fruitfulness of the offerings made by the people there.

original: dassento “na kevala”nti ādimāha.
analyzed: na kevalanti ādim āha
translated: “The Blessed One is near to us” — showing that this is merely an indication, he says “not only.”

original: Sakiñcanasapalibodhanaṭṭhenāti ettha kiñcanaṃ palibodho asamāpitakiccatā, tadubhayassa atthibhāvenāti attho. Mahāvāseti mahāgehe.
analyzed: sa kiñcana sa palibodhana ṭṭhena ati ettha kiñcanam palibodhaḥ asamāpita kicca tā tad ubhayassa atthi bhāvena ati atthaḥ mahā vāse iti mahā gehe
translated: As to the meaning of having possessions and hindrances: here, “possessions” are the hindrances, and “hindrances” are unfinished duties. The meaning is: because of the existence of both of these. In a great residence, in a great house.

original: Dvepi janāti isidattapurāṇā. Sitaṃ nāma mandahasitaṃ. Hasitaṃ nāma vissaṭṭhahasitaṃ.
analyzed: dve api sitam nāma mandahasitam hasitam nāma vissaṭṭhahasitam
translated: Two people are mentioned, Isidatta and Purana. A smile is a slight smile. A laugh is a loud laugh.

original: Muttacāgotiādīsu yaṃ vattabbaṃ, taṃ visuddhimaggaṭīkāyaṃ vuttanayena veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: yam vattabbam tam visuddhimagga ṭīkāyam vutta nayena veditabbam
translated: As to “open-handed,” etc., what is to be said has been said in the Commentary on the Path of Purification.

original: Saṃvibhāgeti parassa dānavasena saṃvibhajane. Akatavibhāganti deyyadhammavasena na🔽katavibhāgaṃ. Puggalavasena pana “sīlavantehī”ti vuttattā katavibhāgameva mahapphalatākaraṇena.🔽Tenāha “sabbaṃ dātabbameva hutvā ṭhita”nti.🔽(Etthantare pāṭho asuddho dussodhanīyo ca, suddhapāṭho gavesitabbo.)🔽7. Veḷudvāreyyasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: saṃvibhāge iti parassa dāna vasena saṃvibhajane akata vibhāgam ti deyya dhamma vasena na  kata vibhāgam puggala vasena pana vutta ttā kata vibhāgam eva mahapphala tā karaṇena  tena āha sabbam dātabbam eva hutvā ṭhitan ti  etthantare pāṭhaḥ asuddhaḥ dussodhanīyaḥ ca suddha pāṭhaḥ gavesitabbo  veḷudvāreyya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: “In sharing” means in giving to another. “Not previously shared” means not previously shared by way of the thing to be given.

original: 1003. Paveṇiāgatassāti anekapurisayugavasena paramparāgatassa. Attani upanetabbanti🔽attani netvā parasmiṃ upanetabbaṃ. Tenāha “yo kho myāyaṃ dhammo appiyo amanāpo, parassapeso
analyzed: paveṇi āgatassa ati aneka purisa yuga vasena paramparā gatassa attani upanetabbanti 🔽attani netvā parasmin upanetabbam tena āha yaḥ kho myā ayam dhammo appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ parassa peso
