original: dhammo appiyo amanāpo”tiādi. Amantabhāsenāti samphassa samphappalāpassa amantāya
analyzed: dhammaḥ appiyaḥ amanāpaḥ iti ādi amanta bhāsena ati samphassa samphappalāpassa amantāya
translated: “The Dhamma is unlovely and disagreeable” , etc.

original: mantārahitabhāsanena.
analyzed: mantā rahita bhāsanena
translated: By a speech that is not a speech: by a speech that is not a contact-speech, a confused-speech.

original: 8-9. Paṭhamagiñjakāvasathasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: 1. The First Discourse on the Brick House, etc.🔽Two villages: two villages of two different clans.

original: 1004-5. Dve gāmā dvinnaṃ ñātīnaṃ gāmāti katvā. Ñātiketi evaṃladdhanāme ekasmiṃ gāmake.
analyzed: dve gāmā dvinnam ñātīnam gāma ati katvā ñātikā iti evaṃladdha nāme ekasmin gāmake
translated: In a village called Ñāti: in a village named after a clan.

original: Giñjakāvasatheti giñjakā vuccanti iṭṭhakā, giñjakāhi eva kato āvasatho, tasmiṃ. So
analyzed: giñjaka āvasatha iti giñjakāḥ vuccanti iṭṭhakāḥ giñjakāhi eva kataḥ āvasathaḥ tasmin so
translated: In the brick house: bricks are called giñjakā; a house made of bricks is a giñjakā-vasatha.

original: kira āvāso yathā sudhāhi parikammena payojanaṃ natthi, evaṃ iṭṭhakāhi eva cinitvā
analyzed: kira āvāsaḥ yathā sudhāhi parikammena payojanam natthi evam iṭṭhakāhi eva cinitvā
translated: That dwelling, it seems, was built by bricks alone, without any plastering, like a structure of bricks.

original: kato. Tena vuttaṃ “iṭṭhakāmaye āvasathe”ti. Tulāthambhadvārabandhakavāṭaphalakāni🔽pana dārumayā eva. Oraṃ vuccati kāmadhātu, paccayabhāvena taṃ oraṃ bhajantīti orambhāgiyāni,
analyzed: tena vuttam iṭṭha kāmaye āvasatha iti tulā thambha dvāra bandha kavāṭa phalakāni  pana dāru mayā eva oram vuccati kāmadhātu paccaya bhāvena tam oram bhajanti iti orambhāgiyāni
translated: Therefore it is said: “in a house made of bricks.” The scales, the door-posts, and the door-bolts and panels🔽are all made of wood.🔽The word ora means the sense-desire world. The states that belong to the sense-desire world by being its conditions are called orambhāgiya .🔽Or they are called orambhāgiya because they are beneficial to the sense-desire world.🔽Therefore it is said: “The states that are called orambhāgiya are the states that are called lower” , and so on.

original: orambhāgassa vā hitāni orambhāgiyāni. Tenāha “heṭṭhābhāgiyāna”ntiādi. Tīhi maggehīti
analyzed: orambhāgassa vā hitāni orambhāgiyāni tena āha tīhi maggehi iti
translated: By the three paths:

original: heṭṭhimehi tīhi maggehi. Tehi pahātabbatāya hi tesaṃ saññojanānaṃ orambhāgiyatā,🔽oraṃ bhañjiyāni vā orambhāgiyāni vuttāni niruttinayena. Idāni byatirekamukhena nesaṃ
analyzed: heṭṭhimehi tīhi maggehi tehi pahātabba tāya hi tesam saññojanānam orambhāgiya tā  oram bhañjiyāni vā orambhāgiyāni vuttāni nirutti nayena idāni byatireka mukhena
translated: By the first three paths. For the fetters are called lower fetters because they are abandoned by those paths.🔽Or they are called lower fetters because they are broken off below. Now, in order to show their lower state by a different method,

original: orambhāgiyabhāvaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “tatthā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Vikkhambhitāni samatthatāvighātena
analyzed: orambhāgiya bhāvam vibhāvetum tattha atiādi vuttam vikkhambhitāni samattha tā vighātena
translated: the text is stated thus: “Herein, the fetter of adherence to rules and observances, etc.” They are not broken by the ordinary man by the suppression of the defilements,

original: puthujjanānaṃ, samucchinnāni sabbaso abhāvena ariyānaṃ rūpārūpabhavūpapattiyā vibandhanāya
analyzed: puthujjanānam samucchinnāni sabbasas abhāvena ariyānam rūpa arūpa bhava upapattiyāḥ vibandhanāya
translated: but they are completely cut off by the noble persons by their non-existence. They are not obstacles to rebirth in the fine-material and immaterial existences.

original: na hontīti vuttaṃ “avikkhambhitāni maggena vā asamucchinnānī”ti. Nibbattivasenāti
analyzed: na honti iti vuttam avikkhambhitāni maggena vā asamucchinnāni iti nibbatti vasena ati
translated: Therefore it is said: “They are not broken by the path or not cut off.”

original: paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena gantuṃ na denti. Mahaggatabhavagāmikammāyūhanassa vibandhanato🔽sakkāyadiṭṭhiādīni tīṇi saññojanāni kāmacchandabyāpādā viya mahaggatabhavūpapattiyā
analyzed: paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena gantum na denti mahaggata bhava gāmi kamma āyūhanassa vibandhanato  sakkāya diṭṭhi ādīni tīṇi saññojanāni kāma chanda byāpādāḥ viya mahaggata bhava upapattiyā
translated: By the method of rebirth: they do not allow one to go by the method of rebirth-linking. Because they are obstacles to the accumulation of kamma that leads to the fine-material existence,🔽the three fetters, namely, the false view of individuality, etc., are special conditions for rebirth in the fine-material existence,

original: visesapaccayattā tattha mahaggatabhave nibbattampi tannibbattihetukammaparikkhaye
analyzed: visesa paccaya ttā tattha mahaggata bhave nibbattam pi tad nibbatti hetu kamma parikkhaye
translated: like sense desire and ill will. Therefore, even though one is reborn in the fine-material existence,

original: kāmabhavūpapattipaccayatāya mahaggatabhavato ānetvā idheva kāmabhave eva nibbattāpenti.
analyzed: kāma bhava upapatti paccaya tāya mahaggata bhavataḥ ānetvā idha iva kāma bhave eva nibbattāpenti
translated: and they are reborn here in the sense-desire becoming itself, having been brought down from the exalted becoming.🔽So all the five fetters are only lower fettering.

original: Tasmā sabbānipi pañcapi saṃyojanāni orambhāgiyāneva. Paṭisandhivasena anāgamanasabhāvoti🔽paṭisandhiggahaṇavasena tasmā lokā idha na āgamanasabhāvo. Buddhadassana-theradassana-dhammassavanānaṃ
analyzed: tasmā sabbāni api pañca api saṃyojanāni orambhāgiyāni eva paṭisandhi vasena  paṭisandhi ggahaṇa vasena tasmai lokāḥ idha na āgamana sabhāvaḥ buddha dassana thera dassana dhammassavanānam
translated: The meaning of “not coming back” is the non-coming back from that world by rebirth.

original: pana atthāya assa āgamanaṃ anivāritaṃ.
analyzed: pana atthāya assa āgamanam a nivāritam
translated: But his coming back is not denied for the purpose of seeing the Enlightened One, the Elder, and hearing the True Idea.

original: Kadāci uppattiyā viraḷākāratā, pariyuṭṭhānamandatāya abahalatāti dvedhāpi tanubhāvo.
analyzed: kadāci uppattiyāḥ viraḷa ākāra tā pariyuṭṭhāna manda tāya a bahala tā ati dvedhā api tanu bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning of “weak” is twofold: the state of being weak in the sense of not occurring often, and the state of being weak in the sense of not being strong owing to the weakness of the obsession.

original: Abhiṇhanti bahuso. Bahalabahalāti tibbatibbā. Yattha uppajjanti, taṃ santānaṃ maddantā
analyzed: abhiṇhanti bahusas bahala bahalā ati tibba tibbāḥ yattha uppajjanti tam santānam maddantā
translated: “Repeatedly” means “often.” “Strong-strong” means “very strong.” They occur in such wise that they occur in the continuity in which they arise, crushing, as it were, and breaking and shattering it, as darkness does the eye’s sensitivity to forms.

original: pharantā sādhentā andhakāraṃ karontā uppajjanti, dvīhi pana maggehi pahīnattā tanukatanukā
analyzed: pharantā sādhentā andhakāram karontā uppajjanti dvīhi pana maggehi pahīna ttā tanuka tanukā
translated: But because they have been abandoned by the two paths they occur weakly-weak and feebly-feebly.

original: mandamandā uppajjanti. Puttadhītaro hontīti idaṃ akāraṇaṃ. Tathā hi aṅgapaccaṅgaparāmasanamattenapi
analyzed: manda mandāḥ uppajjanti putta dhītaraḥ honti iti idam akāraṇam tathā hi aṅga paccaṅga parāmasana mattena api
translated: The statement “They are like sons and daughters” is not a reason. For even when there is mere fondling of limbs and minor limbs,

original: te honti. Idanti “rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā”ti idaṃ vacanaṃ. Bhavatanukavasenāti appakabhavavasena.
analyzed: te honti idam ti rāga dosa mohānam tanuttā ati idam vacanam bhava tanuka vasena ati appaka bhava vasena
translated: They are. This is the statement: “Through the attenuation of lust, hatred, and delusion.”🔽Through the attenuation of becoming: through the attenuation of becoming that is to say, through the non-occurrence of the gross kind of becoming.

original: Tanti mahāsīvattherassa vacanaṃ paṭikkhittanti sambandho. Ye bhavā ariyānaṃ labbhanti,
analyzed: tatti mahāsīva therassa vacanam sambandho ye bhavāḥ ariyānam labbhanti
translated: The construction is: “The statement of the elder Mahasiva is rejected.”🔽The kinds of becoming that are available to noble ones are only those that possess the characteristics of complete becoming.

original: te paripuṇṇalakkhaṇabhavā eva. Ye na labbhanti, tattha kīdisaṃ taṃ bhavatanukaṃ.
analyzed: te paripuṇṇa lakkhaṇa bhavāḥ eva ye na labbhanti tattha kīdisam tam bhava tanukam
translated: But those that are not available to them, what kind of attenuation of becoming are they?

original: Tasmā ubhayathāpi bhavatanukassa asambhavo evāti dassetuṃ “sotāpannassā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tasmai ubhayathā api bhava tanukassa asambhavaḥ evā ti dassetum sotāpannassa atiādi vuttam
translated: Therefore, in order to show that in either case there is no attenuation of becoming, it is said: “In the case of the stream-enterer,” etc.

original: Aṭṭhame bhave bhavatanukaṃ natthi aṭṭhamasseva bhavassa sabbasseva abhāvato. Sesesupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: aṭṭhame bhave bhava tanukam natthi aṭṭhamassa iva bhavassa sabbassa iva abhāvato sesesu pi esa iva nayo
translated: In the eighth becoming there is no attenuation of becoming because there is no occurrence of the eighth becoming at all. The same method applies in the other cases.

original: Kāmāvacaralokaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ itarassa lokassa vasena tathā vattuṃ asakkuṇeyyattā.
analyzed: kāmāvacara lokam sandhāya vuttam itarassa lokassa vasena tathā vattum a sakkuṇeyya ttā
translated: The reference is to the sense-sphere world, because it is impossible to speak in this way with reference to the other world.

original: Yo hi sakadāgāmī devamanussalokesu vomissakavasena nibbattati, sopi kāmabhavavaseneva
analyzed: yaḥ hi sakadāgāmī deva manussa lokesu vomissaka vasena nibbattati saḥ api kāma bhava vasena iva
translated: For the once-returner who is reborn in the divine and human worlds in a miscellaneous way is reborn only through sense-desire becoming.

original: paricchinditabbo. Bhagavatā ca kāmaloke ṭhatvā – “sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā”ti
analyzed: paricchinditabbaḥ bhagavatā ca kāma loke ṭhatvā sakidevaḥ imam lokam āgantvā ati
translated: and it should be defined. And the Blessed One, while remaining in the sense-desire world, said: “Having come to this world only once” .

original: vuttaṃ. Imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvāti ca iminā pañcasu sakadāgāmīsu cattāro vajjetvā ekova🔽gahito. Ekacco hi idha sakadāgāmiphalaṃ patvā idheva parinibbāyati, ekacco idha patvā🔽devaloke parinibbāyati, ekacco devaloke patvā tattheva parinibbāyati, ekacco devaloke
analyzed: vuttam imam lokam āgantvā iti ca iminā pañcasu sakadāgāmīsu cattāraḥ vajjetvā ekaḥ eva  gahitaḥ ekaccaḥ hi idha sakadāgāmi phalam patvā idhā iva parinibbāyati ekaccaḥ idha patvā  deva loke parinibbāyati ekaccaḥ deva loke patvā tattha iva parinibbāyati ekaccaḥ deva loke
translated: And by “having come to this world” the four among the five kinds of once-returners are excluded and only one is included.

original: patvā idhūpapajjitvā parinibbāyati, ime cattāro idha na labbhanti. Yo pana idha patvā
analyzed: patvā idha upapajjitvā parinibbāyati ime cattāraḥ idha na labbhanti yaḥ pana idha patvā
translated: For one kind of once-returner attains the fruit of once-returner here and attains Nibbāna here; another attains it here and attains Nibbāna in the deva world; another attains it there and attains Nibbāna there; and another attains it there and returns here and attains Nibbāna here. These four are not included here.

original: devaloke yāvatāyukaṃ vasitvā puna idhūpapajjitvā parinibbāyati, ayamidha adhippeto.🔽Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “imaṃ lokanti kāmabhavo adhippeto”ti imamatthaṃ vibhāvetuṃ “sace
analyzed: deva loke yāvatāyukam vasitvā punar idhu upapajjitvā parinibbāyati ayam idha adhippetaḥ  aṭṭhakathā ayam pana imam lokam ti kāma bhavaḥ adhippeto ti imam attham vibhāvetum sace
translated: But the one who attains it here and lives out his allotted span in the deva world and returns here and attains Nibbāna here is included here.

original: hī”tiādinā aññaṃyeva catukkaṃ dassitaṃ.
analyzed: hi iti ādinā aññam yeva catukkam dassitam
translated: But in the commentary the fourfold set beginning with “If he” is given in order to illustrate the meaning of the words “this world” , which refers to the sense-desire world.

original: Catūsu…pe… sabhāvoti attho apāyagamanīyānaṃ pāpadhammānaṃ sabbaso pahīnattā. Dhammaniyāmenāti
analyzed: sabhāvaḥ ti atthaḥ apāya gamanīyānam pāpa dhammānam sabbaso pahīna ttā dhamma niyāmena ati
translated: The meaning is: “he has abandoned all evil states that lead to the lower worlds.”

original: maggadhammaniyāmena niyato uparimaggādhigamassa avassaṃbhāvibhāvato. Tenāha “sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
analyzed: magga dhamma niyāmena niyataḥ upari magga adhigamassa tena āha sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ ti
translated: “By the regularity of dhammas”: by the regularity of the path dhammas. He is “fixed” because it is certain that he will attain the higher paths. Thus it is said: “he is bound for full enlightenment.”

original: Tesaṃ tesaṃ ñāṇagatinti tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ “asuko sotāpanno, asuko sakadāgāmī”tiādinā🔽taṃtaṃñāṇādhigamanaṃ ñāṇūpapattiṃ. Ñāṇābhisamparāyanti tato parampi – “niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo
analyzed: tesam tesam ñāṇa gatī ti tesam tesam sattānam asukaḥ sotāpannaḥ asukaḥ sakadāgāmī iti ādinā  taṃ taṃ ñāṇa adhigamanam ñāṇūpapattim ñāṇa abhisamparāyanti tatas niyataḥ sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ
translated: “The knowledge and insight of each one”: the knowledge and insight of each one of those beings, such as “This one is a stream-enterer, this one is a once-returner,” etc.

original: sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karissatī”tiādinā ñāṇasahitaṃ upapattipaccayabhavaṃ.
analyzed: sakidevaḥ imam lokam āgantvā dukkhassantam karissati iti ādinā ñāṇa sahitam upapatti paccaya bhavam
translated: “The knowledge of rebirth”: the rebirth-linking that is accompanied by knowledge for the future, such as “After passing away from here he will be reborn there, and after passing away from there he will attain final Nibbāna without ever returning to this world.”

original: Olokentassa ñāṇacakkhunā apekkhantassa. Kevalaṃ kāyakilamathova, na tena kāci paresaṃ
analyzed: olokentassa ñāṇa cakkhunā apekkhantassa kevalam na tena kāci paresam
translated: “Looking on”: observing with the eye of knowledge. The intention is that there is only physical fatigue, but no spiritual benefit for him.

original: atthasiddhīti adhippāyo. Cittavihesā cittakhedo, sā kilesūpasaṃhitattā buddhānaṃ natthi.
analyzed: attha siddhi iti adhippāyaḥ citta vihesā citta khedo sā kilesu upasaṃhita ttā buddhānam na atthi
translated: “Mental exhaustion”: mental fatigue. This does not exist for the Buddhas, because they are free from the defilements.

original: Ādissati ālokīyati attā etenāti ādāsaṃ, dhammabhūtaṃ ādāsaṃ dhammādāsaṃ, ariyamaggañāṇassetaṃ
analyzed: ādissati ālokīyati attā etena ati ādāsam dhamma bhūtam ādāsam dhamma ādāsam ariya magga ñāṇassa etam
translated: Mirror: it is a mirror in that it is looked at, looked into, by the self . The mirror of ideas: the mirror of ideas that has become a Dhamma, which is a term for the knowledge of the noble path.

original: adhivacanaṃ. Tena hi ariyasāvako catūsu ariyasaccesu viddhastasammohattā attānaṃ🔽yāthāvato ñatvā yāthāvato byākareyya, tappakāsanato pana dhammapariyāyassa suttassa
analyzed: adhivacanam tena hi ariya sāvakaḥ catūsu ariya saccesu attānam  yāthāvataḥ ñatvā yāthāvataḥ byākareyya tad pakāsanataḥ pana dhammapariyāyassa suttassa
translated: For by means of that the noble disciple, having understood himself as he is through the four noble truths free from delusion,🔽would describe himself as he is, and the Dhamma exposition, the sutta, is described as the mirror of ideas because it is the means for describing him.

original: dhammādāsatā veditabbāti. Yena dhammādāsenāti idha pana maggadhammameva vadati. Sesaṃ
analyzed: dhamma ādāsa tā veditabbā ati yena dhamma ādāsena ati idha pana magga dhammam eva vadati sesam
translated: As to the words by means of which mirror of ideas: here he speaks only of the path idea. The rest

original: uttānatthattā suviññeyyamevāti.
analyzed: uttānattha ttā su viññeyyam eva ati
translated: is easily intelligible since it is obvious in meaning.

original: Veḷudvāravaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: veḷu dvāra vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the Veḷudvāra Vagga is ended.

original: 2. Rājakārāmavaggo
analyzed: rāja kārāma vaggo
translated: The Rājakārāma Vagga

original: 1. Sahassabhikkhunisaṅghasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: sahassa bhikkhuni saṅgha sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Sutta on the Community of a Thousand Bhikkhunīs🔽King’s park: a park belonging to a king, one who is compassionate to the people living in the country because he is righteous.

original: 1007. Dhammikattā desavāsīhi anukampito rājāti rājako, tassa ārāmo rājakārāmo, tasmiṃ. Bhūmisīsaṃ seṭṭhappadeso, yattha vasanto lābhaggayasaggappatto hotīti tesaṃ adhippāyo.
analyzed: dhammika ttā desavāsīhi anukampitaḥ rājā ati rājakaḥ tassa ārāmaḥ rājaka ārāmaḥ tasmin bhūmi sīsam seṭṭha ppadesaḥ yattha vasantaḥ hoti iti tesam adhippāyaḥ
translated: Their intention is that the head of the land is the best place to live in, for one who lives there gains the best of gains and the best of fame.

original: Vārāpehīti paṭisedhehi. Yujjhāpetunti kalahaṃ kārāpetuṃ. Puna āgacchantāti aparasmiṃ
analyzed: vārāpehi iti paṭisedhehi yujjhāpetum ti kalaham kārāpetum punar āgacchantā ati aparasmin
translated: “Stop it” means “Prevent it.” “Cause them to fight” means “Cause them to quarrel.” “Coming again” means “Coming again”

original: saṃvacchare āgacchantā. Ubbaṭṭetvāti mahatī vīciyo ubbaṭṭetvā. Yathā tassa sakalameva
analyzed: saṃvacchare āgacchantā ubbaṭṭetvā ati mahatī vīciyaḥ ubbaṭṭetvā yathā tassa sakalam eva
translated: in the following year. “Having dug” means “Having dug a great trench.” Having done so,

original: raṭṭhaṃ ekodakībhūtaṃ hoti, evaṃ katvā samuddameva jātaṃ. Tena vuttaṃ “samuddameva akaṃsū”ti.
analyzed: raṭṭham ekodakībhūtam hoti evam katvā samuddam eva jātam tena vuttam samuddam eva akaṃsu iti
translated: he made the whole country one great lake, and thus he made it a sea. Therefore it is said, “They made it a sea.”

original: Isīnamantaraṃ katvāti isīnaṃ kāraṇaṃ katvā, isīnaṃ hetūti attho, isīnaṃ vā antarabhedaṃ
analyzed: isīnam antaram katvā ati isīnam kāraṇam katvā isīnam hetū iti attho isīnam vā antara bhedam
translated: “Having made the cause of the seers” means “Having made the reason of the seers.” The meaning is: “Having made the seers the cause.” Or else, “having made a division among the seers.”

original: katvā. Tathā loke kolāhalassa patthaṭataṃ vibhāvento bhagavā “me suta”nti āha paccakkhato
analyzed: katvā tathā loke kolāhalassa patthaṭa tam vibhāventaḥ bhagavā me sutan ti āha paccakkhataḥ
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One, who is well known in the world, said “I have heard” in order to show the great extent of the noise.

original: jānampi. Ucchinnoti kulacchedena ucchinno. Na kevalaṃ sayameva, atha kho saha raṭṭhehi.
analyzed: kula chedena ucchinnaḥ na kevalam sayam eva atha kho saha raṭṭhehi
translated: “Cut off” means “Cut off by the extinction of the family.” Not only did he himself do so, but he did so together with the country.

original: Vibhavanti vināsaṃ upagato.
analyzed: vibhavanti vināsam upagataḥ
translated: They are destroyed, they have come to destruction.

original: Taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttanti taṃ yathāvuttaṃ pasenadinā kosalarājena kāritaṃ vihāraṃ sandhāya etaṃ “rājakārāme”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tam sandhāya itam vuttam ti tam yathā vuttam pasenadinā kosala rājena kāritam vihāram sandhāya etam rājaka ārāma iti vuttam
translated: With reference to that, this was said: “In the royal monastery” was said with reference to that monastery built by Pasenadi, the Kosala king, as described above.

original: 2-3. Brāhmaṇasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: 2-3. The Brahmana Sutta, etc.

original: 1008-9. Udayagāmininti ārambhato paṭṭhāya sampattiāvahaṃ.
analyzed: udaya gāminiṃ ti ārambhataḥ paṭṭhāya sampatti āvaham
translated: “Leading to rise” : leading to prosperity from the beginning.

original: 4. Duggatibhayasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: duggati bhaya sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Fear of Bad Destinations

original: 1010. Duṭṭhā gati nipphatti duggati, duggatabhāvo dāliddiyaṃ, tadeva bhayaṃ, taṃ sabbaṃ anavasesaṃ vā duggatibhayaṃ daliddabhayaṃ. Sammadeva atikkantoti samatikkanto.
analyzed: duṭṭhā gati nipphatti duggati duggata bhāvaḥ dāliddiyam tat eva bhayam tam sabbam anavasesam vā duggati bhayam dalidda bhayam sammat eva atikkanto ti samatikkanto
translated: Bad destination is the result of a bad destination. The state of having a bad destination is poverty. That itself is the fear. All that without exception is the fear of bad destinations, the fear of poverty. “Has completely gone beyond” : has gone beyond.

original: 6. Paṭhamamittāmaccasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭhama mittāmacca sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The First Sutta on Friends and Companions

original: 1012. Vohāramittāti taṃtaṃdānaggahaṇavasena vohārakā mittā. Āmantanapaṭimantanairiyāpathādīsupīti
analyzed: vohāra mittā ati taṃ taṃ dāna ggahaṇa vasena vohārakāḥ mittāḥ āmantana paṭimantana eriyāpatha ādīsu pi iti
translated: “Conversational friends” : friends who are friends by virtue of the taking up of this or that conversation. “In regard to invitations, in regard to meeting-halls, in regard to roads, in regard to goods, in regard to gain” :

original: ālāpasallāpagamananisajjādiatthasaṃvidhānādīsu. Ekato pavattakiccāti saha pavattakattabbā.
analyzed: ālāpa sallāpa gamana nisajja ādi attha saṃvidhāna ādīsu ekatas pavatta kiccā ati saha pavatta kattabbā
translated: in regard to the making of appointments for conversation, for walking, for sitting, etc. “In regard to activities that are carried out together” : in regard to duties that are carried out together.

original: Amā saha bhavantīti amaccā. “Amhākaṃ ime”ti ñāyantīti ñātī, āvāhavivāhasambaddhā.
analyzed: amā saha bhavanti iti amaccāḥ amhākam ime iti ñāyanti iti ñātī āvāha vivāha sambaddhā
translated: “They are not-mine, they are together with me” : they are not-mine, they are together with me. “They are known as ‘ours’” : they are known as “ours.” “They are related by marriage” : they are related by marriage.

original: Tenāha “sassusasurapakkhikā”ti. Yonisambandhā vā sālohitā. Tenāha “bhātibhaginimātulādayo”ti.
analyzed: tena āha sassusasurapakkhikā iti yoni sambandhā vā sālohitā tena āha bhāti bhagini mātula ādayaḥ iti
translated: Therefore it is said: “they are on the side of the Suras and the Asuras.” “They are related by blood” : they are related by blood. Therefore it is said: “brothers, sisters, uncles, etc.”

original: 7. Dutiyamittāmaccasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya mittāmacca sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Second Sutta on Friends and Companions

original: 1013. Kismiñci kassaci ca tathā tathā uppannassa pasādassa aññathābhāvo pasādaññathattaṃ.🔽Bhūtasaṅghātassa ghanaādikassa aññathābhāvo bhāvaññathattaṃ. Nirayādigatiantaraupapatti
analyzed: kismiñci kassaci ca tathā tathā uppannassa pasādassa aññathābhāvaḥ pasāda aññathattam  bhūta saṅghātassa ghana ādikassa aññathābhāvaḥ bhāvaññathattam niraya ādi gati antara aupapatti
translated: The alteration of the faith arisen in anyone in any way is faith-alteration.🔽The alteration of the compactness, etc., of the aggregate of elements is substance-alteration.🔽The alteration of the destiny, which is rebirth in hell, etc., is destiny-alteration.

original: gatiaññathattaṃ. Sabhāvadhammānaṃ kakkhaḷaphusanādilakkhaṇassa aññathābhāvo lakkhaṇaññathattaṃ.
analyzed: gati aññathattam sa bhāva dhammānam kakkhaḷa phusana ādi lakkhaṇassa aññathābhāvaḥ lakkhaṇaññathattam
translated: The alteration of the characteristic of the individual essences, which is the characteristic of hardness, etc., is characteristic-alteration.

original: “Ṭhitassa aññathattaṃ paññāyatī”ti evaṃ vuttaṃ aññathattaṃ vipariṇāmaññathattaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhitassa aññathattam paññāyati iti evam vuttam aññathattam vipariṇāma ññathattam
translated: The alteration described as “alteration of what is present” is alteration of what is present.

original: Lakkhaṇaññathattaṃ na labbhati. Tenāha “lakkhaṇaṃ pana na vigacchatī”ti, sesaṃ labbhatīti.🔽Pathavīdhātuyāti sasambhārapathavīdhātuyā. Āpodhātuyāti etthāpi eseva nayo. Purimabhāvoti
analyzed: lakkhaṇa aññathattam na labbhati tena āha lakkhaṇam pana na vigacchati iti sesam labbhati iti  pathavī dhātuyā āpaḥ dhātuyā ati ettha api esa iva nayo purima bhāvā ti
translated: Characteristic-alteration is not found. Hence he said, “But the characteristic does not depart.” The rest is found.🔽In the earth element: in the earth element with its conascent imponderable matter. The same method applies in the case of the water element.

original: ghanakaṭhinabhāvo. Bhāvaññathattaṃ rasaññathattasabhāvo. Gatiaññathattaṃ uggatūpapatti.
analyzed: ghana kaṭhina bhāvaḥ bhāvaññathattam rasa aññathatta sabhāvaḥ gati aññathattam uggata upapatti
translated: The previous state: the state of compactness and hardness. Substance-alteration is the alteration of the substance. Destiny-alteration is rebirth in a higher world.

original: Tenāha “tañhi ariyasāvakassa natthī”ti. Pasādaññathattampi natthiyeva ariyasāvakassa.
analyzed: tena āha tat hi ariya sāvakassa natthi iti pasāda aññathattam pi natthiyeva ariya sāvakassa
translated: Hence it is said, “That is not for a noble disciple.” And the noble disciple has no other faith than that.

original: Rājakārāmavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: rājaka ārāma vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Rājakārāma Group is finished.

original: 3. Saraṇānivaggo
analyzed: saraṇā nivaggaḥ
translated: The Sarakāni Group

original: 1-2. Paṭhamamahānāmasuttādivaṇṇanā
translated: The First Discourse on Mahānāma, etc.

original: 1017-18. Samiddhanti sampuṇṇaṃ. Supupphitanti upasobhitatāya supupphitasadisattā.
analyzed: samiddham nti sampuṇṇam su pupphitam ti upasobhita tāya su pupphita sadisa ttā
translated: “In full flower”: like a flower in its beauty.

original: Byūhā nāma yehi eva pavisanti, tehi eva nikkhamanti. Tenāha “byūhā vuccanti avinibbiddharacchāyo”ti.
analyzed: byūhāḥ nāma yehi eva pavisanti tehi eva nikkhamanti tena āha byūhāḥ vuccanti a vinibbiddha racchāyā ti
translated: “Arbours”: the arbours are the unclosed shade-trees by which one enters and by which one goes out. Hence it is said, “Arbours are called unclosed shade-trees” .

original: Uddhatacārināti yaṭṭhantarā.
analyzed: uddhatacārinā ati yaṭṭhantarā
translated: “Restless in conduct”: in the intervals.

original: 3. Godhasakkasuttavaṇṇanā🔽1019. Tīhīti ratanattaye uppannehi tīhi pasādadhammehi. Catūhīti tehi eva saddhiṃ
analyzed: godha sakka sutta vaṇṇanā  tīhi iti ratanattaye uppannehi tīhi pasāda dhammehi catūhi iti tehi eva saddhiṃ
translated: The Discourse on Godhika

original: sīlena. Kocidevātiādi parikappavasena vuttaṃ bhagavati attano saddhāya uḷāratamabhāvadassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: sīlena kocid evā tiādi parikappa vasena vuttam bhagavati attano saddhāya uḷāratama bhāva dassana attham
translated: “By three”: by the three kinds of faith that arise when the Triple Gem has arisen. “By four”: together with virtue. “By some”: this is said by way of supposition, for the purpose of showing that his faith in the Blessed One was very great.

original: Tenāha “bhagavato sabbaññutāyā”tiādi. Dhammo samuppādoti vivādadhammauppattihetu.
analyzed: tena āha bhagavataḥ sabbaññu tāya atiādi dhammo samuppādo ti vivāda dhamma auppatti hetu
translated: Hence it is said, “because of the Blessed One’s omniscience” , etc. “The Dhamma’s origin”: the cause of the origin of the Dhamma of dispute.

original: Tadeva hi sandhāyāha “kiñcideva kāraṇa”nti. Kāraṇanti nānākāraṇaṃ. Kalyāṇakusalavimuttanti
analyzed: tat eva hi sandhāya āha kiñcid eva kāraṇanti kāraṇanti nānā kāraṇam kalyāṇa kusala vimuttanti
translated: “Reason” is a reason for the various kinds of unreason.🔽“Virtuous, wholesome, and free” :🔽unvirtuous is unwholesome. This is stated in order to remove the view of the purpose of the above-mentioned lack of confidence.

original: akalyāṇaṃ akusalaṃ, tadidaṃ yathāvuttaappasādanena apanītaatthadassanatthaṃ. Assāti
analyzed: akalyāṇam akusalam tat idam yathā vutta appasādanena apanīta attha dassana ttham assāti
translated: “Assa” :🔽Mahānāma the Sakyan.

original: mahānāmasakkassa. Anavajjanadoso esoti catūsu dhammesu ekenapi samannāgato sotāpanno🔽hotīti anujānitvā catūhipi samannāgatena ācikkhitabbanti yāthāvato anavajjanadosoti attho.
analyzed: mahānāma sakkassa anavajjana doso esaḥ ti catūsu dhammesu ekena api samannāgato sotāpanno  hoti iti anujānitvā catūhi pi samannāgatena ācikkhitabbanti yāthāvataḥ anavajjana doso ti attho
translated: “This is not a fault” : one who possesses even one of the four qualities is a stream-enterer.

original: 4. Paṭhamasaraṇānisakkasuttavaṇṇanā🔽1020. Pamāṇenāti ekena pamāṇena, na sabbaso. Olokanaṃ khamantīti dassanamaggena catusaccadhammā
analyzed: pamāṇena ati ekena pamāṇena na sabbaso olokanam khamanti iti dassana maggena catu sacca dhammā
translated: Having permitted this, it is said that one should point out the stream-enterer as possessing all four qualities. The meaning is: “This is not a fault in the way of pointing out the stream-enterer as he really is.”🔽. Commentary🔽“Pamāṇena” : by one measure, not entirely.

original: paccattaṃ passitabbā paṭivijjhitabbā. Paṭhamamaggakkhaṇe hi catusaccadhammā ekadesatova
analyzed: paccattam passitabbā paṭivijjhitabbā paṭhama magga kkhaṇe hi catu sacca dhammā eka desataḥ va
translated: “The seeing is acceptable” : the four truths should be seen and penetrated by the path of seeing. For at the moment of the first path the four truths are seen only in part.🔽But it is proper to say that one is liberated because the act of penetrating is in progress.

original: diṭṭhā nāma honti. “Parimuccatī”ti pana vattuṃ vaṭṭati paṭivijjhanakiriyāya vattamānattā.
analyzed: diṭṭhāḥ nāma honti parimuccati iti pana vattum vaṭṭati paṭivijjhana kiriyāya vattamāna ttā
translated: . “Tena kho pana samayena” : at that time.

original: Agantvā apāyesu anuppattirahattā. Tenāha “na gacchatī”ti, na uppajjatīti attho. Mahāsārarukkhe
analyzed: a gantvā apāyesu anuppatti raha ttā tena āha na gacchati iti na uppajjati iti atthaḥ mahāsārarukkhe
translated: because of the absence of going to the states of loss. Hence he said, “does not go” . The meaning is that it does not arise.

original: dassento āha – “yo koci viññujātiko mama ce gocaraṃ gacchati, ekassa āgamanaṃ avañjhaṃ
analyzed: dassentaḥ āha yaḥ koci viññu jātikaḥ mama ce gocaram gacchati ekassa āgamanam avañjham
translated: showing a great tree, he said “If anyone who is wise and discerning comes into my domain, his coming will not be barren,

original: amogha”nti dassetuṃ.
analyzed: amoghanti dassetum
translated: it will not be fruitless.”

original: 5. Dutiyasaraṇānisakkasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya saraṇānisakka sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Second Discourse on the Refuges

original: 1021. Dukkhettaṃ nirojakaṃ, tāya eva dukkhettatāya visamaṃ hotīti āha “visamakhetta”nti.🔽Loṇūpahatanti jātasabhāvena loṇena ūsarena upahataṃ. Khaṇḍānīti khaṇḍitāni. Temetvāti
analyzed: dukkhettam nirojakam tāya eva dukkhetta tāya visamam hoti iti āha visama khettam ti  jāta sabhāvena loṇena ūsarena upahatam khaṇḍāni iti khaṇḍitāni temetvā iti
translated: is a bad field, a barren field. Because of its very badness as a field, it is uneven. Thus he said “uneven field.”

original: temitattā. Vātātapahatānīti cirakālaṃ vātena ceva ātapena ca upahatāni ābādhitāni.
analyzed: vāta ātapa hatāni iti cira kālam vātena ca iva ātapena ca upahatāni ābādhitāni
translated: Salted: damaged by salt, by natural salt. Broken: split. Having been broken: because of being broken. Damaged by wind and sun: long since damaged, harmed, by wind and sun.

original: 6. Paṭhamaanāthapiṇḍikasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: paṭhama anāthapiṇḍika sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The First Discourse on Anathapindika

original: 1022. Ṭhānanti ṭhānaso. Tenāha “khaṇenā”ti. Niyyānikanti pavattaṃ ñāṇapaṭirūpakaṃ
analyzed: ṭhānam ti tena āha khaṇena ati niyyānikam ti pavattam ñāṇa paṭirūpakam
translated: Place: in place. Hence he said “in a moment.” A way out: a way that is a semblance of knowledge.

original: pakatipurisantarajānanādimicchāñāṇaṃ. Taṃ pana aniyyānikaṃ “niyyānika”nti paccavekkhaṇavasena
analyzed: pakati purisa antara jānana ādi micchā ñāṇam tam pana aniyyānikam niyyānikam ti paccavekkhaṇa vasena
translated: Wrong knowledge such as the knowledge of the thoughts of other ordinary people. But that is not a way out. “A way out” is a way that is a semblance of knowledge.

original: pavatteyyāti āha “micchāpaccavekkhaṇenā”ti. Guṇaviyuttassa attano sakattani avaṭṭhānasaṅkhātā
analyzed: pavatteyya iti āha micchā paccavekkhaṇena ati guṇa viyuttassa attano sakattani avaṭṭhāna saṅkhātā
translated: “By wrong reflection” is said. Wrong deliverance is the deliverance called “non-settling” of one who is devoid of special qualities.

original: vimutti micchāvimutti.
analyzed: vimutti micchāvimutti
translated: The fear of death is the fear of death.

original: 7. Dutiyaanāthapiṇḍikasuttavaṇṇanā🔽1023. Yathākammaṃ samparetabbato samparāyo, peccabhavo, samparāyahetukaṃ samparāyikaṃ, maraṇabhayaṃ.🔽Saraṇānivaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽4. Puññābhisandavaggo🔽1. Paṭhamapuññābhisandasuttavaṇṇanā🔽1027. Avicchedena niccappavattiyamānāni puññāni abhisandanaṭṭhena “puññābhisandā”ti vuttā, tena puññanadiyoti attho vutto. Sukhassa āharaṇato ānayanato sukhassāhāro.🔽4. Paṭhamadevapadasuttavaṇṇanā🔽1030. Devānanti visuddhidevānaṃ. Devapadānīti tesaṃ padāni devapadāni, devoti vā
analyzed: dutiya anāthapiṇḍika sutta vaṇṇanā  yathākammam samparetabbataḥ samparāyaḥ pecca bhavaḥ samparāya hetukam samparāyikam maraṇa bhayam  saraṇāni vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  puñña abhisanda vaggaḥ  paṭhama puñña abhisanda sutta vaṇṇanā  avicchedena puññāni abhisandana ṭṭhena puññābhisandā ati vuttā tena puñña nadiyaḥ ti atthaḥ vutto sukhassa āharaṇataḥ ānayanataḥ sukhassa āhāraḥ           devānam ti visuddhi devānam deva padāni iti tesam padāni deva padāni vā
translated: The commentary on the second Anathapiṇḍika Sutta is finished.
