original: sāmaññaniddesena, “mūlabījañca mūlabījañca mūlabīja”nti ekasesanayena vā bījattho
analyzed: sāmañña niddesena mūla bījam ca mūla bījam ca mūla bījanti ekasesa nayena vā bījattho
translated: and the definition of the state of a recluse, “root-seed, root-seed, root-seed” in the way of a single class.🔽

original: veditabbo. Esa nayo sesesupi. Phaḷubījanti pabbabījaṃ. Bāhirapaccayantarasamavāye
analyzed: veditabbaḥ esa nayaḥ sesesu pi phaḷu bījam ti pabba bījam bāhira paccaya antara samavāye
translated: The meaning of seed should be understood in the way beginning, “root-seed, root-seed, root-seed,” by the method of single terms in the description of the general characteristics . The same method applies in the case of the rest. “Branch-seed”: tree-seed. “External condition”: the condition that is external to the seed itself.

original: sadisaphaluppattiyā visesakāraṇabhāvato viruhanasamatthe sāraphale niruḷho bīja-saddo.🔽Tadatthasiddhiyā mūlādīsupi kesuci pavattatīti tato nivattanatthaṃ ekena bīja-saddena
analyzed: sadisa phala uppattiyā visesa kāraṇa bhāvataḥ viruhana samatthe sāra phale niruḷhaḥ bīja saddaḥ  tad attha siddhiyā mūla ādīsu pi kesuci pavattati iti tatas nivattana attham ekena bīja saddena
translated: The word “seed” is restricted to the fruit that is capable of growing, since it is the special cause for the production of a fruit similar to itself when the external condition is present.

original: visesetvā vuttaṃ “bījabīja”nti “rūparūpaṃ, dukkhadukkha”nti ca yathā. Nīlatiṇarukkhādikassāti
analyzed: visesetvā vuttam bīja bījam ti rūpa rūpam dukkha dukkham ti ca yathā nīla tiṇa rukkha ādikassa ati
translated: It occurs in some of the roots, etc., too, for the purpose of establishing that meaning. So in order to exclude those, it is specified by the word “seed” in the way beginning, “seed-seed,” just as in the expressions “form-form” and “pain-pain.”

original: allatiṇassa ceva allarukkhādikassa ca. Ādi-saddena osadhigacchalatādīnaṃ gahaṇaṃ.
analyzed: alla tiṇassa ca iva alla rukkha ādikassa ca ādi saddena osadhi gaccha latā ādīnam gahaṇam
translated: “Blue grass, trees, etc.”: both blue grass and blue trees, etc. The word “etc.” includes blue herbs, creepers, etc.

original: 9. Vikālabhojanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vikālabhojana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discourse on Eating at the Wrong Time

original: 1149. Aruṇuggamanato paṭṭhāya yāva majjhanhiko, ayaṃ buddhādiariyānaṃ āciṇṇasamāciṇṇo bhojanassa kālo, tadañño vikāloti āha – “vikālabhojanāti kālātikkantabhojanā”ti.
analyzed: aruṇuggamanataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva majjhanhikaḥ ayam buddha ādi ariyānam āciṇṇa samāciṇṇaḥ bhojanassa kālo tad aññaḥ vikālo ti āha vikāla bhojanā ati kāla atikkanta bhojanā ati
translated: From the time of dawn until midday is the time for eating that is customary for Noble Ones such as the Enlightened One. Any other time is the wrong time.

original: 10. Gandhavilepanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: gandha vilepana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Thread-interpretation of Perfumes and Oils

original: 1150. Yaṃ kiñci pupphanti ganthimaṃ aganthimaṃ vā yaṃ kiñci pupphajātaṃ, tathā pisitādibhedaṃ yaṃ kiñci gandhajātaṃ.
analyzed: yam kiñci pupphanti ganthimam aganthimam vā yam kiñci puppha jātam tathā pisita ādi bhedam yam kiñci gandha jātam
translated: Any kind of flower: any kind of flower whatever, whether it has a joint or not. Any kind of perfume: any kind of perfume whatever, whether it is pounded or not.

original: 9. Tatiyaāmakadhaññapeyyālavaggo
analyzed: tatiya āmaka dhañña peyya āla vaggaḥ
translated: The third sub-chapter on fermented urine, etc.

original: 1. Naccagītasuttavaṇṇanā🔽1151. Saṅkhepato “sabbapāpassa akaraṇa”ntiādinayappavattaṃ (dī.ni. 2.90; dha.pa.
analyzed: naccagīta sutta vaṇṇanā  saṅkhepataḥ sabba pāpassa akaraṇa nti ādi naya ppavattam dīni
translated: The Thread-interpretation of Dancing and Singing

original: 183) bhagavato sāsanaṃ accantachandarāgapavattito naccādīnaṃ dassanaṃ na anulometīti
analyzed: bhagavato sāsanam accanta chanda rāga pavattitaḥ nacca ādīnam dassanam na anulomā iti iti
translated: The Blessed One’s Dispensation, which occurs in the way beginning ‘ Abstinence from all evil ‘ , etc., is not in conformity with the appearance of dancing, etc., because of the occurrence of excessive desire and lust.

original: āha “sāsanassa ananulomattā”ti. Attanā parehi ca payojiyamānaṃ payojāpiyamānañca
analyzed: āha sāsanassa an anuloma ttā iti attanā parehi ca payojiyamānam payojāpiyamānam ca
translated: So it is said that ‘ it is not in conformity with the Dispensation ‘ .🔽Dancing and singing and music are included by the word ‘ dancing ‘ in the sense of what is done by oneself and what is got done by others.

original: eteneva nacca-saddena gahitaṃ, tathā gītavāditasaddehi cāti āha – “naccananaccāpanādivasenā”ti.
analyzed: etena iva nacca saddena gahitam tathā gīta vādita saddehi ca ati āha
translated: So it is said that ‘ in the sense of dancing, etc., as what is done by oneself and what is got done by others ‘ .

original: Ādi-saddena gāyana-gāyāpana-vādana-vādāpanādīni saṅgaṇhāti. Dassanena cettha savanampi
analyzed: ādi saddena gāyana gāyāpana vādana vādāpana ādīni saṅgaṇhāti dassanena ca ittha savanam pi
translated: The word “etc.” includes singing, causing to sing, playing music, causing to play music, and so on. Herein, seeing includes hearing,

original: saṅgahitaṃ virūpekasesanayena. Yathāsakaṃ visayassa ālocanasabhāvatāya vā pañcannaṃ🔽viññāṇānaṃ savanakiriyāyapi dassanasaṅkhepasabbhāvato “dassanā”icceva vuttaṃ. Avisūkabhūtassa
analyzed: saṅgahitam virūpa ekasesa nayena yathāsakam visayassa ālocana sabhāva tāya vā  viññāṇānam dassana saṅkhepa sabbhāvataḥ vuttam
translated: by the method of the general and the particular. Or alternatively, because of the nature of the five kinds of consciousness as the mere looking at an object,🔽the mere hearing is included in the mere seeing and is therefore called “seeing.”

original: gītassa savanaṃ kadāci vaṭṭatīti āha – “visūkabhūtā dassanā cā”ti. Tathā hi vuttaṃ
analyzed: gītassa savanam kadāci vaṭṭati iti āha visūka bhūtā dassanā ca ati tathā hi vuttam
translated: Hearing of a song that is not sung in a distorted way is sometimes allowable. Therefore he said: “The seeing of a song that is not sung in a distorted way.”

original: paramatthajotikāya khuddakaaṭṭhakathāya – “dhammūpasaṃhitaṃ gītaṃ vaṭṭati, gītūpasaṃhito
analyzed: paramattha jotikāya khuddaka aṭṭhakathāya dhamma upasaṃhitam gītam vaṭṭati gītu upasaṃhitaḥ
translated: For this is said in the Khuddakapāṭha-atthakathā, which elucidates the ultimate meaning:

original: dhammo na vaṭṭatī”ti.
analyzed: dhammaḥ na vaṭṭati iti
translated: “A song that is connected with the Dhamma is allowable; but the Dhamma connected with a song is not allowable.”

original: 2. Uccāsayanasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: uccāsayana sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: The Discussion of the Discourses on High and Luxurious Beds

original: 1152. Uccāti ucca-saddena samānatthaṃ ekaṃ saddantaraṃ. Seti etthāti sayanaṃ, uccāsayanaṃ
analyzed: uccā iti ucca saddena samāna attham ekam sadda antaram sā iti ettha ati sayanam uccāsayanam
translated: High: the word “high” has the same meaning as “high-pitched.” A bed is that on which one lies down. A high bed and a luxurious bed are prohibited if they are not the property of a wheel-turning monarch.

original: mahāsayanañca samaṇasārupparahitaṃ paṭikkhittanti āha – “pamāṇātikkantaṃ akappiyattharaṇa”nti.
analyzed: mahā sayanam ca samaṇa sāruppa rahitam paṭikkhittanti āha pamāṇa atikkantam a kappiya ttharaṇam ti
translated: Therefore he said: “A bed that exceeds the right size and is not covered with the right covering.”

original: Āsandādiāsanañcettha sayaneneva saṅgahitaṃ. Yasmā pana ādhāre paṭikkhitte tadādhārakiriyā🔽paṭikkhittāva hoti, tasmā “uccāsayanamahāsayanā”icceva vuttaṃ. Atthato pana tadupabhogabhūtanisajjānipajjanehi
analyzed: āsanda ādi āsanam ca ittha sayanena iva saṅgahitam yasmā pana ādhāre paṭikkhitte tad ādhāra kiriyā  paṭikkhittā ava hoti tasmai vuttam atthataḥ pana tad upabhoga bhūta nisajjā nipajjanehi
translated: Here a couch is included in a bed. But since the action of using is prohibited when the support is prohibited, it is said: “high couches and high seats.” But in the sense of the use of them, the lying down and sitting on them are prohibited.

original: virati dassitāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Atha vā uccāsayanamahāsayanañca uccāsayanamahāsayanañcāti🔽uccāsayanamahāsayananti etasmiṃ atthe ekasesanayena ayaṃ niddeso kato yathā – “nāmarūpapaccayā
analyzed: virati dassitā ati daṭṭhabbam atha vā uccāsayana mahāsayanañca uccāsayana mahāsayanañca ati  uccāsayana mahāsayananti etasmin atthe ekasesa nayena ayam niddeso kataḥ yathā nāma rūpa paccayā
translated: Here a couch, etc., are included in a bed. But since the action of using is prohibited when the thing used is prohibited, it is said: “high couches and high seats.” But the avoidance of the reclining and sitting that are the things used should be understood as indicated by the meaning of the words. Or alternatively, “high couches and high seats” is a collective designation for high couches and high seats,

original: saḷāyatana”nti. Āsanakiriyāpubbakattā vā sayanakiriyāya sayanaggahaṇeneva āsanampi🔽gahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: saḷāyatanam ti āsana kiriyā pubbaka ttā vā sayana kiriyāya sayana ggahaṇena iva āsanam pi  gahitanti daṭṭhabbam
translated: like the expression “name-and-form” , which is a collective designation for name and form. Or else the avoidance of seats should be understood as included by the word “beds” because the action of sitting is preceded by the action of lying down.

original: 3. Jātarūpasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: jātarūpa sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: . Commentary on the Discourse on Gold

original: 1153. Aññepi uggahāpane upanikkhittasādiyane ca paṭiggahaṇattho labbhatīti āha –
analyzed: aññe api uggahāpane upanikkhitta sādiyane ca paṭiggahaṇa atthaḥ labbhati iti āha
translated: The meaning of “accepting” is also applicable to the receiving of gifts and to the taking of what is placed in one’s hand. Therefore the text says:

original: “na uggaṇhāpenti, na upanikkhittaṃ sādiyantī”ti. Atha vā tividhaṃ paṭiggahaṇaṃ kāyena
analyzed: na uggaṇhāpenti na upanikkhittam sādiyanti iti atha vā tividham paṭiggahaṇam kāyena
translated: “They do not receive gifts or what is placed in their hands.” Or else, there are three kinds of “accepting”: by body,

original: vācāya manasāti. Tattha kāyena paṭiggahaṇaṃ uggahaṇaṃ, vācāya paṭiggahaṇaṃ uggahāpaṇaṃ,🔽manasā paṭiggahaṇaṃ sādiyanaṃ. Tividhampi paṭiggahaṇaṃ sāmaññaniddesena, ekasesanayena
analyzed: vācāya manasā ti tattha kāyena paṭiggahaṇam uggahaṇam vācāya paṭiggahaṇam uggahāpaṇam  manasā paṭiggahaṇam sādiyanam tividham pi paṭiggahaṇam sāmañña niddesena eka sesa nayena
translated: By body, by speech, and by mind. Herein, the receiving by body is the taking up; the receiving by speech is the asking for;🔽the receiving by mind is the consenting. And all three kinds of receiving are included by the term “receiving” in the expression “receiving of food,” which is stated in the plural form in the Vibhanga, or else the receiving by body is included by the term “receiving” in the expression “receiving of food,” and the receiving by speech and by mind are included by the term “receiving” in the expression “receiving of raw grain,” etc., which is stated in the singular form.

original: vā gahetvā “paṭiggahaṇā”ti vuttanti āha – “neva naṃ uggaṇhantī”tiādi. Esa nayo “āmakadhaññapaṭiggahaṇā”tiādīsupi.🔽4. Āmakadhaññasuttavaṇṇanā
analyzed: vā gahetvā paṭiggahaṇā ti vuttanti āha na iva nam uggaṇhanti itiādi esa nayaḥ āmaka dhañña paṭiggahaṇa ati ādīsu pi  āmaka dhañña sutta vaṇṇanā
translated: This is the meaning of the expression “receiving of food” and so on.🔽The commentary on the Thread on raw grain, etc., is ended.

original: 1154. Nīvārādiupadhaññassa sāliādimūladhaññantogadhattā vuttaṃ “sattavidhassā”ti.🔽5. Āmakamaṃsasuttavaṇṇanā🔽1155. “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pañca vasāni bhesajjāni – acchavasaṃ, macchavasaṃ, susukāvasaṃ,
analyzed: nīvāra ādi upadhaññassa sāli ādi mūla dhañña anta gadhattā vuttam sattavidhassa ati  āmaka maṃsa sutta vaṇṇanā  anujānāmi bhikkhave pañca vasāni bhesajjāni acchavasam macchavasam susukāvasam
translated: Since the raw grain, etc., are included in the seven kinds of grain, beginning with rice, it is said: “of the seven kinds of grain.”🔽The commentary on the Thread on raw flesh, etc., is ended.

original: sūkaravasaṃ, gadrabhavasa”nti vuttattā idaṃ uddissa anuññātaṃ nāma. Tassa pana “kāle🔽paṭiggahita”nti vuttattā paṭiggahaṇaṃ vaṭṭatīti āha – “aññatra uddissa anuññātā”ti.
analyzed: sūkara vasam gadrabha vasanti vutta ttā idam uddissa anuññātam nāma tassa pana kāle 🔽paṭiggahitanti vutta ttā paṭiggahaṇam vaṭṭati iti āha aññatra uddissa anuññātā iti
translated: Since it is said: “Monks, I allow the five kinds of fat as medicine: fat of fish, fat of pork, fat of beef, fat of mutton, fat of ass,” this is called “allowed on a specific basis.” But since it is said: “received at the proper time,” the receiving is allowable. This is the meaning of the expression “other than that allowed on a specific basis.”

original: Vinayavasena upaparikkhitabbo, tasmā samantapāsādikāya vinayaṭṭhakathāya vuttanayenettha
analyzed: vinaya vasena upaparikkhitabbo tasmā samantapāsādikāya vinaya aṭṭhakathāya vutta nayena ittha
translated: It should be investigated according to the Vinaya. Therefore, here, according to the method stated in the Samantapāsādikā Vinaya Commentary,

original: vinicchayo veditabbo.
analyzed: vinicchayaḥ veditabbo
translated: It should be investigated according to the Vinaya. Therefore the decision should be understood here in the way stated in the Commentary on the Vinaya, which is entirely pure.

original: 10. Catutthaāmakadhaññapeyyālavaggo🔽2-3. Kayavikkayasuttādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: catuttha āmaka dhañña peyyāla vaggo  kaya vikkaya sutta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on “fresh grain” is finished.🔽The explanation of the Suttas beginning with that on buying and selling.

original: 1162-63. Kassaci bhaṇḍassa gahaṇaṃ kayo, dānaṃ vikkayo. Tattha tatthāti gāmantare santike ca gamanaṃ dūtakammanti vuccatīti yojanā. Pahiṇagamanaṃ khuddakagamanaṃ.
analyzed: kassaci bhaṇḍassa gahaṇam kayaḥ dānam vikkayaḥ tattha tattha ati gāma antare santike ca gamanam dūta kammanti vuccati iti yojanā pahiṇa gamanam khuddaka gamanam
translated: Taking is buying; giving is selling. The meaning of “here and there” is that going from village to village is called “the work of a messenger.” Going to a near place is a little going.

original: 4. Tulākūṭasuttavaṇṇanā🔽1164. Rūpakūṭaṃ sarūpena sadisena chalavohāro. Aṅgakūṭaṃ attano hatthādinā aṅgānaṃ🔽chalakaraṇaṃ. Gahaṇakūṭaṃ mānesu gahaṇavasena. Paṭicchannakūṭaṃ ayacuṇṇādinā paṭicchannena
analyzed: tulākūṭa sutta vaṇṇanā  rūpa kūṭam sarūpena sadisena chala vohāraḥ aṅga kūṭam hattha ādinā aṅgānam  chala karaṇam gahaṇa kūṭam mānesu gahaṇa vasena paṭicchanna kūṭam aya cuṇṇa ādinā paṭicchannena
translated: The explanation of the Sutta on false weights.🔽False weight is a trick of weights that is similar to the true weight. False measure is a trick of measures that is similar to the true measure. False finger is a trick of fingers that is similar to the true finger. False body is a trick of the body that is similar to the true body. False part is a trick of one’s own hand, etc., by means of a part. False concealment is a trick by means of concealment with iron filings, etc.

original: chalakaraṇaṃ. Mahatiyā tulāya. Pacchābhāgeti tulāya pacchimabhāge. Hatthenāti hatthapadesena.
analyzed: chala karaṇam mahatiyā tulāya pacchābhāga iti tulāya pacchima bhāge hatthena ati hattha padesena
translated: With a large weight. At the back is at the back of the weight. With the hand is with the tip of the hand.

original: Akkamatīti uṭṭhātuṃ adento gaṇhāti. Dadanto pubbabhāgeti paresaṃ dadanto pubbabhāge🔽hatthena tulaṃ akkamati. Tanti ayacuṇṇaṃ.🔽Lohapātiyoti tambalohapātiyo. Suvaṇṇavaṇṇā karontīti asanikhādasuvaṇṇakanakalimpitā
analyzed: akkamati iti uṭṭhātum a dentaḥ gaṇhāti dadantaḥ pubbabhāge iti paresam dadantaḥ pubbabhāge  hatthena tulam akkamati tanti aya cuṇṇam  loha pātiyaḥ ti tamba loha pātiyaḥ suvaṇṇa vaṇṇā karonti iti asa nikhāda suvaṇṇa kanaka limpitā
translated: He presses down on it: he holds it down without letting it rise up. He presses down on the scale with his hand while giving the first portion to others.🔽He: the oil-cake.🔽Copper vessel: copper vessels. They make it look like gold: they make it look like gold by smearing it with the juice of the asan-tree and the kanaka-tree.

original: suvaṇṇavaṇṇā karonti. Mānabhājanassa hadayabhūtassa abbhantarassa bhinnaṃ hadayabhedo.🔽Nimiyamānassa tilataṇḍulādikassa sikhāya aggakoṭiyā bhinnaṃ sikhābhedo. Khettādīnaṃ🔽minanarajjuyā aññathākaraṇaṃ rajjubhedo. Rajjugahaṇeneva cettha daṇḍakassa gahaṇaṃ
analyzed: suvaṇṇa vaṇṇā karonti māna bhājanassa hadaya bhūtassa abbhantarassa bhinnam hadaya bhedaḥ  nimiyamānassa tila taṇḍula ādikassa sikhāya agga koṭiyā bhinnam sikhā bhedaḥ khetta ādīnam  minana rajjuyāḥ aññathākaraṇam rajju bhedaḥ rajju gahaṇena iva ca ittha daṇḍakassa gahaṇam
translated: The heart of the vessel: the heart of the vessel, which is the most valuable part of it. The heart is broken: the heart is split.🔽The tip is broken: the tip of the topmost part of the sesame seed or grain or whatever it may be is split. The rope is broken: the field, etc.,

original: katamevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: katamā eva ati daṭṭhabbam
translated: are made otherwise than by the binding rope. The staff is broken: the staff is broken. The staff should be understood here as the stick.

original: 6-11. Chedanasuttādivaṇṇanā🔽1166-71. Vadhoti muṭṭhippahārakasātāḷanādīhi hiṃsanaṃ, viheṭhananti attho. Viheṭhanatthopi
analyzed: chedana sutta ādi vaṇṇanā  vadho ti muṭṭhi ppahāraka sātāḷana ādīhi hiṃsanam viheṭhananti atthaḥ viheṭhana atthaḥ api
translated: The explanation of the first sub-chapter on killing is finished.🔽Killing: striking with the fist, a clod, a stick, etc.; the meaning is, harming. The word killing is also found in the sense of harming, as in the passage: “Having killed the non-human beings, he would weep” .

original: hi vadha-saddo dissati “atthānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodeyyā”tiādīsu. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: hi vadha saddaḥ dissati atthānam vadhitvā vadhitvā rodeyya ati ādīsu aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: In the commentary,

original: pana “māraṇa”nti vuttaṃ, taṃ pana pothanaṃ sandhāyāti sakkā viññātuṃ māraṇasaddassa
analyzed: pana māraṇanti vuttam tam pana pothanam sandhāya ati sakkā viññātum māraṇa saddassa
translated: but “killing” is mentioned, it can be understood that this is said with reference to the crushing,

original: vihiṃsanepi dissanato. Sesaṃ suviññeyyameva.
analyzed: vihiṃsane pi dissanato sesam su viññeyyam eva
translated: because the word “killing” is also found in the sense of “injury.” The rest is quite clear.

original: Āmakadhaññapeyyālavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Sāratthappakāsiniyā saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: āmaka dhañña peyyāla vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sārattha ppakāsiniyā saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya
translated: The commentary on the section of the Monastic Code on raw grain is finished.🔽The explanation of the meaning of the long explanation of the Mahāvagga in the commentary on the Saṃyutta Nikāya,

original: Mahāvaggavaṇṇanāya līnatthappakāsanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mahā vagga vaṇṇanāya līna ttha ppakāsanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Clarifier of the True Meaning, is finished.

original: Nigamanakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nigamana kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the summary

original: Sakalarūpārūpasammasane saṇhasukhumavisayañāṇatāya vipassanācāranipuṇabuddhīnaṃ susaṃyatakāyavacīsamācāratāya
analyzed: sakala rūpa arūpa sammasane saṇha sukhuma visaya ñāṇa tāya vipassanā ācāra nipuṇa buddhīnam su saṃyata kāya vacī samācāra tāya
translated: Because of the knowledge of subtle and refined objects in the contemplation of form and formlessness,🔽because of the well-controlled bodily and verbal conduct of the monks, the ascetics,

original: samathavipassanāsu sammadeva yatanato ca yatīnaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ khandhāyatanadhātusaccindriyapaṭiccasamuppādabhede
analyzed: samatha vipassanāsu sammat eva yatanato ca yatīnam bhikkhūnam khandha āyatana dhātu sacca indriya paṭiccasamuppāda bhede
translated: and because of the proper effort in serenity and insight,🔽the commentary on the meaning of the excellent Saṃyutta Nikāya,

original: paramatthadhamme nānānayehi ñāṇavibhāgassa sannissayena bahukārassa saṃyuttāgamavarassa
analyzed: paramattha dhamme nānā nayehi ñāṇa vibhāgassa sannissayena bahu kārassa saṃyutta āgama varassa
translated: which is of great benefit as the basis for the analysis of knowledge by various methods in the ultimate truths, which are divided into the aggregates, sense bases, elements, truths, faculties, dependent origination,🔽and which is connected with the commentary,

original: atthasaṃvaṇṇanaṃ kātuṃ sāratthappakāsanato eva nipuṇā yā mayā aṭṭhakathā āraddhāti
analyzed: attha saṃvaṇṇanam kātum sāra ttha ppakāsanataḥ eva nipuṇā yā mayā aṭṭhakathā āraddhā ti
translated: I have begun this commentary, which is skillful in explaining the meaning, by clarifying the true meaning.

original: sambandho. Savisesaṃ paññāvahaguṇattā eva hissa ganthārambhe āditopi “paññāpabhedajananassā”ti
analyzed: sambandho sa visesam paññā vaha guṇa ttā eva hi ssa gantha ārambhe āditas pi paññā pabheda jananassa ati
translated: The connection is this. For it is said at the beginning of the text, “To generate an analysis of wisdom,” because it is the essence that brings about the special quality of wisdom.

original: vuttaṃ. Mahāaṭṭhakathāya sāranti saṃyuttamahāaṭṭhakathāya sāraṃ. Ekūnasaṭṭhimattoti
analyzed: vuttam mahā aṭṭhakathāya sāram ti saṃyutta mahā aṭṭhakathāya sāram
translated: The essence of the Connected Commentary on the Great Book:

original: thokaṃ ūnabhāvato matta-saddaggahaṇaṃ.🔽Mūlaṭṭhakathāya sāranti pubbe vuttasaṃyuttamahāaṭṭhakathāya sārameva puna nigamanavasena
analyzed: thokam ūna bhāvataḥ  mūla aṭṭhakathāya sāram ti pubbe vutta saṃyutta mahā aṭṭhakathāya sāram eva puna nigamana vasena
translated: The word “essence” is used because of the slight deficiency.🔽The essence of the Root Commentary:

original: vuttanti. Atha vā mūlaṭṭhakathāya sāranti porāṇaṭṭhakathāsu atthasāraṃ. Tena etaṃ
analyzed: vuttam ti atha vā mūla ṭṭhakathāya sāranti porāṇa ṭṭhakathāsu attha sāram tena etam
translated: The essence of the Connected Commentary on the Great Book mentioned earlier is again stated by way of conclusion. Or alternatively, the essence of the Root Commentary is the essence of the meaning in the ancient commentaries. By that he shows

original: dasseti “saṃyuttamahāaṭṭhakathāya atthasāraṃ ādāya imaṃ sāratthappakāsiniṃ karontena
analyzed: dasseti saṃyutta mahā aṭṭhakathāya attha sāram ādāya imam sāra attha ppakāsinim karontena
translated: that “having taken the essence of the meaning of the Connected Commentary on the Great Book,

original: sesamahānikāyānampi mūlaṭṭhakathāsu idha viyogakkhamaṃ atthasāraṃ ādāya akāsi”nti.
analyzed: sesa mahā nikāyānam pi mūla ṭṭhakathāsu idha viyoga kkhamam attha sāram ādāya akāsinti
translated: he made this Sāratthappakāsinī, having also taken the essence of the meaning in the Root Commentaries on the other great Nikāyas that is suitable to be included here.”

original: “Mahāvihārādhivāsīna”nti ca idaṃ purimapacchimapadehi saddhiṃ sambandhitabbaṃ “mahāvihārādhivāsīnaṃ
analyzed: mahā vihāra adhivāsīnam ti ca idam purima pacchima padehi saddhim sambandhitabbam mahā vihāra adhivāsīnam
translated: And the words “of the residents of the Great Monastery” should be connected with the preceding and following words: “of the residents of the Great Monastery,

original: samayaṃ pakāsayantiṃ mahāvihārādhivāsīnaṃ mūlaṭṭhakathāya sāraṃ ādāyā”ti ca. Tena🔽puññena. Hotu sabbo sukhī lokoti kāmāvacarādivibhāgo sabbo sattaloko yathārahaṃ bodhittayādhigamavasena
analyzed: samayam pakāsayantim mahā vihāra adhivāsīnam mūla ṭṭhakathāya sāram ādāya ati ca tena  puññena hotu sabbaḥ sukhī loko ti kāmāvacara ādi vibhāgo sabbaḥ satta lokaḥ yathāraham bodhi ttayā adhigama vasena
translated: and the Elder Mahā-Ananda, who was living in the Great Monastery, proclaimed the occasion, and took the essence of the Root Commentary.”

original: sampayuttena nibbānasukhena sukhito hotūti sadevakassa lokassa accantaṃ sukhādhigamāya
analyzed: sampayuttena nibbāna sukhena sukhitaḥ hotu uti sa devakassa lokassa accantam sukha adhigamāya
translated: By that merit. May all the world be happy: all the world of beings classed as the sense-sphere and so on, may it be happy with the happiness of extinction that is to be reached by the attainment of the three kinds of enlightenment according to their several due.

original: attano puññaṃ pariṇāmeti.
analyzed: attanaḥ puññam pariṇāmeti
translated: He dedicates his own merit to the attainment of the highest happiness by the world with its gods.🔽So far

original: Ettāvatā sāratthappakāsiniyā🔽Saṃyuttanikāya-aṭṭhakathāya līnatthappakāsanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ettāvatā sārattha ppakāsiniyā  saṃyutta nikāya aṭṭhakathāya līna ttha ppakāsanā niṭṭhitā
translated: the explanation of the hidden meaning🔽in the Commentary on the Book of the Kindred Sayings is ended.

original: Saṃyuttaṭīkā samattā.
analyzed: saṃyutta ṭīkā samattā
translated: The Commentary on the Kindred Sayings is finished.
